college_info.college_name: GLA University Mathura: Courses, Admission 2026, Fees, Placements, Rankings

highlights.summary:
The GLA University Mathura full form stands for Ganeshi Lal Agrawal University and was founded in 2010 as a private university. It has been accredited by NAAC with an grade A+ and recognised by the UGC and AICTE. Located in Mathura, GLA Mathura, through 14 departments and 9 institutes, offers 250+ courses at the UG, PG, Doctoral and Diploma levels to students. These courses are provided for Engineering, Chemistry, and various others. Moroever, it also offers distance education to students through the Centre for Distance and Online Education.
GLA University Mathura Uttar Pradesh is known for its BTech and MBA programmes. Top companies such Amazon, Facebook, Accenture, Microsoft, and others visited the campus during placements. Check out the table for the major highlights of GLA University Mathura UP:
Constituent Institutes / Departments

table.details: BCI, NCTE, PCI and Government of UP

college_info_program.intro:
GLA University Mathura UP popular programmes are BTech and MBA. BTech and MBA students are placed in various companies such as Adani Group, Wipro, Accenture, Microsoft, Capgemini, and others. BTech students can work as Software Engineers, Data Scientists, Civil Engineers, and Electronics Engineers, or can take up various job opportunities relevant to their field.
GLA Mathura MBA students are provided with project-based learning experiences. There are various job-oriented value-added workshops arranged on the campus. The college tries to incubate various start-up ideas of students. Overall, it is one of the best universities providing quality education to students. Below mentioned are some of the courses offered by GLA University Mathura Uttar Pradesh and their respective eligibility and fees:

GLA University Mathura Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: College has all the facilities, and also the faculty is very helpful.

detailed_review.Placements: 65% of students are placed, and the placements are still going. The highest package is 6 LPA, average is 4.5 LPA, and the lowest is 3.5 LPA. Uno Minda company is the best recruiter. 50% of students are enrolled in the internships. Roles offered are quality department, R&D, research, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every department has its own classrooms and labs. Wi-Fi is provided throughout the college campus. Food quality in the canteen is also average. Medical facilities are provided. Sports facilities like basketball court and ground are also provided.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and also are qualified with Ph.D. degree. The curriculum is updated and new according to the new generation. The exams are a bit difficult, and the pass percentage is 90%. The course thus makes the students ready for the industry.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: College is awesome. It has a good placement ratio even in the COVID-19 pandemic.

detailed_review.Placements: 70 percent of students got placed in my batch. The highest package offered is 18 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. The average package is 7.8 LPA. Concentrix, HCL, TCS, and Microsoft are the top recruiting companies. 90 percent of students got internships. Web developers, data analysts, and business analysts are the top roles offered to students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has the best infrastructure. It has high internet connectivity. Classrooms are neat and clean. The quality of food is awesome, and it has many different options. There is a clinic in college. There are good playgrounds for playing cricket, athletic games, and basketball. It also has a good sports trainer.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-trained. They have good knowledge of the domain in which they are teaching. The course curriculum is industry-based so that we can get good exposure and hands-on experience. Exams are good and moderate to qualify. We have to get at least 40 percent marks to qualify.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Strong academic support with satisfactory placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 70 to 75 percent of the students are placed in my course. The placement process is well structured with pre placement training sessions, aptitude practice mock interviews, and resume building workshops conducted by the placement cell. The highest package offered is 12 LPA, which is secured by students of my college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure available for my course is well maintained and supportive of academic and practical learning. The department is equipped with high speed Wi-Fi, which is accessible in classes and laboratories, and the common areas hostel facility is satisfactory, with clean and well maintained rooms and water supply.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are generally helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable in their respective subjects. Most teachers have a strong academic background along with teaching experience, and a few also possess industry exposure.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Analytics) in academic collaboration with IBM
reviews.review_title: It is a good college for students who do not get admission anywhere.

detailed_review.Placements: Currently, 80% to 90% of students get placed in my course. The highest package offered is 55 LPA. Infosys, Deloitte, TCS, and Wipro are the top recruiting companies. AI/ML and Data Science are the top roles offered during placements. Most companies that come here are mass recruiting companies. They usually offer a maximum package of 7–8 LPA and hire approximately 300–400 students from the campus. Many product-based companies do not hire from here because many students do not have the skills required for those roles. These companies usually offer 12–21 LPA based on your score.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite good in terms of courses. This year, the college started many different programs for different fields like B. Tech CSE in Data Science +AI, Robotics, Cybersecurity, IoT, and Gaming. These courses are designed specifically for the path you choose, giving you in-depth knowledge of your field. Hostels, however, are really pathetic. Mess food is not very good, and hostel facilities are limited. Only a few hostels like Wings 1, 2, 3, and 4 have decent facilities. Other hostels lack proper amenities. The internet connection is also not stable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are mostly average. Many are short-tempered and treat boys differently compared to girls. Teaching ability is controversial. Some teachers do not even know the basics of their courses. They mostly teach through PPTs and rarely help with doubts. However, the course curriculum is good. It is industry-oriented and has a clear vision. Semester exams are quite hard, and cheating is nearly impossible due to strict protocols and good evaluation.
detailed_review.Other: B.Tech CSE (Data Science + AI) is a good course that provides in-depth knowledge of your field. The college could add more content to the course and arrange partnerships with MNCs to enhance industry knowledge. Events and fests are enjoyable, but more concerts and entertainment could be expected when paying 13–15 lakhs. Connectivity and campus surroundings are not very good. Transport facilities are frustrating, and students who love exploring outside the campus may find the place boring.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Cloud Computing and Virtualization) in academic collaboration with IBM
reviews.review_title: Student Review of GLA University, Mathura.

detailed_review.Placements: Companies do come, but most of them do not offer good packages. The interview process is comparable to that of top companies, but PPOs are not up to the mark. Companies such as Capgemini and Cognizant are common. Around 20–30% of students are satisfied with placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are in poor condition. There is no proper network connection for Jio and Airtel in the college. We have to rely on college Wi-Fi, which is not reliable because sometimes it works and sometimes it does not. We have 12 blocks. Only the 1st and 12th blocks are maintained, and the rest are in worse condition.
detailed_review.Faculty: A few teachers are really good. They teach perfectly and give hands-on learning experience. But some teachers are not effective. They do not communicate well, have unnecessary attitudes, and sometimes, due to ego, they negatively affect students. Semester exams are average, not too hard, not too easy, and generally fair. Sometimes, however, they make very hard exams that are not related to previous year's questions or notes.
detailed_review.Other: I think the college should improve its faculty and focus on giving students free time. Too many classes make it hard for students to focus on their primary skills. Three-hour continuous classes on the same subject are not appreciated by students. In the name of training, they make students’ lives hard. Classes run from 8–4 with only one hour break for lunch. During exams, there is no break. Continuous exams are not appropriate. Students need some peace of mind and time to relax.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with my college.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, generally, mass recruiter companies provide placements to students. Everything only depends on students and their environment. From coding to personality, everything depends on students. The highest package offered is 60 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities, including Wi-Fi, labs, an abundant number of books, departmental libraries, a central library, etc., are available in my college. Wi-Fi is available in hostels. The quality of food served is average. The canteen is open till 1 AM.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and knowledgeable. They only teach what is in the course. Some faculty members are highly expert and also provide useful information to enhance our skills. Honestly, the course curriculum cannot make students industry-ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, the college is good.

detailed_review.Placements: There are 96 students in my course. They teach us AI and data science. The highest package offered is 18 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. Top companies like Google and Microsoft recruit students from our college. At least 50 percent of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has well-equipped labs, smart classrooms, campus-wide Wi-Fi, and a library with ample books. The hostel facilities are decent, with clean rooms and regular water and electricity. Quality-wise, the food is good and healthy. It also provides great infrastructure.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are the best part, I guess. They are so supportive at every point in time. The course curriculum is very nice. They provide an industrial environment by taking us to different corporate offices. Semester exams are a bit tough, but teachers help students well to score good marks.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good placements and decent infrastructure. There is scope for improvement in faculty support.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. The highest package offered is approximately 60 LPA. We can assume the lowest salary package as students are unplaced, but placements are okay. TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, and IBM are top recruiting companies. Around 65-70 percent of students get internships in companies like TCS iON, Infosys Springboard, Amazon, Microsoft, Deloitte, Accenture, and startups.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are present, but they are not so luxurious as tables are broken. Fans are not working properly, but overall, it's okay. The CSE department is well-equipped with the necessary infrastructure. The campus has Wi-Fi connectivity, though the speed is average and varies across locations.
detailed_review.Faculty: Everything is okay. Faculty members are helpful. The course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are not so difficult, but end-term exams are a little bit difficult. Many teachers are well-qualified, knowledgeable, and supportive. They explain concepts clearly and are approachable for doubts during and after class.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML) in partnership with Microsoft
reviews.review_title: It is an absolutely good place to explore and to enhance our skills.

detailed_review.Placements: I am doing my graduation in B.Tech with a specialisation in AI and ML. The placement rate through my college with this specialised course is amazing. We have a lot of opportunities to face off. Recently, some of my batchmates got placed at companies like Vivo and Adobe for internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of my college is excellent for building a foundation for a new and bright future there. I have been there since 2023, and there have been various changes throughout the whole campus. Still, it feels surprising that they keep changing things all around, which means they are working on campus infrastructure and many more things to make it as comfortable and secure for the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: To be very honest, throughout this whole course I have learn a lot of industrial life hands-on practical activities and improved my technical skills day by day. I have learned machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and GenAI. I have developed all these skills in practical labs and interactive classrooms. I personally feel myself industry-ready. Semester exams are of a moderate level. We have to learn and keep focus in the classroom regularly.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharm.)
reviews.review_title: Is GLA worth it for you or not?

detailed_review.Placements: Here is a summary of the placement record for GLA University. Mathura campus (recent data). Recent highlights: In the 2025 placement drive, about 2,000 students have been placed so far with 550+ companies participating in campus recruitments. The average (overall) package reported in 2025 lies in the range of 6-8 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GLA University has separate hostels for boys and girls. According to the official site, there are 15 boys. Hostels (capacity 4300+ boys) and 4 girls' hostels (capacity 1400 girls). Room types vary: there are AC and non-AC rooms, with options for single, double, and triple sharing depending on availability.
detailed_review.Faculty: GLA University offers a wide variety of programmes: undergraduate (B.Teach, B.Sc., BBA, BCA, B.Com, B.A., B. Pharma, etc. ), postgraduate (M.Teach, MPHARM, M.Sc., MBA, etc. ), along with diploma and doctoral Ph.D. courses. The university follows a semester-based exam system: generally, there is a mid-term (internal) exam and an end-term (external/final) exam every semester.
detailed_review.Other: I am pursuing B. Pharma. In this course, I am learning about medicine and body functioning.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Decent college with good infrastructure and average placement B.Tech CSE 2027.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from B.Tech CSE 2023 to 2027 batch, and placements at GLA University are average to decent, depending on the students skill level. In our course, around 65 to 70 percent of students usually get placed. The highest package goes up to around 60 LPA for a few exceptional candidates. The average remains near 5 to 10 LPA, while some students receive offers around 3 to 4 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure at GLA University is one of its best features. Classrooms are neat and equipped with projectors. Labs have working systems but can feel crowded at times. The library is large, peaceful, and has good Internet access. Wi-Fi across the campus works most of the time. Hostel facilities are average, rooms are decent, though maintenance requests sometimes take time. Mess is okay, neither bad nor very good, but canteen food is better.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are qualified and supportive, though teaching quality can vary between departments. The updated covers the skills needed in their industry, but students must put in extra effort outside the classroom to excel in coding or development. Exams are moderately difficult, and internal assessment helps maintain a good score. Most students pass without major issues if they attend class and review regularly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good learning environment with supportive faculty and decent placements overall.

detailed_review.Placements: According to last year placement records, the placement percentage lies between 65-80%. For B. Tech (CSE), the highest package reported is 60 LPA. The lowest package is 4.5 LPA, and the average package is 6-7 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Amazon, Microsoft, Cognizant, Accenture, Wipro, TCS, Capgemini, Deloitte, and L&T. Around 40% of students get internships in B. Tech (CSE) in companies like Adobe, Microsoft, and Capgemini. Top roles offered are Software Developer, Software Engineer, and Data Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for my course is quite good. Most essential facilities are well maintained. Classrooms are clean and equipped with projectors, and the Wi-Fi works smoothly in academic blocks. Each block contains its own well-maintained library. Hostel facilities are decent. Rooms are not big but hygienic, and housekeeping is done on a daily basis. The mess food is manageable and offers enough variety, though it can be improved at times. There are three canteens. The campus also provides medical facilities, a well-equipped gym, and sports facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty in my course is experienced and supportive. Most teachers are well qualified and explain concepts clearly using practical examples when needed. The curriculum is updated and includes industry-relevant subjects that help build a strong foundation. Exams are conducted fairly and on time with a balance of theory and practical assessment.
detailed_review.Other: Overall my experience at the university is positive. The campus is clean, safe, and well maintained. The placement cell works actively to bring companies and guide students throughout the process. The college provides facilities to visit other colleges and industries for better learning. Many fests occur on the campus. The campus crowd is slightly large with good connectivity and support services. The campus is safe and secure. There are many scholarships based on merit.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with my course and also with the college.

detailed_review.Placements: 75 percent of students are placed in my course. 60 LPA, 8 LPA, and the average package are the highest, lowest, and average offered in my course, respectively. Top recruiting companies for my course are Capgemini, Cognizant, Zscaler, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are very good. The infrastructure available for our course/department (e.g., Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, library) is good. The quality of facilities in the hostel, the food available in the mess and canteen, medical facilities, and sports and games is overall good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is very good. Sometimes we feel semester exams are difficult, but they are related to the syllabus only. The passing criteria is 33 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am from a science background and I am interested in this course. My overall suggestion is to take admission in this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with my course and also the college.

detailed_review.Placements: 75 percent of students got placed from my course. 60 LPA and 8 LPA are the highest and lowest packages offered in my course, respectively. Top recruiting companies for my course are Capgemini, Cognizant, Zscalar, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are very good, and the infrastructure available for our course/department, e.g., Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and library, is also too good. The quality of the facilities in our hostel, the quality of food available in the mess and canteen, medical facilities, sports, and games is overall good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is very helpful and good sometimes. We feel semester exams are difficult, but related to the syllabus only. The passing criteria are 33 percent. My overall suggestion is to take admission in this college.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am from a scientific background and I am interested in this course.

reviews.course: Bachelors of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: You can check another college.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 30-40 percent got placed in my course. The highest package is something around 5 LPA-6 LPA, the average package is something 3 LPA-4 LPA, and the lowest is something 2 LPA-3 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Capgemini and IBM. The internship is compulsory for all, so everyone does this in their nearby companies. The top roles offered are sales and marketing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and the infrastructure are also good. The Wi-Fi, labs, classroom, and library are also good. It provides you with a good environment. The hostel and the canteen, medical facilities, sports, and games are also good, we can enjoy as well as learn new things.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They help us a lot. The teaching quality is also good. We can easily learn new things with the help of our teachers. In the course, it is relevant when the students enjoy the course and see their future in it. The semester exams are not that hard, if we study properly, we can get good marks.

reviews.course: B.Tech in Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AIML) in partnership with Microsoft
reviews.review_title: Not worth it, you can check a lot of other colleges.

detailed_review.Placements: Something around 30-40 percent got placed in my course. The highest package is around 10-12 LPA, the lowest is around 3-4 LPA, and the average is around 5-6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Capgemini, IBM, and Dell. Around 30-40 percent got internships from my course in nearby companies. Top roles offered are data engineer and software developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are very good. The infrastructure is also very good. Wi-Fi, labs, classroom, and library are all good. We can easily manage there and learn a lot with the help of these facilities. The hostel is also good. The food quality is average. Medical facilities are good. Sports and games are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality was also good. The course is relevant. It may make the students industry-ready if they want to. The semester exams are normal, not harder, not so easy. If you study properly, you can easily get good marks. The passing percentage is around 80-85 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. (Hons.) in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Students should take admission. It gives a chance to get a good placement.

detailed_review.Placements: There are too many companies coming for the placements at our university. Average package is around 8 LPA. Now in 2025, a student gets 60 LPA placement from the B.Tech CSE branch. Recruiting companies are TCS, Amazon, Infosys, etc. Around 90% students have been placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: When I come to university I thought college life is boring but its wrong. I learnt here how to make life beautiful with friends and hostel. Hostels are good here. Mess food is also very good as it is in Mathura, we only have veg food in our mess. That's all about my hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Now the quality is good as they focus on the logic development of the students, and give them practical life examples to study. Teachers are well-qualified with higher degrees, and have great experience in their respective fields. Semester exams are a bit tricky to solve as level of paper is moderate.
detailed_review.Other: I feel good here, meeting new people and making friends.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Faculty member help, guide for placements and projects to put in their resume.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students who got placed is quite high, and about the packages the students got based on their skills, they have in their field. The highest package a student got from GLA University is about 8LPA, and the moderate package is 3 to 4LPA. There are a lot of recruiting companies that come for students, like TCS, Wipro, Capgemini, etc. The number is quite high again here, there are some students who got placed in really big recruiting companies and got a chance to work as interns in foreign companies, too. That is a really good thing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is so good, so spacious, and the classrooms are also spacious and a perfect positive environment for students to study. There is everything for students hospitality, like Wi-Fi in every block department on every floor and in every single room. There are labs too where students can practice with a working system, and there are some common libraries for each departments students, I guess 4, and they are quite spacious. Students do not have to worry about seats, the perfect place I prefer to study after my classes. The hostel has spacious AC rooms and great, healthy, tasty food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teacher are so friendly and they are really good at what they are doing. Good at delivering content. Universities make sure they are making a student enough to crack their dream company interview. The exam level is above average, and the passing criteria are 70%.
detailed_review.Other: The things I personally love are the extra facilities they are providing the students who are actually good at studying, and they actually want to do something in their lives without any extra charges.  lastly, several clubs and events are happening in campus perfect for a student there they can learn so many things they got a chance to explore themselves their hobbies also can participate and won so may prizes the certificates. There are spiritual, communication, and personality development clubs those gonna help them in every interview in every phase of their lives. The scholarship is there.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: This College is average.

detailed_review.Placements: 50 to 55% placement in my course. The highest package offered is 8LPA. The lowest package offered is 2.9LPA. Top recruiters are TCS, Infosys, Capgemini, and Wipro. No one gets any type of internship from our college in any company. Roles offered are Web Developer, Software Engineer, and Data Analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi is not too good, but the labs are above average. Classrooms are okay. The library is better than the others, but too much noise, and there is no proper management. Lastly, I am a day scholar, not any hostler, so I do not have any idea.
detailed_review.Faculty: In my Second year, teachers are really too good as per my expectations. They are very helpful to me. Even if it was any query or any doubt, whatever else. This course is relevant to the industrys technology, which is going on. Exams are moderate, not tough, and not too easy either. Pass percentage is above 60%.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Honest review of GLA University Mathura, BCA course.

detailed_review.Placements: 65% to 70% students get placed. Among them, students who know coding very well get the offer for 6LPA. The average package offered is 3 to 4LPA, and the lowest is 2.5LPA. Capgemini, Retro tech, Tech Mahindra, SAP Labs, etc. Only students who have that caliber and want to do something in life get internship by themselves, college will not help with anything. Students can apply internship based on their project.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good in the Mathura campus. Many universities and colleges are better. Food is not good, you might suffer from food poisoning, so be very cautious about your food intake.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are taken in a very strict manner, teachers are really helpful, they will teach you not just to learn for marks but also for the knowledge. Faculty members make students industry ready, and they share their experiences that help a lot for students. Exams are for students who learn for knowledge, not just marks.
detailed_review.Other: I am pursuing BCA. I chose this course because I wanted to, but I would still recommend people not to opt for it, instead, go for B.Tech or do well in CUET exams so you could get a good college. GLA does not have good brains to be very honest, students are distracted here, and only a few are sincere here.

college_info.college_name: GLA University Mathura Course Admissions 2025: Last Date, Courses & Fees, Cutoff, Eligibility, Selection & Application

admission.title: GLA University Mathura Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text:
GLA University Mathura UG, PG, Doctorate, and Diploma courses are delivered through 13 departments and 9 affiliated colleges. Streams include engineering, science, pharmacy, management, and more. In addition to classroom learning, the university also offers online MBA, BBA, and BCom (Hons) programmes.

Admission to all courses (except PhD) is based on performance in the GLAET entrance test conducted by the university. Below are the GLA University admission highlights:

faqs.question: What is the last date for MBA at GLA University admission?
faqs.answer: GLA University usually concludes the application process for admission to the MBA programme between October and December. GLA University conducts its entrance examination, i.e. GLAET based on which they select candidates for the MBA programme. GLA University also accepts scores of other entrance exams such as CAT, MAT, UPSEE. Candidates are shortlisted for the GD and PI rounds and those who qualify for the GD and PI rounds are selected for final seat allotment.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in GLA University for MBA?
faqs.answer: For admission to the MBA programme at GLA University, check the points below for more details:

faqs.question: How can I get admission in GLA University for BPharm?
faqs.answer: GLA University BPharm admissions are subject to the fulfillment of eligibility criteria. Once the candidates have checked the eligibility criteria, they must register and appear for the GLAET exam. The applications can be submitted in both offline and online modes. After the declaration of the exam results, the applicants are ranked based on their marks. After that, the BPharm seats are allocated based on the order of rank. Students who receive the admission offer must report to the institute for a document verification process. After successful verification, students are required to pay the prescribed fees to secure their admission.

faqs.question: What is the mode of application at GLA University Mathura?
faqs.answer: The mode of application at GLA University Mathura is online with admissions conducted through the university page. Students can apply as long as they meet the course eligibility shown on the same page. Interested students can learn more on the university official website.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam scores does GLA University accept for BCom admissions?
faqs.answer: GLA University BCom course admissions are done based on scores in GLATE/CUET. GLAET conducted by the university is a 1 hour duration exam. Interested students can apply by visiting the official page of the university. The application fee to be paid is INR 700.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for BPharm courses at GLA University?
faqs.answer: The GLA University eligibility criteria vary depending on the choice of BPharma course. Tabulated below is course-wise eligibility criteria: Course Eligibility Criteria BPharm Any candidate who has passed Class 12 with PCB/PCM with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ST) is eligible to apply. BPharm LE Any candidates with a Diploma in Pharmacy from a PCI-approved institution with at least 60% aggregate (55% aggregate for SC/ST).

faqs.question: Which entrance exam scores does GLA University accept for admission to BPharm?
faqs.answer: GLA University conducts its entrance test for admission to its many UG & PG courses including BPharm. Students seeking admission to BPharma courses must register and appear for the GLAET exam. The applications for the same can be submitted in both offline and online modes. The application fee to be paid is INR 700.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission to GLA University?
faqs.answer: No, admission to all courses at GLA University is entirely entrance-based. GLA University Mathura conducts an in-house entrance exam namely, GLAET, for admission to its various UG and PG courses in all the streams. Those who are interested to get admission in to either of the course of GLA University can first apply online on the official website of GLA University and appear for the respective entrance exam to get selected.

faqs.question: What are the courses that GLA University Mathura offers?

faqs.question: What is the eligibility of BTech at GLA University?

faqs.question: Does GLA University offer BTech Lateral Entry admission?

faqs.question: How can I get admission in GLA University for MBA?

faqs.question: Does GLA University accept admission through CAT or MAT?

faqs.question: What is the fees for MBA at GLA University?

faqs.question: How can I get admission to D.Pharma at GLA University?

college_info.college_name: GLA University Mathura Placements 2025: Highest Package, Average Package, Top Recruiters

data.title: GLA University Mathura Placement Report 2025
summary: The GLA University Mathura placements season 2025 is witnessing 2000 students getting placed from various courses. So far, the average package recorded for 2025 is between INR 6 -8 LPA . As per the placement report, the placement rate of 80-90% is observed as of 2025. Moreover, over 550 companies are taking part in the current placements drive. The final placement reports for this season are yet to be out, therefore the current stats may change. Earlier during placements 2024, the GLA University Mathura highest package stood at INR 55 LPA from the BTech CSE branch. Moreover, the highest package recorded from the management branch was INR 19.8 LPA . The overall average package stood at INR 6.3 LPA and over 3000 offers were generated in the GLA University placements 2024 itself.

An amazing placement rate of 86% was recorded during the placements 2024 wherein over 500 companies participated. A total of 37 students got selected by Microsoft with packages up to INR 11.8 LPA . Some regular top companies taking part in the GLA University placement include- Amazon, Deloitte, HDFC Bank, JK Tyres, Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, Reliance, Tata, Microsoft and many more.

The department of Training and Placement is regarded as the backbone of the GLA University Mathura. The placement cell trains their students with intellectual skills as well and gives an equal emphasis to practical skills. Further, the cell regularly organises sessions and interaction programs with industrial experts to help students gain professional exposure.

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The Central Library is the hub of information services in the university. college_info.college_name: GL Bajaj Noida: Courses, Fees, Admission 2026, Rankings, Placements, Scholarships

highlights.summary:
GL Bajaj Institute of Technology and Management Noida was founded in 2007 as a private institute of the Greater Noida region. The institute extends its courses in affiliation to Dr APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University and are AICTE-approved. These courses are extended at the UG and PG level in the fields of Engineering and Management. Also, GLBITM Greater Noida has since received an 'A+' grade accreditation from the NAAC and has also been approved by the Ministry of HRD and Government of India.
GL Bajaj Gr Noida is accredited by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA). Also, GL Bajaj Noida admission process depends on entrance exam scores such as UPCET/ CAT/ MAT. The institute features over 300 highly qualified faculty members with campus featuring all the necessary facilities for student life. Interested students can check some of the major highlights regarding GL Bajaj Greater Noida below:
Check out more on GL Bajaj G Noida - GLBITM Noida Highlights 2026 in the below videos:

college_info_program.intro:
The flagship programmes extended at GL Bajaj Institute of Technology and Management Greater Noida include BTech, MBA and MCA. For BTech, selection is based on the merit of Class 12 + UPCET /JEE Main score. On the other hand, for MBA, students must have a bachelors degree in the respective field. In addition to this, students must appear for UPCET/ CAT/ MAT scores.
The GL Bajaj Noida fee structure for BTech has a total tuition fee of INR 2.45 Lakhs while the GL Bajaj Noida MBA fees stands at INR 1.33 Lakhs and the GL Bajaj Noida MCA fees is at INR 1.22 Lakhs.
For more information about GL Bajaj Institute of Technology and Management Greater Noida check out the below video:

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: The campus facilities are okay. Placements depend a lot on your skills and involvement.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college 60 to 70 percent of students are selected in the final year of their course. In the year 2025 to 26 the maximum package reached 56 LPA in Swiggy. The top recruiting companies are Autodesk, Paloalto etc which give above 50 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our college infrastructure is really good. We have a library which is open 18 hours a day including Sunday and all weekends. The Wi-Fi facilities are also provided. Every year a sports meet is also organised by the college in which all students have a chance to participate.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are also very helpful. Almost all the teaching staff are M.Tech qualified from the top universities. Their way of teaching is also good. The semester exam is conducted by aktu universities because our college is connected to this university. So, the university is conducting the semester exam on its way.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Good placement is in 3 years in Greater Noida.

detailed_review.Placements: 95% of students are placed in my class this year. 56 LPA is the highest package. Recruiting companies are EXL, Amazon, Capgemini, Infosys, PwC, and many more. AI role is offered in my course. The placement opportunities in the college are decent and improving every year. Many companies visit here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Quality of hostel food is good, and not something like very good but girls hostel food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Semester exam taken by ACTU, so that everyone knows how to take the exam. Curriculum is good but in first year we do not join any club and anything only study. Faculty members are generally helpful, well-qualified, and supportive. College is very good. Faculty members are very interactive and helpful. College staff is very helpful.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to build a solid technical foundation and it is the best part of my life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college is the best in academics.

detailed_review.Placements: In this college, 75–80% of students get placed. The highest package is 58 LPA, and the average package is 7 LPA. The lowest package is 4.5 LPA. Mostly mass recruiter companies hire the majority of students, such as TCS, Infosys, Autodesk, Capgemini, etc. The most common roles are software engineer, analyst, developer, and data engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Many facilities are available on campus. It includes a library, gym, sports facilities, coding clubs, and dance clubs. Library and hostels are well- maintained, but the gym has only basic machines for workouts. Most classrooms have projectors. Labs are well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, but not all of them. The course curriculum is relevant to students’ needs. Semester exams are administered by AKTU, and the paper checking is very tough. Sessional exams are conducted by the college and are also tough, which provides good practice for the semester exams. About 90% of the students pass the college internal exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college provides best placement.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, 70 percent of students get placed each year. The average package is 7 LPA, and the highest package offered in 2024 was 58 LPA. Mostly mass recruiter companies hire a majority of students, like TCS, Infosys, Autodesk, Capgemini, etc. However, big multinational companies also hire students from companies like Google, Microsoft, Amazon, etc. But you have to stand out from the crowd for a good package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of my college is very good, neat, and clean. The facilities available in my department are Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and a library. The hostel is very good. Hostel food is very good, but they follow the same menu every time. There is a mess where we eat and have a canteen, sports, and medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Proper exams are taken in college for preparation of university examination conducted by Abdul Kalam Technical University every month, which are called sessional tests and Pre University Test, and the college also provides exposure to many industries and companies. Semesters are difficult because they have some difficult subjects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college is the best in academics and also provides the best placement.

detailed_review.Placements: 70-80 percent of students got placed each year. The average package is 4 LPA, and the highest package offered in 2024 was 58 LPA. Mostly mass recruiter companies hire a majority of students, like TCS, Infosys, Autodesk, Capgemini, etc. However, big multinational companies also hire students from companies like Google, Microsoft, Amazon, etc. But you have to stand out from the crowd for a good package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Buildings are maintained and look good. Wi-Fi is not available on the campus for students. Computer labs are good, but in tech labs. Some machines are not working properly. Classrooms are good, but we feel hot in summer because of the lack of AC. Hostels are okay. The B.Tech canteen is too old, and the BCA canteen is the best. Games like carrom and chess are there. If we are a hosteller, then we can play games because in the middle of classes, there is no permission to play.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality is good, with experienced faculty focusing on both theory and practical knowledge. The curriculum is industry-relevant, ensuring students are job-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult, with a high pass percentage of around 90-95 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college is the best in academics.

detailed_review.Placements: The average package is up to 7 LPA. The highest package was 58 LPA in the previous year. We can easily SEE the placement cell. They are always distrustful as companies started to come for overall placements. We get to know that the placement cell helps you a lot to get a job according to your talents and skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good, neat, and clean. The facilities available in my department are Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and a library. The hostel is very good. Hostel food is very good, but they follow the same menu every time. There is a mess where we eat and have a canteen, medical facilities, sports, and games zone.
detailed_review.Faculty: They provide a good and competitive environment and help their students know the current technology and the latest version of technology, and build their students in such a way that they can survive everywhere and put them in a win-win situation, so that they have a focused mind.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: This college is the best in academics.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very good compared to other private colleges affiliated with AKTU University. If we talk about placement percentage in the 2023-24 session, the placement percentage was around 75 percent. The highest package offered is around 58 LPA. Overall, the average package is around 7 LPA. The median offered package is 3.5 LPA. You should focus more on the average package, which sometimes does not tell you the complete picture. Top recruiting companies are Accenture, TCS, Wipro, and Palo Alto.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are spacious and air-conditioned. There are projectors in some of the classes as well. Labs are well-maintained. The library has a large collection of textbooks and journals. The institute provides separate hostels for both boys and girls within the campus premises. Rooms are decent in size and furnished with essential facilities. The hostel building is Wi-Fi enabled. Mess food is also satisfactory. The canteen on campus offers a variety of snacks and meals at reasonable prices.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum is based on the AKTU exam pattern, and it is not really easy. AKTU, as an examination board, is definitely not good. But the course that the faculty members teach in college is really nice. We need to start early if we want to be ahead of the crowd here because competition is really tough.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college provides the best placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80%-85% of students got placed from our course. The highest package is about 40 LPA, the lowest is around 4 LPA, and the average is 7 LPA-8 LPA. Top recruiters included Microsoft, Amazon, Infosys, Wipro, TCS, and Accenture. Nearly 70% of students secured internships, with companies like Cognizant, Deloitte, Capgemini, and HCL offering roles. The most common roles are software engineer, analyst, developer, and data engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure and facilities are available, but a small campus area, which makes it easier to cover the entire campus easily. Canteen and various other gathering places are provided for student interaction. A decent number of people are seen at the college on most days.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are highly qualified and knowledgeable, and they helped students in every possible way. The course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are quite good, not that hard, and nothing comes from outside the syllabus. It can make a student a little industry-ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college provides the best placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement of this college is very good, and almost all the students get placed. The students of this college get placed in very good companies. The average placement package is 6-7 LPA, and the highest placement package is 58 LPA. This college has very good placements compared to nearby colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is best compared to that of private colleges. The college has 2 libraries, 4 canteens, and a separate boys' and girls' hostel. The college provided the Wi-Fi, but it's just like a showpiece, it doesn't work. Mess food is average, like other hostels, not too good, not too bad. After 6 pm, the warden does not allow students outside the hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Proper exams are taken in college for preparation of university examination conducted by Abdul Kalam Technical University every month, which are called sessional tests and pre-university tests, and the college also provides exposure to many industries and companies. Semester examinations are of high quality, but with good preparation, you can easily get up to a 7.5 GPA.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: This college is best in academics.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college 85 percent of students are placed in the 4th year. The highest placement is 58 LPA and the lowest package offered is 4.5 LPA. The top companies in my college are Samsung, Palo Alto, and Capgemini. Students have to cope with their internships by themselves, as the college does not provide any internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are of top class as they push our limits and finish their course on time. They also provide a competitive environment and help us from every perspective. Whereas hostels are best, but there are very few seats and too many restrictions. They also provide good food and a fresh environment.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are the best, and almost all have earned a Ph.D. They have a lot of experience in their field, and some are IITians. They are always ready to help with your ideas, projects, syllabus, etc. They really explain very well if you attend every class, and lastly, you have proper notes for subjects, and no doubt they provide excellent notes. There are mainly three internal exams, two sessional and one final, after that you have to give your final external exam.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college provides the best placement.

detailed_review.Placements: College is good at placement, with almost 90 percent of students placed on campus. The highest placement of your college is 58 LPA. On our campus, many companies visited like Capgemini, TCS, Deloitte, Cognizant, Infosys, LTI, Mindtree, etc. Almost 40 percent of students start internships in their 3rd year at a good destination.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is good. Classrooms are good with AC for ventilation, and they are well spacious. Labs are also good, with well equipped and required equipment. If a student wants to perform any experiments, he/she can perform them under the guidance of a lab attendant. The library is very good, with thousands of books. The problem with the library is that it closes at 5 p. m. The hostel is not so good, and the worst part is the food in the mess. The food quality is bad, and after complaining, they still give bad food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers of this college are very well educated, and they guide their students very well so that they can score well in the exams. The method of conducting exams at this college is also very good. Exams are conducted regularly so that the students are prepared for the exams in advance.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college provides the best placements.

detailed_review.Placements: In this college, 75-85 percent of students get placed in my course. The highest package offered is around 57 LPA, and the lowest package offered is 4.5 LPA. Accenture and Wipro are the top recruiting companies for my course. 10 percent of students got internships from my course during the 3rd and 4th years. The top roles offered in my course are software developer, engineer, and SDE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are spacious and air-conditioned. There are projectors in some classrooms as well. Labs are well-maintained. The library has a large collection of textbooks and journals. The institute provides separate hostels for both boys and girls within the campus premises. Rooms are decent in size and furnished with essential facilities. The hostel building is Wi-Fi enabled. Mess food is satisfactory. The canteen on campus offers a variety of snacks and meals at reasonable prices.
detailed_review.Faculty: In my college, B.Tech programs are carefully designed to match the latest industry standards. The institute works closely with top companies. Sometimes, college exams are a little harder than the semester exams. The teaching method is very effective, as teachers explain everything in simple language.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college provides the best placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Most students get a salary package that ranges between 5-7 LPA. The highest package offered can go up to 57 LPA. Companies like Accenture, TCS, Wipro, Capgemini, and Cognizant hire students from the college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food served in the college hostel is very hygienic. There is a variety of food items. The college canteen is very good. Many facilities are available in the hostel. The infrastructure of this college is very good. The college has a modern campus with air-conditioned classrooms, a big playground, and facilities for sports like basketball and badminton.
detailed_review.Faculty: In G. L. Bajaj, teachers are very helpful and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students ready for the industry. Semester exams are difficult because they have some difficult subjects. The pass percentage is 33 percent. Students appreciate the supportive teachers and the focus on helping them with their careers. Staff members and teachers here are very cooperative.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: This college is famous for providing the best placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement percentage is up to 90%. There are many companies that come to our college, such as TCS, Infotech, Meesho, etc. The highest package offered in my college is 57 LPA. The lowest package offered is 4 LPA - 5 LPA. Average package offered is 7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is good. I am not in a college hostel, because they provide 3-seater plans, which is bad. Canteens are good. They provide sports activities. Playground is not that big, but what they provide is sufficient, basketball, volleyball, football, and cricket.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very highly educated. They conduct 3 exams in a semester, and those students get less marks and get extra classes to make up. Academics are really hectic but once you get the hang of it, you cover up easily. Semester examinations are of high quality, but with good preparation, you can easily get up to 7.5 GPA.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Overall I want to say that G. L. Bajaj is the best college for all courses in Uttar Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: In CSE AIML, almost 90% of students get placed in this college. The highest package is 46.3 LPA, the average package is 7.5 LPA, and the lowest package is 13 LPA. In this college, there are many companies that place students, such as Palo Alto, Amazon, Autodesk, Capgemini, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Robust infrastructure with Wi-Fi campus-wide. Air conditioning classroom, specialised lab [ cybersecurity, AIML Cloud], an expensive library with all types of books and fully air-conditioned. A rich digital lab and a big auditorium, sports and medical.
detailed_review.Faculty: Overall the faculty members are well educated. Most of the teachers studied in IITs. The faculty members provide some extra knowledge about G. K., Sports, Technologies, etc. Semester exams in this college were moderate to not high. All student covers all.
detailed_review.Other: In this course provide a unique blend of computer science and technology. In the future, AI is most relevant for all type of tasks.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Brief about GL Bajaj.

detailed_review.Placements: My college places around 80 percent of the students. The highest package till date from on-campus placement is 40 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA-4 LPA. Palo Alto is a top recruiter, which gives the highest package, and Capgemini gives so many students. Every student gets a PPO instead of an internship. The top role offered is a software engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi in our college is very bad. Our college libraries are good and have easy access, but there is no Wi-Fi. The classrooms for some courses are very good, but for some courses are very bad. The construction is ongoing for the new classrooms. The sports area is pretty decent, and the hostel food is quite decent, and the canteens are very nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college faculty is supportive, knowledgeable, and helpful. They are strict because they want everyone to get placed in good industries. It is a bit difficult to score in university, you have to study a lot, one night study won't work, the course is not relevant to what the industry demands.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: This college is the best in academics.

detailed_review.Placements: Most students get a salary package that ranges between 4-6 LPA. The highest package offered can go up to 45 LPa. Companies like Accenture, TCS, Wipro, Capgemini, and Cognizant hire students from here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are spacious and air-conditioned. There are projectors in some classrooms. Labs are well-maintained. The library has a large collection of textbooks and journals. The institute provides separate hostels for both boys and girls within the campus premises. Rooms are decent in size and furnished with essential facilities. The hostel building is Wi-Fi enabled. Mess food is also satisfactory. The on-campus canteen offers a variety of snacks and meals at reasonable prices. The college has a modern campus, a big playground, and facilities for sports like basketball and badminton.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum needs to be changed. Faculty members need to focus on application-based things instead of just dictating theories, which consist of different types of lectures. Teachers are always there on time, and they don't take any leave. The faculty also provides 1-on-1 lectures for better understanding. The exam pattern is moderate. The pass marks are 30 percent out of 70. Students appreciate the supportive teachers and the focus on helping them with their careers.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college provides the best faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-85 percent of students got placed from the CSE branch in G.L. Bajaj College. The highest package is 58 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. The average package is 6 LPA. Accenture, Capgemini, and Cognizant are the top recruiters. 30 percent of students got internships in companies like Paytm, etc. The top roles offered in my course are SAP, SDE, HR, and marketing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good, neat, and clean. Facilities available in my department are Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and a library. The hostel is very good. Hostel food is very good, but they follow the same menu every time. There is a mess where we eat. It also has a canteen, medical facilities, sports, and games zone.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are really helpful. They all are qualified and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is not that relevant. They can improve it, or I can say AKTU needs to improve it. Semester exams are not that tough at my college. The pass percentage is around 30.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: My college is the best in academics.

detailed_review.Placements: 75-85 percent of students got placed in my course. The highest package is around 57 LPA, and the lowest package is 4.5 LPA. Accenture and Wipro are the top recruiting companies for my course. 10 percent of students got internships from my course in the 3rd and 4th years. The top roles offered in my course are software developer, engineer, and SDE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is okay, but AC is still needed for first-year students as we face difficulties during the summer. Fans are also very small. Labs are good. AC is present in all labs. But in the case of a lab class of the PPS facility, the teacher needs to take all students together, not only two or three students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very highly educated. They conduct 3 exams in a semester. They conduct extra classes for students who get low marks. Academics are really hectic, but once we get the hang of it, we can catch up easily. They guide their students very well so that all students can score better in exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence (AI) And Data Science
reviews.review_title: GL Bajaj Institute provides the best placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest package is something around 36 LPA, and the lowest is 4.5 LPA. Accenture and Wipro are the top recruiting companies for my course. 10 percent of the students got the internship from my course during the 3rd and 4th years. The top roles offered in my course are software developers, engineers, and SDEs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is well-equipped with modern classrooms, high-speed Wi-Fi, fully functional labs, seminar halls, and a large library with both physical and e-resources. The hostel facilities are decent with spacious rooms, clean washrooms, and adequate security. The mess food is average but hygienic, while the canteen provides better options. There are also medical facilities, sports grounds for cricket, football, basketball, and an indoor gym. Overall, the infrastructure supported academics as well as extracurricular activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, and they are knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good. This course curriculum is relevant and makes the students ready for the industry. Semesters are difficult because they have some difficult subjects. The passing percentage is 33 percent.

college_info.college_name: GRIET Hyderabad: Courses, Admissions 2025, Placements, Faculty, Infrastructure

highlights.summary:
Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology is a private UGC (Autonomous)-recognized institute located in Kukatpally, Hyderabad. Established in 1997 under the inspiration of the late Shri Gokaraju Rangaraju Garu, the institute is recognized by the AICTE and the courses are approved by NBA. Also known as GRIET Hyderabad, the institute focuses on the students’ holistic development by blending values like excellence and integrity with innovation and sustainability. GRIET is affiliated to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, Hyderabad (JNTUH).
Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology has been awarded NAAC Grade-A++, and the institute is placed in the NIRF 101-150 rank band. The Gokaraju Educational Society is recognized by DSIR, Government of India as a Scientific Industrial Research Organization (SIRO). The Material Testing lab at GRIET Hyderabad, known as GRMTL, is accredited by the National Accreditation Board for Testing and Calibration Laboratories (NABL). The quality management system of GRIET Hyderabad has been certified by ISO 9001:2015. GRIET Hyderabad offers UG and PG courses in a variety of specializations.
Further information regarding GRIET Hyderabad highlights can be found below:
Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology Hyderabad Highlights 2025
NAAC (Grade-A++), NBA, NABL, DSIR

AWS, Palo Alto, Celonis, Red Hat, Blue Prism, GoDaddy Academy, Microsoft
