GRIET Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Outdated syllabus and faculty but placements are really good.

detailed_review.Placements: It is better than many of the EAMCET colleges, and several companies visit for hiring. Just need to be skilled and lucky enough to get placed but the TPO works hard enough to get the companies. Jpmc is one of the top companies that comes for hiring. Twice, once for internship and then for full time.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Library is pretty good, but labs and Wi-Fi facilities are not so good. Students are not allowed in the library during classes. Laptops are pretty old in the labs and the course syllabus is pretty outdated. It is better not to jump into arguments with the lab faculty.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty are not so good, curriculum is a bit outdated, but one can easily clear the exams since the paper setting and evaluation are done liberally just have to follow the assignments and important notes to clear the exams. Better not mess with the faculty.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: GREET the college of excellence.

detailed_review.Placements: Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology is good at placements. The average package offered is 6LPA. I love this college so much because of these placements, several different companies will approach our college for recruiting students for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology is good at sports. They conduct sports meets every year, encourage each and every department in sports and a PT period is also available for each department.
detailed_review.Faculty: Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology is very good at conducting exams and maintains high discipline in conducting exams. Faculty is very friendly and highly talented and useful for students in clearing doubts and exam curriculum is also good. Sports Faculty is very friendly.
detailed_review.Other: Gokaraju Rangaraju Institute of Engineering and Technology is very good in infrastructure, sports, and mainly in placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: GRIET is absolutely satisfied with our faculty and curriculum.

detailed_review.Placements: There are less placement opportunities, and most of the people who got placed are getting smaller packages. The highest package in this college is 14LPA and the lowest package is 3LPA. The placement training is very average for the students and the placement faculty is not very experienced.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this college is beautiful and its a green campus. Wherever you see. You find trees, and when it comes to labs, there are less laptops and most of them wont work properly. The canteen food is not that hygienic but worth that price.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is good and friendly most of the time. The curriculum is outdated. The syllabus that they follow is a very old syllabus. The teaching faculty is very friendly and available for the students every time and always be on your side.
detailed_review.Other: Events and culturals are good, and the best thing about this college is very friendly environment. The people are amicable and polite.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good infrastructure, nice facilities, a canteen, a library, etc. It is a good college.

detailed_review.Placements: 85 percent of students get placed in the CSE course. The highest package offered is 50 LPA, and the lowest package offered is 3 LPA. The average package offered ranges from 6-8 LPA. Paypal, Commvault, Oracle, and Cisco are some of the top recruiting companies in my college. 50 percent of students get internships from companies like JP Morgan, IBM, and Amazon. Top roles like data analyst, software engineer, etc., are offered with a stipend that ranges from Rs. 20,000-35,000 per month.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are good facilities and infrastructure in our college. Mostly, Wi-Fi connections have a considerably good speed. In labs, laptops are used, and they are slower than an average laptop. Classrooms are vast, clean, and peaceful. We have a large library for reading with good maintenance. Referenced books for semester preparation are available there. Record books are also sold here. There is no hostel for boys in this college. Clean and good-quality food is available in the canteen. There are no considerable medical facilities. We have indoor games like table tennis, carrom, etc., and outdoor games like basketball, cricket, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are helpful, but most of them are not. Everyone is qualified except some. They are knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is relevant, and the course makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are quite difficult in this college. The pass percentage is above 85 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in technical things like front-end development, and I wanted to become one, so I chose this course. This course will make students industry-ready. It should provide good faculty members to make this course better. Events do happen frequently in our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: I was fairly satisfied with the education, though the facilities were not up to expectations.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college is good in terms of placements. It provides extra training sessions to enhance and improve the coding skills of students. In 2025, our college recorded 86 companies and 1016 job offers. The highest package in our college is 51 LPA, and the lowest package is 3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good, but I am a little disappointed with basic facilities such as washrooms. It would be better if they were improved for better comfort and hygiene. Regarding the canteen, it doesn't meet our expectations. Even though the college infrastructure is good, the way to college is in bad condition.
detailed_review.Faculty: I am somewhat satisfied with the faculty. The staff is good, but in terms of clarifying and explaining subjects, it was not to the point. Our college is pretty good regarding exams and tests. Semester exams are a little hard, so you need to have knowledge of the topics in your syllabus.
detailed_review.Other: At GRIET, for every 20 students, we had a mentor who checked on students regularly to ensure they were attending classes, submitting records, and maintaining discipline. This helps students stay consistent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Faculty behaviour is very bad, but placements are good, and the library is large.

detailed_review.Placements: Above 80 percent of students are placed. The packages range from 3 LPA to 51.6 LPA last year, 2025. Amazon, Paypal, and Google are top recruiting companies. Around more than 70 percent of students apply to Cisco, Amazon, and TCS by themselves. Top roles offered include software engineer, data analyst, and data scientist.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has considerably fast Wi-Fi connection, though some labs have very slow laptops. Classrooms are vast, clean, and peaceful. The infrastructure is excellent, neat, and calm. There is no hostel, but canteen food is good. There are a few indoor and outdoor games and limited medical facilities. The library is very good and large.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty are qualified, though some have very little knowledge and teaching quality is below average. The course is hard but makes students industry ready. The pass percentage is around 85 percent. Some teachers are very helpful, while some are not. Overall, this course is relevant.
detailed_review.Other: I have interest in computers. The course curriculum and faculty experience are good. Many events are held, the campus has a lot of crowd, and the college is in a hill region. Clubs and scholarships are available.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Should not expect more about the fests, mainly the college focuses on the training and placement.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students who got placed from my course is 75 percent, and the highest package offered in my course is 52 LPA by Microsoft, and the lowest package 6 LPA-10 LPA. The top recruiters like Microsoft, JP Morgan, Casio, Oracle, etc., from the 3rd year, only a students got placed through internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available for my department are good. For the lab, they provide laptops. Every student gets a laptop. There are up to 50-60 laptops in a lab. The food provided by the mess and canteen is okay, and they provide a gym and sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The training placement in our college is too good when compared to other colleges. The academics are also good, but training is better, and they started training students from the 2nd year only. It is a good practice for every student to learn from 2nd year. The course curriculum is relevant.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen AIML because nowadays AI technology has changed everything, so there will be a good journey with this course. In our college, the percentage of events is less compared to other colleges. In our college, they provide events like Pragnya, TEDx, and Traditional Day.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Come and explore the Hill Country College.

detailed_review.Placements: Regarding placements, it is better than many other colleges. It conducts training and placement sessions and offers a stipend of Rs. 20,000 for each placement opportunity.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college construction is very bad, as it is built on a hill, which makes reaching the campus tiring. There is no separate college for boys. The campus is only for girls. Sports facilities are of a medium level, and the events are not very impressive.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college follows an average curriculum. It is similar to what other colleges offer. It should focus on trending technologies driving the market, such as Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. They teach students how to train LLMs and gain more practical knowledge in AI and ML.
detailed_review.Other: This is an average college. You will realize its true value after joining.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Honest review of a student from GRIET.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the Computer Science Engineering department. Placement opportunities in my department are too good, and approximately 90-95% students will be placed in my course and sub-branches of my course. The highest package is up to 54 LPA, the average package is 12-15 LPA, and the lowest package is 5-7 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Google, Microsoft, IBM, JPMorgan Chase, etc. Software engineer, data analyst, and project manager are the top roles offered. About 70% students got internships in companies like IBM, JPMorgan's Case.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is good. They provide laptops with Wi-Fi during the lab hours. Classrooms are clean and neat. The library is large and has many books. Students can take the books from the library and return them. 1st year students have a separate sports period, and games can be played after college hours.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers help and guide students. A few teachers are not knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good from most of the teachers. The course curriculum is relevant. In my course, they teach C and Python in the 1st year, Java programming, DBMS in the 2nd year, and full stack development in the 3rd year. It makes the students industry-ready. The semester exams in this college are medium level. The pass percentage is 80-90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE because I am interested in coding and learning programming languages. The best part of my course is that we can play with the code and learn. There are many clubs in my college, clubs conduct quizzes, hackathons, workshops, and make students learn technical skills and communication skills. There are a few fests in the college. The campus surroundings have trees all over, and are far from the traffic.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I loved the college campus for its environment and infrastructure. The college has good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 75-80% of the students of my course, that is Computer Science and Engineering, are placed. The highest package in our course is 52 LPA, the average package is 12-13 LPA, and the lowest package is 7-8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Microsoft, JP Morgan, Oracle, IBM, Google, and more. 50-65% of students in our course got internships in companies like JP Morgan and IBM. Top roles like Data Analyst, Web Developer, App Designer, and Java Development roles are offered in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure of the college are good. The college has spacious classrooms, and the labs are neatly maintained. The college library has books for all the courses, and it is a peaceful place to study. The college's environment is peaceful with greenery. I am from the hostel which is near the college, and the facilities of the hostel, like providing geysers and washing machines, are good. The rooms are spacious and clean. Coming to the food, the quality of food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are helpful in academics and guide us to improve in core skills and perform better in core subjects. The teaching quality is really good. The course curriculum is relevant, and this college makes the students ready for the industry by training them with various skills for placements with better packages, and also helps them gain knowledge about their course. Semester exams are not too difficult. Everyone can clear the exams by putting some effort into academics. 85% of the students will succeed in passing the semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: My interest in programming made me choose this course. The best things about my course are startups, fast-growing technologies like web and app development, Data Science, and creative problem-solving. There will be several technical and non-technical events on the campus. Our college also conducts some fests like the Traditional Day and the Freshers. The government provides scholarships for students based on their merit.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: The college infrastructure is good, with a lot of greenery, and placements are good.

detailed_review.Placements: The college placement is very good and actively provides opportunities in various companies. They have strong ties with big IT companies like Amazon, Microsoft, JPMC, TCS, Cognizant, Infosys, and many others. The placement percentage is above 80%. Placement-oriented training is conducted separately so students can secure jobs. The placement cell actively posts internships and encourages students. The placement cell offers students opportunities in various domains according to their interests.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are good. It has projectors, good lighting, clean rooms, and proper seating. Labs have well-conditioned equipment, modern laptops, necessary software tools, and Ethernet and Wi-Fi. The library has vast resources in a well-organized manner. The lab facilities are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Coming to faculty, some are good in their academic knowledge, while some are not very efficient in delivering classes. The curriculum is well-prepared and advanced, focusing on industry-relevant learning skills. The semester exams are medium in difficulty. The pass percentage is 75 percent. But some lecturers are not strong in their subjects.
detailed_review.Other: The college focuses on discipline, so there are fewer non-teaching fests and events, but more teaching events are conducted.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Satisfied because of the good faculty and good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 85 percent of students got placed in my course, which is in Data Science, and it depends upon you to learn the skills. In my branch, the highest package is 28 LPA, and the lowest is 6 LPA. The top recruiters are Amazon, Google, and Deloitte, and some are off-campus placements. Up to 76 percent of members got internships, which also depends on the way you participate in all hackathons and college events.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Nice facilities and no events. Labs are also good, and classrooms are well-maintained. There is no college hostel for boys, only for girls. The hostel fee for girls is 1,15,000. There are separate grounds for cricket, volleyball, and football, and the college has a gym that is free for all.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college has good faculty. They arre supportive. These curriculum-relevant courses will make you industry-ready, and it depends on you how you prepare and learn. The teachers are knowledgeable, and they have PhDs in their subjects. The teachers are helpful. If you want only to study, then it is a good choice.
detailed_review.Other: Don't expect much in terms of events. There are only 2 or 3 events in a year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: A great place for teaching enthusiasts with strong placements and a vibrant campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: College has strong placements, especially for CSE, AIML, and these branches. The AIML course was created in 2020. The highest package was around 50 LPA, and the average is 5-10 LPA. In 2025, over 600 students are placed. Top companies like Amazon, Google, and J. P. M visit the campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The AIML course has well-equipped labs, classrooms, Wi-Fi, and a good library with required resources. The course gives hands-on experience with support from AI-certified faculty. The hostel is very strictly maintained, and the food quality is good. There are also medical facilities and a gym in the hostel. Reminder: the hostel is only available for girls.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful and knowledgeable, and they explain concepts clearly. The syllabus is updated every 2 years and matched with the growing technologies and industry, which helps us get ready for placements. Exams are not too hard if we study regularly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My GRIET review in my POV.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year, GRIET records between 70 and 90 percent of placements. The highest package in 2025 is 51.6 LPA at Google, and the lowest is 3 LPA, with an average of about 6 LPA. There are 1000+ offers on campus, and Google, Amazon, TCS, Infosys, and Deloitte are among the top recruiters.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GRIET provides a large library, well-equipped labs, Wi-Fi, and smart classrooms. The 24-acre green campus features a gym, canteen, sports facilities, auditoriums, and medical facilities. Boys stay in private hostels, while girls’ hostels are good with food and Wi-Fi.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at GRIET are helpful, knowledgeable, and provide high-quality instruction with clear conceptual understanding. The curriculum helps students develop skills that are ready for the workplace and is reasonably current. Concepts and applications are tested moderately in exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Helpful teachers, updated curriculum, good labs, student-friendly campus, and high pass percentage.

detailed_review.Placements: GRIET Hyderabad placement rate is 70-80%. For the year 2024, it was specifically 89.13%. The highest package offered is 51 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA, and the average is around 6 LPA - 8 LPA for CSE. Companies like Google, Amazon, Microsoft, Oracle, TCS, JP Morgan, and many reputed companies come for placements. 40-70% of students secure internships at companies like TCS, JP Morgan, Amazon, with colleges integrating internships into their curriculum. Top roles offered are software engineering, data analyst, and product manager. Different roles are also offered, like business analyst and android developer, with companies like Amazon, TCS, and Infosys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: CSE department at GRIET has good labs with high-speed systems, smart classrooms, and a well-stocked library. Wi-Fi works well. There are regular workshops and hackathons. Campus is green, student-friendly, and overall supportive for learning and growth. Hostel for boys is not provided, but accommodation for girls is provided. Canteen and mess food is quite good. Medical and sports facilities are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in CSE at GRIET are quite helpful and approachable. Most of them are well-qualified and explain concepts in a practical way. Teaching quality is good, with a mixture of theory and hands-on sessions. The curriculum is updated and largely industry-relevant, covering programming, AI, ML, data science, etc., which helps during placements. Semester exams are moderately difficult. If you attend classes and practice regularly, passing is not too tough. The pass percentage is usually high, as most students clear their subjects without much trouble.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: GRIET records 70-90% placements yearly. In 2025, the highest package offered is 51.6 LPA by Google, the lowest package offered is 3 LPA, and the average package offered is 6 LPA. More than 1,016 students got offers, and more than 400 students got placements with a package of 6 LPA. Recruiters include Google, Amazon, TCS, Infosys, and Deloitte. 50 to 90% secure internships in firms like JPMorgan and TCS. Top roles are software/data engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GRIET offers smart classrooms, Wi-Fi, well-equipped labs, and a vast library. The 24-acre green campus has auditoriums, sports courts, a gym, a canteen, and medical aid. Girls' hostels are good with Wi-Fi and food, and boys mostly stay in private hostels. Mess food is decent, though reviews are mixed.
detailed_review.Faculty: Greetings, teachers are supportive, well-qualified, and deliver quality teaching with good conceptual clarity. The curriculum is fairly relevant and helps students gain industry-ready skills. Exams are moderately difficult, testing concepts and applications. Pass percentage remains consistently high.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for its career scope and practical learning. The best part is a focused curriculum and supportive faculty. More internships and hands-on projects could improve it. GRIET has vibrant fests, active clubs, good campus life, strong connectivity, and scholarships.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: My Experience at GRIET @AIMLE.

detailed_review.Placements: On and off, 75 to 80% placed in the on-campus placements. The highest package is 51.6 LPA from Google, and the average package is about 6.9 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Google, JP Morgan Chase, Commvault, Paypal, TCS, and Infosys, and the roles offered in the course are AI engineer and data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Only the girls' hostel is available. The facilities and infrastructure are quite good, with well-ventilated labs and classrooms with projectors. The seminar halls are quite big and the best, but the college is very secure with security, and there will be two canteens for the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful only with the curriculum, but not expected to have industry-ready knowledge, and the course curriculum is relevant, but not expected to be an industry-ready, skilled curriculum. There will be moderate difficulty in the external examinations.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because I was interested in choosing the AIML course for its originality, making it an industry-ready curriculum rather than a JNTUH affiliation. The events, clubs, and other activities should be encouraged.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and faculty. But fewer events and non-technical clubs.

detailed_review.Placements: If you're in CSE, AIML, or IT, you're likely to have a very good chance of getting placed with a decent salary. Maybe even land a high-paying job if your skills are sharp. Other branches also get placed but might require a bit more effort or off-campus hustle. Internships are available for most students, and companies visiting the campus are a mix of top-tier MNCs and growing startups.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GRIET has good infrastructure. Good classrooms, labs, and a great library. The hostel facilities are better for girls, since they're managed by the college, while boys have to look for PGs nearby. Food is decent, not amazing, and sports are encouraged, though space is a bit limited. Medical support and transport are reliable, and the campus itself is clean and well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers at GRIET are well-qualified and supportive, especially in top branches like CSE. Many hold PhDs and are approachable when you need help. The curriculum is mostly up to date and includes internships, certification, and industry-related subjects. Exams aren't too tough. If you attend classes and revise properly, you'll be fine. The difficulty is moderate, and most students pass. The pass percentage is usually around 80%-90%.
detailed_review.Other: Very few events, mainly focusing on studies. Scholarships are only for TG students. Coming to the clubs, there are only technical clubs. There is only one non-technical club.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a good college for placements. It has a well-educated faculty and a good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 85-90% of students got placed in CSE in the last year, and in my batch, it is almost 80%. The highest package offered is 50 LPA, and the lowest package ranges from 3-4 LPA. The average package is 6 LPA. TCS, Wipro, and service-based companies, etc., hire students. 40% of students got internships in various companies like JP Morgan, etc. Roles offered are project manager expertise, technical manager, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. Facilities in the college are very good. Labs are well-maintained, and well-equipped computers are provided to students. Classrooms are neat, and the library is full of books. There is no college hostel. The quality of food in the canteen is average, and of high price. Good sports and games are conducted.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified, and some teachers are from NITs with the best knowledge. The teaching quality is better. The course curriculum is relevant to the industries and prepares students for companies. Semester exams are neither that difficult nor easy. Almost 60-70% is the pass percentage.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in software development, so I took this course. The best thing about our course is the knowledgeable faculty members, and the lab mentors are also good. Things to improve, according to me, are the food in the canteen and nothing much. Few events are conducted. The campus crowd is large. Scholarships are provided. Extracurricular activities are also conducted, but not much.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: GRIET is good at everything.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students get placed in GRIET. The minimum package is 3-4 LPA, the average is 5-7 LPA, and the highest is about 44 LPA. Popular companies like Wipro, Deloitte, Amazon, Google, and JP Morgan visit the campus. Many students also get placed for internships, and it doesn’t only depend on the college; we also have to work hard.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There will be no Wi-Fi except for labs and labs and classroom will be nice and lib is huge we can find any type of books in library at last idk about hostel coz im a daysscholar mess and canteen will be good medical was good because were be having an pharmacy block in the college as per games there are several options for games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are also good. Most of them are well-educated and explain very well. All the courses explained are relevant to the curriculum. Semester exams are a little bit tough, but it totally depends on the sets. The pass percentage in exams is 21% in external exams, and you have to have at least 14% in internals.
detailed_review.Other: Events do not happen often in GRIET, but there are several clubs used to communicate.

college_info.college_name: Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary:
Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya, popularly known as GGV, is a central university located in Bilaspur, Chhattisgarh. The university was established in 1983 under the Central Universities Act 2009. The university also facilitates 11 schools of study, a Centre of Distance and Online Education (CDOE), a UGC Malaviya Mission Teacher Training Centre, and a Dr. Ambedkar Centre of Excellence.
Formerly known as Guru Ghasidas University, GGV is approved by the UGC, AICTE, and NCTE. GGV is also accredited by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC) with an ‘A++’ grade. The university is an active member of the Association of Indian Universities and the Association of Commonwealth Universities.
GGV Bilaspur offers a plethora of courses at the undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral levels, along with certificate and diploma courses. These are offered across streams such as Engineering, Humanities, Science, Commerce, Law, Education, Medicine and Health Sciences, among others. Further, these courses are offered in full-time mode.
The major highlights of Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya are tabulated below:
UG, PG, PhD, Certificate, Diploma
CUET, CUET PG, JEE Main, GATE, GPAT, NEET PG

table.details: CUET, CUET PG, JEE Main, GATE, GPAT, NEET PG

college_info_program.intro:
Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya offers numerous UG, PG, and Doctoral courses across streams such as Engineering, Humanities, Science, Commerce, Law, Education, Medicine and Health Sciences, etc. The popular courses at GGV Bilaspur include MSc and MA. The courses are offered in full-time mode.
MA graduates from GGV are acquainted with skills such as social, economic, political, historical, philosophical, and ideological. The course provides an understanding and importance of literature, and promotes the moral, mental, and intellectual development of the students. The MA programme provides an understanding of the influence of literature on society. MA graduates from GGV can opt for government and civil services.
MSc at Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya Bilaspur provides students with the fundamental knowledge of subjects such as Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, Botany, Zoology, Microbiology, etc. The MSc programme also assists students in developing analytical skills to critically analyse scientific and critical data to pursue higher studies. MSc graduates from GGV can also pursue careers such as Software Developer, Web Developer, Data Scientist, Lecturer, Research Scientist, etc. Further, MSc graduates can also prepare for government and competitive exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: According to me, this college has value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: I recently took admission in B.Tech in ECE at GGU. My JEE CRL rank is 84000. After coming to campus, I heard from professors that there are no placements in this college. Only 2 to 5 percent of students are placed here. The highest package is 5 LPA on campus, and the lowest is Rs 90,000 per annum. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Mahindra, and Tata Steel. 50 to 60 percent of students got internships by college or outside sources. Top role is circular designer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is overall good. Wi-Fi is also available but it does not work properly. On this campus there is a central library. In hostels, the food they provide like roti is so hard and dal is fully water. One thing that is good here is snacks in the evening. The sports facility is good but not like NIT and IIT. There is one cafeteria in our college. Free medical facilities are provided by college.
detailed_review.Faculty: We cannot accept any help from teacher, they are not much knowledgeable in tech field. Course curriculum is overall good. Semester exam is moderate level. Minimum passing percentage is approximately 5 GPA. It is easy to score well in exams because teachers are very supportive and guide us. One thing I say, please come here only to pass the study because no other activities are happening here. We have to do everything ourselves. Here faculty members are mostly PhD scholars.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am not interested in tech field. The best things about this course are circuit-related things, lab activities, and practical study. Events are not held on this campus.

reviews.course: M.A. in Economics
reviews.review_title: My honest review of my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement records are awesome because the university placement cell brought many companies to the campus recruitment from different bodies like NGOs, multinational companies, government organisations, and private sectors as well. Normally, the company offers Rs 2,80,000 to Rs 14,00,000 package depending on the company. Companies that come here are Wipro, Infosys, L&T, Hindustan Unilever, Godrej, few pharmacy company, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The courses offered by the university are very good which cover all necessary subjects and topics related to the present scenario in various fields. It also organises seminars and research-related work for the students, and then they review the program to determine whether it has been successfully done or needs to be organised again. Hostels are awesome with all basic amenities, having nominal charges on a yearly basis, not more than Rs 5000. All rooms are shared on a basis of 2 persons with separate beds, chair, and table along with rake for book keeping.
detailed_review.Faculty: I am from commerce faculty and commerce faculty has the largest number of students in one class. There are 150 students in 1st semester only. The building of my faculty is an old building, and new building of commerce department is under construction near the Chemistry department. Teachers are good, and there is a good learning environment in my faculty.

reviews.course: Bachelors of Commerce (B.Com.) (Hons.)
reviews.review_title: GGV - A Considerably Good University.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70% of students were placed before my batch, but there was no mention of the packages or companies because my course isn't very popular with big companies. We are offered internships in many places every year, both online and offline.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have Wi-Fi in all departments, and it always works. It's good, we can log in with our enrollment ID. Some classrooms are new, and some are old. We have an integrated big library named Nalanda Central Library. There is everything available, from AC to copying services. The mess food is also of good quality, and we have small Nescafés, Amul, and a separate canteen too. It's very good, and sports and games are organized every now and then in our playground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very well qualified and knowledgeable, and they are very helpful too. They are some of the best ones you can get, except for the subject I chose in the education department, where I didn't have a very great experience. Otherwise, every other teacher is well qualified. The curriculum is according to NEP 2020, and they are following it very well, which makes the students industry-ready. According to my seniors, the semester exam is moderate, and the passing percentage is 40% out of 100 marks.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am from a commerce background and pursuing a CA course, so the subjects are relevant to me. Everything is good except that they sometimes cancel classes daily. Events, fests, crowd connectivity, and extracurricular activities are top-notch, and it's fun.

reviews.course: MBBS - Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery
reviews.review_title: The infrastructure is a bit run-down, but manageable with good professors.

detailed_review.Placements: The course of MBBS from my batch is yet to have placements, but in the long run, I guess it is 100%. The package varies on the type of work you are doing, but for simple MBBS Doctors with no further studies, it will be up to 70k-1.2L. Internship is 100%.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for the lecture hall is fine, there is AC and a projector, so no complaints about it, where wi-fi labs and library are available. The 1st and 2nd Year hostels are really good with attached bathrooms, but the main hostel is a little bit run-down. Medical facilities are top-notch, not much sports and games are available, and the mess and canteen are okay.
detailed_review.Faculty: The professors are really professional at their work, and their teaching qualities are good, but it also depends on the person. It is a very relevant course curriculum, and it does make the students industry-relevant. The yearly exam is hard, with a pass percentage is 50%.

reviews.course: B.A. LL.B
reviews.review_title: I think it's needed reforms.

detailed_review.Placements: 95 percent of students are placed in our course. Not more than 10 LPA. 30 to 50 percent of students got internship with High Court of Bilaspur. I do not know about the company, I will understand the programme. Our top alumni become civil judges, advocates, junior researchers, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is good, not better than good. Classroom is awesome. Library is well maintained. We got fabulous professors and scholars, and office staff. Even the guard is very protective. They scolded, but they love students. Food quality is good. 10 rupees Swabhiman Thali is good for students, we can get proper dal, bhat, sabji. Sports ground is enough, but there are no players.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable but unconvincing with scholars. They only teach all about study, not even about life. Less practical skill, only study, not guaranteed for success in life. Our first exam will be there, so I do not know about the difficulty in semester exam. I think 50% makes the students ready for the justice industry.
detailed_review.Other: I belong to lower middle class. I want to change my society, but why will people follow me if I gain knowledge about the Constitution. So I will definitely change it. I decided to take B.A. LL.B., including politics, which is the backbone of the country, and sociology. These are my favorite subjects, and I want more and more. If there are a meeting hall for students, they could discuss their problems with friends. Definitely, it would become the most loved department.

reviews.course: M.Pharma (Pharmaceutics)
reviews.review_title: Very low charges in this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very average. As this is a government college, not so many companies visit our college. This year, Cipla, Sunpharma, and Mankind visited our college. Students are placed in different production units as production managers, QA, and QC sectors. Salary given was Rs. 30,000-25,000 per month.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good. Hostels are good, they are 2-seater and 3-seater. There are many grounds for different sports. There are canteens, cafeteria restaurants, etc., on the campus. Wi-Fi is all over the campus. Labs are spacious and have all the apparatus used in industry. Classrooms are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good. They are highly educated and experienced. They have many years of experience in teaching. The course curriculum is good, it makes us ready for the industry. There are two semesters in a year, and each semester has two sessionals which are conducted by the college.

reviews.course: M.A. in Economics
reviews.review_title: My honest review of my college.

detailed_review.Placements: As it is compulsory to do industrial training after the third year, I did an internship at Bhilai Steel Plant. I learned a lot in the plant and visualized the real-time application of all the theories being taught in the classes. It was not a paid internship, so I didn't receive a stipend, even though I applied for the internship all by myself. In the field of internships, the college lags far behind other colleges. The students are on their own. The only help I received was from our seniors and some professors.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a separate hostel for 1st-year students and the senior hostel. The 1st-year hostel is good, but the senior hostels are not that great. However, the good news is that the hostels were renovated and most of the issues have been overcome. The fee for the hostel is reasonable. I am interested in Economics as a domain and want to pursue public policy. The student-to-teacher ratio is 1:5. The faculty is experienced and qualified as per UGC guidelines. The teaching methods were quite good, encouraged us to ask doubts, and showed interest in assisting during research work.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course is, no doubt, good and the syllabus is in accordance with the GATE syllabus and other competitive exams in the technical field, but being situated in a small city, the curriculum is mostly confined to the theoretical. There are three courses in each semester, and there is also an optional course to be pursued in the second semester. In each of the second-year semesters, four optional courses must be completed. Details about the courses can be seen on the college website. The end-term exams are usually problem-solving rather than essay-based (for most courses).

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Botany
reviews.review_title: Overall, it was the best college for the M.Sc. in Botany course.

detailed_review.Placements: The amenities at our college were excellent. After graduation, many students found jobs with respected companies. Syngenta, BASF, and Bayer were some of the leading employers. Each year, about 85 to 92% of applicants were accepted into our college. For M.Sc. students studying plants, we offered great resources. Employers often filled top positions like botanist and ecologist. Many students secured internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi was not available at our college. Labs were better when there were more PCs, but we had fewer classrooms because students studied less. The library had many books. The computer was easy to access for studying and finding textbooks. There was no food or restaurant on campus. Even water was not readily available there.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our section, we had one of the best instructors. Every student received advice on how to do well on the structured internal tests. They were the best in their field. The teaching method was engaging and effective. We continued to take part in the course. This curriculum likely prepared us for jobs. 90 percent of students passed the semester exams, which were not too hard.

reviews.course: M.Pharma (Pharmaceutics)
reviews.review_title: Very inexpensive Central University.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very average. Our seniors are working in different production units as managers or QA QC managers. Some students are working in the F&D sectors. Students are placed through referral from the teachers. The highest package offered is 3.8 LPA, and the lowest package offered is 2.8 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi all over the campus with CCTV security. First aid kit and a hospital inside the campus. There are many grounds for different sports. There are hostels for boys and girls inside the campus. Most of the hostels are 3-seated and 2-seated. Mess food is average. Classrooms are spacious and digitally updated. Labs are good, they have all the apparatus used in industry.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, they are highly educated and experienced. They clear our doubts through discussions. The course curriculum is good, it makes us ready to explore a new world. There are two semesters in a year and each semester has two sessionals, which are conducted by the college.

reviews.course: M. Pharm.  (Pharmacology)
reviews.review_title: It is a very good college in Bilaspur.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are not as high as expected. This is a government college, so sometimes companies visit our college, sometimes not. Mostly Cipla, Mankind, and Aurobindo Pharma visited our college. In our branch, students are placed in different clinical trial sectors or in pharma vigilance. They get a salary between Rs. 25,000 and Rs. 30,000 per month.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good, it makes us feel good. Wi-Fi is available all over the campus with CCTV security. There are many hostels inside the campus. Hostels are 3-seated and 2-seated. Mess food is average. There are many grounds for different sports. There are cafeterias and canteen food inside the campus. Classrooms are spacious and digitally updated.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, they are highly educated and experienced. Mostly, they have done their Ph.D. from the top-most colleges in India. The course curriculum is good, it makes us ready to explore a new world. There are two semesters in a year and each semester has two sessionals.

reviews.course: M.Pharma (Pharmaceutics)
reviews.review_title: Very good college. Fees are very low.

detailed_review.Placements: As this is a central university, placements are not so outstanding. A few companies, like Cipla, Mankind, and Sun Pharma visit our campus. Students are placed as production manager, QA department, QC department, or in the F&D department. As fresher students get 2.5 LPA- 3.2 LPA package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good. Very good location. There are parks and good hangout spots. Labs are spacious and have all the apparatus used in industry. Classrooms are good and they are digitally updated. Hostels are good, they are 2-seater. There are many canteens and cafeterias on the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good. They are highly educated and experienced. They all have done their Master's and PhD. The course curriculum is good, it makes us ready to explore a new world. There are two semesters in a year, and each semester has two sessionals which are conducted by the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Industrial and Production Engineering
reviews.review_title: The environment is beautiful  and excellent faculty need better placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement scenario is decent and gradually improving every year. In previous batch most of my seniors secured placement with the highest package offered being 9LPA and the lowest package offered being 3 to 4LPA. Some of the companies that visited the campus are Tata Gotion Autocomp MSP steel L&T. Many students also got internship opportunities in companies like Tata Gotion ONGC Jindal NTPC Indian Railways. The university offers average yet steadily improving placements with increasing opportunities for both placements and internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus is green and peaceful it has 3 boys hostels and 4 girls hostel with one newly constructed. First year hostels are modern and well equipped with all facilities. The hostel for senior students has a solid infrastructure but offers spacious rooms greenery and a calm atmosphere. Mess food is average. Wi-Fi is also working good in the department and hostels. Classrooms and departments are well maintained with proper smart boards. There is one central library with a wide variety of books. The campus also includes two temples and beautiful lakes. Overall the campus is neat green and well facilitated with a healthcare center and cafeterias.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are highly qualified supportive and always ready to help students. They make complex topics easy to understand and guide students both academically and personally. The curriculum is well structured covering all the essential subjects needed for competitive exams like GATE. Semester exams are generally moderate not too tough if you stay consistent with your studies. 75 percent attendance is mandatory for appearing in the exam. The academic environment is student friendly and growth oriented.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Electronics
reviews.review_title: The faculty was very good.

detailed_review.Placements: The package depends on the cutoff of toppers. The lowest package of the department is 4 LPA, and the highest package is 42 LPA. A semiconductor company is coming. There are two types of internships, paid and unpaid. Also, you started an internship after your 1st year was done.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the department is good. There is a garden, a smart classroom and also a mini auditorium in your department after the main auditorium. Near the administrative office, there is also a Wi-Fi facility in the college. I don't know much about the hostel, but hostel rooms are nice, a personal almirah per person and a study table.
detailed_review.Faculty: Not every teacher, but some teachers are very helpful, well-qualified and knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is nice. The course curriculum is relevant, as it makes students ready for the industry. The semester exam will be a little bit difficult, but if you attend classes and study with notes, then it will be helpful.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have a strong interest in electrical devices. I wanted to learn about modern techniques in crop production, pest management, and soil conservation that can help improve the electrical devices.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Electronics
reviews.review_title: The infrastructure is good.

detailed_review.Placements: The package depends on the cutoff of toppers. The lowest package of the department is 4 LPA, and the highest package is 42 LPA. A semiconductor company is coming. There are two types of internships, paid and unpaid. Also, you started an internship after your 1st year was done.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the department is good. There is a garden, a smart classroom and also a mini auditorium in your department after the main auditorium. Near the administrative office, there is also a Wi-Fi facility in the college. I don't know much about the hostel, but hostel rooms are nice, a personal almirah per person and a study table.
detailed_review.Faculty: Not every teacher, but some teachers are very helpful, well-qualified and knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is nice. The course curriculum is relevant, as it makes students ready for the industry. The semester exam will be a little bit difficult, but if you attend classes and study with notes, then it will be helpful.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have a strong interest in electrical devices. I wanted to learn about modern techniques in crop production, pest management, and soil conservation that can help improve the agricultural sector. The campus environment is peaceful and green. The crowd is friendly and supportive. The college also conducts events, cultural fests, and sports activities regularly, which keep students engaged. Scholarships are available for deserving and economically weaker students. The connectivity to the town/city is good, and all basic facilities are available nearby.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Forestry and Environmental Science
reviews.review_title: If you love nature very good course.

detailed_review.Placements: Our department would conduct different types of internships associated with FRI Dehradun and other places. They shared internship opportunities in other places. They also provided different certificate oriented programs to promote the skills of the students. Percentage of students getting placement was a minimum 75%. Mostly students were placed in different agricultural sites or wildlife structures.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus life was really awesome. We had different types of clubs to promote their abilities. Dance drama singing & sports. We had our central library which had a huge collection of all types of books and journals. They had computers for the students to use the internet. We had free Wi-Fi in the university which was accessible to everyone. Hostels were good they were two seated. Many students do not get a hostel and they live in a PG.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty were very educated and professors still lack language skills. Most of the teachers take classes in Hindi when its a central university. Those who respected their teachers like a god were considered the best students. The exams would be 3 exams. Two internal and one main. The exam total marks were 100. I do not like my department head because he was so racist. Only care about Hindu students.

reviews.course: B.Sc. (Hons.) in Electronics
reviews.review_title: Very less expensive college and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement of TCS is offered, other than that, the placement cell is inside the college which helps the students to get placements. If not then students can get in touch with the professors who can hook up with the firms and industries. For internships, students can go anywhere where a vacancy is available. HOD and dean are supportive in that regard TG Reddy sir, recommended some good internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus of the college is very nice as we have garden, cafeteria, auditorium, central library, departmental libraries, playgrounds, and a lot more things offered by our college. Departmental libraries are closed on the department losing time which is around 6:00 PM. Central library is closed at 8:00 PM from Monday to Friday (working days) and closed 6:00 PM from Saturday to Sunday. We have smart classrooms for conferences and presentations. Wi-Fi is available all over the campus. There are many grounds for different sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty members are so gentle and support students like family members. But some faculty members are very rude and unsupportive as they just ignore your doubts and never clear your doubts about the subjects. In our university, the semester examinations are divided into three parts, including 2 internals of 30 marks and an end-of-semester exam of 70 marks. All theory and practical exams are separate and follow the same marking scheme.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Industrial and Production Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely Good University, but location of university is not good.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately every student is placed in my previous batch. The highest package offered is around 8 LPA, and the lowest is 4 LPA. The average is around 6 LPA. MSP Steel, Tata Gotion Autocamp, and NECO are top recruiters. About 70% of students got internships in various companies, some in government and some in private industries like Jindal, Tata, Gotion, Mahindra, etc. Roles offered are general manager and HR.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are good and clean, every classroom has smart boards, projectors, a microphone and speaker system, and the Quality is also good with a peaceful environment. There are 3 hostels in our college in which 2 are newly inaugurated and are good above average and feels like a building or hotel, has elevator and rooms are also good with wide windows and doors but there is one old hostel also which is not that much good as it has old infrastructure but it feels like home there its full of greenery, flowers, plants etc, and also the environment is quite peaceful.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty is quite helpful and supportive. Some faculty are very experienced and have very good knowledge about the subjects they teach. Every teacher has their unique style for teaching, but everyone makes the subject pretty easy to understand. Our curriculum is also quite good, it has all the latest subjects that need to be studied, and it aligns with the subjects in competitive exams like GATE. Our HOD sir makes sure to keep the curriculum up to date. Semester exams are not so tough, but it depends on the faculty as they design the paper.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Placements are not good, campus life is decent, and academic load is less here.

detailed_review.Placements: The on-campus placement is not up to expectations. The number of companies coming to hire students is also less, and there is even a high chance of offers getting revoked. Only 25% of students got placed on campus. The highest package offered was around 6 LPA. Companies like Hexaware, Mountblue, and Gemini Solutions come for campus hiring. The roles are mostly software or system engineer roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a separate building for each department. Classrooms have TV screens, which are used by professors for teaching. There is MHRD Wi-Fi available. The college has 2 libraries: Departmental and Central Library. New hostels are constructed, and the food is good in the mess. There are 2-3 canteens and Nescafe outlets on the campus. A big ground for sports is available, and a coach is also there for training.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and very knowledgeable. Also, the course curriculum is designed so well that students will learn a lot more on diverse topics, which makes them industry-ready. SDE and AI-relevant courses are included in the curriculum. The semester exams are quite easy, and most of the paper questions come from the classroom teaching. The passing percentage is around 60%.
detailed_review.Other: The best thing about my course that I found is that I have good teachers in my department, and the course curriculum covers all the relevant topics that I want to learn. The thing that the college should work on is allowing students to select the elective courses by themselves.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Chemistry
reviews.review_title: A very good environment for studying, with a lot of greenery.

detailed_review.Placements: In this college, placements are fine. Although a few students are interested in my course, the placement percentage is 30% on average. You have to perform very well for further career opportunities like top-level research, a lab, scholarships, and other perks.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Here we have three boys' hostels and two girls' hostels. Although the male candidates are much greater in comparison, it's not always sufficient for them. The overall development could be better, regardless of funding. There's some lack of facilities and equipment in terms of this course as well as others.
detailed_review.Faculty: We are supported by highly skilled teachers, so there is no lack of teaching and study materials in terms of my course. It's a course where theory and practicals are sufficiently needed for a proper understanding and grip of the subject. That way, the course curriculum is very accurate.

reviews.course: B.A. LL.B
reviews.review_title: The college has supportive faculty. There is a scope for growth.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement scenario for B.A. LL.B. at Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya is average, with limited campus placement opportunities. While the academic environment is decent and fees are affordable, students largely rely on self-efforts for internships and jobs in litigation, LPOs, or government exam preparation. The university lacks a dedicated law placement cell, and most students pursue their careers through personal networking, judiciary prep, or further studies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: GGU offers well-maintained college infrastructure with smart classrooms, labs, a digital library, and sports facilities. Hostels are secure with clean rooms, messes, Wi-Fi, and common areas, ensuring a comfortable stay for students. Limited seats and strict timings (curfew for girls at 7 pm and for boys at 9:30 pm) can be drawbacks.
detailed_review.Faculty: The B.A. LL.B. teaching at GGU is rated as solid: the faculty are NET. Qualified, approachable, and supportive, with structured mentorship and regular internal exams, plus a final exam every six months. Teaching quality is good, but due to high student numbers, more faculty are needed. Internships are limited, and placements are rare.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: What should I do to get a direct admission in Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya?
faqs.answer: It is true that admission to GGU (Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya) can be obtained without taking the Vishwavidyalaya Entrance Test, or GGU VET ( direct addmission are open). Admission requirements for the various undergraduate and graduate programmes offered by GGU may differ. While certain programmes may have various entry requirements, such merit-based selection or other entrance tests, others may require the GGU VET. To find out if the GGU VET is required for the programme you are interested in, it is essential to review the entrance requirements specifically for that programme.

faqs.question: How should I prepare myself to get into Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya for B.Tech?
faqs.answer: Hi.To get admitted to Guru Ghasidas Vishwavidyalaya B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering course, applicants must meet the entry requirements - 75% in 12th. GGU Bilaspur B.Tech Admission Process Candidates must meet Guru Ghasidas University B.Tech eligibility criteria. Eligible students should appear and qualify for JEE Main examination. Qualified students can register on the official website through GGU Bilaspur Login portal. Then, candidates must fill out the application form with the required details. Candidates must register for the JoSAA counselling process. Candidates must select the GGU Bilaspur as their preferred college. Candidates will be shortlisted for GGU admissions based on the scores obtained in entrance examination. Thanks

highlights.summary:
Indian Institute of Information Technology, Design and Manufacturing Kancheepuram is a state-owned institute which is designed by the ministry of human resource development of Government of India in 2007. In July 2011, MHRD has given IIITDM Kancheepuram status of Institute of National Importance. According to the NIRF Ranking 2025, IIITDM Kancheepuram was ranked at position under the band 151-200 in the category of Engineering. Also, the institute has been ranked 222 by the QS World University Rankings 2025 in the Asian University Rankings - Southern Asia category. The institute is located in the suburbs of Chennai with a campus area of 51 acres which is fully residential. The institute offers BTech, MTech, dual degree and doctoral level programmes across various specialisations.
IIITDM Kancheepuram accepts admission to the flagship BTech programmes through JoSAA/ CSAB based on valid scores in JEE-Main. Also, for admission to the MTech programmes at the institute, candidates are required to have valid GATE scores. The overall highest package offered during IIITDM Kancheepuram was INR 32 LPA. The highest IIIT Kancheepuram average package was offered to dual degree students and the amount stood at INR 13.98 LPA. Below are the major highlights of the IIITD Kancheepuram:
IIITDM Kancheepuram Highlights 2025
51.72 acre | New Kuppam Main Road, Near Indian Institute Of Information Technology, Vengadamangalam, Chennai, Tamil Nadu - 600048
151-200 under the 'Engineering' category

college_info_program.intro:
IIITDM Kacheepuram offers UG, PG, and doctoral-level programmes in the fields of Engineering, Design, Science, and many others. At the UG level, the institute offers its flagship four-year full-time BTech programme across five specialisations. The UG course is offered in a full-time mode. It is of four-year duration and is further divided into eight semesters. For admission to this programme, aspirants need to have a valid score of JEE Main and participate in the JoSAA/CSAB counselling for seat allotment.
