Islamic University of Science and Technology Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Think before you choose, must read this review first.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good, mainly depending on our skills. More skilled students have chances of getting placed. Almost 60% of students get placed. The highest package is around 9 LPA, and minimum is 1 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Paras Health, Bharat Petroleum, etc. Top roles offered are software engineer and web developed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has good infrastructure. It has nice buildings but doesn't have digital boards in every class. Our college has good natural environment. A lot of canteens are available on the campus. Food quality is good both veg and non-veg. For sports, you can play cricket, basketball but don't have much indoor sports facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and teach nicely. They make us understand the subject very well. Curriculum is very relevant at par with NIT. Exams are not as tough as university conducts its exams itself. Pass percentage is almost very near to 80%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because CSE is the future, AI, and other coding languages. We get huge placements in it as well. I wish there were more recruitment companies, better labs, and digital classrooms. A lot of fests happen like business fests, fashion fests, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Islamic University of Science and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are not that good, but I can say they are average placements. But recently saw a little spike in placements. I don't know about the highest package, but recently, many students from the CS department got placed at good companies. All the students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel and infrastructure are very good. The hostels are new, fully furnished, and the food is also good. Classrooms are nicely furnished. For sports, they have two major grounds. Most importantly, they have a roomy library where students can go and study at any time.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are well-qualified and help students most of the time. The curriculum is also nice. Semester exams are a bit difficult, but we can say it's to the students' advantage. The curriculum makes students ready for future endeavors, as it mostly teaches practical things rather than theory.
detailed_review.Other: After NIT Srinagar, it is the best engineering college in Jammu and Kashmir.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: 60-70% of my seniors are placed in various companies. Some have salary of 5 LPA - 6 LPA. 15 students (my seniors) got research internships in various IITs like IIT Guwahati, IIT Jodhpur. 30-35% of students got internships. You can get roles like power system engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are top-notch. It has free access to Wi-Fi all over the campus (requires authorisation, daily 1GB limit). We have multiple labs with all the equipments. Classrooms are also good. There is a separate 4-floor building entirely for library (it's an open library, where even outside can study), it has countless books, reading room, research labs. Hostel building is good. A room is shared by 3 people (rooms are a little small), and quality of food served in mess is good. They have a clinic with an ambulance service for critical cases. Various sports are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are great and qualified enough to be there. Their teaching quality is good (but not upto the mark). Course curriculum is relevant, but not sure about making the students industry-ready. Exam difficulty is average, and pass percentage is about 60-70%.
detailed_review.Other: They regularly organise events, fests ( like food fest, business fest), and they have multiple scholarship programs. The fee is Rs 36,000 for tuition,  Rs 14,400 for bus fee per semester, Rs 14,000 for hostel fee, and Rs 10,000 for mess.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Limited exposure requires extra effort and developing over time.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are average, but most secure jobs or higher studies. CSE is the best here after NIT Srinagar. IUST collaborates with IIT for internships. Companies like Amazon, IBM, and Wipro visit. The median package is 5.4 LPA. The highest salary is 7 LPA. One senior secured 65 LPA off-campus in 2024.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It's decent and depends on how much you can adjust. Classrooms are spacious with Wi-Fi. The campus is beautiful, surrounded by mountains. There are canteens, cafes, stationery shops, medical facilities, and a well-equipped library. Hostels lack Wi-Fi, wardens are strict, and the mess food is above average.
detailed_review.Faculty: The CSE faculty members here are excellent. They are well-educated, knowledgeable, helpful, and great at delivering lectures. Most professors hold PhDs or M.Tech degrees. The semester exams are moderately difficult but manageable. Class notes are very important and sufficient for good CGPA. The pass percentage is around 85 percent. Internal assessment, assignments, and lab work also contribute to final grades. However, like most universities, self-learning and internships play a crucial role in getting top-tier placements. However, the exposure is somewhat limited, so students need to put in extra effort by seeking off-campus internships, competitive coding, and networking opportunities to stay ahead.
detailed_review.Other: Fests and departmental programs happen regularly. There are various clubs, though extracurricular activities are still developing. Managing them with studies can be tough since the university focuses more on lectures and academics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology
reviews.review_title: The university campus is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of students got placed in this course. This course has a package of rupees 1.5 LPA which is maximum and minimum of Rs 50,000. Nestle, Amul, and Britannia are recruiting companies. Almost 60% of students got internships in companies like Nescafe. Food technologies, quality manager, consumer safety officer, and many more roles are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has a lot of facilities such as well-equipped labs, good Wi-Fi, spacious classrooms, and library with a lot of good books available. The hostel has good facilities. The food in the mess is good, and canteen is good as well. Medical facilities are also available. A lot of sports can be played here. There are a lot of games that we can play.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful, well-qualified, and have vast knowledge. The teaching quality is really good. It gives a lot of good exposure to the students. Semester exams are enough difficult. The pass percentage is 50% here.
detailed_review.Other: I am really into food and it's processing. The best thing is that you learn many food-related things like the nutritional value, etc. I guess industrial visits. A lot of events and fests often happen here. The campus is vast with good surroundings.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology
reviews.review_title: This is a very good college.

detailed_review.Placements: 60% of students in our course are placed in companies like Nestle, Amul, Real, and Tropicana with 26 LPA. The highest package of our course is 26 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Amul, Nestle, Real, etc. Out of 60, 40 students got internships from my course. Food technologies, food research scholars, etc., are the roles offered in our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities in our department are good. The infrastructure available is good. Wi-Fi is available there and 24X7 labs are very well organised. The library contains all types of books. The food quality in hostel is good. Medical facilities, sports, and games are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified, knowledgeable, as well as very helpful. They help the students by clearing their doubts and teach us very well. This course curriculum is relevant and makes students industry-ready. There is no difficulty in semester exams as the teachers have already taught us very well. The pass percentage is 50%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it has a very vast field and has a lot of job opportunities in the future. There are many things I wish would be better about this course. There are events and fests like food fests, extracurricular activities, and scholarships in the department.

reviews.course: Diploma in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am absolutely unhappy because we are getting a 2nd campus 2 kilometers away from the main campus.

detailed_review.Placements: In a diploma, you cannot expect placements on campus and the same situation was in our course. Companies are not looking for civil engineers with a diploma. I think there were some people in the past who got placed but as per I know, students cannot get placed through only a diploma course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Basically, there are 2 buildings in different areas. For any kind of diploma course, students have to travel at least 2 kilometers to their diploma campus. On the main campus, there is good Wi-Fi, classrooms, and a library. The quality of the hostel is very good and clean. It has good and clean food. It has an enjoyable environment.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are amazing, well-qualified, and experienced. I would say teachers are excellent. The course curriculum related to this course is an extra edge for our job if we are thinking of doing B.Tech after it. The difficulty level of exams is moderate and the pass percentage is 35-40%. There are not that many faculty members.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I thought I could gain practical experience with it instead of doing 11th and 12th boards. The course could be more enjoyable if there were the same faculty members as the main campus. We have a separate campus for diploma students that is 1.5 kilometers away from the main campus. Technically, students have access to attend the fest on the main campus by traveling there from their 2nd campus. There are good scholarships for all students, and we can participate in any activity in which we are interested.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Nursing
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of the faculty. They are good at teaching and provide learning environm

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 60% of students got placed from our course. The highest salary offered is Rs. 90,000 per month. Top recruiting companies are from the hospital in Saudi Arabia which came to our college for their recruitment drive. Roles offered in our course are staff nurse and nursing tutor.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the university is excellent with the availability of Wi-Fi in classrooms. Library is almost to continuing to lack books which is known as the room library of the Islamic University of Technology. Canteen and medical facilities are also available and are excellent. Sports week is held every month.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Their teaching is excellent. They help students to understand even the most difficult topics in a simple manner. Semester exams are conducted in time. Passing percentage is 50%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this degree because of my passion for medical health sciences and my passion for providing cures to people and helping them to lead a healthy life.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration in International Business (MBA-IB)
reviews.review_title: IUST is one of the best universities in Kashmir, and our university is well...

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60% of students are placed outside of Kashmir. The highest package in MBA IB is 7 LPA and the lowest is 3.5 LPA. Tata company, HDFC Bank, Jio company, etc. 80% in the banking sector and Amul. Top roles are MBA in Finance, MBA in HR, MBA in Marketing, and MBA in International Business.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In IUST, the facilities and infrastructure are also good, and Wi-Fi is available in all the departments. Every facility is present in the hostel as well as the university. The mess is hygienic. Medical facilities are also available in the university, and an ambulance is present.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is outstanding, our teachers are well-qualified, and they are friendly and help students when they are in doubt. The passing percentage of MBA IB is 45%. Semester exams are not difficult; it depends on the students whether they are hardworking or not.
detailed_review.Other: I chose MBA IB because International Business is a degree that gives us knowledge to work globally, and the best thing in my course is it prepares you to pursue lucrative roles with high-paying salaries. Every event, fest, ethnic day, and scholarship is present every year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The faculty and infrastructure are fine; however, the placements are not satisfying.

detailed_review.Placements: Hardly any students in my course were placed in my university. The placement rate is below 10%. However, after getting my degree, most of the students get placed off-campus. So, not really a bad deal. You can come to IUST and get placed off-campus. There are no on-campus placements whatsoever.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite good. The university is young and is growing rapidly. The classrooms are spacious, and the campus is quite huge with fields around. It has a lot of cafeterias and nice, spacious auditoriums; however, there is less scope for sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is nice, with an excellent teaching style and excellent qualifications from reputed colleges, IITs, and NITs. The course curriculum is quite hectic, and you rarely get time for self-study. The semester exam papers are prepared by the teaching faculty and are checked by them too.
detailed_review.Other: The course I chose is well taught and given priority in my university. It would be better if they focused on making the students more industry-ready. The fests in our college are fine; however, there are hardly any clubs or student crowds.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Food Technology
reviews.review_title: IUST infrastructure is really good, located at a very good place, placements not so good.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60 students were placed in my course. Around 31,000 Nestlé, Coca-Cola, ITC, 2-3% in Nestlé, Coca-Cola, Food Director. A lot of students couldn't make it to top companies because of the non-availability of seats. Only a few students were able to make it to top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure was good. The hostel was good, but the food available was not good. Games were good, medical facilities were good, and sports were very good. They took us to various colleges for different competitions and events. The overall experience with the college was good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, teachers were very helpful and qualified. Semester exams were very difficult. During exams, we had a really tough time, sleepless nights, and the stress was unbearable. We used to have very little time between the papers, but in the end, we are thankful we made it through.
detailed_review.Other: It was my father's choice about this course. I would like to read more about food and the basic things related to it. All the events and the campus crowd were excellent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: IUST and the academic life.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in the university are very good. Students who have a CGPA above 7 get placed easily. The highest on-campus placement was 5 lpa given by the company Bharat Petroleum. Another off-campus placement was for a computer sciences student, which was 24 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is very nice and well built. There are buildings with top facilities and the labs regarding each course are much more advanced. Rumi library is where all sorts of books and journals are available and hostels are also very nice, well maintained and very clean. The food is also very hygienic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are graduates of IITs or other top colleges. They are very helpful and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is inspired by the curriculum of IIT and is very accurate and comprehensive. The exams are moderate, and more than 80% of students pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it was my personal interest and they have many advanced robotics labs in the university, which made my mind more inclined towards it. The time duration of the class should be more practical rather than theoretical. College hosts events and festivals once in every three months, which is very nice and sports event also occur. Scholarships are also available for SC/ST students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It was a mistake to take admission to this very university that I might regret throughout my life.

detailed_review.Placements: Not confirmed as the university has not many connections with the companies that hire mechanical engineering students, which results in higher studies and ending up in an MBA, then joining as a salesperson in a shop. The toppers aren't guaranteed for the job; the rest aren't even on the list.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good but not great as compared to the fee that you're paying and also, sports facilities are the worst ever. There are no proper indoor or outdoor facilities for the respective games and you can't even complain as they are full of excuses. The rules are hectic, which are not even in IITs and you're forced to follow them; otherwise, you'll get punished.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some are brilliant and some are not. Some are really educated and some just copy and paste the notes and sometimes you'll realize that you can copy and prepare better alone without the help of the faculty. It is a horrible experience there every day, and the only day I'm waiting for is the day I finally graduate.
detailed_review.Other: The fee structure is very strict, which is very difficult for a financially weak student .

reviews.course: M.SC. in Statistics
reviews.review_title: Review for the Islamic University of Science and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements occur at this university regularly. International companies regularly come here to offer jobs to students with a 24 Lac per year package and more. Students are very happy with those companies. Recently, they selected many students from our batch and hired them at a very good price.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this university is great. Buildings are designed with new technology and have all the facilities that a modern building could have. They are well-furnished and organized very well. Classrooms are neat and clean, having all the facilities and having Wi-Fi too; labs are well-equipped, having all the instruments and chemicals needed; and the library is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very good. I have no doubt about that. They were very supportive of me; I never felt that I was studying abroad. They were very helpful in all respects. The teachers let us sometimes have fun and play outside. Exams were on time, no matter what the situation was.
detailed_review.Other: My overall campus life was great; I had never been out of my home before. But it was a great experience to be part of the institution.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is good in everything but lacks placements.

detailed_review.Placements: One thing that IUST lacks is placements. Every college in Jammu and Kashmir lacks placements. Our college does not guarantee placements. However, when there are placement opportunities, which are not available very often, students get placed in companies like Bajaj, BSNL, Jio, MI.Com, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a beautiful infrastructure and every possible facility from sports to labs. Our college has high-speed internet, and the labs are equipped with the latest machines, computers, etc. Classrooms have modern equipment like smart boards and speakers. It also has good food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are talented, helpful and well educated. They use a good technique of teaching. Semester exams are easy if you study, and the teachers are always available when you need them. The pass percentage in exams is 40% of marks. My course is relevant to the curriculum and also makes students industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I chose ECE because I love the technical field, and it fascinates me. Our college has a good environment, education, infrastructure and facilities but lacks in placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am dissatisfied with placements, but facilities and infrastructure are average.

detailed_review.Placements: I did a bachelor's degree in electronics and communication engineering from this university. No one in our batch got placed in any of the companies. No company came to our campus for placements. Maybe 2 or 3 students got internships from our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and facilities available are of average quality. Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, library, etc., are of average quality. Many times we went to the lab, but the equipment was not available or is not working. Hostel quality is good, but the food provided in the mess is not that good. Medical facilities and sports were good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are well-qualified and knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is also good. They mainly focused on syllabus completion without thinking about our future. The course curriculum is good and somewhat makes students industry-ready. Semester exams difficulty is average, and most of the students get passed. The pass percentage is approximately 80-85%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am totally satisfied with our college.

detailed_review.Placements: There is almost a 1% chance of getting placements in our college. In the case of placements, this college lacks behind much. No companies visited here. Companies give first preference to NITs and IITs. In PSUs, there is no chance of getting a job until the qualification of the GATE exam.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this college is very good. I am impressed with the infrastructure of this college. Every day we get free Wi-Fi in our college. Our college has the largest library. There is an ambulance in case of emergency.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our college, the civil branch is the most valuable and designated. In this branch, faculty members are very good, and every teacher is also very talented and well-qualified. Some of them are GATE qualified. There are also PhD holders in our branch.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course because the civil branch is the most valuable, and I like it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is the best university in terms of education but lacks in providing placement opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Our batch of B.Tech electrical engineering was the first batch in the university. Though the course was new, the university managed to provide us better education, and almost all the equipment was available for experimental purposes. We were sent to NIT Srinagar for those particals, which were not available in our institution. As far as the placements are concerned, it was almost 0%, that is why I rate it a single star.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure are good and emerging at a fast rate. Though the university is new, the rate of development and infrastructure is high. The whole university is covered with high-speed Wi-Fi internet. A separate browsing center was set up for the students. The facilities available in the hostel were great. The hostel for girls is inside the university premises, and the boys' hostel is about 500m away from the university. Medical facilities and an ambulance are available 24x7. There is a decent canteen inside the university premises which provides food and other items at great discount.
detailed_review.Faculty: The university has good faculty members. They taught us in a better way and were greatly helpful. The quality of teaching was excellent, especially Dr. Shahkar Nehvi. He was a great caring teacher for us. Other faculty members were also good and helpful at any time.
detailed_review.Other: I was a Diploma engineering student and was eager to do B.Tech, but due to family issues, I was not able to move outside the state for further studies. Here, the other universities were not giving admissions for lateral entries, but this university provided me an opportunity to achieve my goal. I would like to say one thing that our university needs to improve in terms of placements. Though the placement cell is set up there, it is not active. Scholarships are available for those students who took admissions from the beginning of the course, and this opportunity was not given to lateral entry students. I felt greatly painful when I applied for the scholarship and got rejected. Overall, the university was a great place to learn new things and gain knowledge.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, I am satisfied with everything in our college.

detailed_review.Placements: Companies like Byju's, etc., visited our college for our placements, and many students got internships and worked for the companies sincerely. I am satisfied with our college placements. If you have good knowledge and good points in your academics, then you will surely get placed if companies visit here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are pretty much well-developed for our course, and we enjoy doing practicals. The hostel is different for different year students, and they are well-developed. The mess is good overall. Overall, I am satisfied with everything in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good and have a great understanding. They have a great bond with students and help every student. They are pretty well-qualified and have great experience in teaching and help students. Overall, I am satisfied.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Civil engineering department of IUST review.

detailed_review.Placements: There is zero placement in campus. You have to struggle on your own to get the placement in any private company, or you have to work even more for getting in government jobs. Further if you want to get in PSUs or for M.Tech in reputed college or IITs or NITs then you to work even hard at own.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
About infrastructure I can say is good. There are also smart rooms available in campus. Besides this there are also normal classes available. Anyway this is new University, so there is ongoing work on buildings for every department in campus. So only I can say is infrastructure is good. Wi-Fi is not available for students. Medical facilities are available. Sports and games are good
Library is also very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teacher's are not so good as seen in NITs or IITs ar any other good University or college. Hardly there are any Ph.D. scholar available. Teaching quality was poor. Method used mostly were marker and board, sometimes few teacher's were using projector. No, course curriculum was not useful.

college_info.college_name: YMCA UST Faridabad: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Ranking

highlights.summary:
YMCA UST Faridabad (J. C. Bose University of Science and Technology) is a state government-owned university in Faridabad. Established in 1969, it was a joint venture of the National Council of YMCAs of India, Govt. of Haryana, and Central Agencies for Development Aid (Bonn, Germany). In 1996, the state government of Haryana took complete control of this institution. It was granted university status in 2009 and named YMCA University of Science and Technology (YMCA UST).
Faridabad YMCA University is recognised by the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act 1956 u/s 22 for offering degree programmes. It holds 'Grade-A' accreditation from NAAC and is a member of the Quality Council of India (QCI) and the Association of Indian Universities (AIU). Besides this, YMCA University has 18 engineering colleges in Faridabad and Palwal affiliated with it.
YMCA UST Faridabad offers UG, PG, and diploma courses across Engineering, Sciences, Commerce, Management, and others. The flagship courses offered at Faridabad YMCA are BTech, MBA, and BCA. The university offers scholarships to meritorious and deserving students. YMCA UST Faridabad admission is based on merit and entrance exams. The university accepts national/state-level entrance exams such as JEE Main, CAT, MAT, XAT, CMAT, and others. The institute has well-equipped infrastructure classrooms, a library, a sports complex, a medical facility, an auditorium, a conference hall, and others.
The key highlights of YMCA UST Faridabad have been tabulated below:
Merit-based, Merit-cum-need scholarships
Check out more on J. C. Bose University of Science and Technology, YMCA Highlights in the below video:

college_info_program.intro:
YMCA UST Faridabad comprises more than 15 departments, including Computer Engineering, Physics, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Management Studies, Mathematics, Life Sciences, Literature, and others. BTech, MBA, and BCA are among the popular programmes offered at the university.
Faridabad YMCA offers a full-time, four-year BTech programme at the UG level. The BTech programmes offered at the university cover core courses in the areas of Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and others. The university offers a two-year full-time MBA under the guidance of expert and focuses on offering quality education to the students. Below-mentioned are YMCA UST Faridabad's popular programmes:
For more information about J. C. Bose University of Science and Technology, YMCA check out the below video:

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: If I have to summarize my college, it is good and I love my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are quite good. Around 80 percent of students are placed in good companies from our college. The highest package goes up to 30 LPA. As far as I know, the lowest package is 6 LPA and the average package is 13 LPA. Top recruiters are Google, Amazon, Goldman Sachs, and Adobe. Around 40 percent of students got internships, mainly in SDE roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is full of facilities, which makes my college life very good. I enjoy my college life a lot and it is a very good college. The infrastructure is also good, and I like this college very much. If I talk about my college quality, then its quality in each term is nice.
detailed_review.Faculty: My teachers are very helpful. To be very frank, the type of teachers I had dreamed of are the teachers I have here. I like the way they teach topics with full clarity. This course curriculum is relevant up to a certain limit. It makes students industry-ready. The pass percentage is 40, and exams are good, neither too difficult nor too easy.
detailed_review.Other: I like this course as I love computer engineering. I have a high curiosity regarding new technologies, and I think this course suits my interest. I think the curriculum mainly focuses on computer engineering and not on AI, ML, and other new technologies. There are no fests in college, but there are plenty of events.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has strong academics and supportive faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 75 percent of students got placed this year. The average package ranges from 5-8 LPA, and the highest package ranges from 12-24 LPA, though figures can vary by year and course. The college provides placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides a library, a gymnasium, a sports complex, and multiple laboratories for practical work. It also has an auditorium, a cafeteria, Wi-Fi, and transportation services. There are hostels with separate accommodation for both boys and girls with a Wi-Fi facility.
detailed_review.Faculty: Dr. Ritu Punhani (CSE HOD) and Dr. Shailendra Kumar (principal), and other faculty members hold advanced degrees from institutions like IIT and NIT. Faculty members in the engineering department are described as knowledgeable and helpful for us. They use amazing teaching methods.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Greatly disappointed by the college faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: The college is not very good for its placement. The average package is 2-3 LPA. They promise 100% placement, but at the time of placement, it gives only to 25%. There is no internship from colleges. Top recruiting companies are HCL Technologies, TCS, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is small. The labs are good, but the computers are of average quality. The library has a good quantity of books. No Wi-Fi facility. The food is good, but there is no facility for sports. The playground is too small. The auditorium hall is also very small. The equipment in the laboratory is useless and needs to be repaired. The benches are satisfied. The bathroom has broken seats. It does not provide good drinking water.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are qualified, but they have less knowledge and experience to teach college students. The semester exam is difficult. The environment is like school. There is full-time waste in this college. The faculty try to get perfection, but the assistant professors just try to complete the syllabus. They don't give any practical knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: I do not have much knowledge about colleges. When I take counselling, they make many promises that attract me, but after some time, I feel useless in this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall academic wise good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are average. Companies come for students. Good students get placed. 70 percent students get easily placed with good package. The highest package is 47 LPA of CS branch and average of mechanical is 6 LPA and the highest is 14 LPA. Companies like Amazon, Yamaha.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good. Hostels are only for girls. No hostel for boys. Maintenance is on work. Canteen is available there. And food is of very good quality and food variety is also available. Ground is much bigger than you think. You can play many games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is nice. Exams are also of good level. Curriculum is also good. Teachers are very helpful and very much qualified in their field. The course curriculum is relevant. This course and college make the student ready for industry. Semester are moderate.
detailed_review.Other: Mechanical placement are good. Events are average and crowd is more. College is small in size.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is the 2nd-best college in Haryana after NIT Kuk in B.Tech course.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 89 percent of eligible B.Tech students got placed. The highest package offered is about 47 LPA. Top recruiters include firms such as Adobe, Samsung, Yamaha Motors India, and Tata Consultancy Services. More than 990 students secured internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The university offers modern infrastructure, Wi-Fi-enabled campus, smart classrooms, well- equipped departmental labs (e.g., computer, electronics, mechanical), and a rich library with more than 76000 volumes plus e-resources. Hostel accommodation is available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at J.C. Bose University of Science and Technology, YMCA, Faridabad, are described as helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable, with the university offering a strong blend of experience and motivation among faculty. Students also appreciate.
detailed_review.Other: The course that I chose offers a variety of opportunities in both hardware and software.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning) (Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: The perfect hub of technology .

detailed_review.Placements: I'm pursuing B.Tech, and the academics are so good that most of the students get placement from campus. There are around 80 percent of students who get placement from the campus. The highest package is 50 LPA in my course. The top recruiting companies of my course are Google, Wipro, Accenture, Yahoo, Zomato, Swiggy, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is overall good for Students. Our department has well-equipped labs, working project tools, smart classrooms, Wi-Fi access, and a decent library with enough books for reference. The hostel facilities are also satisfactory with clean rooms, drinking water, and proper security.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are knowledgeable and supportive. They teach with proper examples and help students during project work as well. The course curriculum is updated and includes industry-related subjects like coding, internship, and practical sessions.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is decent with decent placement.

detailed_review.Placements: 89 percent of eligible B.Tech students are placed. The highest package offered is 47LPA and the average package stood at 6.25LPA. Top recruiters included firms such as Google Adobe Samsung Yamaha Motors, and India.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The university offers modern infrastructure: Wi-Fi enabled campus smart classrooms and a rich library with more than 76000 volumes plus e resources. Hostel accommodation includes separate boys and girls hostels with a reading room RO water coolers.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at J.C. Bose University of Science and Technology. YMCA is described as helpful qualified and knowledgeable with the university offering a strong blend of experience and motivation among faculty. Students also appreciate the teaching qualities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Affordable college with great learning environment and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 95% students get placed in the IT branch (those who are eligible). The average package is around 7-8 LPA for IT and around 9 LPA for Computer Engineering. Top recruiters include Amazon, Google, Capgemini, Deloitte, Infosys, and mass recruiters such as TCS and Wipro. Many get internships, off-campus too.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are good, classrooms have projectors, and library is decent enough. The hostel is available only for girls. Boys' one is demolished. Sports ground, canteen (the best thing here), and medical facilities are available. A bank is also on the college campus for ease. Overall, it's still improving.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified and helpful, at least better than what I have heard about other colleges. Curriculum is updated and industry-oriented. The best thing here I like is workshops, where we get to know so many new things. Exams are moderate, but the checking is a bit strict, passing percentage is around 80% I guess, not sure. The attendance factor is also here, with a minimum 75% to be maintained, but teachers can give a relaxation of 10% for valid reasons.
detailed_review.Other: Good return on investment for the fees. Quality teaching, nice exposure as it's in NCR. I think it's worth it for serious students. Friendly and talented crowd, and the seniors are really helpful. Tech and cultural fests are also fun. Many fun clubs for coding, dance, drama, and many more. Great metro connectivity.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: One of the best budget-friendly colleges, with job opportunities, and a great environment.

detailed_review.Placements: One of the best campuses in Haryana to pursue B.Tech. Healthy environment and good jobs. The placement scenario for the CSE branch here is excellent. In our batch, I would say around 85-90 percent of students who sat for placements got placed. The college's placement cell works tirelessly from the third year itself. The salary packages are very encouraging. The highest package went to a remarkable 50.5 LPA (an exceptional off-campus placement), while the lowest is around 3.5 LPA. The average package for our CSE branch is comfortable between 5.5 LPA and 6 LPA, which is a fantastic start. Top recruiting companies visit our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is genuinely one of the best things about Echelon. For our CSE department, the computer labs are modern, fully air-conditioned, and equipped with the latest software and high-speed internet. The Wi-Fi coverage across the academic blocks and the library is reliable. Classrooms are all smart with projectors, which makes learning interactive. The central library is huge and has a massive collection of books and digital resources.
detailed_review.Faculty: This is where Echelon truly wings. The teachers are not just qualified, they are mentors. I remember being completely stuck on a complex Data Structures concept, and one of our professors stayed back for over an hour after college just to explain it to me one-on-one. They are incredibly helpful and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is excellent and very practical.
detailed_review.Other: Great experience with a limited budget, all types of facilities provided.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: College infrastructure and facility.

detailed_review.Placements: Echelon Institute of Technology gives placement opportunities equally but some students start on startup and joint family business that's why 100% students do not apply for job placement successfully. Approximately 30-35 students are placed. Roles offered are cell executive, business developer, business manager, and HR marketing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Echloan Institute of Technology in its first structure is very good whole campus is under CCTV surveillance. We have smart classrooms with centralise AC and free Wi-Fi service. Sports ground, basketball ground, cricket ground, and medical room are also available 24X7. Ambulance service is available. Gym facilities are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very good in nature. They support every student. Mostly teacher has doctorate. More than 70 teachers are Ph.D. holders. Mostly teachers have good teaching experience. They have more than 10-20 years of experience, and some teachers are government retire officers. Exam is not very difficult because most topics are already covered by the teacher.
detailed_review.Other: My friend suggests choosing the lowest route of technology because it's loan institute of technology is art of infrastructure crowd is very good. Mostly students comes from other states. Echelon Institute of Technology gives private care with reliable degree that's why I chose Echelon Institute of Technology.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of JC BOSE University of Science and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Many students get placement every year. Almost 80% of students in our course get placement every year. Students do internships in their 4th year i.e., in the last semester. Many companies, such as Amazon and Samsung, offer internships. The average salary package is 6 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is only a girls' hostel in the college. The boys' hostel is under construction. Food is good in the hostel, as I hear it. Wi-Fi is available on the campus. Computer labs and the library are also there. There are a variety of books there. The cafeteria is on the campus, which also offers good food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are overall good. They are very supportive and helpful. They also motivate us. Many departments have Ph.D. holding teachers. Semester exams are of a moderate level. We have to study for them for around 1 month before. Teachers also have many years of experience.
detailed_review.Other: YMCA is one of the best colleges in Haryana for B.Tech courses. So, I opted for this college. Almost all festivals are celebrated in college, like ethnic day. The annual sports meet also happens. There are many clubs and societies to join in college.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Echelon is the best college.

detailed_review.Placements: 65-70% of students are placed in my course. The highest package is 50.5 LPA. The average package is 6 LPA - 8 LPA. The lowest salary is 2.6 LPA - 3.9 LPA. All students get internships from the college for better future and understanding. Internship companies are also here for the students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is unique from others. There are three buildings or departments available for different things administration, library, and the academic block/building. The quality of hostel is good. Mess provides good quality food to us, and it's healthy for us. The medical and sports facilities are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful in studies and personal life also like how to manage studies and home works and other work. All teachers are Ph.D. qualified and some teachers are Ph.D. pursuing. Curriculum is relevant, and the industry is ready for students because there are many training programs provided by the college.
detailed_review.Other: MBA provides the knowledge about business and dealing with customers and different types of people. Technical things are missing in the MBA in our curriculum, and we need to improve our course.

reviews.course: BBA in Digital Marketing
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied and dissatisfied for some of facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: There are many students in this course. A huge percentage of students take admission in it. The highest package can be 10 LPA, and the lowest can be 1 LPA. A large percentage of students get internships through the college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is very large, and provides good space for classes. The ground is very big. There are very good sports facilities. Canteen facilities are very good in quality, and the prices are very affordable. The chairs and tables are well arranged.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and motivate students in their studies. Teachers are very experienced and know their syllabus well. The course curriculum is very relevant. There are some seminars that make students industry-ready.

reviews.course: BBA in Digital Marketing
reviews.review_title: Echelon Institute - Top choice for Delhi NCR students.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at Echelon Institute of Technology were strong and student focused. The placement cell arranged training mock interviews and resume building sessions to help students become jobready. Many top companies like Infosys TCS Amazon HCL and Maruti visited the campus for recruitment drives. The highest placement package was around 50.5 LPA with the average package being about 5.3 LPA. Most students got good opportunities in both the core and IT sectors, making the overall placement process effective and supportive.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Echelon Institute of Technology had a big, green, and modern campus spread over 17.5 acres in Faridabad. College had smart classrooms with A/C, more than 70 well-equipped labs, and a large library with more than 50,000 books and digital resources. There were good hostel facilities for boys and girls with shared and single room options. Students got Wi-Fi all over the campus, a cafeteria, gym, sports grounds (like cricket, volleyball, basketball, and football), and medical support for emergencies. We had a shuttle service that helped with transport, and there was a focus on safety with CCTV and 24X7 security.
detailed_review.Faculty: Echelon Institute of Technology stands out because of its unique blend of student-focused teaching, modern facilities, and a vibrant campus life. College truly lives its slogan, an institute of the students, for the students, by the students. Here, every student got real guidance, practical projects, and opportunities to showcase talents in academics, sports, and cultural activities. Curriculum mixed theory with hands-on learning and industry exposure, making each course both useful and relevant.
detailed_review.Other: Institute was affiliated with Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University (GGSIPU), Delhi, ensuring recognised and standardized academic programs. It offered a variety of courses including B.Tech, BBA, BCA, and MCA catering to diverse interests in engineering, management, and computer applications.

reviews.course: BCA in Data Science
reviews.review_title:
Good placements, supportive faculty, and decent infrastructure
.

detailed_review.Placements: In my batch of B.Tech (Computer Science), nearly 75%-80% of students got placed through campus placements. The highest package offered is around 12 LPA, the lowest is around 3 LPA, and the average stood near 5 LPA-6 LPA. Top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Capgemini, Cognizant, Accenture, and Tech Mahindra, along with some product-based startups. Around 60% of students secured internships in reputed companies like TCS, Cognizant, Byju's, and local IT firms. The major roles offered are software developer, system engineer, data analyst, and associate consultant. Overall, placements are decent with a good mix of service and IT companies visiting the campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has well-equipped computer labs, smart classrooms, projectors, and high-speed Wi-Fi accessible across campus. The library is rich with technical books, journals, and digital resources. Hostel facilities are satisfactory with spacious rooms, 24/7 water and electricity, and decent security. The mess food is average but hygienic, while the canteen offers a variety of snacks and meals. Basic medical facilities with a first-aid center and a tie-up hospital are available for emergencies.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are supportive, qualified, and knowledgeable, always ready to clear doubts and guide students in academics as well as projects. The teaching quality is a mix of theoretical and practical learning, with assignments, lab work, and seminars. The course curriculum is fairly relevant, updated with emerging technologies, and include internships and projects that help in building industry-oriented skills. Semester exams are of moderate difficulty, focusing on both conceptual clarity and problem-solving. The overall pass percentage remain high, around 85%- 90%, as most students were able to clear exams with proper preparation.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in technology and problem solving, and it offered good career opportunities in IT and software fields. The best part of the course is the balance of theoretical concepts and practical exposure through labs, projects and internships. The faculty support and placement opportunities are also strong points. I feel the course could be improved by adding more hands-on training, industry collaborations and workshops on the latest technologies to make students even more industry-ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and supportive faculty, with placements and scope for improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: The department attracts reputed recruiters from diverse sectors. Some of the top companies visiting the campus include IT & software Infosys, TCS, Wipro, HCL, Accenture and Capgemini. Core/technical are L&T, Siemens, Bosch, and Tata Technologies. Analytics & consulting are Deloitte, KPMG, EY, and PwC.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are spacious classrooms with projectors, smart boards, and audio-visual teaching aids. Computer labs with updated software and high-performance systems. Access to labs, projects, internships, and case studies that help apply knowledge in real-world scenarios.
detailed_review.Faculty: Regular guest lectures, workshops, and seminars by industry experts further enhance learning beyond textbooks. Teachers are helpful and knowledgeable, who guide not only academically but also in career growth. A good number of reputed companies visit the campus for internships and final placements.
detailed_review.Other: More guest lectures, workshops and industry tie ups would help students gain deeper insights.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Basically, it's good for students.

detailed_review.Placements: 25% of students made their future bright with the help of college placements. It is commendable that the college makes this much effort for students' bright futures and dreams. Approximately 25%-30% of students got internships from their courses. The highest package offered by companies on campus ranges from 5 to 7 LPA, while the minimum goes from 2 to 3 LPA, which is not bad in my opinion, as it inspires students to work hard to achieve their dream jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities on campus are okay, not too good or too bad. The facilities in the department are quite good, and the overall infrastructure is okay. It needs some renovation, but the bond between students and teachers is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is also good, and they are supportive of every student. However, the semester exams are quite difficult, making it challenging to answer them easily.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: This college is good for studies and getting a raw experience of the real industry life.

detailed_review.Placements: BCA data science has a 75-80% placement rate with packages ranging from 3 LPA to 12 LPA (average salary is 5.5 LPA - 6 LPA). Top recruiters include TCS, IBM, Wipro, Deloitte, and MU Sigma. Around 65-70% of students get internships, mostly in analytics and IT roles. Overall, it's a good course with solid opportunities, though advanced learning requires self-effort.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The course infrastructure is well-equipped with Wi-Fi-enabled smart classrooms, computer labs with updated systems, a digital library, and access to various data science tools and software. Hostel facilities are good, with clean rooms, 24X7 Wi-Fi, and proper security. Mess food quality is decent with a mixture of vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. A canteen is available for snacks. Medical facilities are accessible on campus. There are sports grounds and indoor games to support physical activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are supportive, well-qualified, and knowledgeable. They make concepts easy to understand. The curriculum is relevant, covering programming, data science, and analytics, but students need extra self-learning for advanced industry skills. Semester exams are of moderate difficulty, and with regular study, most students clear them easily. The pass percentage is around 85-90%.

reviews.course: BCA in Data Science
reviews.review_title: Well-qualified faculty, industry-relevant curriculum, and supportive environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 90% of students are placed, with the remaining achieving top packages. The highest package is INR 15 LPA (for BCA in data science). Average package is INR 3.5 LPA to 5 LPA. Major recruiters include Wipro, TCS, HCL, Infosys, etc. BCA data science internship statistics are available. Over 3,000 internships are facilitated through the training and placement cell in 2024-25. Exact percentage and specific companies offering internships to BCA data science students are not disclosed. Typical roles offered include data analyst, business analyst, software developer, and likely roles related to data science and analytics.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The institute spans 17.5 acres of lush, and has well-maintained grounds. Campus features centralized AC buildings, smart classrooms equipped with audio-visual aids, and robust Wi-Fi connectivity throughout. Well, over 70 laboratories and workshops support hands-on learning across disciplines, ranging from electronics, mechanical, and data Science to general computer labs. Library is an air-conditioned, separate block housing a rich collection, around 32,000-40,000+ books, 58 or more national/international journals, magazines, encyclopedias, CDs/DVDs, plus access to Delnet and other digital archives.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified, supportive, and approachable. Most hold postgraduate or doctoral degrees and bring both academic knowledge and industry exposure. Teachers are known to be helpful during classes as well as outside, guiding students in projects, research, and placements. Teaching quality is rated above average to good, with a mixture of theoretical concepts and practical assignments. BCA (data science) curriculum is regularly updated to match industry needs, including subjects like python, R, data analytics, AI, machine learning, big data, and cloud computing. The institute also conducts guest lectures.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and faculty members. It has decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: In my batch of mechanical engineering, around 85-90 percent students are placed with packages ranging from 3.5 LPA to 10 LPA while the average is about 5 LPA. Top recruiters included TCS L&T Maruti Suzuki Infosys and Wipro offering roles like graduate engineer trainee design engineer and production engineer. About 60 percent of students secured internships in reputed companies like NTPC BHEL and Hero MotoCorp.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides excellent infrastructure and facilities to support learning and overall development. Classrooms are spacious with projectors and WiFi access while the department has wellequipped laboratories including fluid mechanics thermodynamics CAD/CAM and workshop labs. Central library offers a wide collection of books journals and e resources. Hostel facilities are comfortable with furnished rooms 24/7 electricity WiFi and hygienic mess food. The canteen serves affordable meals and snacks. Medical facilities include a first-aid center and tie-ups with a nearby hospital. Sports and recreation facilities are available for cricket, football, basketball, badminton, and indoor games, ensuring a balanced campus life.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our department are highly qualified, knowledgeable, and supportive, always ready to guide students academically and personally. Teaching quality is effective, combining theoretical knowledge with practical applications through labs, workshops, and projects. The curriculum is industry-oriented, covering both core subjects and modern technological tools, which helps in making students industry-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult, designed to test conceptual understanding rather than written learning. With proper preparation, exams are manageable. The overall pass percentage in the course remains fairly high, reflecting both the commitment of faculty and the efforts of students.
detailed_review.Other: I am pursuing B.Tech in mechanical engineering from our college. I chose this course because of my keen interest in machines, design, and practical applications of engineering concepts. The best things about this course are the strong fundamentals, hands-on laboratory sessions, and the exposure to real-world industrial practices through workshops and internships.

college_info.college_name: YMCA UST Faridabad Admission 2025: Application Fee, Eligibility Criteria, Seats & Fee

faqs.question: Can I get admission in YMCA Faridabad through CUET?
faqs.answer: No, CUET is not compulsory for admission at YMCA University. YMCA takes the students on the basis of merit or entrance exam score. Admission to BSc, BA, BBA, BCA and MA programmes are based on merit. Programmes like MBA , BTech and MTech requires and entrance exam score. JEE Mains and LEET exam compulsory for admission to BE/BTech course.  CAT/MAT/XAT is required to get admission in MBA and PGDM programmes at YMCA Faridabad.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for J.C. Bose University?
faqs.answer: Admission process for J.C. Bose University (YMCA) varies course to course. But all candidate should apply online through official website of YMCA University. Selection will be done on the basis of merit or entrance exam score. For admissions to MTech , students must qualify the GATE exam and have a bachelor's degree in Engineering and Technology with 50% aggregate . MSc admissions are offered on the basis of scores in the University Entrance Test conducted by the university itself.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: What is YMCA Faridabad cutoff 2023 for BTech?
faqs.answer: YMCA University BTech cutoff is based on JEE Main scores for the candidates belonging to All India Quota. Candidates who meet the cutoff are called for the counselling. In 2023, YMCA Faridabad counselling was closed after the release of JEE Main Round 2 Seat Allotment results. faqs.question: What is the admission procedure for MBA in YMCA, Faridabad?
faqs.answer: Candidate must have clearly passed with an aggregate of 50% in the qualifying examination and score well in entrance exam (CAT/MAT/XAT/CMAT). After that, candidates should fill out the application form available on the official website of YMCA and pay the application fee. The last process includes verification of documents and YMCA Faridabad admission fee payment.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility to apply for MBA at YMCA UST Faridabad?
faqs.answer: YMCA UST Faridabad makes it mandatory for candidates to meet the following eligibility criteria to apply to the MBA course: Candidates who belong to the reserved category are given relaxation in the minimum perentage requirement. Candidates utilising this relaxation must submit the required documents as per the guidelines of the university.

faqs.question: What is the cost of MBA in YMCA?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee for YMCA University MBA/PGDM ranges between INR 1.80 Lacs – INR 2.10 lakh . Apart from the tuition fee, there is a hostel fee of amount INR 77,502. YMCA MBA offers specialisations options including HR, Marketing and Finance. There are a lot of seats available for PGDM/MBA programme at the university. Note: Candidates must note that this fee is sourced from the official website of the institute/ sanctioning body and is subject to change.

faqs.question: What are the entrance exams accepted by YMCA UST Faridabad for the BTech course?
faqs.answer: Candidates wishing to pursue the BTech course at YMCA UST Faridabad must appear for either of JEE Main or LEET to participate in the admission process of the university. Candidates who clear the cutoff set by the university are called for further admsision rounds. LEET is conducted for candidates wishing to get into the university through lateral entry. Candidates are advised to check the eligibility and selection criteria of the course before applying for the same.

faqs.question: How to get admission in YMCA, Faridabad?
faqs.answer: YMCA Faridabad admission to UG, PG and PhD programmes are based on merit or entrance exam. YMCA Faridabad admission to BTech is done through JEE Main score followed by Haryana State Technical Education Society (HSTES) counselling. MBA admissions are accepted on the basis of CAT/MAT/XAT/CMAT score. To be eligible for J.C. faqs.question: How to get a scholarship in YMCA Faridabad?
faqs.answer: There are various scholarship available for the eligible students at YMCA Faridabad. Some of these are: Merit-cum-Means Scholarship (MOB): MOB is one of the scholarships which is offered for 15% of BTech/ MCA/ MBA students. The MOB (Alumni of Association of YMCA University) contributed scholarship under the title MOB scholarship (Merit-cum-Means) for the students of PG / UG courses. The notice for this scholarship is issued in the month of February, every year. Scholarship by Technical Education Department: This benefit is available to SC students admitted through Central Counseling only and whose parents/guardians income from all sources does not exceed INR 2.50 lakh per annum.

Check out the updated rankings and category details from different ranking bodies below. As per the NIRF 2025, YMCA University achieved #151-200 rank under the 'Engineering' category. It stands on par with well-known institutions such as Crescent College and BMS College of Engineering under the NIRF 'Engineering' category. sections.heading: Introduction
text: Check out more on J. C. Bose University of Science and Technology, YMCA Infrastructure in the below videos:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: The University Library building has a total area of 7200 sq. ft. It has two Reading Halls with a total capacity of 155 seats. University Library has a rich collection of more than 76 thousand volumes in the stream of Engineering & Technology, applied sciences and Management. The library is also subscribing 104 Print Journals, 6365 E-journals, 701+ E-books, 40 Magazines, 16 Newspapers and 138 CD ROMs (excluding Book CDs). It is well equipped with modern technology like Internet, Bar Code technology etc. The library is automated with the Library Automation Software Libsys. Every member has been provided a Bar Coded Library Membership Card. Online Public Access Catalogue (OPAC) is available to locate the reading material in the library. The library is the member of DELNET and E-Shodhsindhu Consortium. The library having subscription of e-resources from SpringerLink, Taylor and Francis, Nature, Economic & Political Weekly, JSTOR, Oxford University Press, ASME, McGraw-Hill Access Engineering, Science Direct(Engg & Computer Science collection), World e-book Library and Asian Archive.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The University has a total number of 7 hostels, 4 for boys and 4 for girls. One reading room in each boys’ and girls’ hostel with newspapers and magazines. Shift canteen in the girls' hostel.  One common room in the girls’ hostel and two common rooms in the boys’ hostel with LED TVs.  Wi-Fi facility and water coolers fitted with RO are provided.  Guest room in girls’ hostel for female relatives of students. The Boy’s Hostel will be allotted to only first year and second year students only. The hostel will not be allotted to 3rd year, 4th year & PG boy’s students.  Hostel will be allotted on First come first basis.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 1886 published reviews , 1560 reviews are verified.

college_info.college_name: JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu, is located in Anantapur, Andhra Pradesh. Established in 1946, it is a public institute approved by AICTE. JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu provides 44 UG and PG courses in 12 specialisations, namely Chemical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Control Systems and Electrical Engineering. Theses programmes are offered in Full Time mode. B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM and MCA are some of the courses offered at JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu. Some of the streams in which these courses are offered include Engineering, Business & Management Studies and IT & Software. The total fee at JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu ranges between INR 30,000 to 3,00,000. JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu has a student intake of 1023 for all the courses. The average median package at JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu is INR 4,19,048. JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu offers all the infrastructural facilities to students.
