reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: JNTU Anantapur College review by a CSE student.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in my 2nd year, so I don't have a complete idea about placements, but when I enquired about placements with seniors, I got to know that the placements here are good. A few got internships from the 3rd year, and also some seniors got scholarships, and the placements from the previous year are good enough.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good and the library is very good. We can sit there, practice, study, and use computers there for our work. Classrooms and labs are good, where we can stay most of the time. The. The hostel is good compared to other hostels, but we can't leave easily in case of an emergency.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum and calendar will be given beforehand, and a few staff members are not teaching properly. They simply come, show a PPT or a PDF, and study that. If it's changed, then everything will be good. Most of the faculty are good and will help us solve doubts.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A decent university experience that justifies its name and stature.

detailed_review.Placements: I am still pursuing the course, but current year passed out students are having their placements now. Last year’s passed outs had decent placements overall. On average, around 50% of students are placed with offers ranging from 3 to 10 LPA, in which MNC placements are very few (around 5). Even the MNCs that approached for placements are few.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college’s infrastructure is average, the classrooms, departments, and labs are good, but the hostels are disappointing, and even the Wi-Fi didn’t function well, the quality of the food is decent, but the rest of the facilities are very average. We could utilize facilities like the library and ground well, but no other extracurricular activities are up to expectations.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is decent, in fact, but the teaching faculty are not up to the standards. There are a few experienced faculty, but most of the faculty are inexperienced. They are trying to meet the standards, but it isn’t happening. Even some of the experienced faculty are too aged to teach, due to which their teaching ability isn’t helping the students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: An absolutely amazing college with low fees and high-quality education.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 60% of students are placed in our courses. The highest package is 10 LPA, the lowest package is 4 LPA, and the average package is 6 LPA. The top recruiting companies are TCS, Cognizant, Hexaware, and Factset. 50% of students got internships in our course through respective interviews.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided in our college include Wi-Fi, classrooms, a library, a canteen, a CAD lab, and a bookshop. The facilities in our hostel are Wi-Fi, CCTV, food, and TV. The food in the canteen is nice, with reasonable prices and good quality. Medical facilities are also available in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are experienced and highly qualified. With so much experience, the way they teach is very useful, which helps us in semester exams. The course I have taken is relevant to my future. The difficulty level of our exams is medium. The passing percentage is 75%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest. The thing I need to improve is teaching. The events conducted in our college are very interesting, and "Pixel" is one of the biggest opportunities for every student.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: No dissatisfaction during the period.

detailed_review.Placements: There are 60 to 70% of the students placed in our course. There are three different types of packages offered at the time of placement .The highest is 4 LPA, the average is 3 LPA, and the least is 2 LPA. The two top recruiting companies are L&T and TCS.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are so many facilities provided during the time, and good infrastructure will be developed. Especially, Wi-Fi classrooms and a library are provided in a good atmosphere. In the hostel, there are no compromises in facilitating the quality of food in the mess and canteen. Medical facilities are also provided, and there are no compromises in sports and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers or lecturers are very helpful during the period of clarifying doubts, and they are knowledgeable. They provide good and best quality teaching. In this course, the curriculum is relevant and makes students ready for the industry. During the examination period, it is more tough and strict in the college, and the pass percentage of the college is above 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I choose the Civil Engineering course. During my course, I will be more instructed in my field. I chose this course because I am more interested.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements in 2025.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students are placed in computer science and engineering course. The highest package is 10 LPA, the lowest is 3.5 LPA, and the average package is 5 LPA to 6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Factset, Deltax, TCS, Cognizant, L&T, Moschip, Mantra, etc. 70% of students got internships. Development roles are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are wide range of facilities and the infrastructure of college is unique from other colleges. There is a peaceful environment. The department of CSE is so big and there are many labs. Wi-Fi connection is somewhat poor, and classrooms have a digital board. The quality of food in mess is good and it is suitable for Telugu people. The mess and canteen are available during college timings. The medical facilities are there in the dispensary. There is a big ground for sports and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching staff are knowledgeable and friendly towards students. The HOD of department is also supportive. Teaching quality is above average. Course curriculum is so easily designed for the purpose of students. The semesters are easy to crack with concept and domain knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: The CSE course I chose is to become a software engineer. The best things are in CSE, no field work, only we have labs with computers. The course is also being developed by the principal now. There is a departmental fest every year. There are college days and sports days celebrated annually.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good placements and a big and friendly college life. Every place is well-structured.

detailed_review.Placements: In CSE, more than 50% of students get placed. In other branches also 30% of students get placed. The highest package is 10 LPA and the average package ranges from 4-5 LPA. The lowest package is 3.5 LPA in our course. Top companies for our course are TCS, Factset, Cognizant, Accenture, Mantra, L&T, Deltax, etc. 50% of students got internships in various offices and in some IITs. The top roles offered are system engineer, development side, testing, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our department, there are huge facilities, and it is so much bigger than other departments. Classrooms and seminar halls are so big and open. The Wi-Fi facility is not good. Its signal is less. In the hostel, rooms are better as it is a government hostel and the food is also good. It has all facilities. It also includes a digital library.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are supportive, good, and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is better and more comfortable for students. 90% is the pass percentage. Semester exams are not that difficult if we study clearly. The course curriculum is divided in an easy and simple manner. Semester exams are ideology-based and have a way of representation like diagrams and mind maps.
detailed_review.Other: The course I joined is more easy and simple for me. The best thing is that there are wide sources outside of this course. The college provides scholarships. It conducts department fests every year and a college day. It conducts tournaments and matches in sports. Hostels for girls should be big.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good facilities are available at this college.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students are placed in this course. The highest package is 40 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.6 LPA. Mahindra, TCS, and Wipro are the top recruiting companies. Students secure internships from different courses and companies, such as NACC-approved and AICTE-approved internships. ESIOT and VLSI design are the top roles offered in this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi facilities are available in our institution, along with various labs and well-maintained classrooms. We have a library to gain knowledge. The campus also provides good quality sports facilities and excellent medical support. The canteen has great infrastructure and offers tasty and freshly prepared food.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very friendly, and they explain things very well. They equip me with different skills, and the teachers are excellent. The curriculum is relevant. It helps make students industry-ready. The exams are difficult, but when we study, we can crack them.
detailed_review.Other: Good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied because there are good placements and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of people got placed. The highest is 10 LPA. 100% of people get internships in various companies like Amazon and Google. There are mostly all students who got internships. Teachers also helpful. Students get internships and placements too.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good Wi-Fi, good systems, and clean classrooms, every department has one library, and for a total college, there is a central library and for BC, SC, and ST, there is another library. There are good medical facilities, sports and games, and healthy food in the mess and canteen with affordable prices.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. This curriculum is relevant. It makes students industry-ready by doing projects. Each student is doing well and doing useful and good projects in daily life. The difficulty level is moderate. The pass percentage is 93%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: My memories with my college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at the college were good. 70% of students got placed in different companies. They conducted some drives with the companies for the remaining 30% of students. Finally, they were given 100% placements. We are happy with the placements given by our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college's infrastructure, labs, classrooms, library, and everything was good. Washrooms were also good and they were cleaned daily. They bring new equipment into labs and they use new technologies. Classrooms were very comfortable for students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college were very helpful and were very friendly with students. They had so much subject knowledge. With that knowledge, they made students industry-ready. Semester exams were not that difficult, and the pass percentage was 35%.
detailed_review.Other: I am 2020-2023 batch and I have a lot of memories of my college time.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best college for education.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 50% of people were placed in our course. The highest package is 15 lakhs per annum, and the lowest package is 3 lakhs per annum. In our college, TCS, Wipro, Tata, etc., are the top recruiting companies, and a max of 25% of students got internships. The top roles are software.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Excellent and flexible infrastructure and very good facilities in our hostel. Friendly nature in college gives good vibes, so very thankful for the college course and hostel giving this good feeling of relation and also giving stress. Thank you.
detailed_review.Faculty: Very helpful teachers and teaching quality is the best, but semester exams are very tough. The question paper is very sad for students to attempt; it is very tough for semester exams. Please give medium or easy questions in semester exams. Average students are feeling very sad; even toppers can’t attempt the question paper.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college experience with a lot of memories.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 60% of students got placed at TCS, Cognizant, Factset, and L&T. The lowest salary package offered is 3.6 LPA. The highest salary package offered is 10.8 LPA. Above 40% of students got internships. Other companies like Infosys, Three, Mantra, and Accenture are interested in conducting placements every year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very nice. It has good classrooms and laboratories with a good Wi-Fi connection. Hostel rooms are very nice with good maintenance. The food tastes very nice. Every year, a sports day is conducted including games. A gym is also available in this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The quality of the teaching is good. The curriculum is fit for students with all skills. It is fit for students to get industry-ready. The pass percentage is above 80% for every semester. For every 5 months, a semester is conducted. For every semester exam, we need to pay Rs. 700.
detailed_review.Other: I want to become a software engineer, so I chose this course. Our college needs to add additional courses like AI, data science, etc. There is a scholarship facility for students. The campus surroundings are very good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu review.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements at my college are good. The highest package offered was 44 LPA, and the lowest was 4 LPA. Most of the students in our batch were placed this year, which is great news.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has excellent infrastructure, including air-conditioned labs with Wi-Fi. The facilities are top-notch. The hostel accommodations are also very good, and the food is quite edible. A canteen recently opened, and it's pretty good as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are only about 70% helpful, and the rest of the help has to come from the students. The teaching quality is only so-so, and the pass percentage this year was only 85%.
detailed_review.Other: There are three fests held each year. In addition, there is a college-wide sports day. Each branch also has its own fest, like the ECE's E-Emerge.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the placements in the year 2024.

detailed_review.Placements: The college is average, and if you are looking for just a normal job, you can join. Placements have improved. Companies like Deccan Fine Chemical and MSN Pharma recruited students from the Department of Chemical Engineering. Packages are between 2.5 lacs and 5 lacs per annum.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is average. Labs, classrooms, and a library are available. Food in the hostels is not very good. We are encouraged to participate in sports and games. Wi-Fi is not available. The canteen has improved a lot, and the food there is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The quality of teaching is average. We have to learn by ourselves. The course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are not very tough; the pass percentage is 90%+, so there are no issues regarding semester exams. The teachers are friendly and helpful. The quality of education is average since it's a government college. We have to put in a lot of effort to cover the subjects.
detailed_review.Other: The extracurricular activities, events, fests were excellent. Many events were organized. Campus is so good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is very well structured buliding, good faculty and students.

detailed_review.Placements: The highest salary package offered was up to 10 LPA. Some of the companies that recruit from our college are TCS, Accenture, L&T, Factset, Deccan Fine Chemicals, Hetero Drugs, and MSN Laboratories. Every student in the class will get a paid internship, and the college provides both online and offline internships that are related to the student's course or the industry of the faculty.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The labs, classrooms, and library are very well suited for students. The hostel is separate for each year of students, which is good. The food in the hostel is of very good quality, and the canteen is well-stocked. The college also provides a medical dispensary and a large area for sports and practice.
detailed_review.Faculty: The classes provide a highly comfortable environment. Students are given the opportunity to visit industry sites. Semester exams cover the syllabus that was completed with the help of the faculty. Students who struggle are given extra time to complete their subjects.
detailed_review.Other: I really like my college campus. The campus is beautiful, and the students are friendly. There are a lot of activities and events on campus, including the annual department fest. The fest is a lot of fun, and it's a great opportunity to spend time with friends and family.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of infrastructure and greenery.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, almost 70 percent of students got placed in various companies like FactSet, Cognizant, L&T, etc. The highest offered in our college is 11 LPA, the average package is about 6 LPA, and the lowest package is about 4 LPA. Many students are getting internships in various companies such as Blue Star, GENCO, and TRANSCO, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our college, we have a fully equipped gym and a central library containing all types of books required for academics. Wi-Fi facility is not available in our college. In our hostel, almost 100 rooms are there, and each room is facilitated with two tables and two chairs, which are enough to stay comfortably.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our department, almost 200 students are present, and for them, we have almost 20 teaching faculty members. The teaching does not reach up to our expectations. In our college, the pass percentage is almost 85. The regulation design for our curriculum is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Excellent and good to choose.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students from our course get placed. The highest package is 10 LPA, the lowest is 4 LPA, and the average is 4.5 LPA. TCS and Cognizant are the recruiting companies. 50% of students get internships in a few software companies, where they work on web development, including front-end development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department has a good library and wifi throughout the building. The labs are well-equipped, and the classrooms are comfortable and well-lit. The hostel facility is just average, but the food quality is good. There is a dispensary and a gym room available for students' use.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very good at teaching and are all professionals. The course curriculum is exactly what is needed, and it is relevant. This makes the students industry-ready. The semester exams are a bit tough, but they are easier if we prepare well. The pass percentage of ECE is above 80%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose ECE because it offers two career paths: software or hardware. I love my choice because it gives me flexibility and allows me to pursue my interests in either area.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu.

detailed_review.Placements:
80 percent of students are placed.
The highest package is 10 lacs per annum.
The average package is 5 Lacs per annum.
The recruiting companies are TCS, Kia, Mahindra, and Cognizant.
Maximum students got internships.
Roles offered are of supervisor, production lead, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The college has good infrastructure with more than a dozen buildings with good digital classrooms and library is awesome. Here, the library is like a treasure where we hunt the knowledge, and it is pleasant in university.
Hostels are there with good mess and proper rooms.
Canteen is also there.
A small medical hospital is there for emergency purposes.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Faculty members are good, and there are professionals in their respective subjects, and they are good in every teaching aspect.
Each year consists of 2 semesters, in which the questions are a little bit difficult with 10 subjects in each semester with 4 labs and 6 theory subjects.
detailed_review.Other:
Clubs are there like wellness clubs, sports clubs, higher education clubs, fun clubs, peptox clubs, and other clubs. 
Campus is good with stress and other with 100 acres of land.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 35% of our 2024 batch passed out students were placed during the campus placements. Companies like TCS, Accenture, and L&T hire students from our college. 10.2 LPA was the highest package, 3 LPA was the lowest, and 4 LPA was the average package secured by the students. Students won't get internship opportunities in our college; rather, they would search for internships themselves. GET and system engineer were the highest roles offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college lecture halls, campus, and seminar halls are well-equipped with furniture, projectors, and Wi-Fi facilities. The library has each and every academic material required for the students. The college hostels were neat, the food quality was good, and the menu will be changeable according to the students opinions. Also, the hostel fee was very affordable as well. The college has a medical room with a doctor, a canteen, and a sports playground encouraging talents in all possible corners.
detailed_review.Faculty: Every department has 5-6 professors with M.Tech. and above degrees and more than 10 assistant professors who are very qualified but don't teach according to the students needs. The course curriculum is good; the students who follow it could be great engineers and have a bright future. The semester exam difficulty level will be medium. The pass percentage is around 85%.
detailed_review.Other: As I was aware that the mechanical engineering field can lead to a successful career in design engineering, I've chosen this course. If the teaching methods and the training facilities are good, a number of students may be settled at higher positions from JNTUA, which is not happening at present in our college. The good thing about the college is that it promotes self-learning sports, fun-filled activities, culturals, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, it's a good college to pursue engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 20-25% of students were placed in campus placements for the 2024 passed-out batch of Mechanical Engineering. The lowest package was 3.36 LPA, and the highest was 7 LPA. L&T, TCS, and Accenture were the major recruiters during our period. No students got internship opportunities through campus, so they had to find internships through their contacts. The highest role offered to a fresh Mechanical Engineering graduate was Graduate Engineer Trainee.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every department’s lecture halls, seminar halls, and the central library have Wi-Fi. The canteen was recently closed. The newly built lecture hall complex has good infrastructure, including a projector. The library holds a large volume of books, magazines, and journals. The hostel facility at JNTUA is excellent due to its good quality, affordability, and cleanliness. The college has a separate medical building and a large playground for both indoor and outdoor sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching faculty are highly qualified with master's degrees and Ph.D.'s. However, only some teachers mentor and help students, while others just teach for the sake of attendance. I believe self-learning is important to thrive in universities. The curriculum is well-structured, with about an 80% overlap with the GATE syllabus, offering students a brighter future. The difficulty of the end-semester exams ranges from easy to medium, and the pass percentage for our batch was around 85%. However, for the junior batches, the pass rate dropped as students with lower qualifications are choosing core branches in universities, believing it to be more beneficial.
detailed_review.Other: I got a good rank in the AP EAMCET exam, and being from Dharmavaram, a nearby town, JNTUA was my first option. I chose this branch as I met the cutoff. Mechanical Engineering is an excellent field, covering design, aerospace, automobile, and machining concepts. Mastering these areas will make you a renowned engineer. It would be better if students were trained from the second year onwards to become industry-ready and improve communication skills. The institute organizes events year-round like College Day, Sports Day, department fests, and Information Day. It also encourages students to participate in community activities such as NSS and NCC, providing good societal exposure.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college to study and improving your abilities .

detailed_review.Placements: 60 to 70% of students were placed, and it is recruiting students by the top companies. The highest package offered in the placement time is 10 LPA, and the lowest is 3 LPA, and most of the students got internships, and some of them are not qualified for the company.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every thing is there and it was good. All facilities are available Wi-Fi connection is there and gym is also there for body fitness. Large ground is here and this is well supportive for sports and games and food is available with minimum quality and quantity .
detailed_review.Faculty: Lecturers are helpful and good, and all the lectures are highly graduated, and most of them are rewarded for there skills. And they teach all the things for both study purposes and future planning, and this makes the students industry-ready, and most of the students pass.

faqs.question: Can I apply for MBA at JNTUA without an entrance examination?
faqs.answer: Admission to the MBA course at JNTUA subject to a valid score in the state-level entrance exam: Andhra Pradesh ICET. Only the students with an exam score are shortlisted and called for counselling following which seats are allotted. There is no other way to get admission to a full-time MBA course at JNTUA. Therefore can't apply for MBA at JNTUA without an entrance examination. To be eligible for the exam candidates must have the below qualification: Course Eligibility Selection MBA Bachelor's degree with 50% aggregate from a recognised university AP ICET + Counselling

faqs.question: How can I get admission for MBA at JNTUA?
faqs.answer: To get admission to a four-year MBA course at Jawaharlal Nehru Technical University Anantapur, candidates must fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria in the first place, i, e., Bachelor's degree with 50% aggregate from a recognised university. Eligible candidates are required to appear for the entrance exam Andhra Pradesh ICET. Candidates with a valid score in the exam become applicable for the counselling rounds. AfAPSCHE will announce AP ICET 2025 counselling dates at icet-sche.aptonline.in soon after results are announced. After the counselling rounds, candiates are shortlisted for final admission. In the final steps candidates are required to pay the JNTUA MBA fees to finalise the admisssion.

JNTUA College of Engineering, Ananthapuramu has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility B.E. / B.Tech Candidate must have passed diploma in engineering/technology or 3 years B.Sc degree with Mathematics as one of the subjects
And
secured at least 45% marks (40% marks reserved category) from a recognized university. MCA Candidate must have passed bachelor degree of 3/4 years duration with Mathematics as one of the subject at Intermediate or Degree level with above mentioned marks from any recognised University/Institute.
45% marks for BC categories.
Candidate who are appearing for the final year degree examination are also be eligible.

Degree obtained by Distance Mode Program should have recognition by Joint Committee of UGC, AICTE and DEC/DEB.

45% marks for BC categories.
Candidate who are appearing for the final year degree examination are also be eligible.

Degree obtained by Distance Mode Program should have recognition by Joint Committee of UGC, AICTE and DEC/DEB.

Candidate who passed all the subjects of the three years of any Degree course in one sitting is not eligible for admission. M.E./M.Tech Candidate must have passsed B.E./B.Tech. in relevant stream and obtained at least 50% marks (45% in case of reserved category candidates) from an AICTE/UGC
approved institution recognised by the Government of Andhra Pradesh as equivalent thereto.

highlights.summary:
Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering (RSCOE) was founded in 2001 by Jayawant Shikshan Prasarak Mandal as a private college. Located in Tathawade Maharashtra, RSCOE has been affiliated with Savitribai Phule University and recognised by the UGC and NBA. It has also been approved by the AICTE accredited with a grade ‘A’ by NAAC. The institute has achieved several awards over the years. Some of them are ‘Best Professional College award (Urban Category)’ by SPPU and ‘AICTE-CII award in the Platinum Category’ for two consecutive years.
JSPM Tathawade has 12 departments and offers UG, PG, and PhD programmes. The popular courses offered at JSPM RSCC are BTech and MBA. JSPM Tathawade admission is based on merit and national entrance exams. Check out the table for more information on Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering:
Check out more on Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering Highlights in the below videos:

JSPM Tathawade also offers MBA programme for two-years. The college offers MBA specilisation in Marketing Management, Financial Management, Operations & Supply Chain Management, and others. JSPM RSCOE Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Jspm RSCO best college for all branches.

detailed_review.Placements: 65% students are placed in college per year. In which some top students get a high package. The highest package achieved by JSPM RSCO alumni is 1cr. The Average package range is 6LPA to 12LPA. The lowest package is 4LPA. There are many top companies linked with the JSPM scope like KPI, KPI, and many more. Students get internship from the second year at abroad companies with 25k minimum stipend per month.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our college 24/7 Wi-Fi hot water filtered water and a watchman or guardian. In hostel the food quality is not bad. The college has a ground for sports, and also conducts games and competitions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teacher provides all notes for the exam. Prepare us for exams very perfectly. It makes students ready for the industry. There are industry visits conducted for every semester. All faculty conduct sessions of GFM in which they solve our doubts. They do not burden students with assignments.
detailed_review.Other: Many events happen in this college for students as well as for faculty, such as the Smart India Hackathon competition at the college level. There are many club activities for the development of students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Somewhat recommended as they have a good course structure for academics.

detailed_review.Placements: They provide good placements, but Mech students go to Capgemini and Cognizant. They force them to apply there. Even though we are not interested in coding. Overall, core companies like JCI and others also come, but these days, competition is very high.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Half the college is under renovation right now. They are making everything new again. There are 3 canteens, all of which are good and provide okayish food. Hostels are located on the campus. The general stores, too, so students do not have to go out unless they opt for PG.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good for exams. They provide excellent teaching and course structure. They offer re-exams better than the backlog system for students. So they don’t have to get stressed about the next end-of-semester for clearing their backlogs. They also give question banks for extra help.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The autonomous system allows the college to design its own syllabus.

detailed_review.Placements: If you are looking for a college only for academics, then this is the one. So, the electrical department here is actually very strict. If you are looking for them, you need to be flexible with your attendance. Please do not expect this. However, teachers are really great. They really do help you with everything. This year, the placement is 97%. The average package is 3 LPA - 4 LPA with the highest being 11 LPA, and the lowest being 2.5 LPA. I hope this helps you.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are really good. The classrooms are pretty good, and labs are also available. Canteen and mess are also pretty good, and food is great. The infrastructure is modern, with Wi-Fi-enabled campus. It has well-equipped labs, and a good library.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are really helpful and nice. They do help you out with everything. They also encourage exploring extracurricular activities. Semester exams are simple as what is taught during college hours comes in exams. Faculty members are supportive and well-qualified, with many professors being approachable and knowledgeable.
detailed_review.Other: Only one event is held annually, which is also not that good, so do not expect anything more. Sports events are also held during the two semesters of the term.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good campus and all instruments are available.

detailed_review.Placements: As per the records, we have seen in the college. The average package is about 3 LPA, but this year. There is about a 97% placement in electrical engineering. And the remaining 3 are gone for higher studies. Our HOD is very concerned about placement and does all things that are required for students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the department, the course we are studying is good. The instruments are in good condition. If any are defective, they will replace/repair them. They strictly monitor the food quality and cleanliness in the hostel, and an external person is not allowed.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is nice and ready to solve out after college also. Courses are planned properly. They are motivated to do research and innovate new ideas in projects. All subjects are pre-planned, and exams are also pre-planned. So we get time to study as well as to innovate new ideas.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is large. And all study instruments are available. And have done all extra activities, and they provide a platform for that. But college does not have a dedicated ground for playing. They have permitted us to use the Blossom School Ground. But it is not big enough to play properly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college can satisfy the dream and also higher placement jobs.

detailed_review.Placements: As per last year, now this branch has recorded a placement rate of 96% placement and all in the top-notch companies, including the IT sector. Also, it's best for M.Tech, as it also sends its students to other countries, where Taiwan is the most famous. The roles also given are the ground manager, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the course is one of the best and one of the important courses and the hostel is also good, and it also has a food court and cafeteria. The hospital is near the hostel, and it also has a ground connected to the hostel to play. Also, the college supports the physical growth of students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers of this college are highly qualified and also have a Ph.D. in literature, and the faculty have teaching experience of more than 8-10 years. The course curriculum is relevant, and makes students industry-ready through their knowledge and efforts, and the support of the college faculty.
detailed_review.Other: I chose electric engineering because it has a growing demand in the market, and also by taking this course. I have an open option to go to the government sector also, so I guess this is very helpful to me. This college conducts events and programs every week by taking a guest lecture from alumni or an industry expert.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements in 2025 with 96% batch placed in electricals.

detailed_review.Placements: Electrical engineering received the highest number of job offers among the branches. The highest salary package offered was 7.5 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered is 2.5 LPA. Profiles offered to EE students include Embedded Systems Engineer, Hardware Design / VLSI Engineer, Firmware Developer, Research & Development Associate, and Systems Engineer (R&D/ R&D/Tech-focused roles). The average salary package offered was 4 LPA to 5 LPA for most students. Electrical branches are likely similar or slightly lower. Campus recruiters include TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, Accenture, Capgemini, KPIT, Bosch, Continental Automotive, and others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good, but some of the classrooms are poorly maintained, i.e., lights don't work and the fans are damaged. Computers don't work and lag too much. Cafeteria of the college is good, food quality is good, but expensive. There is not enough playground for students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are described as moderately easy, largely due to detailed study materials, important-question guidance, and preparation leaves.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Electrical Engineering because I have always been fascinated by how machines, circuits, and power systems work. I wanted a branch that balanced theory and practicals, and gave me diverse career options from core industries to software roles. JSPM RSCOE, being an autonomous institute with decent placement records and solid infrastructure, was a good fit for me.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Value for money college.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has a very good placement record, with about 90% of our students placed from the college, and the companies are highly recruiting. The roles offered are based on the course, such as CS branch roles, as data analyst, data science course, etc. The highest package is of 1 crore per annum recently from the mechanical branch.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities of our branch are very well-maintained, and a very nice canteen is also available. The hostel is also well-maintained, and good hygiene of food is maintained in the hostel mess. The rooms are cleaned regularly, and water facilities are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful overall, they help with studies, exams, mid-sems, etc. They teach extracurricular subjects too. The course is very mannered in a way that it makes the students industry-ready for the future. The exams are mid to difficult level, not so hard.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has impressive infrastructure but lacking in faculty support.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% placed. 3 LPA has the minimum package, and 51 is the highest package. All companies are coming for interviews. All students are attending interviews. Almost 50% of students have secured internships. The placement packages are around 3 lakhs. All companies come for drives, and all students are allowed to attend.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has all the facilities, good classrooms, Wi-Fi, good labs, a hostel facility, and ground. We have big screens, big classrooms, big screens. There is a good faculty member sitting arrangement or proper relatively of visibility is good. The college has digital classrooms, a playground, and many trees on the campus. The hostel facility is good. The mess and canteen are available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have good faculty members. They give study material. All teachers have good experience. All activities taken by my colleagues. Exam are hard. All syllabus is completed by teachers. They have more than 5 years of experience. We have digital classrooms that's why faculty provide practical work PPT, presentations, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is slightly average.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, 80% of students get placed. The highest package offered is 47 LPA, the average is 5.1 LPA, and the lowest is 2.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Capgemini, KPIT, TCS, etc. Almost everyone gets an internship through the college. Roles like editor are in big companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is good. Wi-Fi is available on every floor, and labs are present for each subject. The library is available in the college and is always open during college hours. Hostel facilities include hot water, cold water, Wi-Fi, etc. The hostel also has a mess on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is slightly better. The course is relevant to the branch and makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are not tough as it is an autonomous college. You have to pay attention in class. The passing percentage is 40.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: College has fulfilled my expectations that I expected.

detailed_review.Placements: Roughly 80%-90% of students get placements every year with good internships and good experience. The highest package is nearly 1.2 crores. The lowest or the average is nearly 3 LPA. The company that offers the jobs are TCS and LinkedIn. Roughly 80% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very helpful and coordinated in all circumstances. They provide very clear and truthful guidelines. The course curriculum is very much aligned with the industrial pattern. It provides a strong base for students to work in the industry. The faculty provided for the given course teaches us very well. They are well-experienced and also very understanding. They are very helpful to us. They have lots of experience which helps students to cope with the academic as well as the internship program and projects throughout the year.
detailed_review.Other: Computer engineering course is very demanding in the market and a course that will maintain its position in the technology industry. The course should improvise with practical knowledge and real-life application. College provides a program every week which helps the students to gain knowledge also about everything.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has good infrastructure. Not very satisfied with faculty, average placements in 2023.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements: Recently, a Mechanical engineering student secured a 1 crore per annum job. However, you need to focus on building your skillset to reach this level. Most students find placement in various companies, with an average package around 3-4 LPA. Some of the recruiting companies include TCS, Infosys, Cognizant, Zensar Technologies, and many others. Roles in mechanical engineering include CAD Designer, Manufacturing Engineer, and Project Manager.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are good. Infrastructure is average, with some broken benches, nonworking fans and lights, and no Wi-Fi. The food is above average in the canteen available. The college partially focuses on sports or games but the main objective of the college is to complete the syllabus and take exams. The college has an ambulance for any emergency. The college has IIF (Innovation and Incubation Foundation) which is a great place for you if you're working on your startup. You'll get a dedicated workplace for your startup to work on. It's one of the best things present in college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified, but they lack the passion to teach the students. The course curriculum is relevant and even some faculty members are supportive. They guide you for your projects and startups and help if there's any need. The mid-semester exam is 30 marks out of which 12 is the passing mark and the end-semester exam is 50 marks out of which 20 is the passing mark. Overall the subject is 100 marks out of which you'll have to get 40 marks to clear that subject.
detailed_review.Other: I'm from the mechanical department and my year of passing out is 2027. I chose this course because I had a low cutoff for the branch I was looking for. I wish the infrastructure of this department was better and more focused on application-based learning instead of theory. The campus is crowded as this is an autonomous college. Events and fests are a big part of this college in February and March. Whereas the campus isn't big. Focus on extracurricular activities is low here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good labs and solid choice for electrical engineering at RSCOE Tathwade.

detailed_review.Placements: The amount of students placed in the 2025 current year of placement is 90%-95%. Students from all branches such as CS it, electrical. Mechanical students are placed in their respective companies. The top recruiting companies for the electrical field are Bosch, Cummins, Volkswagen, force motors, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are well-equipped labs which are dedicated labs that include basic electrical systems that also help in projects. Use of modern technology such as smart TVs, LCD, and ICT-enabled classrooms for better teaching. The department also offers excellent academic infrastructure, labs, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most faculty members hold M.Tech or Ph.D. degree from reputed college and institutions that have more than 10 years of teaching and industry experience. They are very cooperative and also help us prepare for industry as well as exams like GATE. College also takes mini projects and final year projects internships and industry exposure.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It can satisfy your dreams because of the best faculty and also it contains a good placement ratio.

detailed_review.Placements: On average, 80% of students get placed. The highest package is 1 crore for an internship, and the lowest is 3 LPA. Companies like BHEL and Mahavitran, etc., recruit from our college. Around 70%–80% of students get internships. The top roles are government jobs such as in Mahavitran and BHEL. Some students also get the best internships in the third year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is always well-maintained with high-speed Wi-Fi facility. There are also two separate areas for food, the cafeteria and the food court, allowing the crowd to be divided and managed well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified with doctorate degrees. Exams are quite compatible with the syllabus. It also depends on the university paper, as sometimes papers are hard and sometimes easy. It also helps students read and gain practical knowledge about the industry. There are best faculty members for providing knowledge. Faculty members are very supportive and friendly in every aspect.
detailed_review.Other: This course helps me gain knowledge of the core subjects, as my dream is to set up a business. It provides all the required knowledge about materials and other essentials. Every week, some event or the other is held in the college so that students can also be engaged in external activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The good college and faculty members. 1st year was fun.

detailed_review.Placements: I am not looking for any of the placements. I am in the mechanical branch. I am in 1st year, so I don't know many more things about the placements offered by the college. College gives us internships, paid and unpaid. Courses are designed according to the needs of jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel rooms are decent enough, and the food is also good. There is no Wi-Fi. The classrooms are non-AC. There is a little bit of internet problem. But overall, it's all good. I am not in a college hostel, it has a low cost, like Rs. 45,000- Rs. 50,000. There are way too many restrictions. Closing time is at 9:30 PM.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good. It's not like that, but the things taught in the classrooms or available in your notebook are there for tests or exams, so scoring is easy. The courses are good. Faculty members and everything are more than I expected.
detailed_review.Other: I like this college. I was not expecting such a good crowd in the mechanical branch, but not in the other departments. The system is all good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is very excellent for studies. The college is top-rated for placement ratio.

detailed_review.Placements:
Our college gives a good placement ratio. The average package of our college is 7 to 8 lacs per annum. Placements are starting from the third year of college. College is so good in the type of placement ratio.
Our college conducts more activities for placement. College is so caring about placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has 3 floors of building. Three different buildings are made according to branches. The top floor of the electrical building is made into an auditorium. Mac lab is also in our college and contains one food court and cafeteria on campus. Our college has three buildings for B.Tech and other buildings for Polytechnic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty members are supportive. They are so strict for exam purposes. They give us all the required materials for our studies. 40% is required to clear the exam. Teachers provide more knowledge according to the subjects. Faculty members are so strict about studies. They clear our doubts.
detailed_review.Other: Our college conducts extracurricular activities like sports, dance, games, and Gandharva.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placements are average, but the discipline is really good.

detailed_review.Placements: Student placements are quite good. A lot of students even get internships provided by some companies. The college also helps in supporting the students in having internships. A good amount of packages are provided for the students trying their best. Overall, placements are average.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our campus is not too big, but fine. The Wi-Fi library is good, and there's an overall disciplined and kind nature everywhere. It provides a food court and a cafeteria which provide a variety of food. There are better options for hostelites and a good environment to share views and discuss.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty teaching is quite good, the teachers teach well. Being autonomous, the exam pattern and the syllabus have been designed properly, considering all things. Overall, it's better. Considering the industrial requirements, like that of TCS, the syllabus has been taught, so being autonomous is an advantage of this.
detailed_review.Other: I've recently passed out my first year. Wanting to be a software engineer, being in this environment and college will definitely help me to get into a good company. Certain things about teachers, like targeting or not giving marks sometimes just due to personal things, are not okay, else, everything is fine related to the course. Once a year, fests and all those activities are conducted.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best curriculum, decent infrastructure, and value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: This year, the highest package is 30 LPA, and over 500 companies participated in the college's placement drive. Many students also secured packages exceeding 20 LPA. Capgemini extended its offers to 152 seats, resulting in over 780 offers for this batch.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
College campus is not so big, it is moderate in size, having different buildings for different departments. However, some buildings contain two departments in a single building. There is so much greenery on the campus. The Jaywant Library is one of the best places on the campus. Thank you.
.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-educated and possess ample knowledge in their particular subjects, there's no need to worry about the faculty, as their teaching quality is good. The course is relevant and effectively prepares students for the industry. The semester exams range from moderate to difficult, and I believe the pass percentage is over 90%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's a value-for-money college.

detailed_review.Placements: For the 2023-2024 placements, approximately 100% of students secured positions, with the highest package around 12 LPA and the college average at 3-4 LPA. Though overall packages vary by branch and company, with top recruiters including Cognizant, TCS, and Eaton.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College is vast, and the construction is top-notch. The college has a big library at the start in which you will get all types of books and a place to study. There are also cabins in which you can work on your group projects or your startup, etc. Everything is computerized from entrance to exit. Also, the college has different buildings for different branches.
detailed_review.Faculty: Course curriculum is very well established, as it's an autonomous college. Therefore, the teaching is tailored to what's best needed for engineering students. The teachers here are well-studied and also very well-trained in their subjects. The faculty is also very friendly; they will help you even with your personal problems, making it a win-win situation.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Faculties are decent, but they need to be unbiased, and marking isn't transparent.

detailed_review.Placements: Percentage of campus placements is very low, especially for non-technical branches. For IT and CS, it's decent but still low. TCS is the main company that hires in bulk. The percentage of girls getting placed is good as compared to the boys. With the increase in the population of students, the percentage will go even lower.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College building is getting older and needs renovation in years to come. A decent-sized Library is there. There's no playground for students, and sports are not promoted much. The food court and canteen are available but a little expensive and small. The food isn't that great.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are quite helpful, friendly, and good at teaching. On the other hand, some senior teachers have favoritism and aren't that helpful. Subjects are mostly course-relevant, though I can't say they make students industry-ready. The exams are a little on the easier side, but the checking is absurd. While there are specific marking criteria, every teacher gives marks on their will, which affects the CGPA. Also, there are often many mistakes in paper checking, and many times they aren't corrected even after reporting. The pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: There are a couple of fests every year. The surroundings aren't that great. The college doesn't provide any scholarship directly; you have to apply on mahadbt, etc. I chose IT to study coding as I want to be a web developer.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is above average. Placements are good in tech companies. It is very strict about attendance.

detailed_review.Placements: There are a total of 300 students in Mechanical Engineering, out of which 70-80% get placed. The highest package till now is 18 LPA, and the average is about 4 LPA. Companies like TVS, Tata Steel, Mahindra, and JSW are the top recruiters. 70-80% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: For Mechanical Engineering, there is a separate building. The classrooms are good and spacious. All the machines are present in the department, and a library is also available with Wi-Fi. 2 canteens are present, and the quality of food is also good. An ambulance is also available for any medical emergency.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are qualified and helpful. The teaching quality is good, and lectures happen from time to time. The college is autonomous, so the question papers are made in the college itself. The difficulty of exams are moderate. The course curriculum is also relevant.
detailed_review.Other: Very less fests are organized, only one fest is conducted in a year named Gandharv, and a sports day is also conducted. The campus is small but good, and some trees are planted on the campus.

college_info.college_name: JSPM RSCOE Course Admissions 2025: Fee, Eligibility, Dates, Application Process

faqs.question: What are the courses that Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering, Pune offers?
faqs.answer: The College offers AICTE-approved UG/PG and Diploma courses such as BTech, MTech, MCA and MBA courses as well as After 10th Diploma courses. Additionally, BTech, MTech, and Polytechnic courses are offered in 11 specialisations, including Civil Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Computer Engineering. All the courses are offered in full-time mode.

faqs.question: How to apply for an M.Tech course at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Candidates have to apply separately on the college’s website apart from the GATE application. The steps involved in the online application process are online registration (jspmrscoe.edu.in), logging in and application form filling, documents uploading, payment of application fees, and form submission. Along with the application, certain documents also have to be submitted, including Class 10 and 12 mark sheets and passing certificates, Bachelor's degree, Birth certificate, Caste certificate (if applicable), and Coloured photographs.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: What is the expected JEE Main cutoff 2024?
faqs.answer: NIT Manipur JEE Main cutoff 2024 has been released for admission to the BTech courses. During the Round 1 cutoff, the closing rank for CSE was 25886 for the General category students under the AII India Quota. Among OBC candidates, the closing rank for B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering stood at 8750 . Candidates seeking admisison to NIT Manipur can refer to the table below to check out the Round 1 closing ranks for BTech in CSE course for various categories under the AI quota: Category JEE Main 2024 Expected Cutoff Common Rank List 90-91 Gen-EWS 75-76 OBC-NCL 73-74 SC 51-52 ST 37-38 PwD 0.0013527

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for BTech at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: For BTech admission at JSPM’s Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering, candidates must have a valid JEE Main/ MHT CET score. The institute releases separate merit lists for each of the entrance tests. Hence, a separate list is released for students who applied with JEE scores and for the applicants with MHT CET scores. Candidates applying with MHT CET scores have to participate in the counselling as well. Further, no other entrance exam scores are accepted for admission.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for BTech admission at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Eligibility criteria for BTech course at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering demand candidates to pass Class 12 or a similar examination with a minimum aggregate of 50% (45% in the case of reserved category students). Admission is on the basis of entrance exams like JEE Main or MHT CET, followed by MHT CET counseling. The candidates have to register online, submit documents and go through the counseling process for seat allotment. The final option is merit, marks in entrance exam, and seat availability.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for B.Tech at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering, Pune for other than general categories?
faqs.answer: The last year 2022 cutoff ranks for B.Tech. in Computer Engineering at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering, Pune other than General category are - 79931 for OBC,  79931 for SC,  79931 for ST,  79931 for EWS,  79931 for PWD. While the admissions are based on the scores/rank obtained in JEE exam, the last cut offs also change a lot depending on All India quota or Home State. It also varies if the applicant is a female.

faqs.question: What specializations are offered in the BTech programme at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering provides BTech courses in various specializations to meet various streams of engineering. Some of the most sought-after specializations are Computer Science and Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Electronics & Telecommunication Engineering, and Artificial Intelligence & Data Science. The college plans each specialisation to impart rigorous technical knowledge, practice training, and industry wisdom. The students can choose to follow the preferred branch of study based on interest, career objectives, and marks obtained at the entrance examinations.

faqs.question: How do I get a seat at Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering, Pune?
faqs.answer: Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering, Pune offers a large diversity of courses to students in various fields. JSPM RSCOE admissions are held on the basis of entrance tests. Students seeking course admissions must clear their previous qualifying examination and appear for any of the prescribed entrance exams such as MAT, MAH MCA CET, ATMA, XAT, MAH CET, CAT, CMAT, among others. Students can visit the official website to learn more regarding the course-wise eligibility and specialisation details.

faqs.question: When will MAH MBA CET 2025 application form release?
faqs.answer: MAH MBA CET 2025 application form released on December 25, 2024. Registration dates were announced by the Maharashtra State CET Cell at its official website. The MAH MBA CET 2025 registration process will end on February 10, 2025. Candidates interested in appearing for MAH MBA CET 2025 are required to fill the online application form and pay the requisite fee before the last date. MAH CET is a state level entrance exam for admission to over 300 MBA/MMS colleges, but candidates from other part of countries too can register and appear for it.

faqs.question: Does Rajarshi Shahu College of Engineering offer scholarships?
faqs.answer: RSCOE scholarships are offered to students every year. The amount of scholarship varies between INR 40,000 PA to INR 60,000 PA. The scholarships are offered to meritorious students, minority groups, students with good scores in national exams and many more. college_info.college_name: KIET Ghaziabad: Courses, Fees, Admission 2026, Placements, Rankings, Scholarships

highlights.summary:
KIET Ghaziabad was established in 1998 (under the aegis of Krishna Charitable Society) with an initial seat intake of 180. Ghaziabad KIET gives UG, PG, and diploma programmes across the Pharmacy, Management, Engineering, & Computer Applications streams. Many courses are offered to students in accreditation with the AKTU. The available flagship programmes are MBA, BPharma, and BTech. KIET College is accredited with an A+ Grade by NAAC. Krishna Institute of Engineering and Technology gives NBA accredited programmes to students. KIET Ghaziabad has been ranked under the Pharmacy category by NIRF 2025 at the 71st position. The university has also secured 151–200 band in Engineering, and 11–50 band in Innovation by NIRF Ranking 2025.
KIET College Ghaziabad has got QS I-GAUGE Diamond rating and recognition as a Scientific and Industrial Research Organization (SIRO) by DSIR. KIET University Ghaziabad has collaborated with AWS, CISCO, Palo Alto, and others. Krishna Institute of Engineering and Technology has over 9,300 students & 440+ highly qualified faculty members. The below are the KIET highlights:
Establishment year | Ownership type
- 11–50 band in Innovation by NIRF
- 71 by NIRF under the Pharmacy category
For more information about KIET Ghaziabad, check out the video below:

college_info_program.intro:
KIET Ghaziabad popualar programme are MBA, BPharma, and BTech. KIET Ghaziabad BTech students can work as Web Application Developers, Mobile Application Developers, Data Scientists, Software Developers, Software Testers, or can go for various other job profiles. KIET Ghaziabad MBA students are placed in top companies such as Amazon, Cisco, Wipro, Talent Next, and others. Krishna Institute of Engineering and Technology BTech is available in specialiations like Computer Science & Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science & Information Technology, and others. The university has even received NIRF ranking for the Pharmacy and Engineering courses. BTech students are taught Database Systems, Operating Systems, Advance Data Structure, and others.
