reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Very good college, satisfied with teachers and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Mostly, 80% of students from my batch get placements above 3 LPA. The average is 5 LPA. It is a great college for me. Teachers are super friendly, and they help with almost everything. The staff is very old and talented. They guide through every step of placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel and canteens have great food. Each classroom is very spacious. They have AC fans and smart boards in every class. The hall is quite big as well. The structure is really good. It is around 20 acres, but they have planned it very well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is designed by AKTU UNIVERSITY. But now it is an independent college, so it designs its courses by itself. Now, the course structure is very good. It usually covers a lot of relevant topics like machine learning, AI, deep learning, and languages like Python and R.
detailed_review.Other: It is a highly recommended college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with campus, good placement in 2022.

detailed_review.Placements: According to me, a good number of students are placed; approximately 80 to 90 percent of the students are placed every year in different companies. Good companies also come, but for shortlisting, there is a selection criterion, and purely merit-based admission is taken.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and the hostel are just amazing. The best campus in Delhi NCR. A lot of facilities are provided, like Wi-Fi, labs, a library, and AC in classrooms. There are 5 canteens in the college, a few of them being Healthy Hut, Green Chilli, Nescafé, and Big Treat.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good, but in the core branches, the teachers are outstanding. There are basically three exams that take place in a semester: two mid-semester exams and one end-of-semester exam, and it is easy to pass those exams.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is the best option for me and also because of the highest placement rate in the NCERT region.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Information Technology
reviews.review_title: My most honest feedback. Average placement and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: A high percentage of students are placed, but mostly in mass recruiters like TCS, Wipro, etc. The highest package last year was 87 LPA, which was an off-campus placement. Many students went to higher studies, while some settled for really low packages like 3 LPA. Infosys HackWithInfy hired 5 students with 9.5 LPA and 1 student with 6.25 LPA. The highest package on campus was 42.70 LPA at ServiceNow. Many students in the 3rd year do internships in various domains like app development, web development, graphic design, editing, and cryptography. The top role offered by recruiters was in app development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This college is known for its amazing infrastructure. We have Wi-Fi accessibility everywhere, and charging ports are available on each desk in each class. The library is good, where you can get the books issued, and the management keeps introducing new books. The hostel has everything good except the mess. So, not talking about the food, medical facilities are always available, and you can play sports and games. College has a volleyball, basketball and badminton court. Girls are not allowed to leave the hostel after 8.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many of the teachers are neither helpful, nor qualified, nor knowledgeable. You will have to learn everything on your own. Ours is an AKTU batch, so the exams were really tough. But now KIET has become a deemed university, so for incoming students, it has introduced courses that are really relevant according to the industry, and the exams are not too tough.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because, amongst other private colleges of AKTU, KIET is the best. Management is not strict. We have events going on almost every month. The major technical one was Innotech, then we had DataVerse. Various clubs in the college keep organising different contests and hackathons, which is something I really love. I have maintained my Leetcode score because of it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: A genuine review of KIET Group of Institutions, Ghaziabad, from a 2nd-year student.

detailed_review.Placements: About 90% of students get placed in various companies. It includes Infosys (Software Development Intern), TCS (Digital Marketing Intern), Wipro (Data Analyst Intern), Cognizant (Software Engineering Intern), HCL (Business Development Intern), and Zomato (Marketing and Content Intern). About 500 students get mass recruited in Infosys each year. The highest package offered is 87 LPA, and the average package is 5–6 LPA. The placements are decent but have declined this year, with most packages ranging from 3–5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Although a new MAC lab has been built this year, other labs are still not good and feel outdated. The infrastructure of the college is quite good but needs some improvements. Labs are mostly outdated, especially the mechanical labs, but some new labs are good, like the CNC lab and 3D printing lab. There are two libraries in the college, one of which has a vast collection of books and resources. Most canteens are good but need some improvement in seating and crowd management.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching is quite good, with practical knowledge as well. However, I do not like the programming faculty because of their lack of knowledge and school-like behavior. Apart from this, exams go smoothly. The syllabus is good, but I do not think it makes students fully industry-ready. They have to improve their skills on their own.
detailed_review.Other: I chose KIET because it is suggested by my school teachers and it is near my house, which is the biggest reason for joining this college. I wish to add more practical-based learning, which could increase opportunities. The campus is overcrowded, as there are many students in different branches of engineering.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Faculty is really bad good infrastructure average placements wonderful fests and tech events.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are still going on this year but the data is not available. Last year 2024 the highest package offered is 87LPA at Paladin Bladesmith Inc. which is off campus while the lowest reached at 3LPA. Second the highest is 42.70LPA at Service now. Third the highest was 32LPA at AMD. The average package offered is 5 to 6LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS Coforge Infosys and Rapipay.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available everywhere inside the college. Labs are also equipped with good facilities. We have a library and a reading room. Although there are not many good books to read in the library technology related. The experience is quite good. The water index is really bad. Many of my friends complain about losing hair and having pimples. Mess food is average and canteen food is good but you cannot eat it every day. A doctor is always available. We have a cricket club volleyball club athletics club martial arts shooting NCC and that is quite a lot.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not at all knowledgeable. It seems that they are themselves confused in their subjects. There is no point in asking questions to them as they will somehow misunderstand the question and just repeat everything they said. Curriculum is quite relevant. In the first year we have C and Web designing and in the second year Java so it is good. Semester exams are easy you can easily pass. Just do not get detained because of low attendance 75 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have interest in coding and technical stuff. The best things in this course are that everything you study is relevant. I even feel that I can apply Chemistry to solve a real problem. Kiet is autonomous college it has the power to make its own syllabus so we do not have to follow the prescribed AKTU syllabus which is good. Tech events are really good. We have Innotech recently wherein many students showcase their projects. Crowd is quite nice and helpful. Scholarships are easily provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good college with helpful teachers, nice campus, and decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Our batch has around 60 students. The placement drive started in the final year. Some students got placed in good companies like TCS, Wipro, and Infosys. The highest package is around 6 LPA, and the average package is around 3.5 LPA. Internship chances are available for a few students in 3rd year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has good infrastructure. Classrooms are clean and have projectors. Computer labs are updated with the latest software. There is high-speed Wi-Fi available across the campus. The library has many useful books. Hostels are neat, safe, and comfortable. Mess food is okay. It could be better. There are also sports grounds, a canteen, and a gym. Overall infrastructure is good and well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are friendly, well-qualified, and always ready to help students. The course syllabus is updated and includes both theory and practical learning. Teaching quality is good and easy to understand. Exams are held on time and are fair. Internal assessment and lab tests help students prepare well. Overall, faculty and academics are strong and supportive.
detailed_review.Other: College life here is a mix of learning and enjoyment. The campus is clean and disciplined. More placement drives will make it even better. Overall, a good college for those who want quality education and decent exposure.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Information Technology
reviews.review_title: My review of KIET as a first year.

detailed_review.Placements: So I will tell you the complete truth about it. The highest placement is 87 LPA, which is a huge number if you look at the college level, while the lowest is 3.6 LPA from Infosys. The average package is not clear, but around 5–6 LPA. Infosys and TCS internships are quite low. The developer is the highest role.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure-wise, this college is good, but the biggest con is that it has quite a small campus of 17 acres. However, the main buildings are well maintained. They provide all types of facilities, labs are well-equipped, Wi-Fi is available throughout the whole campus, and sports facilities are also there along with a gym and all.
detailed_review.Faculty: Mainly, teachers are from NIT and other government colleges. A few are very good in their field, while a few are just boring, which is the same in every college, I guess. The curriculum is great if we compare it to other AKTU colleges, as we are getting software like Fusion 360, learning web development, and all in the first year.
detailed_review.Other: Actually, I have always been fascinated towards technology and all, so that’s the most basic reason for choosing B.Tech.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placement is average, but campus life is good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is not so good. Approximately 75 - 80% students get the job. The highest package is around 60 Lacs, and the lowest is 3.8 Lacs. Paid or unpaid, an internship is mandatory for everyone. Top Student get offer for SDE role from my college top company come for B.Tech students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has good infrastructure with high-speed Wi-Fi and is green and clean. The hostel is clean and the rooms are comfortable. Mess food is also good. Classrooms are fully air-conditioned, and every seat has 2 charging ports to charge a mobile laptop. We can say that the facilities are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Knowledge of the faculty is good. Sem exams are not so difficult. You can pass the exam easily. There are 2 exams happening during the semester. One is mid-semester and the other is end-of-semester. In the classroom, faculty are supportive, but some are not. If you get 40% makes you pass the exam.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is what you make out of it for some, they really enjoy the college life.

detailed_review.Placements: The college placements are average or above average since there are not many companies that come to the Ghaziabad area, so considering that the opportunities are on point. Faculty provides enough opportunities to the students, but it is up to you if you want to get placed or not.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is very strict with the timings, and the staff are really strict, so its a bit difficult to enjoy after classes. The rooms in hostels are not that big either, and also during rain, sometimes water comes into the hostels as well, so think accordingly for the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty depends, some faculty are really good and helpful, while some are not that great. It totally depends on your branch. The CSE branch has good faculty, along with it, but the CS branches faculty is really strict. They do not approve of medical, and overall, its not that great.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: Overall, it is a good college for education.

detailed_review.Placements: Overall, placements are very good. Currently, around 90% of students in the CSE (AI) department are placed. Top recruiting companies include Amazon, Microsoft, Razorpay, and TCS. The highest package is 60 LPA. The lowest is 1.2 LPA. The average is around 5 LPA. About 90% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are too good. All facilities, such as smart boards, full air conditioning, laptop charging ports, and a well-structured layout. The library is a bit small in size but very beautiful. The hostel is also good, with clean rooms and excellent mess facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very good on our campus who understand students well. They are highly educated, and their teaching quality is excellent. They focus on preparing us to be industry-ready. Semester exams are easy to moderate, and you need to score more than 30% to pass.
detailed_review.Other: Campus is too short and area is okay.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science
reviews.review_title: Good placements and supportive faculty with great facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in my college are quite good. Many top companies like Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, and HCL visit every year. The average package is around 4 LPA–5 LPA, and the highest package goes above 10 LPA. Almost 70%–80% of students from my branch got placed. Internships are also provided by the college through industry tie-ups, which help students gain real experience.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of my college is very good. Classrooms are clean and well-maintained with smart boards and projectors. The library has many books, journals, and online resources. Labs are well-equipped with updated machines and software. Wi-Fi is available across the campus. The hostel is neat, safe, and has good facilities like 24/7 electricity, clean mess food, sports grounds, and medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified, supportive, and knowledgeable. They explain concepts clearly and are always ready to help students. The curriculum is updated as per industry requirements and includes practical knowledge. Exams are conducted fairly, and internal assessments help students prepare better. The passing percentage is also good, as teachers guide students well.
detailed_review.Other: My overall experience was good. The best part about my college was the supportive faculty, proper labs, and good placement opportunities. Hostel life was also safe and enjoyable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: Good placement opportunities, supportive faculty, and memorable campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, around 70%–80% of students got placed, with both service-based and product-based companies participating in campus placements. Some of the top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Capgemini, Cognizant, and a few startups offering domain-specific roles. The highest package went up to around 10 LPA, the lowest is about 3.5 LPA, and the average hovered between 4.5 LPA and 5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for my course is fairly good. The classrooms are spacious and equipped with projectors, the computer labs have high-speed internet and updated systems, and the library has a good collection of academic as well as reference books. Wi-Fi facilities are available across the campus and in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are knowledgeable, approachable, and supportive in both academics and projects. They guided us well during internships and placement preparation. The curriculum was updated and industry-oriented, including programming, project work, and electives aligned with new technologies, which helped in making students industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: Considering the facilities, exposure, and placements, the course is worth the investment. The return on investment (ROI) is decent, as most students can secure jobs through campus placements or internships. The college also provided scholarships and fee waivers for meritorious students, making it affordable for many.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: KIET provides excellent infrastructure and supportive faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at KIET Group of Institutions are considered good compared to many other private colleges in NCR. In my course B.Tech CSE Artificial Intelligence 80 percent to 85 percent of students from the batch got placed through campus drive. The highest package offered in our course is 30 LPA to 40 LPA and the average package offered is 5 LPA to 6LPA. The lowest package usually ranges around 3 LPA. It is a good start for freshers entering the IT industry.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure at KIET Group of Institutions is well-developed and supportive of academic learning. My department CSE Artificial Intelligence has fully equipped computer labs with high speed internet and updated software required for coding machine learning and data analysis. The classrooms are spacious with projectors and smart boards for interactive teaching. The campus is WiFi enabled and the library is well stocked with technical books journals and access to online resources like IEEE and NPTEL. The environment is studentfriendly and provides a good balance of traditional learning and modern technology.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty of the CSE Artificial Intelligence department at KIET Group of Institutions is highly qualified and supportive. Most professors hold advanced degrees and are well-versed in their subject. They are approachable and willing to clear doubts both inside and outside the classroom. The teaching quality is good with a mix of theoretical concepts and practical applications. Many faculty members also guide students in research projects, coding competitions, and publishing papers, which adds to the overall learning experience.
detailed_review.Other: I am currently pursuing B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering with a specialisation in Artificial Intelligence, batch 2024 to 2028 at KIET Group of Institutions, Ghaziabad. I chose this course because of my deep interest in programming, problem-solving, and the growing opportunities in AI and Data Science. The course provides both strong fundamentals of computer Science and advanced topics like Machine Learning, Deep Learning, and Data Analytics, which make it highly future-oriented.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence)
reviews.review_title: Good placements and strong infrastructure with supportive faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the B.Tech CSE batch of 2025. Placements in our course are overall quite good compared to many other private colleges in UP. Around 85%-90% of students in my batch got placed. The highest package is about 48 LPA (off-campus by Microsoft), while on-campus, the highest is around 13 LPA. The average package stays between 4.5 LPA and 6 LPA, and the lowest is around 3 LPA. Top recruiters include TCS, Wipro, Infosys, Capgemini, Cognizant, Accenture, Tech Mahindra, and a few product-based companies like Adobe and IBM. Around 70% of students also managed internships through college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of KIET is one of its strongest points. Labs are well-equipped with modern systems, proper Wi-Fi, and the required software for coding and electronics projects. Classrooms are clean, spacious, and have smart boards. Library is huge, with both technical and general books, along with digital access. Hostel facilities are good compared to other colleges in NCR. Rooms are decent in size, Wi-Fi is available, and common rooms have a TV and indoor games. Mess food is average but hygienic, and you also get a variety from the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified. Most of them have PhDs or M.Tech from reputed universities. They are approachable and genuinely help students both academically and in project guidance. Teaching quality is good, though a few faculty members still follow old-school methods. The curriculum is updated as per AKTU guidelines and also includes industry-oriented add-on courses, which make students more employable. Semester exams are moderately difficult, but if you study regularly, it's easy to clear.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE (AI) because of my interest in coding and future scope in the IT field. The best thing about this course is the placement support and industry exposure. It could be improved if more core product-based companies come for placements. Overall, KIET gives a balanced mixture of academics, activities, and career opportunities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Pretty satisfied with what the college provides.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 75% of the students in CSE got placed this year, with highest package being 24 LPA, average being 6.06 LPA, and lowest being unplaced. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Wipro, and Infosys. A considerable number of students got internships at TCS and Accenture.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are top-class, with a little bit of improvement required. Classrooms are modern with great air conditioning and smart boards. Labs are okay as well. Central library here is a very good spot to learn and practice in peace, where you can get all the fantastic books as well. I'm currently in my second year, and my hostel is pretty good. AC in my room works brilliantly, and lighting is great as well. Food in mess is delicious as it changes every day according to the mess schedule.
detailed_review.Faculty: As I took admission last year, I'm from the autonomous batch. And man, they have taken the level of curriculum to new heights. Teachers are fantastic and helpful. They are well qualified and well behaved (some of them should work on it, though). Curriculum can't be more relevant. It's exactly what's needed today. Semester exams are of average difficulty, with the pass percentage being around 87-88%.
detailed_review.Other: The main reason for choosing this course was my interest in Computer Science and AI, etc. Things that the course can do better are to provide a more relaxing schedule for the students, as it can become hectic sometimes.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: KIET Group of Institutions offers a great balance of academics, infrastructure, and campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good for CSE and CS allied branches, and approximately 80-85% of students are placed. The average package for the CS allied branch is between 5 and 7 LPA, while the highest is 60 LPA. However, mostly students are recruited from companies like TCS, Wipro, and Capgemini. Placement training sessions, mock interviews, and coding workshops help students prepare well. However, core branches like ECE or mechanical have slightly fewer high-paying opportunities. Overall, with proper preparation and skill-building, KIET provides strong placement support and good exposure to industry trends.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good. The campus is Wi-Fi enabled with good connectivity in classrooms, labs, and the library. The computer labs are fully updated with modern systems, and the classrooms have projectors for smart learning. The central library is large, with a wide range of books, journals, and digital resources that help with projects and research. The hostel facilities are good, with clean and well-maintained rooms, 24/7 electricity and water supply, and basic amenities. The medical facilities on campus include a small health center with a doctor available during college hours and tie-ups with nearby hospitals for emergencies.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at KIET Group of Institutions are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They provide clear explanations and support for projects, internships, and placements. The curriculum is relevant and regularly updated, with workshops and training that help students become industry-ready. Teaching quality is good, using both traditional methods and smart classrooms. Semester exams are moderately difficult but manageable with consistent study. Overall, KIET provides a strong academic environment with good exposure to industry practices, making it a great place for growth and learning.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the CSE batch of 2028 at KIET Group of Institutions. I chose this course because of my interest in programming and the growing demand for tech jobs. The best part of the course is the practical exposure through coding labs, workshops, and hackathons. However, I wish the internship support and advanced project guidance were improved. The campus is lively with annual fests, cultural events, and technical competitions. The crowd is energetic and collaborative. Connectivity to the college is good, and scholarships are available for meritorious students. Extracurricular activities make campus life fun and engaging.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Pharmacy (B.Pharma.)
reviews.review_title: It is best for pharmacy student.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement percentage in the KIET School of Pharmacy is 75%-90%. The highest package is 7 LPA - 8 LPA. Average package is 5 LPA, and the lowest package is 3 LPA. Placement companies are Sun Pharma, Mankind, Dr. Reddy's, Cipla, etc. Internship companies depend on our choice.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has the best infrastructure in my college. It provides free Wi-Fi connection in all required areas. Canteen is good. Labs are not good, but it has digital board and 2-3 ACs. There are 2 cameras in every classroom. Sitting furniture is very good in every classroom. Hostel is average, and mess food is average. Sports and games score is very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Mostly all teachers are helpful, highly qualified with better knowledge in our department. Teaching quality is very good. Curriculum makes the students industry-ready. Exam passing percentage is 50% in every subject (same in internal examination and external examination).
detailed_review.Other: I had no interest in this course but my father forced me to take admission in a pharmacy course. But it is a better decision for my life because in the future. I will be able to give my best for the people of my country as a pharmacist or even in a higher post.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: I think college is good and has good infrastructure. One should join it.

detailed_review.Placements: KIET College has a good placement record. Nearly 80% students got placed, and the highest package was 60 LPA, and the average package was 6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS, Infosys, etc. 50% students got internships in many roles like web development, data analysis, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are very good in our college. It has a decent infrastructure, all classrooms have air-conditioners and a digital board. Labs and libraries are good, and it is open from 8am to 2pm for students. Hostel facilities are very good, and the mess is excellent. Many sports and festivals are organised by our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are very helpful and qualified from IITs and NITs, DTU. Their knowledge is very good, and they are very helpful, but some are not. In our college, many new courses are introduced that are very relevant for placements and internships. Our college is autonomous, so it organizes exams very well, and exams are tough. Pass percentage is 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen this course because I have an interest in AI and how machines are trained and how the model works, like ChatGPT, DeepSeek, etc. I think they are providing very good information about the subjects. Many events like Epoque, Rann, etc., are organised by our college and the UP scholarship scheme for the students who got admission through the AKTU counseling.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: College has good infrastructure, supportive faculty, and strong placements with active campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 91-94% is the placement rate in the engineering courses. The highest package is around 48.89 LPA according to multiple reports (BoostMyTalent, Collegedekho), some sources also mentioned as 60 LPA, but it seems specific or less confirmed. The average package is between 5.1-6.5 LPA (official sources suggest 5.11 LPA), some review data and AKTU notes suggest up to 6.12 LPA. The lowest/minimum package is reported around 4 LPA for MBA/PGDM courses in one MBA-specific breakdown.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My department has AC classrooms, projectors, Wi-Fi, and well-equipped computer labs with updated software. The library offers a vast books, journals, and e-resources. Hostels are clean, with 24/7 electricity, Wi-Fi, and water coolers. The mess food is hygienic, though the taste may vary, canteens serve affordable snacks. An on-campus medical room and tie-ups with hospitals ensure quick care. Sports facilities include cricket, basketball, badminton, a gym, and indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are qualified, experienced, and approachable, with good knowledge of their subjects. Teaching quality is effective, using practical examples and modern tools. The curriculum is updated as per industry needs, with coding, projects, and internships helping students become job-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult, focusing on both concepts and application. With regular study and class attendance, most students pass easily, and the pass percentage is generally high.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B.Tech CSE because of my interest in coding and emerging technologies. The best things about this course are industry-oriented labs, supportive faculty and strong placement opportunities. I wish there were more real world projects and internship assistance. The campus hosts vibrant events like Epoque and technical fests with active clubs for coding, sports and culture. The crowd is friendly and diverse. The college is well connected by road and metro with safe surroundings. Scholarships are available for merit and need based students. Extracurricular activities, hackathons and sports events keep the campus life engaging and balanced.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Comprehensive learning and campus experience.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2024, approximately 78% of students are placed from KIET Group of Institutions, Ghaziabad, with 341+ companies participating. The average package is around 5.4 LPA, and the highest package is up to 87 LPA. Major recruiters included Amazon, Deloitte, Microsoft, TCS, and Accenture.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: KIET offers modern labs and classrooms, a well-equipped library, research centers, and sports facilities. Hostels are Wi-Fi-enabled with AC and non-AC rooms, a mess, 24/7 security, and recreational facilities for a comfortable stay. So, the total infrastructure of KIET is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty includes experienced professors and industry experts. The curriculum blends theory with practical projects. Exams follow a semester system with continuous assessment, and labs and projects are used for skill development. This is all good.
detailed_review.Other: Everything is good.

college_info.college_name: KIET Ghaziabad Course Admissions 2026: Fees, Eligibility, Dates & Selection Process

admission.title: KIET Ghaziabad Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text: KIET Ghaziabad admission is open. The University offers admission to candidates based on their entrance exam or qualifying exam scores. KIET Ghaziabad offers courses at UG, PG and diploma levels in Engineering, Management, Computer Applications, Pharmacy and other streams. The university offers courses in affiliation with Dr APJ Abdul Kalam Technical University (Lucknow) . Aspirants can apply online for the preferred course.

faqs.question: Are admissions open at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: KIET Ghaziabad admissions are open currently. Aspirants are offered admission based on their merit or entrance exam scores. The university accepts CUET, CUET-PG, JEE Main, GPAT scores for some courses. Candidates can apply online for the preferred programme.

faqs.question: Is entrance exam required for admission at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: KIET Ghaziabad considers entrance exam courses for MBA, BTech, M.Tech and MPharm. The university accepts JEE Main/ CUET for BTech, CAT/ MAT/ XAT/ CMAT/ GMAT for MBA. GPAT and GATE/ CUET-PG scores are accepted for admission to MPharm and M.Tech programmes, respectively.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for DPharm at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have completed Class 12 or equivalent in 2025 or appearing in 2026 with a minimum of 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ ST) in PCB/ PCM can apply for DPharm programme at KIET Ghaziabad.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for MPharm at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: Aspirants who have passed BPharm degree with at least 60% aggregate (55% aggregate for SC/ ST) can apply for MPharm at KIET Ghaziabad. Candidates must have documents proving their eligibility for admission in MPharm course.

faqs.question: What is the admission process of KIET, Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: KIET Ghaziabad admission process begins with applications. Aspirants have to apply online for the preferred course. The university selects candidates for admission based on their qualifying exam or entrance-test scores. The university accepts scores in JEE Main, CUET-UG, CUET-PG, GPAT, etc. Once selected, aspirants have to confirm their admission by paying the course fees.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: KIET Ghaziabad offers admission to candidates based on their merit or entrance exam scores. The university accepts entrance exam scores for courses such as BTech, MTech, MBA, MPharm, etc. Candidates can also get admission based on their qualifying exam scores in few programmes. Selected aspirants have to confirm their seat by paying the course fees after of all the rounds are done.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for BTech at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: Candidates must have passed Class 12 with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics or equivalent to apply for BTech at KIET Ghaziabad. Aspirants must have documents proving their eligibility for admission. Candidates must have scores in JEE Main or CUET.

faqs.question: Is JEE Main compulsory for admission to BTech at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: KIET Ghaziabad accepts JEE Main score for admission to BTech programme. However, it is not compulsory. Aspirants can also get admission in BTech based on their CUET scores. Aspirants must also complete Class 12 with PCM stream for admission in BTech.

faqs.question: Is the KIET Ghaziabad BTech fees refundable?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates can receive refunds for the BTech fees at KIET Ghaziabad if they withdraw from the course. The institute follows a five-tier fee refund system as per the UGC. Candidates can learn more about the refund policies followed by KIET Ghaziabad by reading the UGN Notificated dated 27-October 2025.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for MBA at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have passed graduation degree in any discipline with at least 60% aggregate (55% for reserved categories) or CGPA score can apply for MBA at KIET Ghaziabad. Aspirants must also have a valid score in any of the entrance exams such as CAT, MAT, XAT, etc. for admission.

faqs.question: What is the fees for MBA at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fees for MBA at KIET Ghaziabad is INR 3.60 lakh . Candidates also need to pay INR 8,500 per annum as exam fee. Aspirants also have to pay a refundable caution money of INR 5,000 for MBA programme.

faqs.question: What is the admission fees for KIET Ghaziabad MBA course?
faqs.answer: The KIET Ghaziabad MBA admission fees is currently unknown. Usually, the admission fees for the MBA course is a small portion of the first instalment of tuition fees. The first instalment of tuition fees for MBA at KIET Ghaziabad is INR 1.8 lakh. In addition to this small amount, candidates are also required to pay the caution deposit of INR 8,000.

faqs.question: Does KIET Ghaziabad charge all fees related to MBA course on per annum basis?
faqs.answer: No, the KIET Ghaziabad charges only the tuition and hostel fees on per annum basis. In addition to these fee components, candidates are also required to pay other fees which are examination fees and caution deposit. The caution deposit is only paid once before the commencement of the MBA course which the examination fee is charged on per semester basis.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for M.Tech at KIET?
faqs.answer: All the candidates seeking admission to M.Tech at KIET, Ghaziabad are required to appear in GATE or CUET-PG. Aspirants must also complete BE/ BTech or equivalent degree in Computer Science & Engineering/ Information Technology or MSc (Computer Science/ Information Technology) or MCA from a recognised institution wih at least 60% aggregate (55% aggregate for SC/ ST) for admission in MTech programme.

faqs.question: Is M.Tech available at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: KIET Group of Institutions offers a two-year M.Tech programme in CSE. Admission to MTech is based on GATE or CUET-PG scores of the candidates. Those who have completed BE/ BTech or equivalent degree in Computer Science & Engineering/ Information Technology or MSc (Computer Science/ Information Technology) or MCA from a recognised institution wih at least 60% aggregate (55% aggregate for SC/ ST) can apply for MTech.

faqs.question: How can I apply at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: The mode of application is online. Candidates can apply for the preferred course on the university's website. Check below the steps to follow:

faqs.question: What is the application fees at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: Candidates have to pay an application fees to fill out the form at KIET Ghaziabad. Aspirants have to pay INR 500 to apply. Candidates can pay the application fees via any of the online payment modes.

faqs.question: Does KIET Ghaziabad offers need-based scholarship?
faqs.answer: KIET Ghaziabad provides need-based scholarships to meritorious students from EWS category. Below are the details for the need-based scholarship: Economically Weaker Section ( EWS )

faqs.question: What is the criteria for DPharm scholarship at KIET Ghaziabad?
faqs.answer: KIET Ghaziabad offers merit-based scholarship to DPharm students. The scholarship is offered to Class 12 board exam toppers or merit holders with more than or equal to 70% in PCB or PCM. A waiver of 10% is offered in the tuition fee in the first year under this scholarship.

data.title: KIET University Placement Report 2025
summary: KIET University has achieved remarkable success in campus placements over the past years. KIET University recorded a placement rate of 87.40% during the 2025 placement drive . A total of 2,226 offers were made to the students and in all 1,606 students secured placements in the 2025 placement drive at KIET University. When compared with last year the number of students placed has been increased from 1,404 students to 1,606 . The highest package recorded during KIET University placements 2025 was INR 60 LPA which has remained consistent since last year. However, the average package has increased from INR 5.39 LPA to INR 5.44 LPA.

placement_faqs.question: What is the tuition fees for MBA course at KIET Ghaziabad?
placement_faqs.answer: The tuition fees for the MBA course at KIET Ghaziabad is INR 3.6 lakh. The aforementioned tuition fees is charged on per annum basis with each instalment costing INR 1.8 lakh. The first instalment of tuition fee is paid alognside the caution deposit at the beginning of the MBA curriculum. Their are two instalments for the MBA tuition fee. The second instalment is charged in the 3rd semester. The fees for other components can be found on the official website of KIET Ghaziabad.

placement_faqs.question: What is the fees for MBA at KIET Ghaziabad?
placement_faqs.answer: The total tuition fees for MBA at KIET Ghaziabad is INR 3.60 lakh . Candidates also need to pay INR 8,500 per annum as exam fee. Aspirants also have to pay a refundable caution money of INR 5,000 for MBA programme.

college_info.college_name: KIET Ghaziabad Photos & Videos

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: KIET is endowed with a Central Library that is connected with eight departmental libraries. It has about 1.74 lac books on Engineering, Sciences, Humanities, Management and Pharmacy with more than 10700 titles. The Library has subscribed to more than 136 Periodicals. The library also has AKTU E-Consortium (E-Books, E-Journals) for faculty members and students. The library is fully air conditioned and has a separate multimedia section with internet connectivity for accessing e-journals & other sites of user’s interest. It is fully automated with Library Management System software under KOHA. The Library, at KIET, is an exclusive member of DELNET, IETE, IEI, ISTE, AIMA, CII, QCFI, ASSOCHAM etc. The library has a separate facility of Book-Bank with more than 1.10 lac books. The book bank issues the course books to the students for the entire semester. The institute is a proud member of NDL (National Digital Library), an initiative taken by the Ministry of Education. The database of NDL is easily accessible to the faculty, staff and students.

facilities.name: Cafeteria
facilities.description: A fully air conditioned double floored Cafeteria, with comfortable, ergonomic furniture with a capacity for around two hundred and fifty foodies is an essential part of KIET. Hygienic and lip smacking vegetarian Indian (both North and South Indian), Chinese and Continental food is available at a nominal price for the students. Around six refreshment outlets like Heroes, Amul, Big bite, Cafe coffee day, Coke, and other Cafes are stationed inside the campus and open almost round the clock to cater to the needs of students studying late at night and very early in the morning as well.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 1566 published reviews , 1432 reviews are verified.

college_info.college_name: KLE Technological University, Hubli: Courses, Admission 2025, Fees, Placements, Rankings

highlights.summary:
Karnatak Lingayat Education Technological University (KLETU) which was formerly known as BV Bhoomaraddi College of Engineering and Technology (BVBCET). BVBCET was initiated as a college in 1947, and in 2015, became KLE Technological University after receiving the status of a State Private University. KLE Technology University Hubli is a part of the VTU, Belagavi and has also got accreditation by the National Board of Accreditation (NBA). AICTE recognises the university.
KLE Technological University Hubli has also signed several national and international MOU with institutes and organisations. KLE Technology University Course design provides undergraduate, postgraduate, research and PhD courses in different fields of study. It provides BArch, BBA and BCA and UG level and MTech, MBA and MCA at the Post-graduate. The BTech programme admissions rely on the valid scores in COMEDK UGET/ KCET, admission to MBA programme is through KMAT score, and admission to the other courses is through the qualification performance of the candidate in the earlier exam. BTech/ BE and MBA programme of the KLE Technology University would cost a student an average of INR 1.9 lakh to INR 10 lakh annually.
According to the NIRF 2024 ranking, the institute is ranked among the 150-200 in the ‘Overall’ category. The highest package offered during KLE Technological University placements in the recent past stood at INR 44 LPA. The institute facilitates its students with a library, auditorium, seminar or conference halls, guest houses, internet & Wi-Fi, hostels, and canteen, among others. The major highlights of the Karnatak Lingayat Education Technological University (KLETU) are tabulated below:
- Ranked 4th- Top Emerging BBA Institutes by Times Ranking Survey 2025
- Ranked 6th- Top BBA Institutes- Placement by Times Ranking Survey 2025
- 150-200 by NIRF 2024 for Engineering
