NIT Manipur Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A developing NIT in the northeast region.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements were quite decent in our college. The placements for CSE and ECE were good, like 100% placements are done. The average package is 7.2 LPA, and the highest package is like 42 LPA. Many companies like Amazon and Genpact were hiring our college students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is not that impressive as compared to other colleges. The college management was trying to develop the college; make sure to adjust for the infrastructure and the food in the hostel. Wi-Fi will be provided in the campus and the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty in our college are the best part of our college. They were all Ph.D. holders and also shared their great knowledge with us. They were super supportive. They make us gain knowledge in subjects deeply. You should get a minimum of 40 percent of marks for passing in a subject.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It’s a beautiful college in the North East.

detailed_review.Placements:
The placements scenarios at my college is quite decent. The year before the last, one of my seniors got into Amazon and a bunch of others got more than 20 LPA as their CTC.
The placements for CSE and ECE branch are almost 100%, and for other branches combined, it is 70-75%. The internship opportunities are quite less here but you can apply individually.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is just ok, it requires a lot of development as it has suffered a lot in the rainy season. Other than that, the college provides each and every thing  required by the students in the classrooms as well in the labs. There are medical facilities available in the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers in my college are just amazing, they are all well qualified and share a great knowledge with the students. The course curriculum is up to date in my knowledge, and if you learn the subjects properly, it’ll definitely make you job ready. There are 8 semester exams held in total.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Finally, it is an average college in India. Except food everything will be fine.

detailed_review.Placements: 100 percent of students were placed in my course. The highest package offered in my course is 47 LPA, and the lowest and minimum packages offered in my course are 8 LPA. Infosys, Google, Microsoft, Apple, TCS, Teach Mahindra, etc. are top companies recruiting companies for my course. All the students get internships in my course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are very average facilities and infrastructure available for our department. We can get free wifi, good labs, ventilator classes, good classrooms, and a and a library in our department. There are many books in our department library. Those books are very useful for our recording department. Hostel facilities are not and not bad. The mess food is average quality. There will be canteen. Average medical facilities: an ambulance will be available for you. We have a very huge playground. We can play many games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, and they are very qualified and knowledgeable also. They can give us the best teaching quality. Our course department faculty are more supportive of us in our department. The semester exam difficulty will be above average. And the pass percent in the semester exam is 40 marks out of 100.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in this course. And now our department is also very good. We can do excellent labs and projects, and these are the best things about the delay course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college to choose but not the only option.

detailed_review.Placements: I was enrolled in the ECE branch; the placements in the branch are not up to the mark if you select core as your major; it's better for you to choose GATE and go for higher studies. The highest package is 47 LPA, and the average package was 9.8 LPA. Amazon, Genpact, and other companies are there.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure was not good. There is a lot more to develop. The classrooms are okay but not good to study in the rainy season. Accommodation in a hostel is the best, but the facilities are low but have good security. The quantity of food is good, but the quality should be increased.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching faculty was good and was always available to us. The semester exams were not tough but also easy; they were moderate. You need to get at least 40% of the marks in every subject to pass and should be regular in the classes because attendance is also included in your academics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Disappointed with the infrastructure, absence of clubs, fest and facilities being provided.

detailed_review.Placements: At NIT Manipur, almost 70-80% of the students get placed. The highest package in 2023 was 47 LPA which was given Amazon. In 2023, the average package was around 9.5 LPA. Companies like Discover and Edfora gave packages worth 27 LPA. Some mass recruiters like Intellipat, Tata Elxsi, Reliance Jio and L&T ECC also visited the campus recruiting a number of students with an average package of 7 to 8 LPA. The placements ratio is quite good here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not that good. It is below average. The campus is big but has not been utilized properly. Wi-Fi is provided in the hostel 24X7. Talking about the classrooms, it is not that great but still it’s decent. Projectors have been installed in all the classrooms. There is one library in the academics block where around 20-30 students can study at a time. Atmosphere is quite good and there are plenty of books available for our reference. Quality of food is again not that great but decent. Canteens are there in every hostel. For medical services, an ambulance is available for us 24x7. There is one very good playground where we can play all the sports we want. It is quite big and good.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are very helpful and well qualified. They are always ready to help us and solve our doubts. There are many teachers who have graduated from IITs. Their teaching is quite decent. The syllabus being taught is a little old (that is same in all the colleges). It won't make anyone completely industry ready but it might help a lot in the future. The semester exams are not that difficult. It is on the moderate to difficult side. Almost 80-85% students clear the exams without any backlogs.
detailed_review.Other: If you wish to participate in fests, cultural activities and clubs, this college is not for you. There are no clubs and there is no gym inside the college. Scholarships like NSP (National Scholarship Portals) are being provided by the central government.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Nice college for B.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: I am enrolled in the Computer Science and Engineering branch; the placement record of my branch is the highest, i.e., 100%; the average package is 10 LPA. A good number of students get internships in the 6th semester or in the 7th semester. Last year, the highest package was 47 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of my college is in very bad condition, with a very small number of buildings that are occupied. Also, the water is logged on campus in the rainy seasons. The food quality in the mess is not at all good. There is a Wi-Fi facility in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some of the faculty members are really good at our college. The curriculum is updated with new technologies. In each semester, there are at least 2 tests, one midterm and one endterm exam for each subject and at least 40 marks to pass out of the total.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Manipur offers good infrastructure and facilities to its students.

detailed_review.Placements: 40–50% of the students get successfully placed at our college. In this course, students are getting average placements at NIT Manipur. The average package offered at the college was between 4 and 9 LPAs. Many big IT firms, such as Accenture, Amazon, Flipkart, TCS, Infosys, Sprinkle, etc., visit our college for placements. Students were also getting internships at MIT Manipur.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Manipur has really good infrastructure for our course. Students were provided with all the necessary facilities at this college. Wi-Fi, labs, library, canteen, computer labs, hostel, sports and all other facilities were given to the students and properly managed by the college management. The food in the canteen and mess was good to eat at an affordable price.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty of the college was helpful, qualified and knowledgeable about our course. All the teachers were experienced in the teaching field. The course curriculum of the college was relevant and it makes the students industry-ready. Semester exams were not that hard to pass. Students were getting all the help and support from the teachers.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title:
Absolutely good for placements but if it's about college life
.

detailed_review.Placements:
It is an average NIT so, it has an placement. Talking about the percentage of students placed so according to 2023 placement report it has a 75 % 
Overall placement. Further, if about branch specific so it's 100% for CSE,  85% for ECE,  75% for ee and <60% for other branches. If we look at the average package it was 9 llpa while the highest is 47 LPA by Microsoft.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The worst thing about this college is lack of infrastructure. They have bare minimum infrastructure required. And trust not going to change in upcoming 5 years. They have temporary structure of tin shades and it cases lot of problems during rainy seasons.
detailed_review.Faculty: It is good and is the positive side of the college which is the reason for it being at 95 th position in NIRF ranking 2023. 65% of the professors are local and they speak Manipur, English  and broken Hindi. Anyways language is not going to be barrier.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good from the placement pov.

detailed_review.Placements:
About 90 percent of the students are placed in this year. 
And the IT sector has more opportunities; also, companies are coming for placement. The core sector have fewer opportunities than the other sectors and top recruiting companies are Amazon, Microsoft, Samsung, Wipro, etc.
The highest package is 42 LPA and the lowest is 4.2 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Generally, hostels are good but infrastructure are bad and library is open at a specific time and date Wi-Fi connections are good sometimes. The classrooms are not good for first-year students. Mess food is average; you have two options: vegetarian or non-vegetarian.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Teachers are good, helpful in any situation and well qualified from IITs and NITs.
Semester exams are average and the pass percentage is 33 in the first year. You have common subject for all branches and you have exam like unit test, midterms, endterms, viva, lab assignment, workshops, etc.
detailed_review.Other:
I chose this course because it has both opportunities and a core. 
Ougri is a famous event at this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement in 2022,2023.

detailed_review.Placements:
Placement percentage has improved in recent year significantly as in 2022 157 out of 167 student (more than 90%) were placed in many companies like Amazon, Microsoft and also many companies which took many students are Samsung, Capgemini, Infosys, New Zera, InfoEdge and there are 
.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
College infrastructure : for infrastructure I would like to say that if you are type that refers best infrastructure I would suggest you that infrastructure here is not so good but one thing that prevails over that is natural beauty of this place, here we don't have well-made road, grand building and many time we have to face some difficult but you are not affected by infrastructure you can consider this college for academic purpose
mess: mess food is average and recently when we tried it has improved a lot. In mess menu they provide all types of foods for people from all different regions. 6 out of 7 days optional nonveg is provided (includes chicken, egg and fish). Medical facilities: we have government hospital (RIMS) approximately 1 km from college so whenever one needs it we call ambulance. Sports: we have less gathering for official sports but we have a field for sports and other thing as many sport tools are provided by college student plays most of time unofficially and most people enjoys it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Academics: not all teachers are good with the subjects but we have many teachers who teaches good but we all know that after coming to college most people focus on their skill development rather than academics so it is a best college, and you have lot of free time as academic pressure is not that much and you can give your skill as much time as you want. Semester exams: the level of semester exam is not difficult, and many find it easy to score.
detailed_review.Other: Campus: out campus has its own natural beauty and with training and sunlight here it looks like one of the amazing places that I have ever seen, and every morning on can breath very fresh air directly coming from hills of Imphal.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Some things about NIT Manipur.

detailed_review.Placements: On campus 5-10% placements take place. I think one or two companies usually recruit like L&T. The highest salary offered was 7 LPA, lowest was 3.5 LPA and average is 5 LPA. 18 students got internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are so many facilities like projector system for 3D view. Wi-fi is also good speed and labs are also the best because almost all the instruments and machinery are available here. Classrooms are also good and library is not comfortable because it is too small. Maximum 10-15 students can study at a time in the library with no air conditioning, but almost all the books are available. There are so many facilities. We have watercooler for cold water in summer. We have a canteen near our hostel but quality of food is not good. Only one or two days in a week food is good. Meals in the canteen are good. For medical facilities, we have an ambulance to reach hospitals. It is available 24*7 and for sports, we conduct Inter NIT Tournament.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Almost all the teachers are helpful and well educated like Ph.D. and M.Tech from IITs and NITs. All the teachers have good knowledge. 
Civil engineering is curriculum relevant because it teaches so many things to live a good life and do hard work. It makes students industry ready. Teachers make tough papers. Exam invigilator is very strict and passing marks are 33 marks out of 100.
detailed_review.Other:
I chose this course because I want to go into civil services so I thought it is the easy way reach my destination. All the teachers teach very well. 
We celebrate so many events like Manipur festival and all the Indian festivals. Campus crowd strength is 850 and Manipur's climate is so amazing with fresh wind and beautiful hills. No scholarship is provided in the college. There are no extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Manipur - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very good. Top recruiting companies are Microsoft, Amazon, etc. Almost 100% of students got placed in this course. The highest salary package offered was 47 LPA. The average salary package offered was 12 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides good education. Hostels are great. There are two boys' hostels and two girls' hostels on campus. In every hostel, you will get free facilities. They will guide you whenever you need help. You can also consult your teachers with your doubts.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very supportive and helpful. Semester exams are very good. Many workshops, laboratory work, etc., are conducted in this college. The passing percentage is 40%. The pass marks for internal exams are 20, and 30 marks for mid-semester.
detailed_review.Other: There is a huge playground in this college. You will get a beautiful view of nature from this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College with poor infrastructure but great placement records.

detailed_review.Placements: As per the current scenario, placements are considered the most important part of college life, so placements are quite decent at NIT Manipur. The CTC ranges between INR 5 and INR 55 (LPA) in the CSE branch, and the average CTC for the 2023 batch (CSE) is INR 12.5 (LPA). Top recruiting companies are Samsung, BEL Infoedge, PeopleStrong, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As the campus is temporary, NIT Manipur lags behind in infrastructure. The hostel for 3rd and 4th year students is decent, but for 1st and 2nd year B.Tech. students, it is in very poor condition. Mess food is average for all the hostels, and fast Wi-Fi is available in all the hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: I will not say that the faculty is extraordinary, but some of them are very knowledgeable and helpful, and some of them don't have a clue about themselves. Overall,  faculty members are helpful, which creates a positive atmosphere. Passing the semester is not a tough nut to crack, but it's tricky to score above an 8.5 CGPA.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Manipur is currently developing.

detailed_review.Placements: Here, generally each year CSE and ECE department placement goes 100% but other department having less percentage chance for placement. The highest placement is around 47 Lacs. Companies like LNT, Microsoft, and Amazon visits the campus. This NIT is continuously growing year by year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Here in 2 hostels- Hostel 1 and Hostel 2 -Wi-Fi service is available. But infrastructure like roads is very poor here. But leave the infrastructure let's concentrate on academics. Medical facility is available here 24/7. Here different clubs are available like coding club, dance club, song club, cricket club etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Here teacher have good level of knowledge and they are very helpful, since Manipur is also a local language here, teachers all over the india used to take the lecture in English   . One who is weak in English   and not able to speak English   frequently he will be able to speak in some time very frequently.
detailed_review.Other: I have choose ECE department since there is more opportunity in future for ECE. I know that coding is very important. So I do coding software developing and hardware development also.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is the best and has great value for money. It is an affordable college.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of students got placed in our course. The highest salary package offered for our course is 21 LPA. The average salary package offered is 7 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered is 5 LPA. The top recruiting company is Tata Motors. About 30% of students got internships from our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The quality of the food in our hostel is not above average. There are 3 canteens in our hostel, but they keep only some general snakes in their canteens. There are no medical facilities inside the campus. Our college provides a bus and an ambulance, which are ready to take patients immediately to a nearby hospital. Sports and games facilities are very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They qualified from top institutes like IITs and NITs. They are much knowledgeable. Their teaching style is average. Our course is relevant and makes students industry-ready. Semester exams are a little bit difficult.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because I like physics mechanics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I'm dissatisfied with our faculty and the teaching quality.

detailed_review.Placements: About 60% of the students were placed in our college placements. In the last 2 years, the highest salary package offered was 45 LPA, but only some students got this package. A few students got the lowest salary package of 6 LPA. Most of the students get an average salary package of above 10 LPA and below 15 LPA. One of the top companies that came to visit our college for placements is Microsoft. Around 95% of the students got internships in the companies but not with much good package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure and facilities of our college are very bad and horrible. It is the worst when compared to other NIT colleges. There are no proper labs or a library available. The mess and canteen are also very horrible. We are not provided with any sports facilities or any clubs.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers of our college are not helpful. Some are qualified, but some are still pursuing their degree. The teaching quality is bad. This course is very useful if we study it properly and conceptually. This course prepares students for industry. But it won't be possible just through the teacher's effort. We should also have to put in our efforts.
detailed_review.Other: This course has much more scope within industry and companies. The best part about this course is that it includes coding. Nothing is done in our college because till now I haven't visited our college. The scholarships offered by the college are good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It provides very good placements, good infrastructure, and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good this year. The highest salary package offered is 45 LPA by Microsoft. The top recruiting companies are Amazon, Samsung, Wipro, Tata, Infosys, and many more. The average salary package offered is 8 LPA. Approximately 90% of students are placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is good to some extent. All the useful and available for all branches. Hostel rooms are average. Need to adjust their food. The surroundings are very good, and the weather is good. It is a pleasant place where students can complete their engineering peacefully.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, experienced, and teach well. They all are highly qualified. They help students in the preparation for competitive exams like Prestigious, GATE, and many more. They take care of every student and help with their projects and all.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has good faculty members and a pleasant atmosphere.

detailed_review.Placements: Software developer at Microsoft is the top role offered. This year 2022, 136 students out of 150 students are placed. The highest salary package offered is 45 LPA, the average salary package offered is 8.9 LPA, and the median salary package offered is 7.15 LPA. Top companies are Microsoft, Intuit, Samsung, and Information Edge. From the 2022 batch, approximately 30% of students got internships. Approximately, above 90% of students got placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is not that so good. The rest are good. Food is almost similar to northeastern. Canteen food is awesome. The atmosphere around the college is pleasant and peaceful. A mini hospital is also available. They cure almost all problems.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our college, all the teachers are highly qualified and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is also good. Semester exams are moderate. If we study a little hard, we can pass the exams but the exams will held very strictly. The punishments are also severe if any malpractice is noticed by the invigilator.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The campus is very good and it provides all the basic facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60-70% of students are placed in IT companies, and it has the best courses that provide. Almost 80% of students get internships from this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has more infrastructure and it provides all the facilities to the students. All the students are maintaining minimum and all the infrastructure development the quality of the facilities in our hostel is good. The quality of food available in the mess and canteen is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: In this college, faculty members are the best. They properly taught the class, and the exams are more depth questions. The curriculum activities are more interested, and it has more depth questions for the student to improve their knowledge and make the students' industry ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has good faculty members, good placements, and facilities that are normal.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80% of students are placed. The highest salary package is 42.5 LPA. The average package is 8.75 LPA. We get offers from top recruiting companies like Amazon, Microsoft, and Infosys. The lowest salary package is approximately3.8 LPA. The overall placements are good especially for CSE students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have a Wi-Fi connection in college, and we have good computer labs containing 120 computers. We also have a good library containing a minimum of 2 lakh books. When we come to the facilities of the hostel, they are not good. We should adjust to the climate since it's a hill area and low temperature. Grounds for cricket, football, basketball, volleyball, etc., are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good with full knowledge. The majority of the teachers are graduates of the Indian Institute of Technology. The curriculum is more relevant to placements. We get good placement knowledge. Semester exams are hard because of the 30 marks for viva only.

college_info.college_name: NIT Manipur Admission 2025: Cutoff, Fees, Eligibility & Application

admission.title: NIT Manipur Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: NIT Manipur admissions are primarily entrance-based. BTech is the flagship course of NITM, admission to which is based on JEE Main rank followed by JoSAA Counselling . For other courses such as MTech and MSc, GATE and IIT JAM scores are considered for admission. NIT Manipur offers UG, PG and doctoral courses through 10 departments. Candidates are required to fill out the application form the respective exams followed by the institute form, if required.

faqs.question: Can I get admission at NIT Manipur without entrance exam?
faqs.answer: No, NIT Manipur offers admission to UG and PG courses based on entrance exam scores. Aspirants seeking admission in BTech must have a valid JEE Main score. The institute offers admission to GATE and IIT JAM scores in M.Tech and MSc programmes, respectively. Besides, GATE, UGC-NET, CSIR NET scores are accepted for PhD courses followed by a PI round. Hence, admission is not possible at NIT Manipur without entrance exam scores.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in NIT Manipur?
faqs.answer: Getting admission in NIT Manipur requires candidates to qualify specified entrance exams. Candidates wishing to get admission in BTech need to pass JEE Main followed by JoSAA Counselling. The select left vacant after completion of the JoSAA Counselling are filled by CSAB Counselling . For other courses such as M.Tech and MSc, selection is based on GATE and IIT JAM score, respectively. The cutoff for BTech, M.Tech and MSc courses is released by the respective counselling bodies. Whereas, for PhD admission, the institute releases merit lists based on the entrance exam score.

faqs.question: Which courses are offered by NIT Manipur?
faqs.answer: The modes of National Institute of Technology, Manipur course admissions are offline and online. Admission to various undergraduate and postgraduate courses is based on merit and scores and entrance examination. At the undergraduate level, NIT Manipur offers four-year BTech programmes to students. At the postgraduate level, National Institute of Technology, Manipur offers two-year M.Tech and several other programmes to students. The NIT Manipur campus offers BTech in five specialisations.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for M.Tech at NIT Manipur?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to pass Bachelor's degree in relevant subjects with at least 60% aggregate or equivalent (55% aggregate for SC/ ST/ PwD) to apply for NIT Manipur M.Tech course. NIT Manipur offers a full-time M.Tech programme of two years. Students are shortlisted based on academic qualification and entrance exam scores. NIT Manipur M.Tech is offered in various specialisations such as Computer Science Engineering , VLSI Design and Embedded Systems , etc.

faqs.question: Who can apply for BTech at NIT Manipur?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to appear for JEE Main to get admission in NIT Manipur BTech. Hence, aspirants need to fulfil the eligibility criteria set for JEE Main to apply for BTech course. Below is detailed eligibility for NIT Manipur BTech:

faqs.question: Who is eligible for NIT Manipur admission?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to complete a minimum of Class 12 for UG courses. Graduation is required to apply for PG programmes. Below is NIT Manipur course-wise eligibility: Non-IIT JAM: Bachelor's degree in relevant subjects with at least 60% aggregate or equivalent (55% aggregate for SC/ ST/ PwD) With IIT JAM: BSc in relevant discipline with at 60% aggregate or 6.5 CGPA (55% aggregate or 6.0 CGPA for SC/ ST)

faqs.question: What is the cost of studying at NIT Manipur?
faqs.answer: The cost of studying at NIT Manipur is determined by the total fee paid for a course. faqs.question: What is the closing rank for NIT Manipur?
faqs.answer: The closing rank for NIT Manipur BTech, MTech and MSc courses is released by the respective counselling bodies. For BTech, JoSAA releases closing rank for every category of candidates. Looking at the past three-year trend of JEE Main cutoff , BTech CSE was found to have the most competitive closing rank in 2024. In 2023, the rank for CSE was 26719 which declined to 30611 in 2024. NIT Manipur Cutoff 2024 was concluded after Round 6 for admission to MTech courses. Talking about the last three years' GATE cutoff, NIT Manipur cutoff for MTech in Computer Science Engineering closed at 357 in 2024 while in 2023 it closed at 351 and in 2022 at 350 . So, Analysing the past year's trends, the above-mentioned course is the most popular course at NIT Manipur because of its competitive ranks over the years as compared to other specialisations. IIT JAM rank is considered for NIT Manipur MSc. Looking at the past year cutoff data, MSc Mathematics came out as the competitive specialisation with 2042 rank in 2024 and 2338 in 2023.

faqs.question: Is NIT Manipur good for CSE?
faqs.answer: Yes, NIT Manipur is one of the best colleges in Eastern India for the BTech CSE branch. Looking at the past year cutoff, Computer Science Engineering is also the most competitive and popular specialisation of NIT Manipur. Talking about placements, the highest package offered during NIT Manipur placements 2023 stood at INR 47 LPA . Further, a total of 37 companies visited the campus and 147 offers were made during NIT Manipur placements 2023.

faqs.answer: NIT Manipur admission to BTech is based on JEE Main score. Candidates are selected through their past academic scores and rank obtained in JEE Main exam. After the commencement of all the selection rounds, candidates have to register for JoSAA Counselling process . The final seat allotment is done through JoSAA Counselling process. Further, if seats remain unfilled, then the vacant seats are filled with CSAB Counselling. After seat allotment, aspirants are required to further apply at the official website of the institute.

faqs.answer: At the undergraduate level, the National Institute of Technology, Manipur offers BTech programmes to various students. The eligibility criteria to apply for the BTech programme is Class 12 with a minimum of 75 percent aggregate and the accepted entrance examination is JEE Main. It is difficult to predict beforehand based on past trends as the cut-off changes every year. The variance in past and present year cut-offs comes due to the changes in the availability of seats, the number of students applying for admission, and various other criteria set by the college year on year. For more information on this, please visit the official website of the college.

faqs.question: How can I get seat in NIT Manipur MTech?
faqs.answer: Candidates need to pass GATE to get a seat in NIT Manipur M.Tech programme. NITM offers seats under Sponsored and Self-Sponsored Category. After qualifying GATE , candidates are required to come for CCMT Counselling. GATE cutoffs are released online, aspirants with score equal or above cutoff, become eligible for CCMT Counselling. Shortlisted candidates need to register for CCMT Counselling to become eligible for seat allotment. Selected aspirants are required to confirm their seat by paying the course fee.

faqs.question: How much GATE score is required for NIT Manipur M.Tech admission?
faqs.answer: GATE CCMT R1 has been released for admission to the M.Tech courses. Candidates seeking admission to the NIT Manipur MTech course must secure a rank between 350 and 357 under the first cutoff list for the General category students. highlights.summary:
The National Institute of Technology Sikkim is an autonomous institute, and was established in 2010. It has been ranked in the band of 151-200 under the 'Engineering' category by NIRF 2025. NIT Sikkim is recognised by the UGC and approved by AICTE. The institute provide UG, PG, and diploma courses across Engineering and Science streams. BTech and MTech are the popular courses offered at the institute.
NIT Sikkim has collaborated with institutes like IIT Hyderabad, IIT Bhilai, IIT Delhi, and others. The college accepts entrance exams like JEE Main, GATE, and IIT JAM/IAT, etc. Students have to appear for counselling process after qualifying entrance exams. NIT Sikkim cutoff is usually the most competitive for the Computer Science and Engineering branch. The highest package offered during NIT Sikkim placement 2025 was INR 44 LPA. Below are the major highlights of the National Institute of Technology Sikkim:
JEE Main, GATE, UGC NET, UGC CSIR, IIT JAM, IAT
NIT Sikkim PhD official brochure

NIT Sikkim Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Chemistry
reviews.review_title: The faculty teaching system is good and understanding.

detailed_review.Placements: The college offers a good number of placement opportunities for postgraduate and undergraduate students. Students become eligible for their placements from the fifth semester (undergraduate) and the third semester (postgraduate). The average package is around 6 LPA per annum, and the highest package received was 10 LPA. Companies that visit for placements are Cipla, Microsoft, Unacademy, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is very well-maintained. The hostel room is fully furnished and properly ventilated. The wardens are very friendly. The hostel's mess food quality is very good and is cooked in a clean environment. The college staff is well-trained, and hostel discipline is very well maintained. The hostel has a common room with an LCD TV. The hostel also provides 24-hour water and power supply.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is designed in such a way that it helps students to understand all the basic concepts along with higher-level information. The syllabus includes the topics that are important for competitive exams such as CSIR NET JRF, GATE, etc. Along with theoretical knowledge, emphasis is also given to real-world practical application through projects, dissertations, internships, etc. The exams are conducted frequently, which helps to keep our brains active. The exams are not very difficult, but they are good enough to make us think practically and critically.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Chemistry
reviews.review_title: Climate of Ravangla, Sikkim, is very pleasant.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year, the placement cell provides various job opportunities to students by welcoming various companies and industries for the recruitment of deserving students. The average annual package ranges from 2.5-4 Lacs per year. However, in case you don't wanna get into the job you can pursue higher studies in the foreign countries as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As NIT Sikkim is still operating from a temporary campus, hostel facilities are not as per the other NITs. Students are forced to live in 5-bedded sharing rooms, where 5 tables,  5 chairs,  5 almirahs, and 5 beds are provided for each student, but it becomes very tough to follow the individual routine. Mess food quality is poor, and the only reason institute states is that Ravangala is a very remote location.
detailed_review.Faculty: For me, it seems okay. But the question that comes in exams is mostly moderate to difficult. Teaching methods sometimes need to change because they need to understand that all students are not same and to bring them on one page, they need to change their teaching style. The whole semester contains only exam, exam, and exam.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: National institute of technology Sikkim.

detailed_review.Placements: There are very good placements and internship opportunities at the college, especially compared to the past 4 years. Over 70% of students are placed through campus recruiting, and there are many campus recruitment drives.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good, but compared to other college campuses, it is very small. However, for this region, having this many resources is very good. The campus is beautiful, with a view of Mount Kanchenjunga.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very good. They are interactive and friendly with students. Many faculty members guide students in every situation and are approachable. There are also faculty members with whom students can share their personal problems.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Sikkim Review on different aspects

detailed_review.Placements: If you are capable enough, you'll be getting decent placements. Overall statistics fall about 80% every year with an average package of 9-10 LPA, including 90-95% for CSE, ECE, and 80-85% for core branches like EEE, ME, CE. Some major recruiters are CDAC, CDOT, BEL, NVIDIA, L&T, VEDANTA, GENPACT, DELOITTE, IBM, SLB, HCLTech, and many others as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Operating from its temporary campus at a very remote location of Ravangla, it has seen some advancements in the recent financial year, but the thing that will be problematic is sharing with 5-bedded rooms, so it will be very much tough for you to follow your own routine or studies. But excluding this hostel facility, the rest of the facilities are okay, type. Classrooms are well equipped with smart boards, and labs are also well equipped.
detailed_review.Faculty: Will say it's really hectic. The curriculum for BTECH is to do all the things including theory, practical, viva, mid-term, and end-term exams and projects in the final year as well. Almost 5-6 hours of daily classes and 2 mid-term exams will be there with one end-term. But this is more or less the same in all other IITs and NITs as well. So you can't complain about it.
detailed_review.Other: Enjoy being at one of the most beautiful places in India, surrounded by a serene view of Mt. Kanchenjunga and forests as well. So much peace and zero percent of chaos around you in terms of vehicles or construction. So enjoy your four years being at NIT Sikkim and learn lots of life lessons as well here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the placements of this college.

detailed_review.Placements: 80 percent of the students in mechanical engineering department got placement; the highest package was 17 LPA and the lowest package was 5.6 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Mahindra, Bajaj, Maruti, TVS, Deloitte, etc. About 100 percent of students get internships, and 60% are paid internships, and in placement, most of the roles offered are GET.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Sikkim has a temporary campus but the facilities and infrastructure are good. 24*7 wi-fi and electricity are there and all types of labs are present. Most of the labs are open at night as well, so you can work at night as well. The quality of food is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified and knowledgeable. They are very supportive and always guide you in your future. The way of teaching is very simple and friendly and the course curriculum is very updated so that students get ready for industry. There is no significant marking .
detailed_review.Other: Mechanical engineering is the evergreen branch that will never disappoint you. With a lot of industry exposure, mechanical engineering always relies on you to do engineering.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: College Experience in NIT Sikkim.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements were different for different years. Like for this year in recession our college had a good placement record. Some of the top recruiters in our college are Infineon, Nvidia, Deloitte, etc. Our college always has 100% internships for the year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are available in abundance irrespective of the fact that our college currently has a temporary campus. The instruments and machines are available for every department. The quality of facilities is also quite good. We have a sports committee for managing sports activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are all Ph.D. or post doc. So, all faculty are qualified, and their way of teaching is also quite good. The course curriculum is like for GATE. The course curriculum is such that there are heavy theoretical subjects and also interesting numerical-solving subjects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Completely satisfied with faculty and campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: Branches like CSE and ECE receive good placement offers, but if we consider the core branches of NIT Sikkim like Mechanical and Civil, the placement rate drops to 50-60%. The location and connectivity of NIT Sikkim also affect the placement rates. However, being in a core branch and supplementing it with some coding increases the chances of placement. In 2023, a student from EEE secured a 44 LPA offer from a software-based company. The overall placement percentage at NIT Sikkim stands at 84%, with a median of 8-9 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: When comparing the infrastructure of other NITs with NIT Sikkim, it's quite disappointing because NIT Sikkim currently operates from its temporary campus at Ravangla. Despite the temporary campus, it boasts a great location surrounded by mountains and lush greenery. Everything is available on campus except for the hostel for first-year students. Yes, first-year students have to stay outside the campus in Ravangla city. The college provides both bus services and hostels for first-year students. Additionally, Wi-Fi is available on campus but not at the first-year hostel. Enjoy.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty and staff at NIT Sikkim are supportive and helpful in nature. With the exception of 1-2 individuals, all teach well. If you're a good student, you won't encounter any issues with the teaching methodology. If you face challenges in any topic, faculty members also allow you to ask for personal assistance within the department.
detailed_review.Other: Overall, NIT Sikkim is good, although the crowd here is very limited. In our branch, there are only 22 students, and the total number of students in our batch is approximately 150. NIT Sikkim also organizes its annual cultural fest called "Udgam" and tech fest named "Abhiyantran." Moreover, various extracurricular activities happen here from time to time.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: We have good placement. Good companies are visiting like C-DAC, C-DOT, BEL,etc.

detailed_review.Placements: In my batch, more than 80% of students got placed. The highest package is INR 20 LPA. And most of them got placed in companies like L&T, RELIANCE, C-DAC, and C-DOT. I am from the EEE branch, and in my branch, all students got placed. Most students get internships in good companies, and many students get internships in PSUs like Power Grid, NHPC, etc. If I talk about my department, most of the students got roles as GETs in core companies. As we know, core companies don't offer good packages for freshers, only IT companies offer packages worth more than INR 10 LPA. But core companies are all good and offer roles of our choice.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Here, facilities are not as per our expectations as NITs should have. There are lots of restrictions on Wi-Fi. We can't watch many YouTube videos. Here, the food quality is very low. Due to the remote area, other facilities are also not good. Teachers rarely motivate us for sports. And if students organise sports, then only we get a chance to play. And once a week, we celebrate Sports Day.
detailed_review.Faculty: Due to our remote area, we don't have much faculty, and we are having problems getting good knowledge. One teacher has to teach many other subjects. And in some branches, it is very difficult to cross the 8 CGPA mark. We almost have all of the tools we need for practical purposes. Just because we don't have a permanent campus right now, we are having all labs in a small area.
detailed_review.Other: This year, 2023, our college has fest and we called a singer and comedian from outside. We hardly get the chance to have such fest here. After a long time, we celebrated such fest.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a good and beautiful college.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate of this year is above 80%. Top recruiting companies are Western Digital, Autodesk, Deloitte, etc. Our college provides 100% internships. Students got internships in good companies like BHEL, IOCL, etc. All students got placed in our college. Placements are good in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides average facilities. We have a good Wi-Fi connection. The power supply is not good. Power cuts frequently on campus. The hostel is not much good. The food served in the mess is not much good. Around five students can share each hostel room.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. The quality of the teaching is above average. The course curriculum is good. The pass percentage is a bit less. All teachers are very supportive.
detailed_review.Other: Our college conducts an annual fest named Udgam and a cultural fest named Abhiyantaram. It organises technical fests.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: You will not be satisfied by campus life but it's okay because you get good placement here.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately all students who are eligible for placement get placed in any company. Some high end companies take students at 20+ LPA and mass recruiter companies give 5-8 LPA and average placement is approximately 8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Nokia / Nvidia etc. Internship percentage is 100% and top roles are like hardware engineer and as intern in Powergrid etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: National Institute of Technology Sikkim doesn't have its permanent campus till yet. So, we are only having 1 cricket ground which frequently use as a football ground / Physical training ground / multipurpose ground. Hostels are good but don't have fan and quality of food in mess is awful.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some faculty members are too strict but most of the faculty members are helping, some are USA return too. Course curriculum for EEE is not relevant because combining both electrical and electronics it became too huge syllabus to cover so we just need to study, attend class or to do assignment all the times. Even semester exams are not that much hard but neither on easier side. Pass percentage is 75% to get eligible for placement.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was interested in robotics and I'm moving forward towards my goal. Events and fests used to happen throughout the year so be chill and participate in all extracurricular activities it helps to heal up your bad day.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Chemistry
reviews.review_title: Improvements are needed.

detailed_review.Placements: 100% students get internship in IIT Kanpur, IIT Bombay and Indian Institute of Chemical, etc. 5 students are doing jobs at Syngene, Byjus and Sunpharma, and the rest are preparing for PhDs. 30k per month was the average salary.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available in the whole campus. Labs are bad in terms of instruments and infrastructure, however it is expected as it is a place in the high mountains of South Sikkim. Hostel in the campus is good and its food is average. Medical facilities are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Semester exams are not too difficult, however during the pandemic, it was difficult to study via online mode. 100% is the pass percentage. The internships have helped us to gain practical knowledge for working in the industry. The course curriculum is standard NET and GATE based, however some parts are somewhat irrelevant.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college lacks opportunities and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: On average, students got a salary package of 4 LPA. College, being in a remote location, not many companies come for campus hiring. Top recruiting companies include Intel, Bharat petroleum, and Power Grid. The highest salary package offered was 18 LPA and the minimum salary package offered was 3.5 LPA. Students were mostly sent to IITs for internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is located in a very remote location. The climate is always cold and rainy. Only a limited number of classrooms are available in our college. Not much scope for sports and games. Badminton, table tennis, football, and cricket are often played. Library has limited number of books. So students need to share it.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college doesn't have much-qualified faculty members. Mostly, teachers preferred PPT. Course curriculum is some what relevant but mostly, it is useless. Semester exams are based on what was taught in class and can be cleared with basic preparations. Students should score at least 40%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, placements are amazing here.

detailed_review.Placements: In terms of placements, NIT Sikkim is also good as compared to newly established NITs. In 2020, overall, the placement rate was nearly 50%-60% in mechanical branches. The major recruiter here is L&T, and the salary package offered is around 5 LPA to 10 LPA. About 100% of students did internships in 2020.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are good facilities in our hostel, and 24x7 high-speed Wi-Fi is available. There is a good library and also very good labs and classrooms. In NIT Sikkim, classrooms are also amazing. The hostel is very good, and the quality of food served is awesome. I am also a mess in charge here. Medical facilities are a little bit and not good because of a hill area. There are many indoor games and sports facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: In NIT Sikkim, teachers are very helpful and clear all doubts in the classroom. They are highly qualified and knowledgeable. This course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. There is a very tough exam pattern in every semester. In one semester, there are three exams. Approximately 100% of students pass every semester.
detailed_review.Other: Our college provides better placements and enough knowledge to become a good engineer. I just wish that we would get permanent campus placement. Our college conducts regular events. Students who are not financially great will get scholarships. There are some extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Everything is good in this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year 25-32 students pursue this course and around 44-55% of students are placed every year from the mechanical branch. This percentage is increasing every year, and the highest salary package offered is 10 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 5 LPA. College provides 100% of internships to all students, and L&T is the top recruiting company. The roles offered are automotive engineer and construction engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are available like gym, playground, library, and Wi-Fi also and currently it is operated under temporary campus but the permanent campus is under construction and will be completed within 3-4 years. The food quality is good, students will get 5 days non-vegetarian here, and there is an ambulance van on the campus for any emergency.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members are Ph.D. holders from top colleges, and they are experts in their teaching careers. All course curriculum is set like top IITs and students will get knowledge as most industries are required these days and students have to study properly to get good marks in the semester. The pass percentage is 35%.
detailed_review.Other: This college is situated at the best place and students will feel like heaven there, I wish students would get permanent campus as soon as possible. There is no crowd and every year government gives scholarships to those students who are not financially strong.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Sikkim - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm a second-year undergraduate student at NIT Sikkim. It's a newly established NIT in 2009, and it's still operating from its temporary campus at Ravangla South Sikkim. Overall, the placement percentage is nearly about 70%, and almost 100% for branches like CSE and EEE. In core branches, it's less than 50%.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has all the resources available that an NIT should have, despite a newly established NIT. It has proposed a permanent campus in Khamdong East Sikkim. It will take at least 3-4 years to get shifted to its permanent campus. There is good Wi-Fi on campus. It has good classrooms and library.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are well-qualified and knowledgeable. NIT Sikkim also has a super computer named Param Kanchenjunga at campus, and the campus progressed a lot in the past 5 years (2016-2021). The professors are very good and cooperative and knowledgeable. The institution is good for harnessing resources and country's human resource enhancement.
detailed_review.Other: It has technical and cultural fests like Avantran and many more. It has all the national and state-level scholarships available. The college is surrounded by the great Kanchenjunga.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placements are improving every year here.

detailed_review.Placements: We are getting good internship opportunities. Our seniors get good placement opportunities through the training and placement cell in our college. The training and placement cell helps us to get placement opportunities and internship opportunities. The highest salary package offered is 23 LPA for our seniors.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for our course is good. The hostel is not so up to the mark as it is a temporary campus, and they are constructing a permanent campus, and it might be completed by 2023 as per the latest news. I hope there will be a good hostel and food facilities on the permanent campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are excellent in teaching and support us every day. As it is online, they are teaching us very slowly to make us understand well and suggesting us doing some other courses for the placements.
detailed_review.Other: All the clubs in the college are also run by the students with the help of faculty members.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Sikkim - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a second-year B.Tech student of NIT Sikkim, and I have completed my first year at NIT Sikkim with good marks. Now I am in the 4th semester, and my studies are going well. It is a newly established NIT, and it is going on in its temporary campus at Ravangla. So, placements are fewer, but it is good in all newly established NIT. In 2020 overall placement percentage is nearly 70%. Placements are almost 100% for branches like CSE, ECE and EEE. Now for branches like civil and mechanical engineering, it is slightly less which is the same in all colleges. Nearly 10 out of 30 students got placed from these core branches. It is day by day increasing because now in our college, the labs' facility is becoming very good. In the coming days, it will surely become 70% to 80%. Our college provides internships to all students in core as well as tech companies like L&T Construction, L&T Infotech, IBM, Microsoft, Intel, TCS, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Despite a temporary campus, NIT Sikkim still provides all academics and research facilities on the campus. Library, digital classrooms, laboratories, workshop, lecture hall, multi-purpose hall, gyms, hostels and many other facilities are available, which is much required for academic and research activities. NIT Sikkim also has a supercomputer named PARAM Kanchenjunga at the campus, and the campus progressed a lot in the past 5 years, i.e., 2016 to 2021.
detailed_review.Faculty: Due to coronavirus, all institutes are going for online classes. Teachers in our first semester are not able to teach us well because they are teaching for the first time. We are the first batch to study online classes, so the understanding between students and teachers is not good in the first semester. As time passed, our faculty members worked hard, and they cleared all doubts. We can call our sir or madam for any query. They provide us with notes, books, PDFs and also important video lectures so that we can understand every concept. In our college, 2 types of exams are taken. The first exam consists of 2 exams that are mid-term exams in which 10 marks are for the written exam, and 10 marks are for the viva exam. Viva exam is taken with video opened. Type-2 exams are the last exams that are written. About 25 marks are provided for assignments, and 10 makes are for reports.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in electrical engineering, but my JEE Main rank is less, so I was not able to take that branch. However, now our mechanical branch is also good. In this AutoCAD, solid work, etc., are very interesting topics. You also can change your branch if you get 8 to 8.5 CGPA in the first year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Sikkim - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good in our college. There is a well-managed placement cell also available in our college to guide students in the placements. Many companies like Infosys, Intel, and Amazon visit our campus for placements. Students also get internships in their core branches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a temporary campus due to a hilly area. Big and well-furnished classrooms are available. Free and fast Wi-Fi facilities are also available. A Big library is provided on the campus. We have well-managed labs with all the essential instruments. Hostel facilities are also good with a hygienic mess. The quality of food served is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well experienced and knowledgeable. They are very supportive even in the online class. They provide essential materials for the revision. The course curriculum is updated and designed according to the modern era. Practical knowledge is also a priority of college with theoretical knowledge. Semester exams are moderate.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Sikkim - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: NIT placements are good and most of the students get placed every year. Around 80-90% of the student get placed in companies like Intel, BEL Power Grid visit every year. So overall placements for CS students is good but there are limited company visits for core branch student.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is not good because NIT Sikkim is newly established among NITs. It is basically on temporary campus so has limited source due to hilly area, but overall it is good. Hostel takes good care of students, so the infrastructure is good and the hostel is also good but the mess is not good, there is always a problem in the food quality.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are educated and well-qualified. Their teaching skills are also good, but some teachers are less experienced. We have a good exam curriculum, and it includes 2 mid semesters each of 15 marks, an end-term exam of 50 marks, and the rest 20 marks are for internal assessment of the student. The pass percentage is 40%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is located in the laps of Himalayas.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in NIT Sikkim are average. About 85-90% of the student get placed. For CSE students, the placements are good because many companies visit NIT Sikkim especially for them. But in the core branch, there is some problem with placements. Only 5-6 students get placements but in the overall branch, about 80-85% of the students get placed in top companies like Intel, Microsoft, Powergrid, BEL, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NIT Sikkim is located on a temporary campus so there is some limitation in the facilities. But overall it is good in all aspects. There is a sports playground, library and auditorium, so it provides all basics types of facilities. Hostel of NIT Sikkim is good, and it provides all types of basic needs of students but the mess quality of food is irritating.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members here are good and they are very much helpful. All the teachers are well-educated and qualified but less experienced. But their efforts make no sense. The course curriculum is good and the same for all branches. there are 2 mid-term exams and one-end semester exams.  You need 40 marks in each subject to pass.
detailed_review.Other: Our seniors are very much helpful, and they provide all types of support in financial as well in academics. A lot more activities are held in NIT Sikkim to enjoy it. Overall it is a very lovable place.

admission.title: NIT Sikkim Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: National Institute of Technology Sikkim admission 2025 is entrance-based . The institute offers various programmes at UG, PG, and doctoral levels. Admission is based on the national-level entrance exam followed by counselling. Students are accepted based on JEE Main scores and JoSAA counselling for admission to BTech. Further, MSc and MTech admission is conducted via CCMN and CCMT counselling, respectively. NIT Sikkim conducts the IAT ( Institute Admission Test ) for admission to the MTech vacant seats after the completion of the course-wise counselling process.

faqs.question: What is the admission procedure of NIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: NIT Sikkim admission procedure 2025 for all the courses is different. Candidates have to apply via various national level entrance exam and central counselling to get admission into the institute. Find below NIT Sikkim admission process 2025:

faqs.question: Does NIT Sikkim offer direct admission to various courses?
faqs.answer: NIT Sikkim does not offer direct admissions for any of its courses. Admission are purely entrance based followed by counselling process for seat allocations. Admission to the BTech and MTech programmes are based on scores in JEE Main and GATE respectively. For NIT Sikkim MSc admission , students have to clear IIT JAM and register for CCMN counselling. Similar to these UG and PG courses, PhD admission at NIT Sikkim is also entrance and interview-based.

faqs.question: Is BTech free in NIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: No, BTech programme isn't free at NIT Sikkim. Candidates seeking to get admission are required to pay the tuition fee which ranges between INR 5 Lacs - 5.3 lakh, the fees excludes of Eamination Fee of Semester Registration Fee,  Library Fee,  Laboratory Fee, Internet Fee, etc. However NIT Sikkim does have scholarship schemes for students. Students can visit the official website of NIT to apply for the scholarship. Refer to the NIT Sikkim Scholarship page for more details

faqs.question: Can I get into NIT Sikkim with 73 percentile?
faqs.answer: Yes, NIT Sikkim accepts a percentile between 70-80 in JEE Mains. Also the candidates must have aslo secure minimum 75% (65% for SC/ST/PWS) in class 12 exam. With all the eligibility and selection procedure cleared candidates are sure to secure seat in NIT Sikkim.

faqs.answer: NIT Sikkim MSc cutoff 2024 has been released across multiple specialisations. faqs.question: What is the cost of MSc at NIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: The total fee for the BTech programme at NIT Sikkim is INR 49,500. Total fee is calculated based on annual/ semester fee available for the academic year, hence is indicative. ST/SC & PH students are fully exempted from paying tuition fees, while the most economically backward students (whose family income is less than INR 1 Lacs per annum) are granted full remission of the tuition fee. Other economically backward students, whose family income falls between INR 1 Lacs to 5 Lacs per annum, are granted a remission of 2/3rd of the tuition fee.

faqs.question: Which is the best course offered at NIT Sikkim?

faqs.question: What will happen if someone misses the internal exam in National Institute of Technology Sikkim?
faqs.answer: If someone misses the internal exams in NIT Sikkim, there are chances of consideration if the reasons are genuine just like health issues, severe health conditions, death of someone in the house. It will be considered if you talk to your head of the department and your faculty advisory with the prime consent of dean academics.There are no such issues, but if you fails to show or satisfy your faculty and HOD then you will not be considered for re-exam and declared as back. So beware of this things and try to attend all the examination. Miss the examination in severe cases which are unavoidable else try to attempt and attend all the examinations properly.

faqs.question: What is the application process of NIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: NIT Sikkim application process varies from course to course. The application process of BTech, MTech, and MSc is done via the official website of their respective entrance exams JEE Main, GATE, and Jam, followed by applying for the counselling bodies of JoSAA (BTech), CCMT (MTech), and CCMN (MSc). As for the PhD programme, candidates must apply via the NIT Sikkim official website by filling the online appplication form available online. Additionally, the institution conducts IAT (Institute Admission Test) for admission to the MTech/MSc vacant seats after the completion of the course-wise counseling process. faqs.question: What will happen if someone misses the internal exam in National Institute of Technology Sikkim?
faqs.answer: If someone misses the internal exams in NIT Sikkim, there are chances of consideration if the reasons are genuine just like health issues, severe health conditions, death of someone in the house. It will be considered if you talk to your head of the department and your faculty advisory with the prime consent of dean academics.There are no such issues, but if you fails to show or satisfy your faculty and HOD then you will not be considered for re-exam and declared as back. So beware of this things and try to attend all the examination. Miss the examination in severe cases which are unavoidable else try to attempt and attend all the examinations properly. faqs.question: Is BTech free in NIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: No, BTech programme isn't free at NIT Sikkim. faqs.question: What is the total tuition fee of the BTech programme at NIT Sikkim?
faqs.answer: The total fee for the BTech programme at NIT Sikkim is INR 5 lakh, Total fee is calculated based on annual/ semester fee available for the academic year, hence is indicative. ST/SC & PH students are fully exempted from paying tuition fees, while the most economically backward students (whose family income is less than Rs.1.00 Lacs per annum) are granted full remission of the tuition fee. sections.heading: Introduction
text: National Institute of Technology Sikkim provides various facilities to the students. Some of the facilities include a library, lab, sports, hostels, etc.
Check out more on NIT Sikkim Infrastructure in the below video:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description:
TheKnowledge and Information Centre(KIC) is situated in the midst of all departments and hostels and is easily accessible to all/everyone in the campus. It has text books, reference books, encyclopaedias, dictionaries, Videos, CDs/DVDs, Journals/Magazines, Local and National newspapers, e-books, Bibliographic and full text databases, NPTEL videos, E-book reader.
Library is fully automated with Automation Software (LIBSYS 7). Circulation Services are executed through Barcode System. Science Direct, IEL, Sci-Finder, Encyclopaedia Britannica, Pearson E-books (Selected title), Kindle e-book reader and DELNET access are available.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: There are 3 (three) separate hostels for girl students and 9 (nine) hostels for boys students in the institute. There is a central mess facility large enough to accommodate 250 – 300 students at a time.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 51 published reviews , 48 reviews are verified.

college_info.college_name: NIT Uttarakhand (NIT UK): Cutoff, Placement, Fees, Courses, Admission 2025, Ranking

highlights.summary:
The National Institute of Technology Uttarakhand was established in 2009. It is a public university. The university is an 'Institute of National Importance'. It is ranked between 150 and 200 under the ‘Engineering’ category by the NIRF 20245 Rankings.
NIT Uttarakhand courses include numerous undergraduate and postgraduate level courses. It imparts education in major faculties of Engineering, Sciences, and Humanities, among others. The university boasts PhD level programmes under the same streams. The university also offers their flagship BTech and MTech programmes in various specialisations such as CSE, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, etc.
The National Institute of Technology Uttarakhand, has collaborated with many institutes in the country and beyond signing MoUs to deepen collaboration.
The key highlights of NIT Uttarakhand are listed in the table below:
Check below the student review on NIT Uttarakhand:

college_info_program.intro:
NIT Uttarakhand provides a wide range of courses like UG, PG, and doctoral levels through its 9 departments, including The Department of Civil Engineering, the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, and others
At the UG level, NITUK offers BTech programs in five branches: Civil Engineering, CSE, ECE, Electrical & Electronics Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering.
The BTech program given by NITUK is well known due to its promising career prospects. NITUK accepts JEE Main scores for admission to its BTech programme. Among the various specialisations offered in the BTech programme, Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) is the most preferred specialisation among the students as it helps them to build a strong understanding of fundamentals in computational, logical and analytical skills. The NITUK curriculum also ensures that students develop good communication, teamwork and management skills for leadership and entrepreneurship. The excellent placement record of the BTech CSE programme also makes it popular among students. The top recruiters for the course include Adobe India, Algo Sec, Samsung SRI Noida, and Atlassian, among others.
Below mentioned are some of the courses offered by NIT Uttarakhand and their respective eligibility and fees:
