NIT Uttarakhand Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Dissatisfied by the infrastructure, Cse have good placement, but campus life is poor.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements here at NIT Uttarakhand are quite good for CSE and ECE. Even the highest package recently was received by an ECE student. The overall package is 18-20 LPA for CSE companies. Companies like Accenture and Cognizant visit the campus. Also, NVIDIA and Intel , companies like Microsoft and Google, are rare, but overall placement is good for CSE and ECE. Other branches have a low placement rate.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no permanent campus of this college. Yes, there is one main building which has a mess boys hostel and classrooms which we call lecture halls. There is no AC , even the library is not maintained properly. There is no sports facility here. Even the school grounds are bigger. The canteen is not available and the Wi-Fi is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are well qualified, and some of them are helpful, but they burden you with a lot of assignments, tests, and the semester exams can be difficult based on your studies. The curriculum is totally irrelevant here cse student don't have any course related to cs in the first semester, so most of the things you have to do by yourself.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college because of the CSE branch; otherwise, a private college would be better than this college. The festivals here are like school functions; faculty interferes too much in events; even budget approval is a big thing here .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you love mountains, valleys and spritual temples you should take it.

detailed_review.Placements:
In Electronics and Communication its around 70-80% get placed who were eligible. Highest package is 25lakh this and overall its around 40-50lakh. Top recruiting companies are Google, amazon, Accenture, Optym, Global Foundries, Samsung E&A, Samsung R&D, BEL, etc.
Associate Knowledge person, Semiconductor Engineer, Software Engineer SDE-1
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wifi and lan connectivity is very fast around (10-40Mb/s). Labs are good enough and equipped with latest machinery, devices and latest version software for RTL design ,TCAD and Cadence. Latest computers with high speed processors. Classrooms are small but equipped with AC, fans and Projectors. Hostels are modern design newly build with 24/7 high speed lan, hot water and modern almiras. Each room have separate balcony. Mess food is average not that good. Medicals facility is fair. Games are average. There is only one canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty:
The teachers are very friendly in nature. Faculties are minimum top IIT post graduate most are from IIT Roorkee. Teaching quality is above standards. Projects are given by almost every faculty in each year. Students are made industry ready like for VLSI some additional post graduate courses are personally tough in lab sessions according to the student interests.
The semester exams are difficult but according teachers taught at that level also.
Passing percent is recently changed it is minimum 45marks should be there for each subject from 100.
detailed_review.Other: Semiconductor is future of India and there will be a job boom in this engineering branch. Electronics in Nit Uttarakhand from my side is better than any other branch if you want to get in core company and higher studies. This year Cliffesto announced its fest will be organized every but after Corona this year it is heading. Sarman Foundation will be there from 2nd year students whose family income is less than 1lakh and who fell into top 10 of the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Pros and cons of taking admission in NIT Uttarakhand.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 50 percent of students were placed each year. The highest package is 24 lakhs per annum and the lowest package is 10 lakhs per annum. Samsung, BEL. I don't know much about the internship statistics. Right now, I am in the 2nd year, 3rd semester. I also don't know about the roles offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our department is very good; all things are available. There is Wi-Fi availability. The infrastructure of our college is not so good because we are living in a temporary campus and our permanent campus is still under construction. Mess food is average. There is no canteen inside the college. Medical facilities are good and sports and games are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are top-notch in my department; all have done their PhDs from IITs. All are very knowledgeable and their teaching style is very good. They are preparing us for the GATE level test. The course curriculum is also very relevant. The semester exams are a bit difficult because each month there will be an exam and in mid-semester, we need to give 2 to 3 papers in a day. Except for 5 to 6 students, no one passes.
detailed_review.Other: When I cleared JEE and after my Jossa counseling, I got Electronics and Communication Engineering. At first, I wanted CSE, but after knowing this branch and its future outcome, I loved this course. My interest started developing in this field. The best thing is real-world applications like making circuits on the breadboard and making circuits on the FPGA board with the help of Verilog. Events are happening from time to time, but fests are not happening at a good level. It's not a crowded place, but that is the benefit of this college. This campus is situated in Uttarakhand, so the surroundings are very beautiful. Extracurricular activities also happen from time to time.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College doesn't have its own infrastructure, but it has good academics and bad mess food.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a CSE student, and almost 90% of the students got placements. The average package in CSE is 12-13 lakhs per annum, and the lowest average package is somewhere around 8 lakhs per annum. I don't know which companies the students are placed in, but companies quite often visit the college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The faculties are good and younger in age. The infrastructure is under construction. Students are quite competitive. Wi-Fi, labs, and classrooms are quite good. The library isn't that good; it's very small. The canteen is also unsatisfactory and small in size, and nowadays, it's not in operation as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, knowledgeable, and qualified, and most importantly, they are very friendly. Every month, there are mid-term exams; in total, there are two mid-term exams and one final exam in one semester, along with lab evaluations. Semester exams are of mid to high levels.
detailed_review.Other: Infrastructure needs to be improved.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely dissatisfied with the college.

detailed_review.Placements:
Approx. 60 to 70 percent of students got placed last year in the civil engineering branch and this ratio is the same as for previous years also.
6 to 10 lakh per annum is the range of the package that is offered every year. 
Top recruiting companies are TCS and L&T.
There is a very low percentage of getting an internship in civil engineering.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Wi-Fi is available in each hostel and labs are small but overall well structured. The same is true for the classroom and there is no good library.
The quality of hostels is better, but food quality can be changed by some efforts. 
No canteen is there.
Medical facility is average.
Sports and games are very few.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Teachers are knowledgeable and perfect in their skills or subjects, so overall it is good.
Semester exams are good enough.
Passing percentage is 90 percent.
Overall, there is a good pattern of exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college infrastructure is not good, but professors are good and helpful.

detailed_review.Placements: Only a few students are placed. The highest package is 20 LPA, and the lowest is 60 K. Samsung, Infosys, Accenture, Microsoft, etc., are some of the recruiting companies. Till now, only one person got an internship, and that was in Accenture. Roles offered include data scientist, ethical hacking, software developer, AI, and ML, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not good; it is on lease, and only a small area is provided. Wi-Fi is in good condition, labs are also good, but the library is not that great, and classrooms are average. There is no canteen in our college, and the hostel is good, but the mess food is not good. Sports and games are available here.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our department, only three assistant professors are present; the rest are trainee teachers. Semester examinations are different and are not too hard to pass, but scoring a good CGPA is a little bit harder, with a passing percentage of about 96%. The courses are curriculum-related and prepare the students for the industry.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIT Uttarakhand review by Rohit.

detailed_review.Placements: Especially In mechanical engineering branch, almost 90% students get placed in different companies like TATA, Mahindra, etc. The overall placement at NIT UK is about 80%, which is good. But due to the location, most of the company does not want to come.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It is obvious we are NITians, and the facilities like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, libraries, etc. are there and they are good too but due to the temporary campus, which means sufficient space, these things get managed there. Space is less there but these get managed.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very helpful there. As we know, this is NIT, so their faculty members are well qualified and knowledgeable. They teach us in a very manner. Semester exams are difficult but if you go into the class, you will definitely get passing marks and your CGPA will also be better.
detailed_review.Other: I like designing and in mechanical engineering, I use AutoCAD, SolidWorks, etc. There are various application which help in designing. Connectivity is the problem there due to the location. The campus crowd is good. Events and festivals are the main part of engineering; without them, no one live their. There are enough extracurricular activities .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college review in my words.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college placement statistics show that on average, about 70 percent of students were placed every year, which was between 8 and 40 LPA. Companies like TCS, L&T, TATA, and many more top recruiters come every year. Our placement cell also gave internship opportunities to many companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college facilities and infrastructure are quite limited as compared to any other NIT because our campus is temporary; our permanent campus is under construction, but all the basic facilities are provided by the college, like medical, canteen, sports, hostel, and so on.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college faculty were too good; they are too cooperative with the students; they help their students a lot; they also motivate and try to teach students to grow in their lives. Every faculty member is like our parents in the college; they are available to guide us.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course via Jossa counselling by preference, but now I like it because in it we are able to solve real-life problems.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: My honest review for my juniors.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2023, 95% students were placed in mechanical engineering branch and in other branches, placements were also good, nearly 80-85%. But in 2024 placement in every branch was low. The highest package offered in mechanical branch is 18 LPA, and average package of the college is 7.5 LPA. Top recruiters visiting NIT Uttarakhand are LNT, Mahindra, Unacademy, and many other companies like some of the PSUs which hire based on factors other than GATE score also recruit students from NIT Uttarakhand. Internship programs are not good at all, and don't expect too much from college about internships do it on your own by applying to different companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The condition of the classrooms is not too good but every classroom has projectors and many of them have air conditioning. Labs are good and Wi-Fi speed is good but with LAN it gives high-speed. Students can issue books from library at any time for their respective semester and return them at the end of the semester. Quality of the mess food is not too good but it is okay. Games and sports are also played like football, cricket, volleyball, table tennis, and many more. Different tournaments are also held in the NIT Uttarakhand like Inter NIT, Intra NIT, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very helpful and experienced in their respective subjects. All professors have done their Ph.D. from IITs or any other reputed college. Courses are relevant for students who want to pursue jobs in their core branch. Exams are held in three phase mid-term 1 of 20 marks, mid-term 2 of 20 marks, end term examination of 40 marks and 20 marks for internal either class test or any project or assignment is given to the students.
detailed_review.Other: I love to learn about machines and how machines are invented, how heavy machinery is made, how they design such things, how they installed turbine in hydroelectric power plant, and many more. Practical knowledge is more relevant in mechanical engineering than theoretical knowledge, then practical knowledge should be more than theory. Recently, a tech fest is conducted in NIT Uttarakhand named Prodyogeeky'24. In this fest many competitions are there like done race, root fight, coding competition, dancing competition, sports competition of games like PUBG mobile and many more. Every year alumni meet is conducted for better alumni connectivity. Many clubs are there for the extracurricular activities like literary club, coding club, sports club, and few more. In first year students can get scholarships easily.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: GATE Specials NIT Uttarakhand.

detailed_review.Placements: NIT Uttarakhand has 70–80% students with a placement record. The lowest 3-4 LPA, Medium 7-10 LPA, Highest 25–30 LPA. LNT Company and Nokia, Tata, Wipro, Micromax, in my branch Civil Engineering. Many students are going on internships with 70 percent.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure with good quality tables, wardrobes, windows, chairs, but less maintenance. Good Wi-Fi connectivity, good lab infrastructure, and good classroom conditions. Bad quality food in college. Sometimes, a good and clean environment, good mess, and sports activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: There is a good teaching structure and well-qualified teachers who are very helpful and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is very good and skilled. This course of civil engineering is necessary for future development, as there is a need for well-designed industry and innovative types of infrastructure with highly skilled work for a better outcome.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the civil engineering branch because it offers opportunities in both private and government sectors. It is the oldest branch. There is good knowledge usage in this branch.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best College in Srinagar, Uttarakhand.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70 percent are placed every year. They teach at Mahindra, Tata Motors, and other companies. The average package is 3–4 Lacs. Almost 85 percent of students get an internship every year. Some big companies also come, but with slightly lower packages, ranging between 10-20 Lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The labs are decent. The classrooms resemble those of your school, not large lecture halls. There is also a library with a sufficient amount of books. The hostels are good, with three students per room. The canteen's food is average and does not remain open throughout the night. A pool table is available, and there is a gym with basic facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful. Yes, the course curriculum is relevant and prepares you for the industry. The difficulty of semester exams is moderate, with a pass percentage of 98 percent in almost every subject. The teachers are highly qualified with good teaching experience.
detailed_review.Other: Some events are occasionally organized, and many scholarships are available for the students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Most reviews are not good because of the campus, I agree, but other facilities are almost good.

detailed_review.Placements: I just consider our branch Electronics and Communication Engineering, so through on-campus placements, the colleges invite placements from various companies like TCS, and almost 25% of students get placed. The highest package ever is approximately 15 Lacs, the lowest is approximately 2 Lacs, and the average package received by students is 6 Lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and Infrastructure, like the classrooms, are basically in a temporary campus, but it is quite okay. There is a 24/7 Wi-Fi facility in the hostels, the libraries are open and easily accessible during the daytime. If you speak about the hostels, so the mess, the food is not good, the quality is very regarding. Even after frequent complaints by the students, there is an institute canteen available. Das Institute also has a dispensary, which is accessible 24/7. There is also a sports room and an equipment room, and students can usually take equipment.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are Ph.D. scholars from IITs and NITs, and they are highly qualified and eligible. Their teaching quality is also very good. The institute has a pretty fine semester academic calendar, which has all the specific events that have to be conducted in that particular semester. All the subjects taught prepare the students for future placement opportunities. The semester exams are conducted frequently, after a gap of 1 month, and the difficulty level is medium to almost difficult, and 93% of students pass the exams. Some appear for backlogs.
detailed_review.Other: So I chose this course just because I got it in the JoSAA Counselling; otherwise, I would have definitely chosen Computer Science and Engineering. However, I do like this course, as it provides knowledge about the various electronic equipment that is used in daily life. The Lab Assessments are also done properly. The extracurricular activities like sports and cultural activities are also performed in which students perform enthusiastically. Recently, a Techfest was organized in our college, which invited various other colleges from different states and in the USA for this opportunity. The college also provides opportunities like Intra-Nitis for different Sports and Games.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life at NIT Uttarakhand .

detailed_review.Placements: The placement and training cell at NIT Uttarakhand has done great work in the past years, helping students get better opportunities in their 3rd years by getting internships from various companies to kickstart their careers in the real world. The placement rate is quite good and the average package for CSE is 14 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The current NIT Uttarakhand is run on a temporary campus of the government Polytechnic College and one ITI campus at Srinagar, Uttarakhand. A permanent campus is under construction in a place known as Sumari, which is nearby Srinagar. Hostels are available for both boys and girls in the undergrad program. The facilities include bedrooms with 3 beds and tables, one social gathering area and a mess. The food is just eatable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Facility members are good; all have done their PHDs from IITs and other renowned institutes so they have good knowledge about their core subjects. The curriculum followed in college is old and 3 exams are held in each semester, which include two midterms and 1 end term.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good and Decent Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college were decent. 70% of the students were placed in the year 2023. Core branches also have quite good placements. The average package was around 8 lacs, and the highest package was around 18 lacs. Many students qualify for the GATE exam and get jobs in PSUs. Internship opportunities were also available.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is not good as the campus is temporary. Our temporary campus is also improving, and construction of our permanent campus is underway. Hostels were quite decent, only for boys. New hostels were also built after 1 year, but for girls, only old hostels are available. Mess food was pathetic.
detailed_review.Faculty: NIT Uttarakhand has one of the best curricula; it is the same as the other NITs in India. Faculty were well qualified; most professors were alumni of IITs and had 5–10 years of teaching experience. There are three exams in one semester: midterm 1, midterm 2, and end term.
detailed_review.Other: There are four clubs in NIT Uttarakhand. Cultural club, technical club, sports club, and literary club. Cultural clubs organize festivals for most of the festivals. The sports club was excellent; it provided all opportunities in every game.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: No campus life, many good places to travel nearby, only road connectivity, and good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80 percent of students were placed. The highest package was 21 lpa, and the average package was 11 lpa. The lowest package was around 5 lpa, probably more than that. The top recruiting companies were Google, Wipro, Adobe, Samsung, etc. Around 7-8 students got internships in our 2nd year batch. From the third year on, many students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very poor. Clogged washrooms; some rooms had leaking roofs during the rainy season. Wi-Fi facilities are good 24/7, the library is very small, the labs are average, and the and the classrooms are like school classrooms. Our coaching classes had better classrooms and projectors. The quality of food is not up to par. We found larvae in our food and also in our chairs. Medical facilities are also not good, and sports facilities are also not that good due to the small size of our campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified and knowledgeable; most of them are helpful but some of them behave rudely. The teaching quality of most of the teachers is good, except for some teachers. The course curriculum is mostly relevant but it doesn't make students industry-ready. Students have to make extra efforts if they want to get a good placement and I think everyone will agree with that. Semester exams are difficult, depending on the teacher who is teaching you. As a teacher, make the exams  themselves and also check them. So you have to make a good image of yourself in front of the teacher.
detailed_review.Other: Even though our campus is small and our student strength at our college is very low (around 720), our seniors still make great efforts to organize different events and also collaborate with different colleges to organize an event. Recently, we are having our prodygeeky tech fest, which includes things like robot wards, stalls, sports, photography, graffiti, done races, etc. Connectivity is not good as it is located 100km further into the hills from Rishikesh. It is only connected by road, although it will be connected by railway in the upcoming 3–4 years. Scholarships are also good if your parents income is less than 5 lpa; your 2/3rd tuition fee is waived, and if your parents income is less than 1 lpa, you have to pay no tuition fee. Other than this, you can also apply for different scholarships. Because of the small campus size, there is a limited selection of extracurricular activities available. Our campus is surrounded by hills and located in the Alaknanda River Valley. The surroundings are beautiful and filled with lush greenery.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I'm dissatisfied with facilities and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement percentage of our college is good. The highest salary package offered by Upstox for the EEE student in 2022 was 20 LPA. The average salary package is 10 LPA and the lowest salary package is 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies are L&T, Cogoport, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms and the library are not good. Labs are very good but not well-equipped. There is neither space nor equipment for sports and games. There are no medical facilities but an ambulance is available for medical conditions.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are helpful and knowledgeable. All of them are Ph.D. qualified. They teach students according to the curriculum. The course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are difficult. The pass percentage is good.
detailed_review.Other: Few events are held on campus but there is no special fest. The atmosphere and surroundings of our college are very good with mountains, rivers, and forests.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you want to enjoy your campus life, I would not recommend this college.

detailed_review.Placements: In our branch, a total of 10 students out of 20 have been placed at different companies. Most of them are placed in Gurugram-based companies. In our branch, the highest salary package offered is 18 LPA, the lowest is 14 LPA, and the average is 16 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Publicis Sapient, C-Dot, and Optym.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: New hostels are provided for us now. They are fine, but classrooms and labs are temporary. Food is fine. The food in the canteen is not good. Medical facilities are fine up to some extent. For sports and games, they even don't have their own playground. The playground that is available for sports is at GVT Polytechnic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are fine, but there is a lack of faculty members for our courses. The course curriculum is up to the mark and relevant. Semester exams are not so tough. The pass percentage is 25% to 50%, depending on our performance.
detailed_review.Other: Our course provides good placements in this institute, so I chose this course. The number of faculty members should be increased. All activities are conducted on a small scale.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you do not get other NITs for your rank then you can take admission to this college.

detailed_review.Placements: It is one of the 31 colleges in India. This college was established in 2010 by the Government of India under the NIT Act 2007. The average salary package offered was 8.4 LPA. The highest salary package offered was 33 LPA. The average salary package offered was 8.7 LPA. The maximum salary package offered was 39 LPA. The minimum salary package offered was 26 LPA. It is due to the downfall of the world's economy and other things.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It is a temporary campus located in Srinagar, Uttarakhand. But when you search in Google, it shows two locations one is in Srinagar, Uttarakhand and the other is in Sumari, Uttarakhand. Sumari campus is under construction, so the students go to Srinagar to study. Wi-Fi is available. Classrooms are well-maintained. There is a decent library. It is a small campus compared to other NITs.
detailed_review.Faculty: The course curriculum is good. Teachers are great. They are very knowledgeable in their respective subject. They conduct projects and assignments so that we can gather in-depth knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: It is a very good college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has the best teachers.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 85% of students got placed in our college. The average salary package offered 10 LPA. Top recruiting companies are L&T, Samsung, etc. Almost 60% of students got internships at many companies like Samsung, L&T, ZS, etc. The average stipend offered is Rs. 50,000 per month.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is average. Currently, our college operates from a temporary campus which is located in Srinagar Uttarakhand. The infrastructure of labs and classrooms is decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are well-qualified. Many teachers are from well-known institutes. They are always ready to help students with their subjects as well as in other institutional matters. Many teachers are well-versed in their area of study.
detailed_review.Other: Our college has a good environment.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is the best.

detailed_review.Placements: It is one of the most developing branches in our college. The average salary package offered ranges from 15 LPA to 30 LPA. Many programs are organised in our college for increasing salary package. Mostly government-funded companies visit our college for recruitment.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are very good in our college. Wi-Fi is available on our campus, and the speed ranges from 10 to 142 Mbps. Classrooms are very good. It also provides a decent library.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified, and all of them are young. The course curriculum is very good to make us ready for the industry.

college_info.college_name: NIT Uttarakhand Admission 2025: Courses, Cutoff, Fees, Eligibility, Application & Ranking

faqs.question: How to get a seat at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: To get a seat in the National Institute of Technology Uttarakhand undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD courses, candidates must visit the official website of respective national-level entrance exam conducting bodies to register themselves. Eligible candidates are then required to appear for the entrance test, followed by another selection process. Apart from these, to get a seat in NIT Uttarakhand students are also required to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria of the course.

faqs.question: How can I take admission at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: NIT Uttarakhand offers a four-year BTech, and a two-year MTech programme at the UG and PG levels, respectively. The programmes are offered in five specialisations: Civil Engineering, Computer Science & Engineering, Electronic & Communication Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering. For admission to its BTech programme, NIT Uttarakhand accepts JEE Main scores, whereas for admission to its MTech programme, the institute accepts GATE scores. NIT Uttarakhand accepts GATE/ NET/ SET scores, for admission to its PhD programme. The candidates must fill out the application form available on the institute's official website to apply for these programmes.

faqs.question: What is the selection criteria for course admission at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: National Institute of Technology (NIT) Uttarakhand offers a list of courses at the UG, PG and Part-Time programme and PhD. Admission to NIT Uttarakhand BTech course is through JEE Main. Students can check the list of course eligibility and selection criteria from the table presented below: Class 12 with a minimum 75% aggregate and studied Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics as core subjects JEE Main + JoSAA counselling BTech in relevant subject with a minimum 60% aggregate GATE + CCMT counselling Master Degree GATE/NET/SET + PI

faqs.question: How can I get direct admission in NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: Candidates looking for course admission at NIT Uttarakhand must sit and appear for the entrance exam as per respective courses. NIT Uttarakhand selects candidates based on valid JEE Main score for BTech courses. Candidates are further allotted seats through JoSAA Counselling. MTech admission to the college is entrance based with the institute accepting GATE scores. Hereafter, shortlisted students are invited for CCMT Counselling. Candidates seeking admission to PhD are shortlisted for written tests on the basis of GATE/NET/SET.

faqs.question: Is NIT Uttarakhand good for BTech placements?
faqs.answer: NIT Uttarakhand offers good placements for BTech courses. As per the latest report, the highest and average package offered to BTech students during NIT Uttarakhand placements in 2025 stood at INR 12.5 LPA and INR 8.03 LPA, respectively. The median package received in 2025 was INR 7 LPA. Further, 56 offers were made this year as well.

faqs.question: What is NIT Uttarakhand cutoff for BTech course?
faqs.answer: In 2021 cutoff, BTech CSE was the course with the highest cutoff of 16613.

faqs.question: What is the total fee of BTech course offered at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: The total fee of BTech is INR 5.79 lakh.

faqs.question: What are the M.Tech specialisations offered at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: There are various specialisation offered by NIT Uttarakhand for the MTech course. Refer to the list below to know your options.

faqs.question: How to get admission to M.Tech course offered at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: Admission to M.Tech course is based on GATE score followed by CCMT/ COAP Counselling.

faqs.question: What is the total tuition fee for M.Tech programme at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: Candidates who are offered M.Tech admission at NIT Uttarakhand must pay the fee to confirm their admission. As per official sources, the total tuition fee for M.Tech amounts to INR 1.4 Lacs The fees can be paid via net banking/credit card/debit card. Note: The above-mentioned fee is as per the official sources. However, it is indicative and subject to change.

faqs.question: What is the JEE Main application fee?
faqs.answer: The application fees for JEE Main is

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: Can I take admission in NIT Uttarakhand BTech without JEE Main?
faqs.answer: No, NIT Uttarakhand BTech admissions are purely entry-based. The institute accepts JEE Main scores. Thus, students seeking admission to this programme must apply for the JEE Main exam. Based on JEE Main scores, students are ranked and allocated a seat. Moreover, the students must also fulfill the eligibility requirements prescribed by the institute.

faqs.question: When will the GATE result 2025 be announced?
faqs.answer: IIT Roorkee announced the GATE 2025 result on March 19, 2025. To check the result, candidates will need to enter their GATE enrollment ID, registered email ID, and date of birth. The GATE exam is very prestigious among engineering and Science graduates. It is conducted every year by one of the IITs among the nine IITs. In 2024, IISc Bangalore conducted the GATE exam. The exam also opens various opportunities for engineering and Science graduates to work in Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs) and in the field of research. The GATE 2025 brochure has been released by IIT Roorkee comprising of all the relevant information about the GATE 2025 exam, including exam dates, paper codes, eligibility criteria, etc. Read more about the GATE 2025 Result: https://www.shiksha.com/engineering/gate-exam-results .

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for BTech at NIT Uttarakhand for OBC category?
faqs.answer: NIT Uttarakhand BTech cutoff 2023 for Civil Engineering was 16503 for OBC category. While the admissions are based on the scores/rank obtained in JEE Main, the last cut offs also change a lot depending on All India quota or Home State. It also varies if the applicant is a female.

faqs.question: Can I get admission to NIT Uttarakhand with a rank of 40000?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is possible to get admission to NIT Uttarakhand with a rank of 50000. NIT Uttarakhand JEE Main cutoff 2025 for the General AI category was ranged between 16830 and 48190 . Looking at the cutoff range, we can say that getting at NIT Uttarakhand at 40000 rank is possible among the General AI category candidates.

faqs.question: How can I get into NIT Uttarakhand for UG/PG courses? Am I eligible for admission?
faqs.answer: Admission to NIT Uttarakhand is based on the entrance exams, followed by an interview or counselling. For UG course such as BTEch, the university accepts JEE MAIN score and for PG course such as MTech, NIT Uttarakhand accepts the merit scores of GATE exam. Other than these, the university expanded the variety of courses recently including Communication English, Social Sciences, Literature and Cinema, Screenwriting and Creative Writing. Admission to these courses are based on CUET scores or merit-based scores. Final seat allocation is done through counseling sessions such as CCMT, CCMN, and others.

faqs.question: Can we join NIT Uttarakhand without entrance exam?
faqs.answer: No, National Institute of Technology, Uttarakhand accepts national-level entrance exams for admission. Candidates can take a look at the following entrance exams that the university accepts:

faqs.question: How to get a seat at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: To get a seat in the National Institute of Technology Uttarakhand undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD courses, candidates must visit the official website of respective national-level entrance exam conducting bodies to register themselves. Eligible candidates are then required to appear for the entrance test, followed by another selection process. Apart from these, to get a seat in NIT Uttarakhand students are also required to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria of the course. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How can I take admission at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: NIT Uttarakhand offers a four-year BTech, and a two-year MTech programme at the UG and PG levels, respectively. The programmes are offered in five specialisations: Civil Engineering, Computer Science & Engineering, Electronic & Communication Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering, and Mechanical Engineering. For admission to its BTech programme, NIT Uttarakhand accepts JEE Main scores, whereas for admission to its MTech programme, the institute accepts GATE scores. NIT Uttarakhand accepts GATE/ NET/ SET scores, for admission to its PhD programme. The candidates must fill out the application form available on the institute's official website to apply for these programmes. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What is the selection criteria for course admission at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: National Institute of Technology (NIT) Uttarakhand offers a list of courses at the UG, PG and Part-Time programme and PhD. Admission to NIT Uttarakhand BTech course is through JEE Main. Students can check the list of course eligibility and selection criteria from the table presented below: Course Common Eligibility Selection Criteria BTech Class 12 with a minimum 75% aggregate and studied Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics as core subjects JEE Main + JoSAA counselling MTech BTech in relevant subject with a minimum 60% aggregate GATE + CCMT counselling PhD Master Degree GATE/NET/SET + PI Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How can I get direct admission in NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: Candidates looking for course admission at NIT Uttarakhand must sit and appear for the entrance exam as per respective courses. NIT Uttarakhand selects candidates based on valid JEE Main score for BTech courses. Candidates are further allotted seats through JoSAA Counselling. MTech admission to the college is entrance based with the institute accepting GATE scores. Hereafter, shortlisted students are invited for CCMT Counselling. Candidates seeking admission to PhD are shortlisted for written tests on the basis of GATE/NET/SET. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Is NIT Uttarakhand good for BTech placements?
faqs.answer: NIT Uttarakhand offers good placements for BTech courses. As per the latest report, the highest and average package offered to BTech students during NIT Uttarakhand placements in 2025 stood at INR 12.5 LPA and INR 8.03 LPA, respectively. The median package received in 2025 was INR 7 LPA. Further, 56 offers were made this year as well. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How to get admission to M.Tech course offered at NIT Uttarakhand?

faqs.question: What is the total tuition fee for M.Tech programme at NIT Uttarakhand?
faqs.answer: Candidates who are offered M.Tech admission at NIT Uttarakhand must pay the fee to confirm their admission. faqs.question: What is the JEE Main application fee?
faqs.answer: The application fees for JEE Main is INR 1,000 for Male unreserved, OBC, EWS category candidates INR 800 for Female unreserved/OBC/EWS category candidates INR 500 for SC/ST/PwD/Transgender category candidates Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Can I take admission in NIT Uttarakhand BTech without JEE Main?
faqs.answer: No, NIT Uttarakhand BTech admissions are purely entry-based. The institute accepts JEE Main scores. Thus, students seeking admission to this programme must apply for the JEE Main exam. Based on JEE Main scores, students are ranked and allocated a seat. Moreover, the students must also fulfill the eligibility requirements prescribed by the institute. Not satisfied with answer? faqs.question: When will the GATE result 2025 be announced?
faqs.answer: IIT Roorkee announced the GATE 2025 result on March 19, 2025. To check the result, candidates will need to enter their GATE enrollment ID, registered email ID, and date of birth. The GATE exam is very prestigious among engineering and Science graduates. It is conducted every year by one of the IITs among the nine IITs. In 2024, IISc Bangalore conducted the GATE exam. The exam also opens various opportunities for engineering and Science graduates to work in Public Sector Undertakings (PSUs) and in the field of research. The GATE 2025 brochure has been released by IIT Roorkee comprising of all the relevant information about the GATE 2025 exam, including exam dates, paper codes, eligibility criteria, etc. Read more about the GATE 2025 Result: https://www.shiksha.com/engineering/gate-exam-results . data.title: NIT Uttarakhand Placement Report 2025
summary: In 2025, a total of 59 job offers were made for the batch of BTech and MTech. 56 jobs were offered to the BTech students. For MTech, 3 jobs offers were made. For BTech, the highest package offered was INR 12.5 LPA , while the average package stood at INR 8.03 LPA in 2025. Similary, for MTech, the highest package was INR 9 LPA. For the same course, INR 7.33 was the average package. Some of the top recruitrs participated in the placement drive include, Nexturn, Samsung, Publicis Sapient, Oracle, Adobe, Lowe's, Google, and Accenture , among others.

sections.heading: Introduction
text: Check out more on NIT Uttarakhand Infrastructure in the below videos:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description:
The library has open access system along with a reading room facility. The Library houses a total collection of approx. 32,000 printed books (with more than 6000 titles) which includes Text books and Reference books in the field of Engineering and Technology, Sciences and Humanities, English Literature and Fiction. The library has a rich collection of E-books (i.e. 26,457 titles) procured from various renowned publishers and the library subscribes various online databases to increase and enhance the quality of academic and research work. The library subscribes 69 magazines for the students.
The library's has Online Public Access Catalogue to search all the bibliographic records available in the library through a web based search i.e. WebOPAC.

college_info.college_name: NHCE Bangalore: Fees, Placements, Admissions 2025, Cutoff, Ranking, Courses

highlights.summary:
New Horizon College of Engineering is an autonomous college established in 2001. NHCE is affiliated with VTU. The institute has been approved by the AICTE & UGC. The institute is accredited by NAAC with an 'A' grade. NHCE offers courses accredited by NBA at UG, PG, professional and research level. The college offers courses in streams such as Engineering, Management, Computer Applications, etc. BTech, MBA, MTech and MCA are the flagship courses of NHCE.
The college has been ranked at 151-200 in the ‘Engineering’ category in the NIRF 2024 rankings. NHCE has also been ranked 28 out of 175 colleges in India under the BTech category by the Times of India Ranking 2024. The college accepts several national and state-level entrance exams such as KCET, PGCET, GATE, MAT, etc. The college has a panel of guest lecturers to inspire students in their respective careers and to give them tips and invaluable insights in every course. Most importantly, New Horizon College of Engineering courses are provided to students at reasonable fees, to enable students to acquire knowledge and skills in their preferred area of interest. Some of the top recruiters at NHCE Bangalore are Hitachi, Visa, Morgan Stanley, Zscaler, Eurofins, Microchip, Amazon and Capgemini etc. The major highlights of New Horizon College of Engineering are tabulated below: Check out more on New Horizon College of Engineering Highlights in the below video:
Government of Karnataka, AICTE, UGC
Visvesvaraya Technological University (VTU)
- 151-200 by NIRF 2024 (Engineering)
Check out more on New Horizon College of Engineering Highlights in the below video:

college_info_program.intro: The flagship programmes offered at NHCE Bangalore are BTech and MBA. The college offers these programmes to students at UG and PG levels. Further, the college offers these programmes for a duration of 4 and 2 years, respectively with a comprehensive curriculum. New Horizon College of Engineering courses strive to enhance the learning experience of students to prepare them for the industry. NHCE Bangalore Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really good overall development of student and good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: I am still in first semester, first year, but it has been assured that in CS department the placement is almost 100 percent, and the highest package is around 42 LPA for foreign placement and 38 LPA for domestic placement. Placement training is very good according to seniors.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are very neat and well maintained. Same applies to campus and washrooms. Teachers use smart board to interact with class and teach. Library and Labs are very accessible and make everything easy for students. Sports department are very good and facilities are also amazing.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are super helpful and interactive, no negative behaviour or any form of targeting or bullying. Labs are very useful and experiments are nice. The course is very curriculum relevant and exams are made easy from this. The exams are made moderate and not too tough for anyone.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it has high packages and I like coding. The course is easy compared to other more pure Science oriented courses and not stressful at all. I wish that there are more options about the subjects. I also play basketball and the sports department is very supportive and nice in this college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college for both studies and enjoyment. Placements are good, and you can have a good life.

detailed_review.Placements: Mostly, 80 percent of the students got placed. The highest package is 33 LPA, and it was a Japanese company. The average package is about 6 LPA, and the lowest is 3.2 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Capgemini, Infosys, Eurofins, Ancko Visteon, and many others. Roles offered in our courses are electronics engineer, VLSI Engineer, and embedded system engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have the best infrastructure that any college can provide, 24-hour library facilities, including a digital library. Wi-Fi access for every student. Best labs, most of the labs are developed by recruiting companies, and classrooms are well-equipped with a digital board for every classroom and good ventilation.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-educated and can provide a good education. Most of them have a doctoral Certificate, and teaching quality is good. Coming to the course curriculum, it is good and will make the students industry-ready because every detail of VLSI and embedded systems is covered. Most of the industries look for these skills only. Semester exams are moderate, though, and the pass percentage is 85.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in the electronics domain, and the best thing is that we can explore both the software and hardware parts. Events are held nicely here, celebrating every Indian culture, and scholarship is also provided.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Finally, our college is the best for placements. It provides 100% placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The average package is 6 LPA, and the maximum packages range from 15-20 LPA and sometimes, above 20 LPA. On the core side, one of the best company that hire students is Capgemini. The percentage of students who got internships from our course is 60%. Companies like SAP, LG, etc., hire students from the college. The top roles offered in our course are chip designer and software developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is available, like a gym, Wi-Fi, library, labs, and classrooms. The maintenance is very high. The food is excellent. Emergency medical facilities are available. The infrastructure and facilities will help thousands of students make an informed college decision.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college has highly qualified lecturers. They teach excellently. Every year in a semester, they train students for the industry or on how to crack interviews. Semester exams in this college are not very difficult. The pass percentage is 60%.
detailed_review.Other: I am currently in my 4th year in the ECE branch, and it is very nice in our college. It is one of the best colleges in Bangalore, so I chose it. Every year, it conducts events and fests. The connectivity, campus surroundings, scholarships, extracurricular activities, and everything are good in our college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: NHCE has a good placement percentage, campus life, and industry exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: I have just completed my first year, so I do not know much about placement opportunities in the college, but what I have learned from seniors is that the number of students who got placed this year was higher than last year. The highest package is 42.5 LPA, and the lowest package is around 4 LPA. The average package is 7 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Zscalar, Visa, Flexcar, Hitachi, IBM, Infosys, Capgemini, Cognizant, Deloitte, etc. Nearly 45% of students got internships from my branch in companies like VMware, Société Générale, etc., Top roles offered are full-stack developer, data analyst, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus is spread over 11-12 acres. The infrastructure is great. There are like 3-4 food stops and a Nescafe. Wi-Fi is not at all good, and it keeps on fluctuating. Classrooms are very good with a multi-purpose TV installed in all of them. The library is stocked with almost every necessary book required. I am a day scholar, so what I have heard from my hostel friends is that the hostel mess is the worst. The quality of food is not good. Rooms are decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified. Their teaching quality is decent anyway, and it all depends on us and not teachers. Many teachers are supportive. This college has an industry-relevant curriculum, company-fitted labs, a lot of assignments, and mini projects. Exams conducted are moderately difficult. For the CSE branch, as of I know, the pass percentage is 40% including assignments.
detailed_review.Other: CSE is a popular course, so I chose this course. The best thing about the CSE course is that it has the highest placement rate and more job roles compared to other courses. It is surrounded by IT companies.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: My review of this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements and job opportunities were very high. Almost everyone got placed through the college, provided they were eligible. In the first year, students were eligible for internships, and by the time they reached the second year, they became eligible to sit for final placements. Many companies were regular recruiters, like ICICI, HDFC, CITI, Wipro, AYE Finance, TASL, etc. In total, around 70+ companies visited our college, offering more than 100 positions. The highest package offered to us was 18+ LPA, and the average package of the college was 9.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I resided in the hostel. Hostels were on campus, and although there were no issues with electricity and water, rooms were pretty small to accommodate three people. Another major issue was the food, the mess food had been really pathetic even after repeated complaints. If something tasty was ever cooked, it was rare. The fee of the hostel was Rs. 62,000 yearly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Almost all faculty members were Ph.D. holders or PG qualified, and all had more than 10 years of experience, which is why the success story was high. They were very interactive with students, and the standard of teaching was above excellence. Every month, we had internals, and every 4 months, we had externals. It was a nice exam structure. We could gain more knowledge through practicals. If we failed in any exam, makeup exams were conducted very soon, and results were also announced quickly. Very good courses were offered by the college, and exams were conducted very strictly by the department, which helped students develop themselves through college activities and increased their willpower to prove their talent.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is an amazing college for students to explore various opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: I am studying computer science with data science. The topmost package for our batch is 25 LPA. Almost 75% of students got an internship offer and are excelling in various companies such as MathCo, Airbus, Nokia, and Rakuten. The top roles given are data analyst and data engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are huge and can accommodate up to 80 to 90 students with smart board facilities and projectors for all uses. The hostel food and the lifestyle are good and well-maintained. They make hygienic food and the all the medical facilities are always available 24 hrs.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified with Ph.D. Certification and are very friendly and helpful. The curriculum is very relevant and they make sure that the students are given a lot of information based on the current market scenario. The semester exams are always hard if you do not study for them, so make sure you study in advance.
detailed_review.Other: The field of data science was out of my interest and exploring various opportunities. The fest here is the main throughout Bengaluru and it is called Sargam. Campus surroundings are amazing and very helpful around the students.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: NHCE: The Bangalore college experience.

detailed_review.Placements: 88% of students have been placed. Overall, the highest package leads up to 32.5 LPA but in Japanese-based companies. The average package is around 5 LPA-6 LPA in companies like Accenture and Microsoft. Internships are more self-found. We have just completed one semester of the third year but usually placements as internships start by the end of 6th sem. The biggest role offered is of a full stack software developer that's what the placement cell trains us for.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available to every student for free, secure using their passwords which is throughout the campus. Library has all the required books, moreover a digital library is also available which helps with research by a ton open to all. Classrooms are massive and accommodate about 60-70 students with a smart board and projector. Each specific subject that requires a lab has a separate lab for it. The quality and quantity are nice. There are 4 cafeterias each with a unique kind of food. The clinic inside college is free. 2 basketball courts, one football ground, cricket space, and badminton area are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, their goal is to explain the concept more than forcing theory. Younger teachers have more gen-z slang making it easier to communicate with them. Course curriculum is extremely learning and application-based with no use of textbooks and real-world examples of applying concepts. Focused towards company requirements and how a course will help us in the same. Semester-end exams are pretty simple as an entire semester is divided into 5 modules to be completed in 3 months. All 5 modules are easy to understand. The pass percentage is 35% excluding internals.
detailed_review.Other: CSE is what I have been passionate about doing for the longest time but for the same price, this college offered me a specialization course on data science along with CSE which is maximum value for money. The best thing about my course is that my minor degree helps me scale tasks that normal CSE wouldn't be able to. Sargam is the biggest college festival in Bangalore and it is organized by NHCE and it is amazing. Crowd is very like-minded. There are hospitals, multiple food chains, and malls near the college. Scholarship exams are conducted every year which depends on marks up to 70%. There are 20 clubs to take part in.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: The placements were average, good hostel facilities, can opt if you're a nerd.

detailed_review.Placements: I was placed in Accenture, where both technical and non-technical roles were offered. There was pressure from the placement department, where we have to handle academics and placements too. There was a aptitude training, company-specific tests and training.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facilities were good, the food was comparatively good than the surrounding colleges. College had good infrastructure and environment. A 24/7 medical facility is available. They have their own ambulance for emergencies. They concentrate even more on sports, too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Students were assigned mentors who would help in submitting projects and assignments. The placement department made the students industry-ready by providing placement training like aptitude and coding tests. If you're a nerd, you can survive easily.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because if faculty and the placements .

detailed_review.Placements: I think, 80% of students got placed from my course. The highest package is 50 LPA and the lowest is 24 LPA. Top recruiting companies for my course are Samsung, Intel, Qualcomm, Texas Instruments, Nvidia, Reliance Jio, Tata Communications, Nokia, Airtel, BSNL, Cisco Systems, Honeywell, Siemens, HP, and Dell. Other major IT companies like TCS, Infosys, and Wipro.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi quality is very good and smooth working. Labs are clean and useful. Instruments are clean and lab teachers are the best and they guide us well. Classrooms are clean and clear. The benches are too comfortable to sit on. Electricity is available 24/7 electricity. Library is a very peaceful place to study and well maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Teachers were very helpful towards students and they always guide students for studies and also extra curricular activities they are well knowledge and teaching quality was excellent 
When it came to semester exam in this college they were based on what u had studies if u studies well than exam were easy if didn't than it was difficult .
detailed_review.Other:
I choose this course coz I'm quite interested in electronic from the beginning and I love learning about that too 
I wish the placements would be more better 
When it comes to events, fest, campus crowd, connectivity, campus surroundings, extracurricular activities my college is good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Deep Dive into New Horizons College of Engineering: Academics, Campus Life, and Much More.

detailed_review.Placements: So, our placements usually started in the 6th semester, and we had to pay an amount of 12000 INR as the placement training fee. Approximately 1000 students had SAT for the placements, and nearly 700 students were placed among them. In total, 100+ companies had been to our college for both technical and non-technical roles. The highest package is 28.5 LPA from the company Visa. The lowest package is 3.5 LPA, and the average package of our college is 4.5 LPA. Some of the companies that came to our college are Speridian Technologies, Epsilon, Zopsmart, Netradyne, Epicor, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have a huge library in our college, and it has all the textbooks. Coming to the classroom, we have a smart board. The blackboard is only used for some explanation. The labs have Wi-Fi connections, and all the systems work very well. The classrooms are spacious, and nearly 80 students can accommodate in one room. Our campus also has an indoor gym, which is separate for both boys and girls. We also have an outdoor and indoor BB court, an indoor sports court for indoor games, and 2 dance studios for the dancers to practice before any special occasion.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are educated and qualified but are not experienced. The English fluency isn't good. Some of the teachers mainly focus on the first benchers. Yes, the course curriculum is relevant and it makes the students ready for the IT field. It makes them an independent person after their course, as they can select their respective jobs after engineering. The semester exams are pretty easy, mostly from the PDFs given by the teachers. The pass percentage is 40/100. Apart from that, we also have 3 internals every semester, including the mini project and assignments.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because the placement opportunities will be more for Computer Science and Information Science. The thing which I wanna improve is the teaching quality and experienced teachers. The teachers are well-educated, but their teaching quality isn't good. We have 2 main fests called Sargam, which is held in November or December, and Revolution, held in June or July. Along with that, we also celebrate Diwali night, Independence Day, Republic Day, and ethnic days. We also have various clubs that organize events for students to participate in. Our college also organizes Hackathons which help students to improve their skills.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely best college in regards of education.

detailed_review.Placements: Seniors have got good placements with an average of 4.5 LPA, and staff are very supportive. They tell us and prepare us for how to attend an interview. About 100 percent of placements have been done. The highest was 45 LPA, and the lowest was 4 LPA. Capgemini and Nvidia are top recruiters.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have unlimited Wi-Fi in our college for each and every student, and there is a dedicated lab for each and every subject, be it Mathematics, Chemistry, Physics, or Mechanical. There are good facilities such as hot and cold water. In the library, there are adequate books for studying.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are top-class, and they have adequate knowledge about the topics. Teaching quality is top-class. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. Exams are of moderate difficulty, and the pass percentage is 95 percent, which is very good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to know more about practical things in life, like how automobiles work, how CNC machines work, etc. There are numerous clubs and fests in our college. Sargam is one of the largest fests in Bengaluru, and NCC is the best thing about this college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great placements and good teachers but they know how to loot us well.

detailed_review.Placements: 99% of the students in my course are placed. Companies like Mitsubishi, Toyota, Toshiba, Visa, Capgemini, and TCS come to our college for placements each year. Top roles offered in my course are software development engineer, full-stack developer, data scientist, and mobile application developer. The highest offered package is 36 LPA, the lowest offered is 2 LPA, and the average is 17 LPA. 30% of the students in our college get internships at various startups and companies like TCS.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have well-equipped classrooms with Wi-Fi and a smart board for teaching. We have lifts for commuting from one floor to another. We have a good, spacious library where various study materials are available. There are spacious hostel rooms with individual beds and study areas for three students in each room. However, the food quality is below average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and very helpful. They teach exactly what is required for students to pass the exams. The course curriculum is somewhat relevant, with some courses and topics being very outdated. Semester exams are at a moderate level, and the pass percentage is 40%.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: New Horizons College of engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: The professors are very well trained and good at explaining to students and coaching for placements. Also, the best thing is 80% of students were placed in my course. The highest was 24 CTC, and the average was 4 CTC. 70% of students got internships. Programme Analyst roles were offered in our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: They have good labs, good facilities, and overall good things when it comes to facilities. We have great classrooms and a library, good teaching staff, and indoor and outdoor sports. Many students got medals and cups for the college, and the ground staff was always supportive of the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful all the time, and they are very well-versed and have good communication and knowledge across all subjects. Yes, it makes the students industry-ready. The difficulty level was 9/10 in semesters, and the pass percentage was 48% minimum.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen CSE because in our college it is the best, not in NHCE, but overall in the city. The best things are working physically, focusing on coding and labs all the time.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is an average 2-tier college, and students can join this college.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement cell is working very hard. Our college has a placement rate of 80-85% and others go ahead for M.Tech courses. All of them get internships in the college. Top recruiting companies are TCS, SAP, and Benz. The average salary package offered is 6 LPA which is decent. The lowest salary package offered by TCS is around 2 LPA - 3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is free for all and is available in every corner of the campus. The highest Wi-Fi speed is 200 Mbps. There are 5-6 computer labs in our building. Classrooms are equipped with smartboards and around 15 benches per class. There are 2 libraries in our college. One is underground, and the other is on the ground floor. We get access to the online library.
detailed_review.Faculty: All our teachers are very helpful during doubts. They are Ph.D. qualified. They are very friendly. The curriculum is a bit old, but they are constantly updating the curriculum. The syllabus and the college are VTU-affiliated. It is an autonomous college. There are a total of 3 exams in a semester. We have internal exams and final exams. The pass percentage is 50% out of 100%.
detailed_review.Other: My course is mechanical engineering. I have a keen interest in mechanical engineering, and my family is from a mechanical background due to which I get constant support from them. The syllabus should be a little bit updated. There is an upcoming event on 29-30 November where a celebrity named Badshah is coming to college, and I'm very excited about it. There are a total of 146 clubs in engineering.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: New Horizon College is a beautiful and a peaceful college in the city.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has 100% placement, but the average salary is only 4 to 6 lakhs per annum. Only a few students get more than 20 lakhs per annum. The highest salary offered was 34 lakhs per annum, and this year we are aiming for 80 lakhs per annum. The top companies do visit our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have separate boys and girls hostels on the college premises. The boys' hostel is divided into three blocks, and both hostels offer good shared rooms with a lot of amenities like Wi-Fi, canteens, games, gym, sports, etc. Both hostels are fully secured and safe. And the food in the hostels is great.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are well qualified and helpful to all the students. The curriculum is very relevant to the outside world, and they keep updating the syllabus very regularly. This makes the students industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to pursue a career in computer science engineering. I found the course to be very good, and it prepared me well for the software world.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Awesome college with great atmosphere.

detailed_review.Placements: As the college is situated in the IT corridors and has many IT giants coming in for campus recruitment, the main companies like Cognizant and Infosys come to the college by the 6th semester to give you a placement for CS, IS, CE, and other departments respectively.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is free everywhere and can be super-speed sometimes. The library is a very informative place to study and borrow books. The classrooms have smartboards and all digital modes of studying and can increase our knowledge in many ways. The hostel has a changing menu, which is very good for people from all over the country.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are good in every branch. Despite COVID and other problems, we all have been trained well. The exams are continuous, and we don’t get holidays. The exams are easy if you pay attention in class and write notes. The pass percentage would be 35, and then you’re promoted to the next year.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure along with friendly faculty and good food.

detailed_review.Placements: The lowest rank selected by the college through KCET was 16500 for the EEE course. I am still in the first year, so I can't say anything about the internships and roles, but the average package was 4L. In the orientation, we heard that we would get 100% internships and also that if we somehow did not get placed in our fourth year, the college would help us even in the following year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is amazing. There is a garden surrounded by all the different course-specific buildings and canteens. I love lying on the grass in the evening with my friends. Also, the college has four canteens with many options. I'm a day scholar, so I have no idea about the hostel life, but judging by the canteen food, it is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are pretty qualified and knowledgeable, especially our physics teacher. He has around three patents, and two more are waiting for approval. The entire curriculum changes every two years, and yes, it is relevant and up-to-date with current industry requirements.
detailed_review.Other: The college provides flexibility in courses. Even though I am an EEE student, if I am qualified enough, I can even sit for CSE placements. The college has a national-level event called "SARGAM." This year, the face of Sargam is "Badshah," performing live in front of the crowd.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: It's a good college among the top colleges in Karnataka with good infrastructure, placements, & fest

detailed_review.Placements: For placement, students must have at least a 7 CGPA. The highest package is thirty Lacs. Many top companies come for placements, all through good college for placement. Even students must be skilled in coding for their easy placement. CGPA is helpful for students to go forward.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is very good. It is less in area but good infrastructure with company-sponsored labs. Classrooms have smart boards. The college has nearly three blocks according to their branch. The hostel is very good compared to other college hostels with Wi-Fi and laundry.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very interactive with students, and a minimum of 75% attendance is mandatory. Semester exams are easy if you go through. The curriculum is okay, but when you are in the first year, you think it is not so relevant to your industry. I think it's the same for every college.
detailed_review.Other: Sargam is the college fest, which is the most famous fest conducted every year. This college is also the best for cultural activities.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college to improve your skills.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement of the college is good, as they provide you with placement training from the 3rd year onwards. The college offers Japanese placements, where companies like Hitachi, BELC, etc., take part. The highest reported package is 32 Lacs by Visa and 50 Lacs for Japanese placements. The lowest package is 4.5 Lacs by Capgemini, and the average package is 5.5 Lacs. About 50% of students get internships by the end of their 3rd year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is average, but there are 20+ industry-based labs, which is a key factor for joining this college, as these labs help you gain hands-on experience before entering the industry. The mess food and canteen food are good and affordable. There is a 24/7 library and Wi-Fi available on campus. The classrooms are average, each holding 60 students, and most sports are available in the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are highly qualified and have great experience. They help us understand concepts and link them to industry perspectives. The teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is very relevant and allows every branch student to learn about their core subjects and the IT sector, helping to make students industry-ready. The semester exams are average, and one does not have to put much effort into scoring, which buys you time to participate in different events and improve your skills. The pass percentage is 95%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as it holds immense potential in the industry, and the college helps us explore them. There are three fests in total each year, with the biggest being Sargam. The crowd is cosmopolitan, and the connectivity is really good. The college is surrounded by a giant tech park.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Student review of the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90% of students who applied were placed. The highest package was 26 Lacs, and the top recruiters are Zenken, Deloitte, TCS, and Infosys. All students who applied for internships were successful, and many paid and unpaid internship opportunities were made available.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is decent for a small college, with good classrooms that are spacious and bright, featuring large windows. The labs are good, and the library has lots of books and study material that are easily accessible. The hostel has good facilities and food as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is good; they are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is relevant for engineers and helps students become industry-ready. The exams aren't very hard, but students need a good understanding of the subjects to pass and score well.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was interested in electronics, and the best part is that the subjects align with my interests. It would be better if it had more hands-on experience instead of so much theory.
