admission.title: NHCE Bangalore Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: NHCE Bangalore admission is open for the UG and PG courses. The college has released the application form available on the official website. The college also accepts entrance exams such as KCET, GATE, PGCET, KMAT, etc. for admission to specific courses. The step-wise admission process is mentioned below:

faqs.question: How to get admission in New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: The college has released the application form, which candidates can obtain from the official website. New Horizon College offers admission to its UG and PG programmes on a merit basis. Students can check the table below to know some of the course-wise eligibility and selection criteria from the table presented below: Class 12 with at least 45% aggregate in each subject for Management Quota 2nd PUC/ Class 12 or equivalent examination with English as one of the languages with at least 45% aggregate (40% aggregate for candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes (Category I, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B) in Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with Chemistry/ Bio-Technology/ Computer Science/ Electronics/ Biology KCET Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Technology in Computer Science and Engineering/ Information Science or AMIE in the appropriate branch GATE CSE Bachelor's degree with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ ST/ Category-1 for candidates belonging to Karnataka) MAT/ KMAT/ Karnataka PGCET Bachelor's degree with Mathematics or Statistics or Computer Science or Computer Programming or Computer Applications or Business Mathematics or Business Statistics as one of the optional or elective at degree level with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ ST/ Category-1 for candidates belonging to Karnataka) KMAT/MAT/ Karnataka PGCET

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted by New Horizon College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: New Horizon College admission to all the UG and PG programme is based on national level entrance exams. Find below the list of course along with the exams required for the course: KCET GATE CSE MAT/ KMAT/ Karnataka PGCET

faqs.question: Is MBA expensive at New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee for MBA is INR 6.5 lakh as per an unofficial source. Candidates are required to pay the course fee after completion of all the selection rounds to confirm their seats. In case, a candidate is unable to pay the fee within the specified time, his or her admission will stand cancelled. Aspirants will also need to pay a registration fee to apply for admission. Comparing the fee with the highest package offered in 2023 whihc was INR 28 LPA , it is a good return in investment.

faqs.question: How do I join New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: To join New Horizon College, candidates must first get admisison to any UG or PG courses offered there. Candidates must first check the eligibility criteria for the course they are applying for. For e.g. to get admission to MBA  programme, candidates must have bachelor's degree with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ ST/ Category-1 for candidates belonging to Karnataka). Once qualifying the criteria, they must fill the online application form.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff required for admission at New Horizon College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: New Horizon College of Engineering cutoff 2024 has been released for BTech and BPharma courses. KCET cutoff 2024 has been released separately for all the courses and colleges in the form of opening and closing ranks.NHCE Bangalore - New Horizon College of Engineering Karnataka PGCET Round 2 Seat Allotment ranks are out for admission to MBA/ MCA courses. Students can check detailed New Horizon College of Engineering cutoff stats here.

faqs.question: Is New Horizon College good for BTech?
faqs.answer: During New Horizon College of Engineering placements 2023, a total of 109 recruiters visited and over 1,312 students got placed. For admissions to the BTech course, candidates need to fulfil the eligibility criteria. The eligibility criteria for admissions is that candidate should have passed Class 12 or equivalent examination with English as one of the languages with at least 45% aggregate (40% aggregate for candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes (Category I,  2A,  2B,  3A and 3B) in Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with Chemistry/ Bio-Technology/ Computer Science/ Electronics/ Biology. Below are the details regarding New Horizon College of Engineering BTech specialisations:

faqs.question: Who is eligible for BTech admission at New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: Candidates who have twelve years of school education with English as one of the languages with a minimum 45% aggregate (40% aggregate for candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes (Category I,  2A,  2B,  3A and 3B) in Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects along with Chemistry/ Bio-Technology/ Computer Science/ Electronics/ Biology is required to apply for BE courses are eligiblr for the BTech programme. BTech admission at New Horizon College is merit-based. Candidates must fill the application form for admission to the BTech programme.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in NHCE Bangalore BTech?
faqs.answer: The inquiry form is open for the year 2025. The college has released the application form for UG and PG courses on its website. It accepts admission through national or state level entrance exams such as KCET,  GATE, PGCET, KMAT, etc., for specific courses. The criteria to get admission in programme is that the students must have passed Class 12 with at least 45% aggregate marks in each subject.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for MBA at New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: Candidates who has bachelor's degree with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ ST/ Category-1 for candidates belonging to Karnataka) are eligible for MBA at New Horizon College. The MBA programme is offered in dual specialisations across six areas, which are Marketing, Finance, Human Resources, Business Analytics, and Operations. The programme is divided into four semesters. New Horizon College offers admission to the MBA programme based on MAT/ KMAT/ Karnataka PGCET scores

faqs.question: What is the fees of MBA in New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: The fees of MBA in New Horizon College is around INR 6.5 lakh. The fees might include multiple components, which candidates must pay during admission. This information is sourced from official website/ sanctioning body and is subject to change. New Horizon College offers two years MBA programme across six specialisations. Admission is based on  based on MAT/ KMAT/ Karnataka PGCET scores.

faqs.question: What is the NHCE Bangalore Karnataka PGCET Cutoff 2025?
faqs.answer: The NHCE Bangalore Karnataka PGCET Cutoff 2025 has been released till Round 3 for admission to the MBA programme. The Round 3 NHCE Bangalore MBA cutoff 2025 was 20729 . In 2024, it was 2616 , and in 2023, it was 3501 . We can say that after analysing the cutoff, the competition for admission to this institute for the MBA course via the Karnataka PGCET exam has dropped low over the years.

faqs.question: How difficult is it to get into NHCE Bangalore for MCA?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria for MCA course at New Horizon College of Engineering is that candidate should have Bachelor's degree with Mathematics or Statistics or Computer Science or Computer Programming or Computer Applications or Business Mathematics or Business Statistics as one of the optional or elective at degree level with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ ST/ Category-1 for candidates belonging to Karnataka). The institute accepts KMAT/MAT/ Karnataka PGCET scores for admission to its MCA programme. With right preparation and strategy students could easily get into the MCA programmes offered by NHCE Bangalore.

faqs.question: Who can apply for MCA course at NHCE Bangalore?
faqs.answer: Aspirants who have passed bachelor's degree with Mathematics or Statistics or Computer Science or Computer Programming or Computer Applications or Business Mathematics or Business Statistics as one of the optional or elective at degree level with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for SC/ ST/ Category-1 for candidates belonging to Karnataka) can apply for the MCA course. Candidate who has studied and passed one of the subjects specified in the first provision in the Pre-University course with at least 50% aggregate in that subject shall also be considered for admission. However, in the case of candidates from Karnataka belonging to SC/ ST and Category I, the aggregate percent of marks of all the years of the qualifying examination shall not be less than 45%.

faqs.question: How many seats are available for MCA course at New Horizon College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: A total of 180 seats are available for MCA course at New Horizon College of Engineering.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for M.Tech at New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: Candidates who has achelor’s degree in Engineering or Technology in Computer Science and Engineering/ Information Science or AMIE in the appropriate branch is eligiblr for M.Tech at New Horizon College. Admission to M.Tech is based on GATE CSE. It is mandatory for candidates to complete online application form, therfore they are advised to go through the application process carefully.

faqs.answer: Important Documents Required at the time of Admission at NHCE Bangalore : Note: The list of documents mentioned above are the general documents. For more details visit the official website.

faqs.question: Does NHCE Bangalore provide any scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes, the college provides 50% Freeship Scholarships for topper in BE AI and Machine Learning, Civil Engineering, Computer Science & Engineering, Computer Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering, Information Science Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, MCA, MBA, and MTech. Apart from this, Sports Scholarship is also provided to students pursuing a UG or PG course from the college.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for scholarships at New Horizon College?
faqs.answer: The eligibility criteria for scholarships at New Horizon College are tabulated below: Above 85% in II PUC/ 12th- Above 75% in Degree The candidates who represented the State & won medals in individual & team events (organised by the Department of State Associations and National Federations) The candidates who represented National Games, National Champions, All India Inter Zonal Meets Inter-University (at National Level) National Tournaments & Champions The candidates who represented the country at Asian Games/ Common Wealth Games, Olympic Games, and International Meets

sections.heading: Introduction
text: The campus is spread over 12 acres of land with lush greenery housing a 700-seater auditorium built to international standards. The computer laboratories are equipped with the latest multimedia Pentium processor-based systems. The labs are networked using LAN with internet connectivity. The campus is Wi-Fi enabled. Conference rooms of corporate standards are one of the highlights of the New Horizon campus. Ultra-modern facilities to conduct board meetings/recruitment meetings are also available.

New Horizon College of Engineering Bangalore has classrooms, a library, hostels, etc. New Horizon College of Engineering Bangalore has a big campus. Some of the facilities available in the college include A fully Wi-Fi campus, Air-conditioned classrooms with the audio-visual and multi-media facility, a State-of-the-art auditorium, Well-equipped conference hall, lecture hall, and seminar hall, Libraries, Full-time internet connectivity, Hostels facility for boys & girls, etc. Other facilities are mentioned below:
Canteen/Cafeteria:
The college cafeteria is spacious, clean, and hygienic, it offers a variety of north Indian, south Indian, and Chinese cuisine. All food is offered at concessional prices in the canteen/cafeteria.
Sports:

Our students play different sports & games at different levels. The college provides a host of indoor & outdoor sports facilities for the students. An indoor stadium with state-of-the-art facilities houses courts for basketball, volleyball, and badminton alongside a well-maintained playground. The campus also features a well-equipped indoor and outdoor gymnasium including indoor games like chess & table tennis.
Student Clubs

Joining a club gives the opportunity to gain skills that one wouldn't get in a classroom, giving more liberty to manage time effectively, make practical decisions, and plan and execute important events.
Check out more on New Horizon College of Engineering Bangalore Infrastructure in the below videos:

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: Institute library has a collection of 47398 books, 10150 titles, 84 encyclopedias, 76 dictionaries, 58 print journals and over 4253 multimedia resources and also have Institution membership of DELNET, IETE, ISTE, CSI and IEI. Library has spread over two floors with 605 seating capacity, state of art digital library, E-Learning center, video conference room, online class room with recording facility, student’s discussion rooms, faculty discussion room, books & stationary shop are available in the ground floor. Stack area, reference section, circulation counter, OPAC Search, Journals/ Magazines and newspaper section are made available in lower level of the library building.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: Hostel accommodations for over 1200 students on campus have been built to provide students with a safe and welcoming environment. There are separate hostel facilities for boys and girls. The living areas are designed to promote harmony. We have gone to great lengths to keep the surroundings green and fresh. Such an environment fosters the development of productive thoughts and ideas. It serves as a student's "home away from home." We see the dormitories as a place for students to study, relax, and socialize.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 305 published reviews , 268 reviews are verified.

Our college has placements department (placements cell), it is effective in training us for placements with external trainers from various sources on soft skills and aptitude training.

paragraphs: New Horizon College of Engineering Bangalore offers scholarships to students based on criteria decided by the college. The college offers merit-based, sports scholarships and general scholarships. The criteria to avail of each scholarship is different for NHCE Bangalore students and other school or college graduates. It must be noted that scholarships awarded are valid for one academic year only.

The scholarship amount offered based on merit is between INR 15,000 to INR 25,000. The table below illustrates the New Horizon College of Engineering Bangalore scholarship details for merit-based selection:

NMAM Institute of Technology Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Software Engineering
reviews.review_title: NMAM Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: 90 percent of students are placed in my course in my college. The highest package is 50 LPA, the lowest package is 5 LPA, and the average package is 10 LPA, offered in my course. 40 percent of students got internships from my course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In my college, the facilities are good, and the infrastructure is good. Wi-Fi is provided. The labs are good and provide AC and a projector. Classrooms are good and have AC and a projector. The library is good and provides many books. In the hostel, the quality of food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are qualified and helpful. Faculty members are very knowledgeable and qualified for teaching. The teaching quality is good, and we are approached by students in a friendly manner. In the semester, we have conducted two mid exams and one final exam. The pass percentage of exams is 40 percent.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: One of the best colleges for studying and enjoying.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college offers all related courses in B.Tech, BE, and M.Tech. The highest package is 1 CPA, the average is 30 LPA, and the lowest is 10 LPA. Top companies like Toyota, Fath Automation, etc., recruit here. The top offered role is Manager.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
North Indian and South Indian foods are available with great rooms and attached bathrooms, and wardens are friendly. Rules and discipline should be followed in the canteen as well as in the college. 24*7 current will be available, there is no power cut, and internet is available.
.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified and experienced, and every teacher has completed a Ph.D. Their quality is better than that of other colleges. After every semester, they provide internships to help us become industry-ready. The pass percentage is 60%, and exams are easy, you can easily score up to 80% in college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: NMAMIT - A review of the engineering college in Nitte.

detailed_review.Placements: The college placement was not cent percent. But placements were good for IT branches, but not as good for non-IT branches. The highest package was 25 LPA, and the lowest package was nearly 3 LPA. The average was about 8 LPA. The internship started in the 8th semester.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college facilities were good in terms of ambiance and infrastructure. The quality of hostels was good in terms of facilities. The quality of food was good, with both North-Indian and South-Indian menus available. The hostel was near the college and good in terms of safety.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching and non-teaching staff were good in terms of approachability. The course was relevant in terms of IT needs. But students had to take additional courses to improve their own skills, as the college provided a basic curriculum. Overall, it was good. The course was good.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Machine Design
reviews.review_title: It is an encouraging college with a lot of facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Even though I completed my bachelor's degree with the placement I am not satisfied with the salary package, so I aimed to do masters in the specialisation of machine design. I learned a lot of skills and underwent a lot of training at the college. Now, I have been placed in ABB company as a design engineer with a starting salary of 8.3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Students' securities are prior when compared to all other things. Security cameras and guards are located all over the campus and in the hostel areas. Wardens and in-charge staff members are appointed in the hostel to maintain student entry and the existing database throughout the day.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are conducted twice a year. Semester academic results are more important and based on such scores, training will be given to the students. For toppers, less training will be provided. For below-average students, extra classes are provided.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college I would like to say. The library and classrooms are very clean.

detailed_review.Placements: There is good placement support. The lowest salary package offered is 4 LPA. The highest salary package offered is 53 LPA. Top recruitment companies are DXC Technologies, Mindtree, Capgemini, Accenture, etc. The highest number of roles are offered to computer science engineering students. CSE students received 356 placement offers along with 16 internship offers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has the best infrastructure in Karnataka. The hostel has 24/7 high-speed Wi-Fi. The hostel has good food compared to other colleges. I should appreciate the discipline of the hostel which none of the colleges have it. Rooms are cleaned every time. Drinking water is also good. It has solar water and a geyser is also available for hot water.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are very supportive and caring. I have the best HOD named Dr. Roshan Fernandez who teaches the best in the college. Exams are quite easy if we study well. The pass criteria are 5 CGPA. Our department has good lecturers. The teaching is the best.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is full of greenery with cool and hot weather. It has the top fest named Incredia which we enjoy a lot.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Some facilities are fine. Placement offices will aim for small mistakes. Infrastructure is good.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course, over 85% of people were placed. The highest package was 53 Lacs, the lowest package was 3.59 Lacs, and the average package is 12 Lacs. In my college, people got internships from Infosys, Finacle, Twilio. Top roles like software engineer, full stack developer, and data analyst were offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms have AC, Wi-Fi, and projectors. The labs are equipped with new infrastructure like PCs and tables. The hostel food is not that good. People get food poisoning sometimes. It's better to take food from outside the college, like the hotels that have mess facilities. Medical facilities are free. Sports and games facilities are also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are qualified, approachable, and knowledgeable, with nice experience in teaching. The curriculum is industry-relevant, covering both theoretical and practical skills. Semester exams are moderately difficult, requiring consistent study. The pass percentage is generally high, around 85-90%. Students need to maintain an attendance of 85% minimum.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for its blend of innovation and career prospects. The best aspects are hands-on projects and industry-relevant skills. Improvements could include more internships and a focus on research. The campus is lively with diverse events, good connectivity, scholarships, and active extracurriculars.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Structural Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: In the field of structural engineering, we need experience and a degree. College will help us start a career with a good company. If we compare our placement with the CS and AI branches, our placement and package are lower. But later, you have the opportunity to switch to companies like Dream Builders, Civil Ace Construction, Utkarsh Construction, L&T Construction, and more that offer jobs as well as internships. Salary package CTC average is 3.8 LPA, and the lowest CTC is 1.8 LPA. I got the role of junior structural engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college entrance is full of green trees. But there is a bad smell that is unbearable; it must be cleaned every day to prevent that. The college is away from city so there is less pollution. The college has Wi-Fi but speed is an issue. The college library has many books, newspapers, notes and study materials. The hostel has separate blocks for girls and boys; in one room, 2 people stayed with attached washrooms. The meal menu is good; they offer different varieties of food. I give 5/5 to the quality of the food.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are very friendly and keep clarifying our doubts. My learning experience has been good with the faculty. Teachers also help us with projects and keep helping to complete them. Our project is the design of a commercial building, and the faculty really helped us. Structural engineering is similar to civil engineering, but it is an in-depth civil concept. In a growing country like India, civil engineering is a rapidly growing sector, and we have enough jobs. Semester exams are not very difficult; one needs to have a clear understanding of the basics.
detailed_review.Other: I think after graduation, structural engineering is better than an MBA. It is from my field, so I prefer structural over MBA.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great college for better learning and highly recommended.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement was average for civil engineering; around 40 percent of students were placed. The top companies that came here were Prism Johnson, Semox, Google, Infosys, Accenture, Mind Tree, RoboSoft, etc. A total of 60 percent of the students get placed on average .
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the hostel was quite good; there will be separate buildings for every branch. And also, hostel food is good. The Wi-Fi at the college was very fast. You will get both digital libraries and physical libraries. The labs were good and will have all the necessary equipment.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is quite friendly and expert in all the branches. And it also makes difficult subjects easy. In spite of having an engineering syllabus that is very old, this institute is working on updating it with the latest technology. The semester was quite difficult compared to VTU.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of the college infrastructure. The best thing you get is that it is off-road in the traffic environment .

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A fantastic college with good facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Actually, to be honest, the college is very good. The teachers are brilliant; they make you understand everything perfectly. Many staff members, including the cleaning staff, are very supportive. The placement in this college is also very good; it's one of the top-rated colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is fantastic. There are Wi-Fi labs, classrooms, and a library, all equipped with air conditioning for good ventilation. I don't stay in the hostel, but as far as my friends have told me, the hostel is also very good, with no such issues with the hostel staff.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is just fantastic; they use projectors and other facilities to teach, which helps us understand more efficiently. I can easily recommend this college to other people. The semester exams in this college are going very well.
detailed_review.Other: I have a dream to become a software engineer.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life at NMAMIT: A life where you can explore all your desires towards the success of your career.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of students get placed. The highest package is 57 LPA and the least must be 3 LPA, with the average around 3 LPA. We have top recruiting companies like Wipro and Cisco, etc. Most of our students have got internships in NITs. We offer top roles like senior software designer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am not a hostelite so I will not comment on these, but yes, the course and hostel facilities are very good according to my hostelite friends. The hostel is very good, it seems. We get high-speed Wi-Fi, the best labs with high-end computers, and both offline and digital libraries. We have all the facilities that anyone needs in the college, and these facilities are the best.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified and have good knowledge of the concepts that they are teaching to us. This course is almost 90% relevant according to others, and a few students are industry-ready. Semester exams are always a bit difficult as externals prepare these papers and also correct them.
detailed_review.Other: I had no other courses to select so I had to select this course. My course syllabus deals with most of the outside world technology. I wish they could have given practical knowledge to the students so that we could better understand the knowledge. There are many fests conducted by the college, among which the best one is INCREDIA. It's the best among all the fests. Many scholarship programs are provided to reservation students.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 60% of the 2023 passout batch had been placed in various companies. The average package at NMAMIT is 4 LPA. The highest was 42 LPA, and the lowest was 2.5 to 3 LPA. The top companies that came for recruiting were Accenture, Allegion, Bosch, Capgemini, LTI Mindtree, Cognizant, Samsung and many more. 40% of the students got internship opportunities. The top roles offered were GET, analyst, software engineer, tester and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure at NMAMIT are of good standard. A green campus with lots of biodiversity. Speaking about the ELC department, the labs and the classrooms are well-equipped with the latest technologies. The boys hostel is nearby the playground and various sports complexes, with some amount of time and coaching for extracurricular activities. The girls hostel is in and around the main college campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The lecturers at NMAMIT are well qualified, with most of them having doctorate degrees in their respective fields. The course curriculum is very relevant and provides good theoretical and practical knowledge. The semester exams are easy to moderate, with questions asked based on what was taught in the curriculum. The pass percentage is about 90% in a batch of 200 students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of the good faculty in the ELC department. The placements were pretty decent but core companies are hard to get into due to the limited number.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: No campus life @ NMAM Institute of Technology!

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are average, around 7 LPA, and not all students get placed, but a decent amount does. The highest package was off-campus, about 46 LPA. Top recruiters are Accenture, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, etc. Internships are also available, and they are average as well.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All labs and facilities are available, and some of them are good too. However, the Wi-Fi service they provide is the worst. It's not just in the hostel, but even on their own so-called college campus. They block entertainment sites on their Wi-Fi, taking away the only source of entertainment.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are super helpful and nice. They are well qualified, but some of them teach classes in a branch that is completely different from their department. For example, mechanical staff teaching IT skills and all. The exams occur three times in a semester, with two midterms and one end semester exam. They are pretty easy to score in.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My opinion on NMAMIT, Nitte.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement rate in our college is around 96 percent. In our course, the average package is around 5 LPA with the highest package being 53 LPA and the lowest around 1 LPA. Companies like Accenture, Cadence, Bosch, Amazon, TCS, etc., come for recruitment of students in our college. Ninety-eight percent of students from our course got internships in companies like Infosys, TCS, Accenture, etc. Top roles offered in our course include Web Developer, Cybersecurity Specialist, App Developer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is pretty good. Our college has good classrooms and labs that are well-maintained. All labs are air-conditioned and have new computers with the latest specs. The hostel meals are really good and well-prepared. They are very tasty as well. The food in the canteen is also good with reasonable rates. There is a clinic in the college which provides emergency treatment. Our college has a ground named BC Alva Sports Ground which is very spacious and well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were helpful all the time. They were always supportive and helped us on every occasion, both study and non-study related. Teachers had a good way of teaching by using presentations and video analysis. The course curriculum is relevant to present world opportunities. Semester exams were moderately difficult, and the pass percentage was around 80 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I thought it had the potential to prepare me for web development and other coding-related topics. My course lacks a bit of hardware that is provided in other courses. Events and other extracurricular activities are great in this college. Fests like Incridea happen every year with great zeal and enthusiasm.

reviews.course: B.E. in Biotechnology Engineering
reviews.review_title: Very decent placements in the biotechnology stream, but good placements for other streams.

detailed_review.Placements:
About 11% of the students got placed in biotech jobs. The highest package offered was 30K, the average was 20K, and the lowest was 10K.
Syngene, Automed, and Novozymes. 2022: All students got internships from Samahitha Solutions, etc. 2022: Clinical researcher, pharmacist, and quality assessment officer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: 24/7 free below-average internet speed throughout the campus, with an equipped library, canteen, and in-campus hospital with free medical check-ups, spacious classrooms with AC and projectors, and un-updated labs. It offers good lab facilities with assisting and helpful lab staff, enhancing the learning abilities of the student.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are friendly and helpful with Ph.D. qualifications. They teach decently well. The course curriculum is very relevant and makes the students industry-ready. Semester exam setting depends on the course coordinator and is easy to moderate most of the time. The pass percentage is 40/100.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Nmam institute of technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements in our college are good with an average salary of 4 LPA and the highest package of about 40 LPA previous year. The highest package of this year is 49 lakh yen (Japanese currency). It is about 28 lpa in Indian currency. But unfortunately, many top recruiting do not visit the campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are good in our college with 14+ courses available in B.Tech course. Clean labs, classrooms and library are good. Even free Wi-Fi is available in our college campus and as well as in our hostel. The facilities available in our hostel are good but the food is not up to our expectations.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful and they even help us  in our academics very much. They explain our doubts whenever we face problems. There are 2 AI exams and one lab in every semester. The exams are easy and we can easily get good marks in them.
detailed_review.Other: The fests and other activities conducted in our college are very good. There are many extra activities rather than academic activities which is a very good thing.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NMAM Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 200 students got placed in this course. The highest salary package offered was 30 LPA. The lowest salary package offered was 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies visit our college for recruitment.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facilities are very good. Free Wi-Fi is available in this college. Study rooms are available and we can study there peacefully. Facilities are very good in this college. The food quality is average. Medical facilities are available. There is a gym facility in this college. Sports are also conducted on our campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very good. They are helpful in all aspects. They always clarify our doubts. Our college provides good education. Two exams are conducted every semester. The pass percentage is good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in it. This course provides in-depth knowledge about industries. Our campus life is good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Review of NMAM Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements here are good, as in 2023 there were about 1000 students placed with an average package of about INR 4-5 LPA, which is good, and about 200 companies visited our campus this year. Year by year, the number of companies visiting the college is increasing.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Courses have experienced teachers, and we have different types of labs and a huge library. We also have four hostels: the main hostel for boys and girls, the PG hostel for boys and girls, and different types of rooms are available, like with and without attached bathrooms, with and without AC, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers used to support each and every individual to clear the exams. There are different courses, different subjects, and different exams. Semester exams are tough compared to our IA exams, so it's harder to get good marks in semesters when compared to IA exams here.
detailed_review.Other: This course is the future and has a lot of hope for the future, so I chose it. There are many fests and events hosted at the college in different years. There is even a lot of scope in sports, etc.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Everything is provided in our college.

detailed_review.Placements: Students of our college received 1200 placement offers. The highest salary package was increased from 24.7 LPA to 53 LPA. Computer science and engineering students received the highest salary packages. The recruiters were DXC Tech, Mindtree, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel provided facilities like 24-hour hot water, a cot, a chair, and a locker. Meal served was good, and the menu varied every day. The registration process was done at the college by paying the hostel fees in 2 to 3 installments of Rs.15,000, which was refunded while vacating the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in our college were good. There were 2 lecturers for every subject for some common subjects. All the faculty members were highly educated with some doctorate degrees and some of them hold experience in major companies like L&T. There were 25 faculty members.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Structural Engineering
reviews.review_title: One of the best college of my life .

detailed_review.Placements: The placement of our college is good. Last year students are eligible for campus placements. Many companies visited our college like Infotech, TCS, Wipro and many other companies provide good jobs to the students with a placement package offer of INR 12 Lacs per annum .
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facility of our college is very good. The rooms of the hostel are big and two students are living in one room. The fees of the hostel is affordable. The food in the canteen is good and the quality of food is good as we get healthy food. Pure drinking water facility in our hostel is available. I loved living in the hostel .
detailed_review.Faculty:
The course of M.Tech is good as the teachers of our college are very good and friendly with the students. They are highly qualified and skilled teachers. They are good in their field and their method of teaching is very good as they use simple language for their teaching. 
Exams are held in every semester.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NMAM Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good in our college. You will get placed only if you are good in aptitude and have proper domain knowledge related to electronics if you prefer core. Samsung recruited students with a salary package of 22 LPA. If you prefer IT, you should be good at DSA. So overall, it's your effort that matters because the placement department brings various companies on board for recruitment with a salary package of 3 LPA - 40 LPA. It depends on students' ability to crack the company assessment and interview to avail of good salary packages. More than 200 companies visited our college for recruitment along with mass hiring companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides good facilities like a hostel, food, a canteen, medical facilities, sports, etc. All classrooms, a library, and labs are well-equipped. The campus is Wi-Fi enabled. For placement-related activities, our college provides high-speed internet. If you have any issues, the respective department will help you.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good and well-qualified. Notes are also uploaded to the online moodle platform. The curriculum is up to date. Semester exams are easy, but sometimes external papers will be difficult. About 70% of students pass exams. You must refer to previous years' question papers to pass exams. You should do well in internals.

faqs.question: Is NMAM Institute of Technology hard to get?
faqs.answer: Generally, NMAM Institute of Technology does not have very high stipulation when it comes to admissions, albeit the several degree courses it may admit may be moderately competitive. The KCET or COMEDK entrance examination scores are usually the requirement to attend undergraduate classes like B.Tech. If a student wants to pursue his or her education from the KCET then the general range of the rank is between 10000-20000 depending on the branch such as Computer Science Engineering or others, where as for the other branches more rank is required. Regarding COMEDK, students preferred ranks are between 5000 to 12000 for admission to the best branches. The institute also looks into the academic performance in the qualification exams. Its acceptance rate is about 60-70%, so it is not very selective, yet, the prospective student has to engage in constant studying and preparing for entrance exams.

faqs.question: How can I take admission to NMAM Institute of Technology for MCA?
faqs.answer: To secure MCA admission at NMAM Institute of Technology: Step 1: Know Your Opponent – 50% in graduation, 10+2 pass with Mathematics. Step 2: Apply Online- Download application form from institute’s website and fill it. Step 3: KFIT KMAT/PGCET – KMAT/PGCET entrance exam. Step 4: Counseling – In accordance with eligibility, attend counseling meetings. Step 5: Document Verification – Pay fees, Verify documents. Key Requirements: - UG aggregate: 50% - 10+2 with Mathematics - Entrance exams: KMAT/PGCET - Counseling: Merit-based - Fees: Rs 140000 – Rs 350000 per annum.

faqs.question: What are the documents required for admission to NMAM Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: For admission to NMAM Institute of Technology, submit: Documents: Original and photocopy of the Tenth and Twelfth marks cards. Original and photocopy of UG/PG marks cards – COMEDK UGET score cards, KCET score cards, JEE Main score cards, GATE Score Cards, KMAT Score Cards - Transfer Certificate - Migration Certificate - Character Certificate - Aadhaar / PAN /Passport for photo identification. Caste Certificate if belongs to SC/ST/OBC/EWS category. Fees: - Application fee: INR 500-1000 - Admission fee: INR 50,000-1 Lakh -Tuition fee: INR 2.5-3.5 Lakhs per annum All the best for your admission

faqs.question: How can I get into NMAM Institute of Technology for UG/PG courses? Am I eligible for admission?
faqs.answer:
NMAM Institute of Technology has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility M.E./M.Tech Candidates must have passed qualifying examination or equivalent examination as prescribed by the Competent Authority and obtained an aggregate minimum of 50% marks (45% of marks in case of SC, ST and Category-I candidates) taken together in all the subjects of all the years/ semesters of the Degree Examination from any recognised institute/university.
Final year students can also apply on provisional basis.
Candidates must have valid GATE score. MCA Candidate should have studied Maths at 10+2 stage or at graduation level. B.E. / B.Tech Candidate must have passed in 2nd PUC / 12th Std / Equivalent Exam with English as one of the Languages and obtained in aggregate in Physics and Mathematics along with Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Biology / Electronics / Computer with the mentioned marks in aggregate from a recognised Institute/ University. college_info.college_name: NERIST: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Cutoff

highlights.summary:
Itanagar, Arunachal Pradesh's Nirjuli, is home to the North East Regional Institute of Science & Technology. The primary level (UG) & secondary level (PG) courses are offered by the institute.
The names of some of the famous courses offered at the institute:
North East Regional Institute of Science & Technology was created in the year 1984, & this institute is also acknowledged by the UGC & AICTE. The college is also known as NERIST. The college is accredited by the NAAC & NBA.
The institute has 3 departments, namely Engineering, Science, & Management Studies. Additionally, through these departments, BTech, BSc, MTech, MBA, & PhD, & many other courses are offered. The reason behind the fame of this institute is its faculty & infrastructure. Not only these components, but there are other imp details that students should know before applying for the course:
North East Regional Institute of Science & Technology Highlights 2025
Nirjuli, Itanagar, Arunachal Pradesh
UG, PG, Certificate, Diploma, Doctorate
BTech, MTech, BBA, BSc, MBA, PhD
PwC, IBM, Infosys, Taazaa, Ashok Leyland, Reliance, Jindal Steel, Wipro, Tech Mahindra

table.details: BTech, MTech, BBA, BSc, MBA, PhD
PwC, IBM, Infosys, Taazaa, Ashok Leyland, Reliance, Jindal Steel, Wipro, Tech Mahindra

college_info_program.intro:
Some of the popular courses at North East Regional Institute for Science and Technology include the flagship Engineering programs. Students can enroll in the Bachelor of Technology (BTech) courses to fulfil their aspirations for a career in Engineering and Technology. Management courses include BBA and MBA programs that lay a solid foundation for students in the Business Management fields.
NERIST also has in place a faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences and offers top-notch trainings to students in the Humanities realm. Agriculture and Forestry continue to be the sought-after specializations at NERIST.

NERIST Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has a good and favorable environment for good quality of studying.

detailed_review.Placements: This year, the placement rates for students at my college are impressive compared to previous years. I am from the ECE department, and companies are seeking skilled students rather than just those with good CGPAs. VLSI skills require a considerable amount of coding ability, and the focus is on the core domain of the department.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am a hosteler, and being a hosteler the quality of the room is quite good not much. If we compare it with the other private colleges the infrastructure quality needs to be improved as soon as possible. The size of the rooms is not enough for 2 people.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good, and the professors are highly qualified and knowledgeable at their equal level. No compromises are there in education. The exams are conducted at very high security. There are negligible amount of chance of cheating in college during exams. Highly range jammers are used during the exam conducting.
detailed_review.Other: I feel like NERIST is mostly likely focused on the development of the core branches but I would appreciate the college if they provide more opportunities to the other branch students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the things I am getting in my college. Especially for the placements.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, there are ample placement opportunities for Mechanical Department students. Most companies, such as Oil India Limited, L&T, and TCS, recruit here. The average package is between 10 and 12 LPA, which is good for new engineering graduates. All final-year students are actively seeking jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our departments, library, classrooms, and labs have good infrastructure. The Wi-Fi system offers 24/7 service. Hostel facilities are also decent, and for sports and games, there is a football turf, a volleyball court, and a gymnasium with all the necessary equipment. The mess food is quite okay—not particularly good or bad.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty members are well-informed and educated. They graduated from various colleges, including IIT Guwahati and IIT Bombay, among others. They possess strong teaching skills. The semester exams are easy if any student attends classes regularly. Teachers assign presentations.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen mechanical engineering as my ambition is in aeronautics and aircraft design. If more instructors were available for our software learning or structural design, it would be more beneficial. Our college hosts mainly two events: one is RACAF (college fest) and the other is SYNERGY (sports event). We enjoy them a lot. E

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Strong faculty, Industry- Relevant Curriculum, Vibrant Campus.

detailed_review.Placements: 60 percent of students were placed from my department. The highest package offered in my department was 1,200,000 LPA, and the lowest package was 300,000 LPA. The average package was above 400,000 LPA. Top recruiting companies were Tata Projects, L&T, and Vedanta.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Most departments are equipped with high-speed Wi-Fi to ensure seamless internet connectivity for research. Classrooms are typically equipped with multimedia facilities like projectors and smart boards. University libraries usually have a wide range of textbooks.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college has dedicated faculty who are approachable and willing to assist students. The faculty are typically well-qualified, with many holding advanced degrees (Masters or Ph.D.) in their respective fields. Our college has two exams: one mid-semester and one end-semester.
detailed_review.Other: The batch I am referring to consists of those who joined the course in 2021 and will graduate in 2025. I chose this course because of a strong interest in mechanical engineering coupled with a desire to pursue a career in the automotive industry.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: NERIST pros and cons. Hidden behind the hills of Northeast.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are average. The average per annum incomes which our college gives range from 3 LPA to 9 LPA. Many known companies do come, like L&T, TATA Projects, Vedanta, OIL India Ltd. Unknown small companies also come for non-technical posts. Otherwise, you can prepare well for GATE and get better placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Academic blocks and classroom infrastructure are average. You won't find broken tables and chairs in classrooms. However, hostels are the worst here. Every single room will either have broken windows or broken walls, and some have water leaks too. Even the electricity wiring is very bad; the way they have done the wiring in the hostel is so bad that it can't take heavy loads, and during summer, there is always the problem of electricity overloading. Drinking water supply is very bad, both in the hostel and academic blocks. The tube lights and bulbs we have to buy by ourselves.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are very good and have good knowledge. Unlike other institutes, our teachers are very engaging and frank with us students. They are open-minded and love to interact with us. They teach the concepts very well and try to make sure that we have understood the concept well. The exams are also quite good. The questions you get here make sure that you have understood the concept properly in the classroom.
detailed_review.Other: NEIRST has lots of events and other extracurricular activities. RACAF is a yearly college event which will help you showcase your talents in singing, dancing, photography, drawing, arts, and so many things. It's an event where you can make your hobbies better or explore other new hobbies. Then there is SHRISTI, a technical fest where you can apply your engineering knowledge and aptitude knowledge to solve puzzles and participate in various events like Robo Wars.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall Experience Was Best of My Knowledge: Great Campus Life and Very Good Environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Above 75% of students got placed last year. The highest package offered to students was 18 LPA by Power Grid, while the average package was 9.9 LPA. The top recruiting companies included Vedanta, Tata Projects, Oil, and Power Grid. More than 75% of students secured internships at Tata Projects and Vedanta.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My department is Electrical Engineering, and we have all possible labs, a library, and classrooms equipped with smart boards and projectors. There is 24/7 Wi-Fi availability in our department. In our hostel, we also have Wi-Fi, a common room for group interactions, various games courts, and a garage. The mess provides good quality food. On campus, there is an NHU (Nerist Health Unit) where a doctor is available 24/7.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers in our department are very helpful and qualified, with all of them holding doctorates in their subjects. The course curriculum is relevant and provides various industrial training opportunities for students. They plan trips to visit nearby industries for training. We have exams in one semester, including mid-semester and end-semester assessments. The semester exams are quite tough, requiring a minimum score of 35% to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Electrical Engineering because of my interest in electrical things, and there are great job and placement opportunities in this field. I wish our college had better transportation services and improved practical classes, as some equipment is quite old. Our college holds many events every year, such as the cultural fest called RACAF and the sports event called Synergy, along with various other cultural events. The campus crowd is fascinating, and the connectivity among different departments and classrooms is excellent. The atmosphere of our campus is beautiful, surrounded by greenery that provides fresh air and a pleasant environment. NCC and NSS are additional extracurricular activities available on campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Agricultural Engineering
reviews.review_title: More or less, the college is great.

detailed_review.Placements: So far, there have been very few placements in my department. The top companies are Amul and Nestle, but they really don't want to come so far away from the main land for recruitment. So the campus selection is really low. But the TNP cell is working hard on this.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The lab and the infrastructure are really good; we have all the equipment that we need for our business, whether in a farm lab or a food lab. The medical facility is also good; there is everything available for indoor and outdoor games, and the Wi-Fi is also great.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are also good. The teaching quality is also good; we have specialized labs and lab attendees for every subject. In the farm machinery domain, we are industry-ready, but due to the scarcity of faculty in the food domain, we have less knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: The campus life is really great; we have a great ambience, and the campus is really silent. A cultural festival like Sonabyss Racaff is the oldest cultural festival in Arunachal Pradesh, and a technical festival like Shristi is really good for us.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college days in my university .

detailed_review.Placements: This institution guarantee 90% placement. The highest package till now is 18 lacs, and the average package is 8 Lacs. Companies like OIL INDIA, GOOGLE, VEDANTA, TATA, BYJU's, NYKAA, etc. offer campus placements. The companies offers good job roles and some of our alumni are now world-wide.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: This institution has very good faculty and infrastructure. Every professor is a Ph.D. holder, very knowledgeable and approachable. The hostel rooms are decent. A 24-hour Wi-Fi connection is available. The quality of food is average. The buildings are a bit old but the overall experience is decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are humble, approachable highly educated and well experienced. Moreover, our faculty members also makes students ready to face the industry. The semester exams are liberal the pass percentage is around 70 %. Every semester has two main exams: midterm and endterm.
detailed_review.Other: I'm a mechanical engineering student and I chose this subject because our department has the best infrastructure and faculty. The laboratory is well equipped. Apart from these, the institution has certain festivals, such as Synergy, which is the sports event, and RACAF, which is the annual cultural event.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Quality education at NERIST.

detailed_review.Placements: In NERIST there is good placement. The maximum placement was 22 LPA. Every year, there are many placements of every branch. This college has a decent placement record, with a significant percentage of students being placed at various companies. It is a good college in the north-east region.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: NERIST offers various courses in various disciplines, including engineering, technology, sciences, and management. The infrastructure for each course typically includes classrooms equipped with modern teaching aids, laboratories with state-of-the-art equipment for practical sessions, and research computer labs with high-speed internet connectivity. They also provide hostels for their students, especially those who come from different parts of the region and beyond.
detailed_review.Faculty: NERIST typically employs a team of highly qualified and experienced faculty members across various disciplines. These faculty members hold degrees from reputed institutions and often have industry experience as well. They have many extracurricular activities like NCC, NSS, and others. The examination in this institute follows a structured examination system designed to assess students' understanding of the course material, practical sessions, and overall academic performance.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life at NERIST, Arunachal Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: Very poor placements; 40/450 students got placed with the highest package of 8 LPA and the lowest of 2.16 LPA. There is no dedicated placement officer and very poor conditions for placement but its getting better, and some new initiatives are being taken to make placements better.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
As the institute is very old, the infrastructure is very old: small classrooms, a lack of technology, no smart classes, no advanced labs, old labs with sufficient technician, lack of types of equipment, etc.
But in this regard, new buildings are being constructed and slowly, things are getting better.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Some old teachers are very good and helpful but most of them are retiring and no new faculty members are being recruited. Research scholars take classes but they are not that efficient and inexperienced.
The curriculum is mostly relevant, with some unusual things.
Exams are conducted with the utmost seriousness.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I recommend students to take admission to this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Many students get placed in our college in many reputed companies. It is a good college for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facility is good. Buildings, water, food, and Wi-Fi are good. Students can easily adjust well on campus within a few days. The environment of the college is student-friendly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in our college are good, friendly, and helpful. They teach students in an easily understandable manner. Examination process is very good with many rules and regulations.
detailed_review.Other: It is a good engineering college.

reviews.course: Certificate in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology (NERIST).

detailed_review.Placements: Top recruiting companies like OIL, ICOL, BHEL, etc., visit our campus. Almost 41% of students are placed. The salary package has increased by 10%.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our classrooms are huge and neat. Our college has old infrastructure. We have a central library. It is the largest library in the state. We have two playgrounds. A gym is available. Wi-Fi is available in the hostel and library. Our college has good labs, classes, and seminar halls.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are qualified and knowledgeable. The course curriculum is similar to that of other famous institutes like IITs and NITs. A CGPA of 6.5 is required to pass. Almost 75% of attendance is required to be eligible for semester exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has good infrastructure and facilities and is the best place for socialising.

detailed_review.Placements: In the mechanical department, last year's final year batch had 45 students, out of which more than 50% of students got placed, about 10 students were preparing for GATE, 5 students were into MBA courses, and around 5-6 students were looking for placements. The highest salary package offered was 20 LPA by Oil. The lowest salary package offered was 4 LPA by several IT companies. Top recruiting companies were Oil, IOCL, BHEL, NEPCO, NHPC, NTPC, NRL, Tata, Tisco, Mahindra, etc. About 20% of students got internships in some private and government firms such as NRL, etc. The top role offered was a senior executive engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is under the central government. The infrastructure of our college is good. Our college provides all necessary facilities like smart classrooms, Wi-Fi, air conditioners, speakers, etc. All the modern equipment is available in labs. The infrastructure of the hostel is a bit old and needs some renovation. The mess food has a good value for money.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful. They always help us with our studies. Our institute is a deemed university, and it is easy and convenient to get from our respective course coordinators regarding subject and exam matters. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students industry-ready, as it is well-prepared by UGC. Semester exams are moderate. Students can pass if they study a few days before exams. The pass percentage is 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because I have an interest in mechanical engineering. I cracked the entrance exam and got mechanical engineering. Our new course is good and vast. Our college hosts the Sonabyss festival, which is the largest cultural event in our state.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college has good infrastructure and facilities but dissatisfied with hostels.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are fine but few companies like OIL IOCL, etc. come for placement. Students opt for internships during summer from pre-final and final years. Around 3 to 4 students got placement in OIL and IOCL with 20 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure for classes is good with digital and air-conditioner facilities. The size of the accommodation is huge but the hostel is not good. The water leakage problem is there and is still not fixed which is very problematic during rainy days.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are not easy. Few teachers are helpful few are not but are qualified and knowledgeable. Students are thought based on the course they have chosen. The pass percentage is 6.5 CGPA. Attendance of 75% is required for writing exams.
detailed_review.Other: Campus surroundings are good. College is recommended for students who like sports and for NE students.

reviews.course: Diploma in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is a good college for studying engineering. Students from here doing jobs abroad.

detailed_review.Placements: It is a normal engineering college, not like IIT so student placements are not good, but many students get placed. Around 10% of students are placed because of covid-19 in the previous year. The minimum salary package offered is 4 LPA. I heard from a senior that ONGC came in a particular year. In the previous year, students did not go for any internships, but this year students are going for internships in a company name JCV Company Limited.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is available like Wi-Fi, laboratories, classrooms, and a library. But infrastructure is not good but now it is improving. In the hostel everything is good. Rooms are very good but some are very dirty so it depends on students to get a good room. Mess is good but someday food is not good. The medical facilities are very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very talented. They are teaching to their best level. Teachers are well qualified. This semester students are getting ready for the industry. Semester exams are moderate, it is heard if students do not study well. The pass percentage is around 30%.

reviews.course: Certificate in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Honest review of NERIST in 2022.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are not so good in our college as it resides in remote area of Arunachal Pradesh in the North East region. Some of the public sector companies visit the campus for placements which include Tata, Asahi Glass, ONGC, OIL, NHPC, etc. Apart from that, other private companies like Tech Mahindra also visit the campus for placements at irregular intervals. But, this year it has been good in terms of placement as recently Google visited the campus for a placement with around 17 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is average as the existing infrastructure of the building dates back in the era of 2000s. As the institute was established in 1980s, the buildings of the hostel block have turned much old and there is a urgent need of renovation. Apart from that, hostel has good facilities in terms of living experience, which includes good food quality. The hostels have good Wi-Fi connection, which is an advantage for the students. The hostel complex has good number of shops. Also, we have basketball courts, badminton courts, tennis courts and all other sports facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified in NERIST, most of them come from other states of the country as well. Teachers are well-trained in IITs and NITs of the country. But, one of the major problems of the institutes teaching curriculum is that Ph.D. students are given the job to teach the students, which makes it bad for the students. Because Ph.D. students are not keen to teach the students for free. This is the only problem that the institute has for a long time. Apart from that all courses are good and have good pass percentages among the students. Semester results are also adequately maintained by the hard working students with the aid of online study materials.
detailed_review.Other: NERIST has a rich and vibrant culture where students from all the states of Northeast come to study together. The institute holds beautiful cultural festivals that enlighten the experience of studying in the campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: There is value for money, and it is a central university in the Himalayas.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost every student who searched for a job in our batch got one job, while others went to foreign or joined IITs for higher studies. Companies like Infosys, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, TCS and many more visit here for placements. Indian Army and some PSUs also visit the campus, but you need to be from the northeast region to be selected in those companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are old but in good condition here. There is a total of 8 hostels for boys and 2 hostels for girls. First-year students get their own hostel, and it is very good for them. You will love the serene view of the mountains. There is Wi-Fi for 24 hours and highly equipped labs. Good food is available 3 times a day.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers here are well qualified and very helpful. You just have to ask them anything after class. They also conduct doubts clearing sessions on Sunday. Attendance is compulsory. Semester exams are very good and neither very tough nor very easy. You have to study, and there is no other way.
detailed_review.Other: Sonabyss is our cultural fest, and an annual sports meet is organised. Racaf is another cultural fest, and the technical fest named Shristi is organised.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I suggest you search for better colleges and keep it as the last option.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement attempts were not made here. Our college always makes excuses and blames the students. According to the college, the students are not good enough. However, the same students will get jobs on their own performance. All the high-profile jobs grabbed by alumni have been through off-campus placements. But our college shows wrong data that it has offered those jobs to just maintain its rank.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Lab equipment is below average here, and there is no software. You will need permission to use anything. The internet is very fast, but there are useless restrictions on everything. There is a censored life. The hostel authorities are apt in torturing students. The cleanliness is very bad, and unhygienic food is served. If you say something about it, they will make a wrong case of indiscipline and disturb you with legal consequences.
detailed_review.Faculty: Except for some faculty members, none of the others is good. Some faculty members even don't know the fundamentals and are quite arrogant. However, lab staff members are good. The semester exams are good. Some faculty members have maintained the standard well. Only for them, the department is still thriving.
detailed_review.Other: The college used to be good, but good students have left the college. There are many politics at the administrative level. The administration is corrupted, so the functioning of the college is difficult.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: Around everyone who wants a job got placed and the rest of the students opt for M.Tech. The highest salary package offered was 16 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered was 3.5 LPA. Top recruiter was Infosys and Power Grid. Indian Army and Airforce were also visited for SSB selection. TCS, Tech Mahindra, Smart Tech, and others also visit to hire students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Students will get very high-speed internet connectivity along with a college email ID. Hostels were old but still good to live in. Rooms were 2 sharing but will get a single room in final year. Football was the most prominent sport in this college and students will see regular sports tournaments.
detailed_review.Faculty: Like any other central government institution, our college also had very qualified teachers. They were helpful and depends on circumstances. The teaching quality was good. College courses were always revamped so it was relevant. Semester exams were difficult, students will feel the heat once they were in.
detailed_review.Other: I studied ECE and from classes for 2019.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Physics
reviews.review_title: It is a good institution, especially for engineering.

detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms of our college are good. All kinds of instruments are available for practicals. The campus is not so good, but Wi-Fi is available on the campus. Hostel fee is a little expensive. Food provided is quite good. There is a central library where you will get all the necessary books. The medical facility is available in the campus. There is a free gym in the college. The infrastructure of the compound is not much attractive. Overall, you can study here if you don't get admission in Assam.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly educated and helpful. The professors are highly educated. But as all the universities, some are not much good in teaching. Self-study is more important. Still, I haven't got any campus interview for placement. Campus interview happens only for engineering students.
detailed_review.Other: I love physics, that's why I chose it. The scholarship is available here under the national scholarship portal.Department of physics is quite good. The syllabus of the department contains all the topics that are in the NET exam. This department also provides a PhD course.  Overall you can study here if you don't get admission in Assam.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Enjoyed NERIST life with good faculty members but with a certain amount of hardship and sacrifice.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 33% of the students got placed. Maximum CTC was 3.6 LPA. Mostly IT companies visited our campus for recruitment. Only Bosch visited our campus for recruitment in the field of core mechanical engineering. Placement in the core mechanical/civil engineering jobs is very poor. Students prepare for GATE and try to get into good colleges for M.Tech.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs have all the equipment necessary to carry out experiments as part of the curriculum, but they are not well maintained. Most of them are out of working condition. Classrooms are unhygienic. Mess and dining hall are also unhygienic. Medical facilities are not good. Most of the time, the health centre remains closed as the doctors practice privately.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were well qualified and very supportive. Classes were conducted regularly, and the way of explanation was pretty good. The course curriculum was also good but lagged in certain areas to make the student's industry-ready. Practical classes were not conducted regularly.

college_info.college_name: NERIST Admission 2025: Eligibility, Selection Process, Fees & Last Dates

faqs.question: Can I join NERIST directly?
faqs.answer: No, you have to give different exams or score for getting admission in different courses  of the college respectively. Every course has its own admission criteria. As like for admission in MBA candidate should have with valid CAT/ MAT score or they  have to give NERIST admission test. Similarly, for all the other courses different exams are conducted by the institutes or scores of different exams are required for admission. It offers 10+2 level certificate courses, post-10+2 Diploma courses, and degree programs. The degree programs offered at NERIST include BTech, BSc (Forestry Stream), MTech, MBA, MSc, and PhD programs. Various conducted by them for admission purposes are like: NEE-I, NEE-II. and NEE-III, so, these are conducted by the institute itself. For admission to the UG level degree courses, the institute admits students via NEE-III and NEE-II exams. Candidates seeking admission to the NERIST BTech programme must take NEE-III for lateral entry or they may directly be admitted through the Diploma module to the BTech degree module. Whereas, the candidates seeking admission to the BSc degree module have to qualify for the NEE-II exam after their 10+2 in PCB. Apart from NEE-II & NEE-III, NERIST also accepts the JEE Main entrance scores for BTech admissions.

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for MBA at NERIST?
faqs.answer: The total intake for the MBA programme is 30 . The North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology (NERIST) offers a full time two year (4 semesters) MBA program. It offers MBA in 5 specializations namely Human Resources Management, Marketing Management, Systems Management, Finance, and Operation Management. Bachelor's degree in UGC or AICTE accredited disciplines/courses, with 55% marks in total and 50% for the category of SC/ST. The selection process for MBA is divided into two parts: Part I: NEPGET Part II: Group Discussion & Personal Interview (GDPI)

faqs.question: Does NERIST accept MAT score?
faqs.answer: The North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology (NERIST) offers a full time two year (4 semesters) MBA program. It offers MBA in 5 specializations namely Human Resources Management, Marketing Management, Systems Management, Finance, and Operation Management. And, admission to MBA is open to all Indian Nationals. The institute accepts valid scores of CAT/ MAT /XAT. Otherwise, candidates can appear for the NEPGET to qualify for admissions. so, basically yes, it accepts MAT score. Other than that its eligibilty crieteria is that the student should have a bachelor's degree in UGC or AICTE accredited disciplines/courses, with 55% marks in total and 50% for the category of SC/ST. Students can also give NEPGET for admission in it and they can apply through the official website and after that selected students are  called further for group discussion and personal interview based on marks obtained in NEPGET or scores obtained in CAT/CMAT/MAT/XAT.

faqs.question: When is NERIST application forms out?
faqs.answer: NERIST NEE 2025 Application Form: The North Eastern Regional Institute of Science and Technology (NERIST) will release the NERIST NEE 2025 application form. The application process for NEE-I, NEE-II and NEE-III will start together and candidates can apply for NEE as per their choice of course. The NEE-II exam is held for admission in BTech and BSc (Hons) in Forestry. Whereas, NEE-I is held for admission in certificate courses and the NEE-III is held for BTech LE admissions. The entire process of filling online application form can be completed in below mentioned 9 steps. The steps include registration, activation, programme selection, filling details in the form, uploading scanned images, filling in academic details, selecting the NEE exam centre, and reviewing the form and fee payment.
