SMVDU Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: M.A. In Economics
reviews.review_title: SMVDU has a scenic campus, supportive faculty, good academics, and improving placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements for our batch in the economics and related courses are satisfactory. 70 to 75 percent of students are successfully placed. The highest package offered is 12 LPA, the lowest package is around 3.5 LPA, and the average package is 6 LPA to 7 LPA. Top recruiters included Deloitte, TCS, Wipro, Infosys, HCL, and ICICI Bank. 60 percent of students got internships in reputed organizations such as NITI Aayog, state government departments, and corporates. The most offered roles are business analyst, data analyst, financial consultant, research associate, and management trainee.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: SMVDU has modern facilities, with Wi-Fi-enabled classrooms, well-equipped labs, a central library, and digital resources. Hostels are clean with basic amenities, 24X7 internet, and study areas. Mess and canteen serve hygienic food. Medical center, sports complex, gym, and grounds support student health, and recreation is available for development.
detailed_review.Faculty: At SMVDU, teachers are highly qualified, supportive, and approachable, ensuring conceptual clarity and practical exposure. Teaching quality is good, blending lectures with projects and presentations. The curriculum is regularly updated, industry-oriented, and includes internships, workshops, and skill-based courses to make students industry-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult. It focuses on understanding rather than written learning, and can be cleared with consistent preparation. The pass percentage remains high, usually above 90 percent, as faculty guide tutorials and remedial sessions. The academic environment is balanced, preparing students for both higher studies and professional careers.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course at SMVDU for its reputed faculty, industry-oriented curriculum, and serene campus environment. The best things are the quality of teaching, research opportunities, and exposure through workshops and internships. Improvements could be made in core company placements and increasing industry collaborations. University hosts vibrant events like Tatva, Verve, and other cultural/technical fests. It brings energy to campus life. Campus crowd is diverse, friendly, and cooperative. Scholarships are based on merit and need. The college is surrounded by scenic hills, with good facilities, extracurricular activities, and sports. SMVDU provides a holistic environment for academic and personal growth.

reviews.course: B.A. (Hons.) In Economics
reviews.review_title: The college has good infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: A few of them were placed because there is a smaller mass of people in economics. That's one of the reasons. I am not sure about the package, but I can say a decent amount. In different courses, students got internships and even placements. Range and ICICI are the recruiting companies. HR and research analyst are the common roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is the main facility, which is helpful for the students. Wi-Fi facility is available for both students and faculty members. There are several messes and canteens available for different houses. A gymnasium is available for hostel students. Ground available for all the students. University sports games are held among different houses.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful and skilled in their spheres of knowledge. The quality of teaching is awesome. Levels of semester exams are good. The pass percentage was the same as 33%, and there are some exceptions. There are extra technical subjects there for extra skills.
detailed_review.Other: I selected this course because it provides several opportunities in all spheres of life, whether it is the government or the private sector. Specifically for the banking sector. It also provides great exposure to the private sector.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is surrounded by a heaven.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is average in this university, generally ranging between 5 to 6 LPA as the average salary. They bring good companies like Orange, Amazon, and TCS for student recruitment. They also provide opportunities for students to attend off-campus placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college facilities are very good and well-provided. It also has a good mess facility. The campus spans 450 acres with lush greenery and is surrounded by the beautiful Trikuta mountain ranges, which enhance the beauty of the campus and its surroundings.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are nice, but most of them are rude in nature. This makes students hesitate to approach them, which is why they can’t fully benefit from their knowledge. But, not all faculty members are like this, many of them are kind and share their knowledge completely with students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: SMVDU: Where learning meets nature.

detailed_review.Placements: Here at SMVDU, most students got placed. In the case branch, the average package is 5 to 6 LPA, and the highest this year is 32.5 LPA. Some of the top recruiters are Wipro Accenture, Zscaler Vi, L&T, TCS, etc. Students have to do internships in the 4th, 6th, and 8th semesters; it is compulsory.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good on the campus, which is 474 acres. The campus has Wi-Fi in all areas, classes, labs, and a central library. The food is also better in SMVDU. There are two girls' and five boys' hostels. It has its central gym for boys and girls. You are provided full medical assistance in the hospital. All the bills are paid by the university. It has all the sports facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers are well experienced and qualified in their domain and subject. Professors also use PPTs for a better understanding of concepts and provide lab assistance. The industry-based course is followed to help students. Semester exams are of good level and relative marking in the result is followed.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: College surrounded by trikuta hills.

detailed_review.Placements: TCS, Wipro, L&T, and other companies visited my college every year. The highest package was 12 LPA, and the lowest package was 4 LPA. If someone wanted to do internships our college also provided internships to students. Students need to maintain CGPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure was good. College provided high-speed internet connectivity and smart classes. There was a big library. Classrooms were well organized and equipped with CCTV cameras. Hostel infrastructure was good. But hostel food was not that good. There was a huge sports ground also.
detailed_review.Faculty: Highly qualified teachers were there. Good projects to train our future. Difficulty of the exam was moderate. It covered everything tough in class. 36 marks out of 100 were passing marks. The students were made ready to face all the difficulties, they will face during their jobs through courses.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the college because of its good infrastructure and good ranking.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good campus life and excellent campus area.

detailed_review.Placements: 40% of students got placed in my course. 1 LPA is the lowest package, 3 LPA is the average package and 17 LPA is the highest package. L&T Construction, Ambuja Cement, and Pidilite are the top recruiters. Almost 30% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are high-tech labs and good Wi-Fi connectivity. Projectors are available in classrooms. Library has huge variety of books. Two sharing rooms are available in hostel. 4 badminton courts are available in my hostel. A large mess is available with good quality food. A medical dispensary is available on the campus with ambulance.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, highly qualified, and with better experience. Course curriculum is relevant and it surely makes students industry-ready. Semester examinations are not much difficult and easy to pass and the pass percentage is 33%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest and there is nothing to improve about my course. There is an annual fest celebrated with full enthusiasm.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: In summary, I can say that our college is not as good as IITs but still a good choice for students.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good for our branch compared to other branches in our college. About 60% to 70% of students got placed last year. The highest package was around 18 LPA and the average package was around 7 LPA-8 LPA. There are several companies in which the students got placed such as Larsen & Toubro, Airtel, Jio, Nvidea, etc. There are also various internship programs for college students in various companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are good facilities and infrastructure in our labs and classrooms, all the appliances are as good as new. Books availability is also good enough in library. Hostel is good but bathroom conditions are so bad. Rooms are clean and we get one single bed with one table and chair along with an almirah.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are excellent because they are helpful as well as supportive. Teachers are well-qualified as well as knowledgeable and deliver good quality teaching. Course curriculum is relevant and knowledgeable. Semester exams are not much difficult but not that easy. The difficulty level of exams is moderate. We need to score 36% to pass a subject.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B.Tech in electronics and communication engineering because in this college the highest placing branch is ECE. My interest in this branch is very good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Affordable college for B.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at our colleges are not good and have a dedicated placement cell that actively works to secure job opportunity. Placements are not that decent as the opportunities are negligible.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good. College provides high-speed internet connectivity and smart classes. There is a big library and classrooms are well-organized and equipped with CCTV cameras. Hostel food is not that good but provides variety in food. There is a huge sports ground also.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members and curriculum in our college are amazing. The exam is moderate to tough. It makes students industry-ready. Pass percentage for the exam is 33% and requires 75% attendance to appear in the exam. There are 2 exams in the semester 1st is midsem and 2nd is major. Course curriculum is well-structured that blends theoretical knowledge with practical application.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Detailed review of SMVDU.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in civil engineering branch, and about 50% of students got placed. The highest package is 30 LPA and the average is 7 LPA. The top recruiters for our college are L&T, Bosch, etc. About 70% of students got internships in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of our department is not so good. We don't have our department we have to study in the architecture department. In our hostel, rooms are very big and clean but hostels washrooms are so bad even animals can't go there. Mess food is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members of our college are very good, they are well-educated and friendly with students. They clear our doubts but the teaching method is old because of the infrastructure we don't have smart boards. The semester level exam is moderate to difficult. Almost 90% of students get passed.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with all facilities, but the hostel infrastructure is not good. Overall, good.

detailed_review.Placements: I don't know much about placements because I am currently in my 2nd semester, and placements start from the 7th semester. However, I have heard from some seniors that placements for the civil branch are pretty average. The average package is 3-4 LPA. A minimum CGPA of 6.5 and no backlogs for sitting in placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the university, the civil branch has a combined department with architecture, where they provide three classrooms for civil students and some labs. The university also has a one central library and a gym. In the hostel, the university provides all basic necessities, but the only reason they lack is cleanliness, as hostels are not up to that level. The food provided is not good. But the overall experience is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members of the civil branch are very good, and all teachers are well-qualified, but sometimes they fail to connect with students. The civil engineering course provides us with all theoretical knowledge and also teaches us about the industry and the future of civil engineering. There are two exams in one semester a minor exam which is of 20 marks and one major exam of 40 marks. The rest 40 marks depend on the professor, whether he can take quiz or assignment.
detailed_review.Other: The only reason I chose this course is because of my family background, and I also know some professors. The only thing I would like them to improve is that they should give more practical knowledge and also put less pressure on students. The college has many fests and functions, including Ekatva, Musical Fest, Dance Club, and Zenith Club. The university also has extracurricular activities and tournaments for sports like Sarang.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: An honest and unbiased review of Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently in my first year second semester in civil engineering. There are only 28 students in my batch. We don't know about our placements but the average placement is 5 LPA which is lower than expected. The number of students placed is also less than expected.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the campus is quite good. The hostel is also very nice. Rooms are very neat and look more like hotel rooms. The infrastructure of our washrooms is even worse than railway toilets. There is Wi-Fi everywhere. There is a library inside the hostel. You can play badminton. We have a very large ground on our campus where you can play any sport.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have well-qualified faculty, especially in my course which is civil engineering. The faculty is very well-qualified, knowledgeable, and helpful. I don't know much about the curriculum, but it seems currently the curriculum of all the branches is the same for the first year. The semester exams are not too easy and not too hard. The minimum percentage required to pass is 36%.
detailed_review.Other: The best thing about our college is the social life and the well-planned structure. Roads inside the college you can go from anywhere and can end up in the place you want on the map. The building is very good. There is a lot of crowd in college that is all students. The nightlife of the college is also very good. The view is very good. The season and the weather are just amazing.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placements are bad, rare fests, great restrictions on girls, not worth it.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a B.Tech computer science student, I'm passing out in 2025. Around 30%-40% of students got placed but almost half of them were placed in marketing where the companies were offering Rs. 20,000 per month. Other than that Infosys offered 3.5 LPA, Accenture offered 4 LPA, Range offered 5 LPA, and Cognizant offered 3.5 LPA, 5.5 LPA, and 6.7 LPA (results haven't been disclosed yet). The highest package was offered by Forbess Marshal, which is 7.8 LPA but it selected only 1 student from CSE. The placement has been worsening year by year here and it's not worth it. The location of this for placement is also not good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are just fine like the hostels are supposed to be. There's Wi-Fi available here but you cannot rely on it, there are frequent shutdowns, apart from that websites like Quora are banned on the university Wi-Fi. Classrooms are fine but you can expect the projectors to not work. Initially, the classes for CSE were held in a lecture theatre which has the facility AC and projectors working there but later on, they were shifted to classrooms. Library is fine, equipped with AC and you can find books related to your course. Labs are pretty outdated.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are fine and lenient. You cannot expect all of them to be good but they are just fine. The course content however I'll say is pretty outdated, it definitely won't make you industry-ready. You can get a good grade by studying 1 night before the exam, to pass you need to have at least 33 marks in the subject out of 100, which is pretty easy. Exams are checked by subject teachers.
detailed_review.Other: I would not recommend you to join this college unless you are a local. The crowd is not good, the university spends the least it can for extracurricular activities. Campus surroundings are just like semi-developed villages, there are a lot of unnecessary restrictions, especially on girls. Fest are conducted once a semester if you are lucky. For connectivity you can use auto, metadors are also there but they are overcrowded and their frequency is low.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mathematics and Computing
reviews.review_title: College and Clubs are inactive with no fest.

detailed_review.Placements: Mathematics and Computing is a new branch introduced here. Placements in this batch are not recorded, as the first batch will pass out in 2028. However, college's placement status is poor. No companies are interested in hiring students from this college, as the placement record shows that only 20-30 students from the 2024 pass-out batch get placed, with the package as low as 2-3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Rooms are not well-maintained, but the campus looks beautiful, especially at night. The hostel is different for students of different years. The 1st-year hostel is good. All other hostels have a badminton court and a basketball court, which is good and makes our hostel life beautiful.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is not well maintained, and the faculty is too strict about attendance, but some are not strict. The marking scheme seems biased, as some local students from Jammu benefit from higher lab marks and internal marks. Jammu students are favored, while students from outside are not treated as well in all aspects. Teachers are also biased here. Courses are not good here, as both faculty and students are focused only on academics.
detailed_review.Other: I know about the course, and due to its future potential, I chose MNC as my course. Some practical knowledge is implemented, but the college has no active clubs that work in favor of students, and no fests are happening. This can be improved to give students more practical and hands-on experience. Scholarships are available based on JEE Main rank and other meritorious exams. However, the crowd here favors Jammu students, which sometimes creates disturbance and ruins the hostel facilities. All the administration also favors them.

reviews.course: Discontinued (AUG 2025) Integrated BBA (Hons.) + MBA
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied, etc.

detailed_review.Placements: 100+ students are enrolled in this course, and many have had great success in their careers. The highest package is 20 Lacs for students with a 7+ CGPA. There are 3 practical and 2 theory classes every week. Teachers help in building up the confidence of the students with all their best efforts.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good. Air quality is also good, and the morning view of Vaishno Devi is completely divine and mesmerizing. Hostels are also good. Each floor has Wi-Fi connections and LAN. Every student has their own keys, one table, one chair, and B.Ed. The canteen prices are also reasonable. During exams, it's open till 3-4 am to provide students with what they need.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are mid-term exams of 20 marks theory, 20 for our presentations, which every student gives on their own. 40 is again for theory, which we call major exams, and 20 is for a quiz taken every 2 weeks. These help in revision for students, and they learn new things.
detailed_review.Other: I'm lucky to enroll here and want more people to join and make their future better.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, the college is good as compared to other private colleges.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is good but not as good as NITs or IIITs. Despite being a GFTI, you have to rely more on your skill than depending on the college. Here, you are provided with a good environment and have the opportunity to grow. Good internship opportunities and good packages as compared to other private colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are well maintained, well equipped with internet and lifts and they have attached common washrooms for each floor and are well cleaned and hygienic. And hostel accommodation is like home and the mess food is also good. They have a variety of menu items, so you will never get bored of the menu.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are good. Sometimes they are strict when it comes to 75% attendance but not all the teachers, but some of them are strict about 5% attendance. The curriculum is good and well structured. It is easy to pass the exam, as the teachers are well qualified, helpful and knowledgeable.
detailed_review.Other: The environment is clean, safe, and calm.

reviews.course: Integrated B.A. (Hons.) + M.A. in English
reviews.review_title: Good faculty, infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: As my course was not technical, very few recruitment companies had arrived, but professionals were there, also varying from banks to school departments in particular streams. Most of the students actually pursued higher education in my batch so that they could get the most out of it.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure provided by the university were sufficient for a student, with high-speed internet, a library, and many other things. There is a grocery store on the campus where you can get anything you want based on the items needed. Apart from these, the hostels are even good, though sometimes the mess food is a bit average.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are quite helpful to you and even guide you for your betterment in the field and what more you can achieve in the field. They will help you if you have any doubts about the course. In my batch, the course curriculum of my field was sufficient to gain a lot of knowledge.

reviews.course: Discontinued (AUG 2025) Integrated B.A. (Hons.) + M.A. in Economics
reviews.review_title: The college is not good for study purposes. You will only get placement in B.Tech and MBA.

detailed_review.Placements: A minimum of 50% in 12th is required to join economics. There are no placements offered in this course. Only for B.Tech and MBA will you get placement, and you will learn zero skills here. You only study for exams. This university doesn't do any fests or student activities to engage students. The quality of the university is getting poorer day by day.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are good. A LAN port is available for Wi-Fi service in every room. Food quality is also not good. It depends on the cook, whether they want to make good food or not. Even for a wealthy person, washrooms are not good. Even in some hostels, there are only Indian-style toilets.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful while learning the course. Semester exams are not difficult. Even if you study the day before the exam, you can easily pass it, but you will not learn anything from this course because the exam pattern is very easy. Still, students fail and request teachers to pass them. The system here is very poor.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to go for UPSC, and economics will help me in that. Otherwise, the economics department is no good. You will get no exposure while studying, just old-style study, which is not good in today's time.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Education at the foothills of Trikuta

detailed_review.Placements:
At least 60 percent of students get selected every year from the college.
The highest package is 20 LPA and the lowest package is 5 LPA .
The top recruiting company is Orange. Also, the semiconductor industry is active here in our college. People get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The ambience of the university is very nice, and therefore there is a piece of nature in the environment.  Peace and an ambitious environment are also there. Students have hostel and mess facilities, and they have a lot of sports facilities too. Enjoy the mountains.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, the teachers are qualified enough and knowledgeable.  The course which I have chosen is also good, and therefore I chose this course . So that the semiconductor industry is getting a boost, and that is the reason to choose this department for myself.

reviews.course: Discontinued (AUG 2025) Integrated B.A. (Hons.) + M.A. in Economics
reviews.review_title: If you love environment then this university is for you.

detailed_review.Placements:
1: More than 150 students are placed.
2: There is currently no placement in economics but internships are available. 
3: Microsoft, etc. are the top recruiters. 
4: Internships from our courses are mainly in economic services like accounts, data handling, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
The facilities of shri Mata vaishno devi University is too good and very supportive towards the students, the environment is very good in the campus; and the class rooms are good. 
There are 6 hostel for boys and 3 hostels for girls With that, the mess food is good and every hostel have its own CD cafes. The medical services are very good; we have a medical aid centre on campus, which is 24/7 open. Sports events like Satarang [inter house ] and interdepartmental matches Goonj [inter university] are organized.
detailed_review.Faculty:
The teaching quality was very impressive. The professors of Shri Mata vaishno devi University are very intelligent and very supportive towards the students; they are always available for the help of the students.
Some courses like MBA,  economics , mech, etc. are offered. 
The passing percentage is 80 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you think that you'll manage out and you can study hard then WELCOME TO SMVDU.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement here in my college is just average, maximum strength get placed but not on a very decent package. Highest package in the year 2024 was 19 LPA and average was around 4-5 LPA. The top recruiting companies which came was TCS, BHEL, Orange etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is one central library, in which you can go and study or you can issue any book. Wifi is available everywhere in the campus, There are 4 lecture theatre available in my campus. Hostels are also good, canteen are open till 8 pm. Don't expect that you're going to get a very awesome food from the mess. There are courts available for sports, indoor badminton court or one sports complex and other games are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: I chose this college because I was getting CSE branch, and placement here is decent. However you'll not get a very good exposure from here, but if you don't have any choice left and you are interested in CSE, this college will be a good shot. Academics here is good and faculties are also helpful. Here one mid-semester and major exams occur.

college_info.college_name: SMVDU Admissions 2025: CUET, Eligibility, Cutoff, Date & Fee

faqs.question: Can I get admission in SMVDU without CUET?
faqs.answer: SMVDU admission process are both entrance and merit-based followed by counselling. SMVDU accepts the admission on the basis of CUET exam for most of the UG & PG courses.  For few courses such as BTech, MBA, M.Tech admission are based on JEE/CAT/MAT/GATE/CCMT.

faqs.question: What is the JEE Main cutoff for SMVDU?
faqs.answer: SMVDU admissions to BTech and BArch courses is based on JEE Main cutoff 2023 for several specialisations. Tabulated below are the last round closing ranks for SMVDU:

faqs.question: What is the last date to apply for SMVDU 2024?
faqs.answer: SMVDU conducts application process in two-phases. For Phase 1 , the last date of closing of application forms for BTech / BArch / MSc/ MA courses is in May. For BTech/BArch/BA/BSc/BBA, the opening date of application forms for Phase 2 are available estimately after 15 days of the declaration of results.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: How are B.Tech placements at SMVDU?
faqs.answer: According to NIRF report 2023, 164 BTech, 11 MTech, 68 MBA, 4 Integrated MBA and 13 BArch students were placed during SMVDU placements 2022. The median package offered to BTech and M.Tech students stood at INR 4.6 LPA and INR 4.01 LPA.The placements at the college are overall good and the students have good reviews about the placements.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for MBA at Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University?
faqs.answer: First of all, you must be eligible to go for the MBA course at Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University. Its first criteria is you must have 50% aggregate in undergraduate degree or equivalent CGPA with valid MAT/CAT/CMAT score along with 10+2 with 50% aggregate. Then open the web page of the college, register yourself, choose MBA in type of admission, fill in your academic details, upload documents, upload your photo and signature declaration form, and at last pay the fee of Rs1500 which is non-refundable . Cannot change your email once submitted, the photo size ought to be between 120kb same for signature.

faqs.question: How merit list for admissions in MBA is prepared at SMVDU?
faqs.answer: SMVDU merit list is based on valid score of (CAT/MAT/Feb/May/CMAT 2024 along with score obtained in GD/PI in first phase. For vacant seats, score obtained in CUET (PG) 2024 by candidate along with score obtained in GD/PI will be considered. Cnadidates can apply online on the official website of the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University.

faqs.question: Can I do an MBA after BA Hons from SMVDU?

placement_faqs.question: Does Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University have better placements than Tezpur University?
placement_faqs.answer: No, Tezpur University has better placements than Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University. The average placement package for graduates of Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University was Rs. 5.5 lakh per year, while the average placement package for graduates of Tezpur University was Rs. 6.5 lakh per year, according to the placement reports for 2023. Students from Tezpur University were hired by a larger spectrum of businesses, like as tech behemoths as Google, Microsoft, and Amazon. Students from Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University were more likely to get hired by regional businesses. Remember that placement outcomes might change from year to year and that both colleges provide high-quality education. Tezpur University, on the other hand, has a better track record of placing students in well-paying positions.

college_info.college_name: Sona College of Technology: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements

highlights.summary:
Sona College of Technology is located in Salem, Tamil Nadu, and was established in 1997. It is a private college and has been accredited by NAAC with an A++ grade. The college is AICTE-approved and offers PhD, MCA, BTech, MTech, and MBA courses in 13 specialisations. Further, the college is affiliated with Anna University and is ISO certified. Over the last few years, the college has received various prestigious awards such as TechEDU India Awards’24, IBM Award 2023, etc.
Sona College of Technology courses are offered across several specialisations such as Civil Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Communications Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, etc. The courses are diversified into various streams such as Engineering, IT & Software, Business & Management Studies, etc. Sona College of Technology Tamil Nadu offers an encouraging and healthy environment for students to grow with an affordable fee range and has decent connections with top-notch companies. For more details, candidates can check out the table given below:
Sona College of Technology Highlights 2025

college_info.college_name: Sona College of Technology Course Admission 2025: Application Process, Eligibility, Courses & Fee

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission in Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: Candidates looking for course admission at Sona College of Technology must have valid entrance exam scores such as TANCET/CET/MAT etc. However, for BE/BTech direct second-year lateral entry course admission, students are selected based on percentage marks obtained in the Diploma (graduation/Class 12) examination. Sona College of Technology's admission process includes several steps. Students applying for the programmes offered at the college must ensure to satisfy the course-specific admission criteria as per the college's guidelines. The entire application process is in online mode.

faqs.question: What is the fees of Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: The institute offers BTech/B.E, M.E/MTech, MBA and MCA courses at the UG and PG level. Apart from the UG and PG courses, the institute offers doctorate courses. faqs.question: How can I get admission to various courses at Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: Sona College of Technology admissions are entrance-based. The university considers national-level entrance exam scores for various course admission. The entrance exams accepted are TANCET/CET, GATE, etc. Besides, the selection criteria for the PhD course is based on UGC NET or GATE. Selected candidates must keep their educational documents ready for verification purposes.

faqs.answer: The institute offers BTech/B.E, M.E/MTech, MBA and MCA courses at the UG and PG level. Apart from the UG and PG courses, the institute offers doctorate courses. faqs.question: How many seats are available for the M.Tech course at Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: A total of 138 seats are available for the M.Tech course at Sona College of Technology. Majority of seats are available for the M.E. in Industrial Safety and Engineering course, i.e.,  30. Students can check specialisation-wise seats from the table presented below:

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission in M.Tech at Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: Sona College of Technology offers entrance-based admission to MTech. To be eligible for admission to M.Tech students are required to apply and appear for TANCET entrance exam and counselling. Further, students are required to fill out the basic eligibility i.e., must have a graduation degree from a recognised board.

faqs.question: Is TANCET required for M.Tech at Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, TANCET exam is required for admission to M.Tech at Sona College of Technology. Tamil Nadu Common Entrance Test which is mandatory for admission to MTech. Applicants seeking admission to M.Tech are required to apply and appear for TANCET to be eligible for admission.

faqs.question: How can I get an MBA seat at Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: Students are selected for MBA admission at Sona College of Technology based on TANCET entrance exam, followed by  counselling round. Students are required to apply and appear for TANCET exam to apply for admission. Further, students are required to fill out the basic eligibility i.e., . pass graduation degree with 50% aggregate score.

faqs.question: Is MBA available in Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, students can pursue MBA at Sona College of Technology . The institute offers a full-time MBA course of a two-year (four semesters) duration. MBA at Sona College of Technology is offered at the PG level. Interested students can visit the official website of the institute and apply for the desired specialisation by filling out the application form.

faqs.question: How can I get admission to Sona College of Technology?
faqs.answer: Sona College of Technology admission to UG and PG courses is based on TNEA Counselling and TANCET entrance exams, respectively. Further, to be eligible for admission, students also need to pass Class 12 with 50% for admission to BTech and a graduation degree for admission to MTech, MCA and MBA with 50% aggregate from a recognised board.

faqs.question: Is Sona College of Technology admission open?
faqs.answer: Yes, admission is open to Sona College of Technology for all UG and PG courses through TNEA and TANCET, respectively. Interested applicants can visit the official websites of TNEA Counselling and TANCET to apply for the BTech, M.Tech respectively.

faqs.question: Does Sona College of Technology offer scholarship?
faqs.answer: Yes, Sona College of Technology offers scholarships to deserving students. The college offers four types of scholarships. Students can check the list of all scholarships offered from the points mentioned below:

faqs.question: Does Sona College of Technology offer merit-based scholarship?
faqs.answer: Yes, Sona College of Technology offers merit-based scholarship. Students can check the table below for more details: Scholarships Scheme Norms Eligibility Merit Scholarship (Tuition Fee Waiver) INR 10,000 to INR 40,000 per annum Students of first year BE/BTech/ME/MBA/MCA are eligible based on the commitment given during admission on the basis of cut off marks / TANCET score / MAT score. The scholarship amount may be continued for further years based on the following conditions. 1. The student should not have any arrear in the previous year (s). 2. The student should have a minimum of 95% attendance in the regular classes and class/model tests/exams in the previous year (s). 3. Academic results should be within top 10% in the branch. First Year BE, BTech, ME, MBA, MCA Merit cum Means Scholarship INR 5,000 to INR 10,000 per annum 1. The annual income of the parents (Father & Mother) or Guardian should not exceed Rupees One Lacs per annum. 2. Students other than first year will be required to fulfill the following conditions. 3. Students should not have any arrears in any of the subjects. 4. 95% overall in class attendance in the previous year. 5. Every students selected for this scholarship will have to contribute 8 hours / month for Library /Admission/students’ affairs/Laboratory/ Cleaning of the class room/ Sports assistance etc. All Students of BE, BTech, ME, MBA, MCA

data.title: Sona College of Technology Placement Report 2024
summary: The placements are ongoing for the Class of 2024. Till July 2024, the institute recorded 91% placements for the batch 2024. As per the latest report, the highest domestic and international package offered during Sona College of Technology placements in 2024 stood at INR 19.94 LPA and INR 33.6 LPA, respectively. Further, the average package offered to the CSE, IT, ADS students of the batch 2024 stood at INR 5.4 LPA. As of Jul 2024, the participating recruiters presented 1,097 job offers to the batch 2024. The top recruiters of Sona College of Technology in 2024 included Accenture, Capgemini, Decathlon, L&T, Delta, Medtronic, Propel, etc.
Additionally, Sona College of Technology offers various internship opportunities to its students. The highest stipend offered during the internship placements 2025 stood at INR 98,000 .

college_info.college_name: Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College is a private institute, established in 1994 in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu. Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College is approved by AICTE and offers a total of 30 courses at UG and PG levels in 17 specialisations such as Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Construction Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Electronics Engineering and Information Technology. Furthermore, it offer courses such as B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech and MBA/PGDM in Full Time mode. Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College fee structure includes a total tuition fee ranging from INR 50,000 and 3,00,000. Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College has an annual seat intake of 1230 for all the programmes. It offers courses, in streams such as Engineering and Business & Management Studies. As per the recent Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College placement records, the average median salary at the Institute is around INR 4,43,143. The institute has a safe and well-equipped campus with all the advanced facilities.

college_info_program.intro: Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College's popular programme is BTech. The institute offers BTech specialisations such as Mechanical Engineering, Electrical & Electronics Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, CSE, Electronics & Instrumentation Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Aeronautical Engineering, and others. The below-mentioned are Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College's popular programmes:

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really good facilities, infrastructure, and good placements in 2025.

detailed_review.Placements: 95% students are placed in my course. The highest package is likely to be 55 LPA for my course, the average package is 20 LPA, and the lowest package is above 7 LPA. The top recruiting company for my course is Capgemini. 85% students got internships in the same company, Capgemini. The top roles offered in my course are Software Developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: For CSE, we have Wi-Fi facilities in all labs. We have nearly 10 labs specially for CSE, and good library facilities are also available online, to get books anywhere. The hostel facilities are good. Some of my hostel friends told me that there are some drinking water issues, but other things are good. Our college has a food court on campus, and the food is good, no complaints. Our college trustee has their own hospital, so the medical facilities are good in our college and sports and games are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members in our college and in our course are well-experienced and qualified, so the teaching quality is also better in our college. Our college is an autonomous college, so they update this syllabus every 4 years. The latest syllabus update was done in 2025. Semester exams are not too tough, and they are manageable, and the pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am interested in computer science, so I preferred this course. My course is the easiest course in engineering, so I think I could survive better in it. Our college hosts many events, first standard campus road, and there is more connectivity between the passed-out alumni. Our college also provides government scholarships for specific students. Our college is also connected with NPTEL, which gives online courses as certification courses in our course. Our college hosts more hackathons and connects with other college hackathons, so extracurricular activities are also good on our college campus.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is the safest plan B for any student.

detailed_review.Placements: 75% of students got placed. The highest package is 20 LPA, the lowest package is 2 LPA. Capgemini, Accenture, and TCS are the top recruiting companies, but getting a placement is easy. However, the company has told the students that they are not capable enough, and more than 60% of students have been fired within one year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is good. Wi-Fi is provided at selected locations. The hostel is below average with very high fees. Facilities like mess, canteen, medical facilities, sports, and games are good, but you need to find time to utilize these facilities, and the gym is also available, but the equipment is very average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, and the course curriculum is relevant, but we should be selecting good teachers. Semester exams are good, but we have to study to pass, otherwise, you can fail. Some teachers may have some issues with you.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good faculty members with PhD. It has helpful teaching and average placements.

A lot of companies visit our campus like Cognizant, Kovai. Co, Accenture. etc. This time, only 78% of students of students get placed. A lot of seniors passed from the college and got placed in good companies and also higher companies like Amazon, Flipkart, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is okay and the food is not good. Students are not satisfied with the college. The food available in the canteen is not that much of good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and qualified. They do not have a lot of knowledge about it nowadays. Internal exams are easy, and semester exams are normal. Many teachers in this college are PhD holders. The principal is also very good. They take action if students say anything. They solve students' problems.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Overall, it is the best college for the MBA course.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 82-92% of students participated in this study. The highest package is 29 LPA, the average is around 15-22 LPA, and the lowest is 3-6 LPA. Top recruiters are Flipkart, Snapdeal, Larsen & Toubro, etc. 70-80% of students get internships in many industries. The top jobs offered are financial analyst, operations manager, and more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has well-equipped labs available for all branches. You have to pay for Wi-Fi, as it is not available for students. There are three libraries with all the books, and an excellent cafeteria where students can treat themselves to all kinds of good food. The college provides a bus service, and it plies all over Coimbatore and some places outside Coimbatore.
detailed_review.Faculty: Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College's faculty members are well-qualified and experienced. When students need support and assistance, they provide it. The teachers teach simple teaching techniques to make learning and comprehension easier for the students. Even industrial locations are visited by teachers. With a 90% pass rate, the semester exam is simple to pass with a good score.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)

In my last year, around 30 firms came to interview on this college campus. The wage packages given by such companies range from 4 LPA to 15 LPA. These interviews on college campuses resulted in placements for almost 97% of students. Well-known businesses include Teach Mahendra, TVS, Hyundai, and TCS. These businesses came to interview on this college campus.

There is a wide selection of cuisine at this campus canteen. There were also other sports facilities on this campus. Traveling was made easier for us by the excellent transmission options this college offered its students. This college also had Wi-Fi facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The instructors at this college were more skilled and knowledgeable individuals. They were amiable individuals. The teacher-to-student ratio at this college was outstanding. Innovative teaching strategies like project-based learning and group discussions were employed by the faculty members. Thus, all semester exams were passed by 97% of pupils.

Over 95% of students secure internships in reputable companies like Reliance Construction, IBM, Zoho, TCS, and Yamaha. Salary packages range from ₹20,000 to ₹50,000 per month.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: We have plenty of placement and internship opportunities. Nearly 50+ companies approach our campus for student recruitment. Our students got placed with the highest salary package of 12.7 Lacs per annum, and the lowest salary package offered by recruiters is 3.1 Lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have excellent infrastructure within the campus. There is a strict security system for the college and hostel. We maintain a very healthy and hygienic campus. All the seniors and juniors are very coordinated with us at all times, and they are also very friendly.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are highly educated and experienced. They are kind, helpful, and treat everyone equally without any discrimination. We can't miss even a single session because of our strict teachers. Roughly, we have 4 to 5 classes in a day, and we also have a schedule for each and every day.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Everything is fine except the out-of-town bus facilities, infrastructure, and placement.

detailed_review.Placements: 80 percent of the students are getting placed, and the highest package is 24 LPA, the lowest package is 4 LPA, and the average package is 10 LPA. Swiggy, Zoho, Capgemini, and Delta. In Accenture, Zoho students got a 6-month internship and got an offer letter too. Overall, Coimbatore Engineering College, SREC, has the least feel, with an assured number of placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very simple, but the facilities have no compromises as they have clean drainage for both the college and hostel. Immediate action is taken if any issue is raised. Labs, classrooms, and libraries are fully ventilated and air-conditioned. Wi-Fi is available throughout the college and hostel. The food is fine, and the snacks provided there are healthy and hygiene-friendly. The college has a health centre with 3 nurses and 1 doctor. Ambulance is also available for the hostel students in case of any emergency at night.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are so friendly, helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is always in a practical mode. As a computer science student, I learned about databases, four languages, operating systems, and algorithms. It is not difficult, but the exams are quite different from school. For example, the question will be given in school, but at the college level, we should create a question. So that is quite a challenging part.
detailed_review.Other: As I'm a NEET aspirant, except for this, I had no knowledge at the last moment, so I chose this CSE. In CSE, there is an assured future for skilled students. It doesn't mean that other departments have no value, but up to me, CSE was good, and I chose it. The improvement is that there would have been a real-time application there. Club activities and department activities are conducted, and scholarships are provided. Extracurricular activities are encouraged.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: SREC is one of the best colleges in Coimbatore .

detailed_review.Placements:
The percentage of students getting placed in this course is 91% among the students who opted for placements. The highest package is about 25lpa, the lowest package is about 4 lpa, and the average package is about 12 lpa. The top recruiting companies are JP Morgan's, Amazon, HP, Accenture, Cognizant, Renly, etc. The percentage of students getting internship opportunities is about 85% and they got internships at companies like Health Edge, L&T, Multicoreware, Hexaware Technology, etc. 
The top roles offered in the course are software developer, data analyst, AI engineer, project manager, database engineer and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college's facilities and infrastructure are good. The college has classrooms equipped with projectors and screens with Wi-Fi connections, well-equipped laboratories, a collaborative innovation center, an incubation center and a huge library with a wide range of books, including subject books, journals, magazines, and even storybooks. Also, we have a digital library and have access to books online. The hostel is quite good. The hostel room can easily accommodate 4 people in a single room and it has shelves to organise their belongings. The bathroom is common for a floor. The hostel food quality and taste are good. There is a canteen inside the campus; the food is good and it remains open during college working hours. There is a medical center inside the campus that is open 24/7 and an ambulance is also available for critical situations. There are a wide range of sports and games being trained on campus, and the students can join any of the sports they like.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers in SREC hold advanced degrees from reputed institutions and some professors are actively involved in research. Teachers are very helpful and we can contact them anytime after the class hours. The teachers employ innovative teaching methods, including practical demonstrations and interactive sessions so we can easily understand things. The curriculum is relevant because it is framed based on industry requirements. The difficulty level of the exam varies from moderate to challenging. The pass percentage is >90%.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My thoughts about Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: Mostly, 80%–90% will be placed in my course. The highest package last year was 18 Lacs, and the lowest package was 4.5 Lacs. Mostly everyone will have an average package of 4.5 Lacs.  Our college's top recurring companies are Amazon, Zoho, Capgemini, and many more.  About 60% of the students got internships, and the companies in which they got them are Cognizant, Capgemini, and Zoho.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
We have many Wi-Fi labs for each subject, and our library has more than 3,000 books that can be accessed online. The classrooms will be clean, but the infrastructure is old. The quality of the food will be good, but the taste may not be so good in the food court as well as in the hostel. 
There is a medical center at our college.  Every day, there will be practice sessions for sports players after 6 p.m.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are very helpful, as they clear all doubts at any time, even after classes. They are so well qualified that most of the teachers are doctorates. The teachers mostly teach many concepts practically so that we get practiced to get ready for the industry environment. The semester exams will be average here, but mostly easy; about 90–95% of the students will clear all the exams.
detailed_review.Other: In this college, CSE is the best course to choose, as most of the students are placed. There is nothing to improve in this course, as we get all kinds of knowledge from all domains in this course.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Tech.+ M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: One of the Best institution for placements in Coimbatore.

detailed_review.Placements: SREC offers slightly above average placements, with above 70% of students placed every year. Especially in CSE and IT, there are various IT placement opportunities. The highest salary offered last year was 15 LPA, and overall 27 LPA by Amazon, with the lowest salary being 3.5 LPA offered by Cognizant Technologies. Top companies recruiting from our college include Mahindra, Mercedes-Benz, HCL, Soliton, Amazon, ZOHO, and others. Here, 75% of students got internships in their 3rd year based on tier CGPA/GPA. By pursuing CSE or IT, you would be able to specialize in roles like Developer, Cybersecurity, UI/UX Designer, and more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our department and in the library, Wi-Fi facility is good. Labs are not up to the mark compared to other institutions. Some labs are used only for accounting purposes. Classrooms are neat but not Hi-Fi. Hostel facilities are not well appreciated; the old building's toilets are Indian-style. There is an International Hostel available, but it costs 25% more than normal. The canteen, known as "FC" - Food Court, is truly good, price-efficient but lacking in variety. This college gives much importance to sports such as football, volleyball, etc. There is a Health Center at the end of the campus; a doctor is always available, making it reliable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers of this institution are knowledgeable. There are some psycho staff, but most of them are well-qualified; more than 60% of them are Ph.D. holders, and some are pursuing it. The course curriculum is subjective based on your opinion because for our course, we face some issues, but other departments are good with these curricula. The difficulty of exams is average, not too hard or easy. The pass percentage is always above 75%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely dissatisfied with the faculty members .

detailed_review.Placements: Earlier placements were good. Last year, there were totally around 1040 offers in the entire institution in IT, and around 108 students were placed. But this year placements are too poor, like the total offers obtained are not even around 350 in IT, which is around 50. Companies say that students do not have the necessary skill set to get placed. So the management is trying to improve it by starting the placement classes in the second year itself. I hope they tackle this and bring back their reputation.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are decent, but sometimes the fans do not work properly. Restrooms are not maintained properly. Computers in labs do not work properly most of the time. Either the keys on the keyboard are broken or the system itself does not work. The hostel rooms are not well maintained, and the buildings are very old and need preparation, but they will cover this by painting the building and making it look new.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most professors do not know anything about the subject, even though they know they behave rudely towards the students. They blame you for everything. They do not take classes properly. They are mostly biased. They only like students who study well and do projects well. And they will never focus on weak students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because everyone told me that the IT sector is the next big thing. I suggest that faculty members should be changed and the management should improve the infrastructure. Scholarships for ST and SC students are good, but not for general and BC students. Events are mediocre.

reviews.course: B.E. in Aeronautical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with placements, faculty members, and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 100% of students got placed in our course. The highest salary package offered is 5.5 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 4 LPA. Capgemini, L&T, Infosys, and Wipro visit our college. Almost 100% of students got internships from our college. The top role offered is design engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides facilities like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, a library, etc. Our department provides very good infrastructure. The quality of the hostel facilities is good. The quality of the food in the mess and canteen is good. Sports, games, and medical facilities are very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good. This course curriculum is relevant. It makes students ready for the industry. Exams are difficult. The pass percentage is 50%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I like it. Aircraft is the best. Events, fests, the campus crowd, and scholarships are good.

faqs.question: Is Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College hard to get admission in?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is hard to get admission at Sri Ramakrishna Engineering College. The college accepts admission based on merit and entrance exams. college_info.college_name: Sri Sairam Engineering College: Fees, Cutoff, Course, Admission 2025, Rankings

highlights.summary: Sri Sairam Engineering College is a private college established in 1995 in Tambaram Sanatorium, Chennai. The College is affiliated with Anna University. It is approved by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE). Sairam Engineering College offers UG, PG and Integrated programmes in the Engineering and Management stream. The Engineering specialisations include Civil Engineering, Computer Science and Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, and Electronics and Communication Engineering among many others. The fees for various courses may vary based on the type and level of the program. The college has a well-equipped campus with state-of-the-art facilities to enhance the learning experience of the students. Candidates can check the major highlights of Sri Sairam Engineering College:

college_info_program.intro: Sri Sairam Engineering College offers BTech and MBA as its flagship programmes. The admission is based on merit scores and entrance exams. Candidates must have passed Class 12 from a recognised board and appear for TNEA counselling for the BTech course. Whereas, for MBA, candidates must have a bachelor's degree with a valid score in the TANCET entrance exam. The total seat intake for BTech and MBA is 1740 and 180.
