Sri Sairam Engineering College Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am very satisfied with this institutions .

detailed_review.Placements: Till now, 65% of students were placed in my course, TCS, CTS, Zoho are the top recruiting companies, and the average package for this course is 4 LPA. Almost 50% of students got their internships, and the roles offered in my course are software development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Well, the infrastructure and facilities are quite great because they provide a high-speed Wi-Fi system. Labs are filled with new computers that enable the students to work easily, and the classrooms are converted into smart classrooms that help the students to learn digitally.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, kind, and polite. They are qualified and specialized in the course. They will solve/clear the students' doubts, and they will choose the curriculum-relevant topics, so that the students will only know about the relevant topics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, supportive faculty, and decent placement opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70-75 percent of students from my course get placed every year. The highest package offered is around 8 LPA-10 LPA, and the lowest is about 3 LPA. The average package stands close to 4 LPA-4.5 LPA. Top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Cognizant, Accenture, and Capgemini. Roles offered include Software Engineer, Graduate Engineer Trainee, Analyst, and Core Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has good infrastructure with Wi-Fi-enabled classrooms and smart boards. Laboratories are well-equipped and suitable for practical learning. The central library has sufficient academic and digital resources. Hostel facilities are decent with proper security and basic amenities. Mess food quality is average but hygienic, and sports facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are qualified, knowledgeable, and supportive of students. Teaching quality is good, especially for core engineering subjects. The curriculum follows Anna University and is structured and relevant. Extra certifications are needed to become fully industry-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult with a pass percentage above 85 percent.
detailed_review.Other: The campus crowd is disciplined, friendly, and diverse. Cultural fests, symposiums, and workshops are conducted regularly. Sports and extracurricular activities are encouraged. Campus connectivity is good with public transport facilities. The surroundings are calm and suitable for learning.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My experience with my college and its Incubation.

detailed_review.Placements: I think most of the students from the Incubation have a higher chance of placements as they have gained a higher level of insights and experience in their domain, which makes them more likely to have more exposure to industry and diligence to handle clients, which are the vital social skills. Many colleges fail to teach a wide range of technical resources and lab facilities, which are easily available for students to explore their field of expertise.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The course infrastructure is far greater and perfect for my curriculum, but the hostel is not what I would oblige to. The food provided here is fabulous, but not the accommodation, but since I am in Incubation, I don't have to worry about that. This is an advantage that Incubation students have over hostellers.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are knowledgeable enough to take classes, but some are far more knowledgeable in their field of expertise and would help students to push further than the academics, which is far more important, and the teachers would also learn with us daily, along with their careers.
detailed_review.Other:
You would like to experience most of the audio launches for free and more fun. Happy learning.
.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: The college is good for those who interested in studies.

detailed_review.Placements: So our college has good placement offers for the students, and almost everyone will get placed in a company. Our college has specific sessions for aptitude and coding training for placements. Top recruiting companies are  Infosys, JPMorgan, Zoho, Wipro, TCS, and Microsoft. Around 75-80 percent in my course have been placed in those companies. The highest package is around 20 LPA, and the lowest is around 2.5 LPA-3 LPA. Top roles are AI and ML engineer, Data analysis.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a good infrastructure with smart classrooms and labs. The quality of the mess food is good. Labs have high-tech computers, which are used for training models. College canteen food is also of high quality. Transportation systems such as buses are also in good condition and fast while traveling.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching facility is good and everyone will complete the portion within the time and will be provided with a revision test and practice. The curriculum is good and somewhat outdated, but it's still in the industrial standards. The semester exam is somewhat competitive, and the pass percentage is 50 percent.
detailed_review.Other: The course I chose was AI and Data Science because I am interested in the newly booming field of AI. College faculty share every competition and hackathon available.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, experienced, and supportive faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: I belong to the 2023-2027 batch of Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering. Around 70 percent of students from my course got placed. The highest package offered is 12 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA, and the average package is around 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies included L&T, Honeywell, TCS, and Infosys. Nearly 60 percent of students received internships in companies like L&T, Bosch, Siemens, and Cognizant. The major roles offered are Instrumentation Engineer, Control Engineer, Graduate Engineer Trainee, and System Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has good infrastructure for the Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering department. Classrooms are spacious and well-maintained with proper seating and projectors. Laboratories are adequately equipped with the required instruments and equipment for practical learning. Wi-Fi is available across the campus, and the central library has sufficient technical books, journals, and digital resources. Hostel facilities are decent, with clean rooms and regular maintenance. The quality of food in the mess is average but hygienic. Medical facilities are available on campus, and sports grounds support indoor and outdoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are qualified, knowledgeable, and supportive. Most professors explain concepts clearly and are approachable for doubts. The curriculum is relevant and provides a good foundation in core subjects like control systems, sensors, and instrumentation, though more industry-oriented training could improve readiness. Semester exams are of moderate difficulty, and students who attend classes regularly can clear them comfortably. The overall pass percentage is good, around 85-90 percent, making academics manageable with consistent effort.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering because of my interest in automation, control systems, and industrial applications. The best part of the course is its combination of electronics and real-time industrial processes. However, more hands-on industrial exposure and core company internships would improve the course further.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely good staff and good guidance with our staff.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are average and companies like TCS, HCL, CTS, Zoho, and even companies like JPMorgan, etc. Placements start in 6 th sem onwards and the college will provide placement training to develop apt skills and coding skills through the skill track.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is average and this college has more facilities to help us grow ourselves in innovation. The hostel is good enough but it costs more.  Food is good enough they provide you with all 6 days of non veg except Thursday. We can go home once a month or on festive holidays if they permit.
detailed_review.Faculty: This part is so good. Faculty members are excellent. Fee might be higher but the education is average. We need to make efforts to succeed in life and exams, and if all is good then the curriculum is also good. Mostly according to Anna University. They provide a platform like a skill track, to grow your coding skills.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Tech.+ M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good infrastructure and decent placements. The curriculum needs more industry focus.

detailed_review.Placements: Still, placements are ongoing, and the exact percentage is not confirmed yet. The highest package is 18 LPA. Many students got placed off-campus with higher packages. Top companies like CTS, TCS, Genworks AI, etc., recruit students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is spacious with a good collection of books. Each department has its own well-equipped lab facilities. There are 2 types of hostel blocks, i.e., AC and non-AC, and each fee is different. The mess food is good compared to colleges around Chennai. Sports are not much encouraged here.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many teachers are helpful and well-qualified. The overall teaching quality is good, with concepts explained clearly in class. The course curriculum is fairly relevant, but could include more industry-oriented projects. Semester exams are moderately difficult if we pass all the CAT exams.
detailed_review.Other: NCC, NSS, UBA, and other clubs are highly prioritised.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Great place for professional development and to climb the career ladder.

detailed_review.Placements: Many top rated companies with high packages come to our college, with a strong placement percentage, decent average packages, and good internship opportunities in reputed firms. Roles that align well with industry requirements. They ensure you are ready for the placement process.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Necessary infrastructure for both the course and hostel is provided meticulously by the management with there being hardly any places you can complain about from high speed Wi-Fi and well equipped labs to clean hostels, decent food options, and ample sports facilities that support the overall learning experience.
detailed_review.Faculty: Highly knowledgeable faculty members with great patience to interact and clarify with all the students, delivering quality teaching with a proper curriculum that ensures industry readiness. Semester exams are moderately challenging with a good overall pass percentage.
detailed_review.Other: This college provided me with various opportunities to develop and showcase my skillset.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: No trip is provided by our college.

detailed_review.Placements: I belong to the 2023-2027 batch of the B.Tech programme in artificial intelligence and data science. Approximately 70-80% of the eligible students from our course are placed through campus recruitment. The highest package is 18-15 LPA, the lowest package is 3-4 LPA, and the average package is 6-8 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has a good infrastructure, and our course has Jarvis labs with full Mac systems and bands combined with Intel for power unit labs for AI services. On campus, there are separate hostels and canteens. A mess is also available. We have many halls for conferences and many more events.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have 3 CAT exams from which the best of the 2 exam scores will be taken out. They provide 1 week of placement training classes for every semester. College also provides placement training, books, and free library access. About the semester exams, everything will be relevant to the CAT papers.
detailed_review.Other: Our college has a strict formal dress code, and students should have a proper haircut. Without an ID card, no one will be allowed inside the campus. For your liberal thoughts on the product, we have Sairam Techno Incubation Centre.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Tech.+ M.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A review of Sairam Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80 percent of the students get placed, according to my knowledge. Where the average is about 4 to 6 LPA, and the highest is about 30 LPA. The top recruiter is TCS. My seniors all got internships in Virtusa, with a majority in software development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are good, but the most impressive infrastructure is the incubation centre, where the students are involved with real-time experts. The canteen food is good, providing a variety of foods. It satisfied the food palette for students of different tastes.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very resourceful and knowledgeable in their respective subjects. The students can interact with any faculty to clear their doubts. The curriculum is updated to empower students with real-time skills. The sem exams are not difficult on average.
detailed_review.Other: The course is a bit intriguing, so I took it to see its potential. There is an event throughout the years where the facilities push students to participate and volunteer for events and even give student to coordinated their events to their own way. The college management provides scholarships to students based on many criteria.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and good Placements throughout the year.

detailed_review.Placements: 60 to 70% students are placed in our course. The package between 4LPA to 12LPA has been offered. Top recruiting companies are BHEL, ONGC, etc. This year, Keyence offered, and some students got placed in Keyence. 60% of students got internship with a stipend.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good. Classrooms and labs should be very neat and disciplined. Network connection through Wi-Fi is unlimited. The quality of food is rich in taste. Two canteens are available, and a mess is available for both boys and girls separately.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers and staff are very helpful throughout your course. Teaching quality is good, and the course curriculum is relevant, as the students are ready to be placed in top core companies. Semester exams are almost coming in our syllabus. 90% of passed students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in electronics.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements and facilities, decent campus life, opportunities are plenty, its in your decision.

detailed_review.Placements: All students are placed, with the placement percentage being close to 100%. The highest package offered is 19 LPA, while the lowest is 3.25 LPA, and the average package generally ranges between 4.5 to 6 LPA, depending on the year. Top recruiting companies included major IT and product based firms such as TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Accenture, Cognizant, HCL, Tech Mahindra, Zoho, Capgemini, and a few startups. Around 70 to 80% of students also secured internships. The most common roles offered to students are Junior Software Developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department is well equipped with modern classrooms, computer labs with high speed Wi-Fi, and access to digital resources through the library, which supports both academic and research activities. The hostel facilities are comfortable with good accommodation, and the mess provides nice and hygienic food. The campus also includes canteens offering a variety of options, reliable medical facilities for students, and well-maintained sports grounds and amenities that encourage participation in both indoor and outdoor games. Overall, the facilities and infrastructure are good and contribute to a positive learning and living environment.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our department are reasonably helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable, but the teaching quality can be considered average, which makes self-study an important part of the learning process. This is because relying on classroom teaching alone may not be sufficient to fully grasp industry-oriented concepts. The course curriculum is relevant and does cover the fundamentals needed to make students industry-ready, though its effectiveness largely depends on how much effort students put in beyond the syllabus. The semester exams are moderately difficult, but with consistent preparation, they are manageable, and the pass percentage remains very high, around 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my strong interest in technology and its career opportunities. The best aspects are the nearly 100 percent placements, good infrastructure and exposure to industry relevant skills. The teaching quality could improve as self study plays a major role. Our campus hosts vibrant events and fests with an active and supportive crowd. The surroundings are well connected and students can benefit from scholarships and various extracurricular activities in sports, clubs and cultural events, making the overall college experience enriching.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: I'm satisfied because of good placements in 2025.

detailed_review.Placements: 75 to 85% students in the year 2025 got placed in good companies. For  AI and DS course, top companies were TCS, CTS, Wipro, and more. 75% students got an internship from this course in my college. Roles included software developer, software engineer, product engineer, sales executive, and more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are too good, better wi-fi will be provided. detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers and staff were helpful and knowledgeable. Teaching quality was too good. Course curriculum is better to make students ready for placements. Semester exams are kind of better. Pass percentage is more than 85%. There were floor supervisors to notify the student activities in classroom.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: If students want to get placed in a good company, then they can join here.

So we can learn skills for the project and we get hands on training when we complete our engineering. This is the main reason to get placements.

For one semester, there are 3 CAT exams and one main exam with a lab. Exams are not that difficult, so we can refer to the previous year's question papers.

detailed_review.Other: I am most likely to have a course and better placement. Coding is improving in this course. Sports, games, and most events are conducted.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of the environment, live in lab, incubation, and others.

We are enriched with aptitude skills to enter the placement.

detailed_review.Other: I was interested in this course so I selected it. My course is an emerging course. The labs in our college are fully equipped with full high facilities. In my college, audio launches occur very often.

college_info.college_name: Sri Sairam Engineering College Admission 2025: Fee, Eligibility, Application & Selection

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Sri Sairam Engineering College admissions are either merit or entrance-based. The college selects candidates for BE/ BTech programmes based on Class 12 scores. The institute also accepts TANCET and CEETA-PG scores for admission to MBA and MTech/ ME programmes, respectively. Once the selection process is over, candidates have to participate in respective exam counselling.

faqs.question: What is the admission process for Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Sri Sairam Engineering College admissions begin with registration. Candidates have to first apply for the accepted entrance exam for MBA and ME/ M.Tech programme. For BE/ BTech, aspirants need to register for TNEA Counselling. The selection for BTech programme is based on Class 12 score whereas TANCET is required for MBA admission. The selection to M.Tech is based on CEETA-PG score. Once selected, candidates are alloted seat in the preferred programme.

faqs.question: Is TNEA compulsory for Sri Sairam Engineering College admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, aspirants seeking admission in BE/ BTech courses have to apply for TNEA Counselling after completing Class 12. Candidates are alloted seat in the programme based on their Class 12 score during the TNEA Counselling. After the seat is alloted, aspirants have to pay a course fee to confirm their seat in the institute.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted by Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Sri Sairam Engineering College considers entrance exam scores only for admission to PG courses. The college accepts TANCET scores for MBA and CEETA-PG for ME/ M.Tech courses. Once candidates have appeared for the entrance exam, they need to participate in respective exam counselling. The seats are alloted in these programmes based on the rank of the aspirants.

faqs.question: What is the TNEA rank required for BTech admission at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Candidates seeking admission in BTech programme of Sri Sairam Engineering College need to pass Class 12 and participate in TNEA Counselling. In 2024, the closing rank for TNEA for General-All India category was 14662 for CSE. The rank for CSE was the most competitive one out of all the specialisations. The rank saw a dip from 7944 in 2022 to 12759 in 2023.

faqs.question: Which are the BTech specialisations offered at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Sri Sairam Engineering College offers a four-year BE/ BTech programme for four-years at the UG level. The course is spread across eight semesters. Below are some of the BE/ BTech specialisations offered at the college:

faqs.question: What is the eligibility for BTech at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Candidates must complete HSc examination to apply for Sri Sairam Engineering College BE/ BTech course. Aspirants should also satisfy other eligibility rules as prescribed by the Anna University and Directorate of Technical Education, Government of Tamil Nadu, HSc of the vocational stream (vocational groups in Engineering/ Technology) as prescribed by the Government of Tamil Nadu for BTech course.

faqs.question: Is CEETA-PG required for M.Tech at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Yes, Sri Sairam Engineering College admission to ME/ M.Tech course is based on CEETA-PG score. It is a state-level entrance test conducted by Anna University once in a year in offline mode. The exam is conducted for two hours and includes 115 questions. Once selected, candidates have to participate in CEETA-PG Counselling for admission.

faqs.question: How much is the fee for M.Tech at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee for Sri Sairam Engineering College ME/ M.Tech ranges between INR 50,000 and INR 2.5 lakh . Candidates have to pay the course fee to confirm their seat in the college. The total fee of ME includes various components such as caution deposit, tuition fee, exam fee, etc.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for MBA at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Aspirants need to pass a minimum of UG examination of Anna University or equivalent as specified under the qualifications for admissions as per the Tamil Nadu Common Admission Sri Sairam Engineering College MBA programme. Candidates must hold the documents proving their eligibility for verification at the time of admission.

faqs.question: Is MBA available at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Yes, Sri Sai Ram Engineering College offers a two-year course of MBA programme divided into four semesters. The selection to this course at Sri Sai Ram Institute of Technology is entrance-based. Candidates need to pass UG examination of Anna University or equivalent as specified under the qualifications for admissions as per the Tamil Nadu Common Admission to apply for MBA programme.

faqs.question: What is the total tuition fee of the MBA programme at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee of the MBA programme at Sri Sairam Engineering College is INR 35,000. This is the tuition fee of two-year MBA programme and does not iclude additional cost like mess fee or hostel fee. The fee is taken from unoffical sources and hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: What is the application fee for Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Candidates have to pay an application fee to register for accepted entrance exams. Sri Sairam Engineering College considers Class 12 score and TNEA Counselling for BE/ BTech. The application fee for TNEA is INR 500 for the general candidates and INR 250 for the SC /SCA /ST category belonging to Tamil Nadu. The college considers CEETA-PG and TANCET scores for M.Tech and MBA respectively. Aspirants have to pay an application fee INR 1,800 + GST for CEETA PG and INR 1,000 for TANCET. There is a relaxation in the fee for reserved category candidates.

faqs.question: What is the last date to apply for Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Sri Sairam Engineering College applications are open. Candidates can fill out the admission enquiry form available on the official website of the college for details. Aspirants have to apply for TNEA after completing Class 12 for BE/ BTech. Aspirants need to apply for CEETA-PG and TANCET for M.Tech and MBA programmes, respectively. Candidates must pay an application fee to register for the exam.

faqs.question: What is the fee for B.Tech at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: BTech is one of the flagship courses provided at Sri Sairam Engineering College. The total tuition fees for the BTech course is around INR 2 Lacs to 2.5 Lacs . The course is offered in full-time mode for 4 years. SSREC Chennai admissions are both merit and entrance-based. The college considers Class 12 score for BE/ BTech programme. The college offers courses at UG and PG levels in Engineering and Management streams. Interested candidates can fill out the admission form on the official website.

faqs.question: What is the total tuition fee of the MBA programme at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee of the MBA programme at Sri Sairam Engineering College is INR 35,000. This is the tuition fee of two-year MBA programme and does not iclude additional cost like mess fee or hostel fee. The fee is taken from unoffical sources and hence, is indicative.

faqs.question: What are the scholarships offered at Sri Sairam Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Sri Sairam Engineering College provides scholarships to UG and PG students as financial assistance. The scholarship is offered to candidates based on their university exam score. Students can apply for scholarships only if they meet the criteria. A maximum of INR 25,000 is provided as scholarship to students who have secured first place in the university examination for MBA. The college completely waives off the first year tuition fee for BE/ BTech students with 90% and above score (cumulative).

college_info.college_name: Tezpur University: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Ranking

highlights.summary:
Tezpur University is a government university established by an Act of Parliament. The University was established in 1994 and is known to be recognised by UGC. Tezpur University has earned an A grade via the NAAC accreditation and is known to offer courses while being recognised by the AIU and AICTE.
Ranked 69 under the University category, Tezpur University is ranked by the NIRF ranking 2024. As per the QS World University Rankings 2025, the university is ranked 168 in Southern Asia and 561-580 in Asia.
Tezpur University offers courses at the UG and PG level through 20 academic departments. The respective departments are seperated among 4 Schools and the courses include BSc, BA, BCom, BEd, MA, MSc, and MBA, among others. Tezpur University offers various scholarship schemes based on merit. In addition to this, Tezpur University offers placement assistance to students through training programs, skill-enhancing events and a top recruiter panel in association with the University.
Tezpur University cutoff 2024 for BTech was most competitive for the Computer Science and Engineering branch. Tezpur University admissions are offered based on a set of eligibility criteria drawn for the aspirants. Below are the major highlights of Tezpur University:
Tezpur University Highlights 2025
Check out more on Tezpur University Highlights in the below videos:

Its popular courses are B.Ed, BTech and MBA. Admission to all these courses is entrance-based. Students should have passed Class 12 or equivalent exams from a recognised board with a minimum of 60% aggregate for B.Ed and BTech courses. Tezpur University Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The infrastructure, faculty, and environment are good, but I am dissatisfied with the placements.

detailed_review.Placements: For the 2025 batch, the role of GET (Graduate Engineer Trainee) is offered to all, with two civil engineering students placed in L&T and NCC Limited with packages of 6.5 LPA and 3.2 LPA respectively, while 40% of ECE and CSE students are placed in companies like BEL, BHEL, TCS, and Accenture at an average of 5 LPA and a maximum of 11.5 LPA by BEL, and 40% of Mechanical and Electrical students are placed in companies such as Oil India, RDC Concrete, and L&T with an average package of 4 LPA and a maximum of 6.5 LPA from L&T.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, digital boards, a library, a computer center, and labs with a good quantity of instruments are all available, though not in great quantity. There is also a central library, a medical hospital, and grounds for basketball, football, hockey, and badminton. The sports facilities are good here. Regarding the food, more non-vegetarian options are available, and North Indian food is not. Roti is not served, and the price of fruits is very high.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good, helpful, and knowledgeable. Many of them have Ph.D. degrees from reputed institutes like NITs and IITs. The teaching quality is good, but the academic schedule is very hectic here. The course curriculum, which is decided by AICTE, is good, but it is not industry-ready. The semester exams are very easy; one can pass by only studying class notes.
detailed_review.Other: Connectivity is not good, which is why placements are not good here. The campus environment is good, as it is not too hot and not too cold.

reviews.course: M.A. in Hindi
reviews.review_title: Overall, it is the best university for the M.A. in Hindi course.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 96% of the pupils feel at ease in my branch. The maximum salary offered is 30 LPA. At least 6 LPA is required. Packages range from 15 to 21 LPA on average. Students get placed at Randstad India, Monster India, Naukri.com, and others. Positions include roles such as government officer, literary critic, and more. College students receive good support for internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The amenities are excellent, equipped with all the latest comforts. There is Wi-Fi on the campus and in the hostel rooms. The hostel offers great rooms with high-quality timber furnishings and beautiful paintings. There are also good computer labs. In Assam, having good transportation is essential, and the college provides that. Both North Indian and South Indian food at the canteen, and both are excellent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are regular and punctual in classes. From my experience, our department professors facilitate conversations outside of class. Most of them are very friendly. They are helpful and complete the curriculum on time. Every two months, technical visits for students to expose them to technical needs. The semester exams are easy to score, and the pass rate is 79%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is not as bad as people might think.

detailed_review.Placements: While the placement cell itself might not be the best, it doesn't hold back students from landing great offers. This year (2025 batch), 8 students from the ECE branch land PSU placements of 12.5–13 LPA. Previously as well, CSE students land jobs up to 37 LPA, and many score well in GATE exams and go abroad for further studies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are pretty good compared to other government institutions. Classrooms have the required facilities, although not all of them. The campus Wi-Fi works in certain areas but isn't very dependable. The mess food is also quite decent. Sports facilities are available and quite active.
detailed_review.Faculty: It is surprising at times to see how well-qualified some professors are, with some having studied at top universities around the world and others holding very high AIR rankings in national exams. Some teachers might not be very friendly, but overall, the majority are very helpful. Curriculum is also updated according to the latest NEP course structure. The exams are also quite easy.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is absolutely beautiful. The campus life is very vibrant with something or the other always happening. The only thing this university lacks is good fests. The events and fests could be a lot better, and there should be more focus on extracurriculars.

reviews.course: M.A. in Hindi
reviews.review_title: Overall, the best university for M.A. in Hindi course.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 95% of students got placed in our university. Very good bundles are available, all with the core firm. The maximum is 26 LPA, while the minimum is 6 LPA. The average compensation package is 17 LPA. Charishma, MM Enterprises, Michael Page, and other top recruiting companies are listed below. All students are assigned positions such as content writers, translator, etc. Approximately 92% of students receive internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our university features modern labs, classrooms with Wi-Fi, and libraries that are well-stocked for every course. Large rooms, Wi-Fi, and recreational amenities are features of hotels. The mess food has a variety of options and is good. Munchies are served in our restaurants. There is a clinic that is open continuously. A gym, basketball, football, and cricket are among the sports facilities. All things considered, the buildings are kept up nicely and are convenient for students to access.
detailed_review.Faculty: The professors are very knowledgeable about their courses and are well competent. In order to comply with industry requirements, the curriculum is well-designed and revised frequently. Semester exams are meant to assess both practical application and critical thinking, and they are somewhat challenging. Over 60% of students pass.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: It has good return on investment but the facilities could be improved more.

detailed_review.Placements: 95% of students got placed for 2023-2025 batch. The highest package is 12 LPA. The lowest salary is 4.5 LPA. The average package is 7 LPA. Top recruiters are TVS Motors, IDBI Bank, HDFC Bank, ITC, Reliance Consumer Products, Dalmia Cements, and others. 100% of the batch got internships in companies like Marico, ITC, NRL Refinery, Oil India, Amul, Coca-Cola, Kantar, etc. Mostly only sales roles are offered, with only few finance and HR roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the facilities are provided like Wi-Fi, classrooms, computer lab, and library. Hostel and mess facilities are also provided along with recreational activities like sports both indoor and outdoor, cafes, and restaurants. It also has medical center where check-ups and medicine are provided free of cost.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers of different subjects are quite equipped with knowledgeable topics. They are also good at teaching. 90% of the course is theoretical only 10% is practical. So it doesn't make students much industry-ready. The semester exams are quite difficult and there are exams every month.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: My experience at Tezpur University. Beautiful Campus, one of the best in India.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college for B.Tech computer Science are average. The average placement is around 3 LPA-4 LPA and around 60% of students got on-campus placement. The highest placement is 12 LPA, and the minimum is 1.2 LPA. Companies like Wipro, Amazon, TCS, and Velocity often arrive for on-campus placements, so overall for B.Tech in computer science, placement is average at Tezpur University.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of college and department is very good. Classrooms are well-built and structured. There are many labs with a maximum capacity of around 80 students at a time. AC rooms are also available, all around the university. Wi-Fi is available and with good connection, in every hostel, you will find Wi-Fi with good connectivity. There are 7 men and 8 women hostel in our university. Hostel rooms are well built and with good facilities. Mess food quality is very good and it is tasty. Canteen is also available in every hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members of our college are very friendly, helpful, and well-qualified. Some teachers studied at IIT and many big colleges in India, they are well knowledgeable in their fields. Course curriculum is very good, they make students ready for industry in their fields. There are 4 exams in every semester, 2 sessional, 1 mid term and then end term. Pass percentage is 30%, and the level of exam is moderate.
detailed_review.Other: B.Tech in computer science department is one of the best courses provided at Tezpur University, for this course, there are many facilities in the university. Placement is average, and faculty members have good qualifications. Placements could be better in the college, that is a must. Every year 2-3 fests are conducted. Campus surroundings are very beautiful as campus is surrounded by trees and full of greenery. There are facilities for all sports activities like football, basketball, cricket, badminton etc. And many other facilities for extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Well-Qualified Faculty, Industry-Relevant Curriculum, and Vibrant Campus Life.

detailed_review.Placements: Till now, 30 percent of the batch is placed, and the placement season is going on. The highest package is 11 Lacs, 8 Lacs is the average, and the lowest is 6 Lacs. Till now, the top recruiter is TVS. 100 percent of students get internships in different companies. The top role is Area Sales Head.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the facilities are available, like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and a library with good equipment, which enhances the academic environment. The quality of the facilities in my hostel and other hostels is good. Food is also nice, and all the facilities like medical, canteen, sports, and games are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are highly qualified and possess a deep understanding of their subjects. The course curriculum is well-designed and regularly updated to align with industry standards. The semester exams are moderately challenging, designed to test both conceptual clarity and practical application.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my passion for the subject and its relevance to my career goals. Opportunities for internships, projects, and workshops provide real-world exposure. The college hosts several cultural, technical, and sports fests, which are vibrant and offer opportunities to showcase talent and build networks.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Education (B.Ed.)
reviews.review_title: Good college and best facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Tezpur provides decent placements; about 70 to 80% are placed in our batch. My friends and I got a good package of 4 LPA, while the highest package offered is 18 LPA and the lowest package is 7 LPA. The recruiting companies include Page Group, HB, AcT, and many others. The internship opportunities are more than 68%. Students are placed in our batch.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a private bank facility such as Wi-Fi on campus with high speed, and the classrooms are well maintained and clean. The hostel rooms are fine; they really adhere to protocols and rules, especially for girls. The food in the hostel is good, and there are many games we can play. The mess provides good facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is very helpful; they assist me with academics to score well and secure placements. They provide hands-on training in real technology. Our teachers make students ready for the industry and are well-equipped with higher degrees and PhDs. The pass percentage is 78% in our batch.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is really good, and they hold various cultural events.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Exploring Tezpur University .

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are good in the sense that every engineering department student above CGPA 7 is eligible for campus interviews, and many get selected. Even if not placed via campus interview, many opt for off-campus placement, which is easy to get as we are Tezpur University passouts.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of Tezpur University is by far the best in the way. It is the 3rd most ranked university in the Northeast. Of course it has good hostels and playgrounds, swimming pool, yoga center, computer center, gym, central library, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members of the university are IIT passouts; some are Tezpur University passouts with good learning and mentorship for the students. Students are guided by professors, assistant professors, and research scholars. The exam is taken half yearly every year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Campus life is good, and you will have plenty of free time to prepare for any competitive exam.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students get placed, while those who don't often opt for M.Tech. Top recruiting companies include BHEL and Indian Oil. Last year, the highest package offered was 18 LPA, with an average package of 5 LPA. Internship opportunities are also good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are clean and well-ventilated. Labs are well-equipped with all the necessary instruments for experiments. Hostels are also clean, and the rooms are pretty good. Each hostel has its own canteen, which stays open until 2 AM, and campus Wi-Fi is accessible.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are nice and teach very well. If you don't understand something in class, you can ask your doubts after the class ends; they will help you for sure. The difficulty of semester exams is well-balanced, but the end-term exam is a bit harder.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure, facilities etc.

detailed_review.Placements: 70 to 80% of the students were placed in our course. The highest package offered in our course is 50 LPA, the lowest is 1 LPA and the average is 25 LPA. The top recruiting company is Apple. 100% of students got internships from our course. This is all the information about our batch and course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available for our course/department are very good there were smart classrooms where monitors are present and AC, fan, etc. The classroom also has AC, fan, etc. The library is very huge one of the largest libraries at Tezpur University.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality of the teachers was good. The course curriculum is relevant and it makes the students industry-ready. Firstly there were 4 exams in every semester 1,2, mid and end term. The semester exams in the colleges are difficult rated 8.5 out of 10.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is the best north-east college ever and the infrastructure and facilities are really good.

detailed_review.Placements: To be honest, placement here can be a little disappointing, but it is getting better day by day. The major hindrance is the location factor but the TnP cell works very hard to bring companies and provide students with equal opportunities. CSE has an average placement, followed by ECE. In the core branch, most people go for exams like GATE ESE, State PSU exams or any higher studies; however, some people also get placed on campus at PSUs like OIL, Electricity Boards and all.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Tezpur University has well-developed hostel facilities for its students. There are a total of 11 hostels on campus, which provide accommodation for both undergraduate and postgraduate students. The hostels are divided into separate blocks for male and female students. Each hostel has its own mess facility, providing affordable and nutritious meals. The rooms are well-furnished with basic amenities like beds, study tables, and cupboards. The hostels also have common rooms with television sets, and some have sports facilities like badminton and table tennis courts. Regular maintenance and cleaning of the hostels is ensured by the university administration. Overall, the hostel facilities at Tezpur University are considered to be of a good standard and meet the needs of the student community. At the end, one thing I want to say is that you have to face some problems.
detailed_review.Faculty: Academics here is quite hectic as we are under continuous assessment. We give 4 exams in a semester Test-1 (25 marks) Midsem (40), Test-II (25) and Endsem (60). Professors here are quite qualified, as most of them hold Ph.D. degrees from good and reputed colleges like NIT and IIT and have many years of teaching experience.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Tezpur University, The most peaceful place.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is key for every college, and we have good placement opportunities. Students start participating in the recruitment process after the 2nd semester exams. Every year, new recruiters come for placement, with top recruiters including IDBI Bank, Wipro, Accenture, Apollo, and HDFC Bank. The highest CTC offered to our batch is 8.5 LPA, and the average CTC is 4 LPA. We are primarily given domains in marketing and consulting. I secured a job at IDBI Bank with a good position as a Probationary Officer. Everyone participates in the summer internship program, which starts after the 1st semester. The stipend paid is around 5,000 INR for 8 weeks of service with the company.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: On campus, there are four schools included in TU: the School of Science, the School of Management, the School of Humanities and Social Science, and the School of Engineering. All schools share some common grounds, which have facilities for football, cricket, kabaddi, volleyball, and basketball courts, with engineering students dominating the area. The food quality in the canteen and hostel is a matter of concern. Wi-Fi connectivity is limited, with very low speeds, around 50 kbps. Monkeys on campus can be a nuisance, sometimes stealing bags and tiffins. The biggest drawback is that the university is 11 km away from the city. In the hostel, I have a 2-seater room with 2 beds, 2 tables, and 2 chairs. The room has proper ventilation. The food provided in the hostel is very bland and often too salty; sometimes, they serve the same food for 3-4 days, which becomes quite monotonous.
detailed_review.Faculty: The MBA course is covered with rich topics like data analysis, finance, accounting, and economics. We are given practical sessions to sharpen our material skills. The academic calendar is filled with project work, assignments, seminars, grooming classes, vivas, and many such activities. The teachers in the college are very helpful; they try their best. One teacher’s friend gave a referral that helped place 2 students. The teachers are well-qualified and supportive. Exams are held almost every week, but they are mainly for practice; the semester ends with the final exams, and in between, we have quizzes, assignments, and practicals.
detailed_review.Other: There are many events organized at the university, like Insights, Cyberweek, IEEE, etc. My plan is to work in the management sector, so my natural choice is an MBA.

reviews.course: Integrated M.Sc. in Life Sciences
reviews.review_title: Our college is good in infrastructure .

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are good. 70% of students were placed last year. One of the top recruiting companies at our college is Byju's. The average package offered during campus recruitment is around 10 LPA. Finally, placements on our campus are satisfactory and good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and facilities in our area are good. Wi-Fi, lab equipment, classroom infrastructure and a library—all kinds of facilities in our college are of good quality. The food available in our hostel mess and canteen is really good. Other activities, like sports and games, are also encouraged in our college .
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are highly qualified and knowledgeable professors. They help us in all academic activities and also in interested extracurricular activities. Our course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams at our college are difficult. The pass percentage is 75% .
detailed_review.Other: Apart from academics, our college also conducts some fests. The government provides us with scholarships as an encouragement .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average college with very beautiful campus!

detailed_review.Placements: I am in electrical engineering course; around 50 students are enrolled in our course. Talking about the previous year, around 80% of the students got placed in electrical batch. The package offered was quite decent, with an average of 8 LPA, and the highest package was around 20 LPA, while the lowest package was 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Reliance India limited, Assam State Electricity Board, Celstream Technologies, etc. Around 75% of students were offered an internship programme in companies like ITC limited. Various roles are offered in the course, such as product designer, product manager, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure available on the entire campus is magnificent. However, currently, the institution does not have an electrical department available. But the rest of the academic facilities are very well maintained and provided for students. Classrooms are provided with smart projectors and digital screens. The library is good enough, with a collection of around 20,000+ books and journals. Wi-Fi is also provided on the library campus. Hostels are quite good, as most of the hostels here are electricity-neutral and well-equipped with solar panels. Mess quality in hostels is not too good. However, a canteen is available for students in the hostel. The institute has its own health center available for medical facilities. A wide variety of sports are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are really helpful here. They have very good knowledge of the subjects. Their teaching qualities are also decent enough to make you understand the concepts. However, a few may be very boring. The course provides a wide variety of knowledge and understanding about the curriculum. The course is totally relevant. It will help students explore wider aspects of industry. Semester exams are not very tough! As it is primarily from the discussed portions of the classroom. One with a basic knowledge of class notes can easily pass the exams. Semester exam pass percentage is around 80%. .
detailed_review.Other: In my electrical batch, around 40 students are enrolled. The reason behind choosing this course is obviously due to my bad rank in JEE Main, and this was the only course I was getting. The best thing about this course is that you can get a good PSU's job through it. I think there should be more focus on providing practical knowledge in this course, as the complexity of the theory makes it difficult to understand. You will find lots of recreational programs on campus; various events like Inscignis, Techxetra, and food festivals are generally organized here. The campus is very beautiful, as it is covered with lush greenery and good infrastructure. However, connectivity is not very good here. Scholarships are also provided by the university; for more details, you can check the university's official website. Extracurricular activities like debates and quizzes are generally organized here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good central government college for those whose %ile is low in JEE Main.

detailed_review.Placements: To be honest, placements are a little disappointing here, but they are getting better day by day. The major hindrance is the location factor, but the TnP cell works very hard to bring companies and provide opportunities to students. Here, some PSUs are also looking for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The best things about this university are its lush green campus and its infrastructure. It is one of the best among many institutes in the North-East. The institute has 7 boys and 9 girls hostels, and some are under construction. It also has a central library, which is attached to all modern equipment and has a wide range of book collections.
detailed_review.Faculty: Academics are quite hectic here as we are under continuous assessment. We give 4 exams in a semester: sessional tests (25 marks), midterm (40 marks), and endterm (60 marks). Professors are well qualified, as most of them hold Ph.D. degrees from IITs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Tezpur University Worth taking admission or not.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 50 percent get placed with 12 LPA the highest package and average package 5 LPA with top recruiters TCS, Infosis, Wipro, BHEL, Indian Oil, APDCL, ONGC, AGCL, Google, etc. With 100 % of students getting internship in APDCL, AGCL, Indian Railways, ONGC, L&T,.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good, with a good Wi-Fi speed, a smart classroom, and a library with more than 2000 books. The hostel facilities are good, with a hygienic mess and canteen, good medical facilities, and a field with lighting for a basketball and volleyball court.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful with good qualifications and knowledge. The course curriculum is relevant, but the exams are difficult and pass marks are quite high. But the curriculum is industry-ready, and the teaching quality is very good with reachable professors and helpful lab assistants.
detailed_review.Other: The batch size is 50 students, with various extracurricular activities and festivals like Techxetra.

reviews.course: Integrated M.Sc. in Life Sciences
reviews.review_title: Good and best-environment college but lacks the facility of placement on campus.

detailed_review.Placements: Due to COVID, the companies didn't come for the recruitment. But before COVID, famous companies came for freshers placement. Students usually have to apply for off-campus placement. Very few companies come for campus recruitment and only a few are selected.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has the required and useful instrumentation in the labs. There is a very good environment in the classroom. Wi-Fi works great at high speeds, but sometimes there may be a problem with the connection. The hostel premises are great and the working staff is really helpful and sweet.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are great. They provide and help you with immense knowledge. We provide presentations every semester and it helps to correct our mistakes. It makes the student industry ready. But for the exam part, it is too much. It contains 4 exams, and the semester is for 5 months only.
detailed_review.Other: As I am interested in biological science, I took this Life Science course. It has various practicals and has made me learn a vast knowledge of biology. The thing I would like to improve is the placement cell in this department. Overall, its a good department. Here, many events and festivals happen, and the famous Inscignis is a famous event for science students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: Tezpur University's B.Tech Review .

detailed_review.Placements: 30-40% of students get placed here. The highest placement is 12 LPA. The lowest and average placements, I have no idea about, but you can check in Tezpur University's liked page. Companies like BEL, Amul, Ag Software, Oil, Larsen and Turbo, etc., visit here. Students find internships by themselves. Offers like GET, SDE, Consultancy are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is a bit slow but manageable. Projectors, desks, and benches are proper, and labs are good, filled with necessary equipment. The infrastructure is very good. The hostels are average, the canteen is there for packaged foods, and the mess food is average. The hostels are not very clean but manageable. The health center is there, so no need to worry. You can enjoy all sports and games here.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified enough. The course curriculum is pretty relevant and includes everything other colleges have. Semester exams are difficult towards the end but still manageable if you have done well in sessional and mid-semester exams. There are 2 sessional exams, 1 mid-semester exam, and 1 end-semester exam, totaling 150 marks.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE because it's the booming industry. Placements could have been better here, okay. Fests like Insignis, Tecxetra, etc., are there. Scholarships are provided for those in need.

reviews.course: Integrated B.Com. + M.Com.
reviews.review_title: Good campus and a healthy environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year, around 30–40% of students got placed during the campus placement drive. The average placement package was around 4–5 LPA. The top recruiters included Deloitte, Federal Bank, Dabur, etc. 100% of the students received internships in various companies like SBI Life, car dealerships, Dabur, and various FMCG companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities included Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and libraries were well organized and systematic. The infrastructure was very convenient for students, which helped them fulfill their needs. These facilities helped create a very peaceful environment for the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality was of a high standard and well-mannered. The activities in the course curriculum were relevant to the subjects. This helped in making the students industry-ready. The semester exams were very competitive in nature, with a pass percentage of 40.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this because it was one of the top universities in the North-East region. That offered integrated courses. The teaching quality, facilities, highly qualified teachers, and curriculum were the standout aspects of the course.

college_info.college_name: Tezpur University Admission 2025: Eligibility, Application Process, Courses, Entrance Exam & Dates

admission.title: Tezpur University Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: Tezpur University is an entrance-based university. The university has undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral courses in the different affiliate colleges. Tezpur University has diversified programmes in different disciplines and through four schools, including School of Sciences, School of Management Sciences, School of Engineering, and school of Humanities and Social Sciences and has been applying a large number of entries into the university through different national-level and university-level entrance exams, like CUET-UG, TUEE, JEE-Main, CAT, etc.

faqs.question: Can I get admission to Tezpur University with 60%?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University offers a wide range of UG, PG, certifications, and doctoral courses under various specialisations. Admission to any of these mentioned courses depends on their own eligibility criteria. Each course has its owns set of eligibility criteria set. Candidates can get admission to Tezpur University with 60% in courses like BEd, BA, BSc, BTech, Integrated MBA, etc.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: What is the application fee of MBA at Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University MBA application fee for 2024 is tabulated below: Candidates must pay the application fee once they complete filling the application form online.

faqs.question: How can I take admission to Tezpur University BEd?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University (TU) intakes admission in its B.Ed programme through two mediums: CUET-UG and Tezpur University Entrance Examination (TUEE), which is TU's entrance exam. Candidates willing to take admission in any of the specialisations of BSc must need to take the examinations described above. Before applying candidates must qualify for the B.Ed eligiblity criteria, i.e., twelve years of schol education with 60&% aggregate. Students must have a valid scorecard/ rank in CUET-UG or TUEE which must be within the range specified in the merit list released by Tezpur University. After the release of the merit list, eligible applicants should register for the counselling process through the university’s official website, followed by document verification and fee payment.

faqs.question: What is the percentage required for Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: The persentage required for Tezpur University's programme are as follows: Popular Courses Eligibility Criteria B.Ed Class 12 or SSC with a minimum of 60% aggregate Integrated MA Class 12 or SSC with a minimum of 60% aggregate BTech Class 12 or SSC with a minimum of 75% aggregate MBA UG Degree with a minimum of 45%-50% aggregate MCA UG Degree with a minimum of 50% aggregate ME/MTech BE/BTech with 50-60% PG Diploma UG Degree with a minimum of 45% aggregate

faqs.question: Which entrance exams are accepted for MBA by Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: Admission to the PG course is entrance-based. The entrance exams accepted for MBA by Tezpur University are CAT/MAT/XAT/ATMA/GMAT/CMAT. Additionally, more than 20 courses across multiple specialisations, and the admissions start in the month of June.

faqs.question: Are CAT cut offs announced along with the CAT result?
faqs.answer: Following the results announcement, Indian Institutes of Management (IIMs) will make available the Common Admission Test (CAT) 2023 cutoff. By the second week of January 2024, the outcome will be known.Prior to that, the qualifying CAT cutoffs—the minimal score requirements for admission to MBA programs—were announced by the IIMs. The CAT cutoff is different for every IIM. Shortlisted candidates for the admissions process will be those who meet the CAT 2023 cutoff. Candidates must meet the requirements set out by each IIM in order to be selected for the Group Discussion (GD) and Personal Interview (PI).

faqs.question: Does Tezpur University accept CAT score?
faqs.answer: Yes, Tezpur University does accets CAT score for admission to its MBA programme. As per the university's admission guidelines, admission to MBA is based on national level entrance exams such as CAT, XAT, MAT, ATMA, etc. Candidates must also qualify the eligibility criteria, i.e., A Bachelor's degree in any discipline from a recognised Indian or foreign university/institution (foreign degree must have UGC approval) with a minimum of 50% aggregate (or equivalent grade).

faqs.question: Can I join the BSc B.Ed Integrated course at Tezpur University through CUET 2023?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University accepts admission in the BSc B.Ed Integrated course through CUET-UG score/ rank. Candidates willing to take admission in the BSc B.Ed course at Tezpur University must take the CUTE-UG exam and perform well to secure a good rank. Candidates whose rank will be above the closing rank as specified in the merit list released by Tezpur University can further apply for the counselling process through the university’s official website. After counselling, the applicant must undergoe document verification and fee payment to secure admission for BSc B.Ed integrated course at Tezpur University.

faqs.question: Does Tezpur University accept CUET for admission in BTech?
faqs.answer: CUET-UG is a national-level entrance exam conducted by NTA whose score card/ rank helps in taking admission in all major UG courses besides BTech. Candidates willing to take admission in BTech must take the JEE-Main exam, which is also a national-level entrance exam but mainly for admission to BE/ BTech in various government and private universities and colleges. Also, Tezpur University accepts admission in its BTech course based on the scorecard/ rank of JEE-Main. For lateral entry to BTech, the candidate needs to take Tezpur University Entrance Examination (TUEE), which is TU's own entrance exam. Candidates must prepare well for the examination described above because only a good rank above the closing rank specified in the merit list released by TU will make the applicant eligible for further counselling rounds followed by document verification and fee payment.

faqs.question: What is the last date for Tezpur University BSc B.Ed application form?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University (TU) accepts admission in the BSc B.Ed Integrated course based on the rank secured by candidates in their CUET examination which is a national level entrance examination for admission in UG courses for differenent universities and colleges. CUET-UG application process generally conlcuded between March and April. Students willing to take admission in the the BSc B.Ed integrated course at Tezpur University must take the CUET-UG exam to become eligible for the counselling process. Candidates whose CUET rank is above the closing rank specified in the merit list released by the Tezpur University official website can register for the counselling process followed by document verification.

faqs.question: Should I join B.Tech at Tezpur University or make a drop?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University is a government university providing BTech programme at the undergraduate level. Students are offered the course across multiple specialisations and it costs INR 1.2 lakh to pursue this programme at the university. As per student reviews on the web, the university offers an amaing experience to the students. The curriculum of the BTech course is said to be informative and the infrastructure is decent too. However, some students have expressed their dissatisfication witht the placements. Students can expect an average package of INR 5.6 LPA once they have completed their degree from the Tezpur University. If you are looking to apply for an affordable university with decent placements and good infrastructure, you can certainly opt for Tezpur University BTech course .

faqs.question: How can I get admission for B.Tech in Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University BTech admission is based on the candidate's performance in JEE-Main. Candidates willing to take admission in BTech at Tezpur University should have passed class 12 or SSC with a minimum of 60% aggregate. Eligible candidates must take the JEE-Main examination and secure a good rank because only those applicants whose JEE-Main rank will be above the closing rank as specified in the merit list released by Tezpur University can proceed further with counselling process. Candidates with a valid scorecard/ rank must register for counselling, followed by document verification and fee payment.

faqs.question: Which BTech specialisations are offered at Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University offers BTech for four years via the school of engineering across seven specialisations. Find below the BTech specialisations offered:

faqs.question: What is the last date for Tezpur University BTech admission?
faqs.answer: Last date of applying for the counselling process at Tezpur University for B.Tech (Northeast quota through JEE Main) was 30 th May. Tezpur University (TU) accepts admission based on the candidate’s performance in JEE-Main, a national-level entrance exam conducted by NTA. Also, for lateral entry to BTech, i.e. admission to direct 2 nd year of BTech, candidates need to take Tezpur University Entrance Examination (TUEE) and for BTech (Lateral Entry), only those students who have a three-year Diploma in engineering course are eligible for admission.

faqs.question: Does Tezpur University conduct any exam for B.Ed admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, Tezpur University conduct an exam for B.Ed admission. Tezpur University Entrance Exam (TUEE) is the exam conducted by the University for admission to B.Ed and other courses. However, candidates can also must first qualify the eligibility criteria, i.e., twelve years of school education with 60% aggregate. Additionally, the university also accepts CUET UG exam for admission to its B.Ed programme.

faqs.question: Is there BEd course in Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: Yes, Tezpur University offers B.Ed course as an undergraduate programme. The department also offers a four-year integrated BA/BSc/B.Ed. Admission is based on a personal Interview, academic performance in qualifying examinations, and eligibility criteria. Qualifying candidates must apply via the university's official website. Eligibility: Twelve years of school education with 60% aggregate. Find below the seat intake of BEd programme:

faqs.question: How can I get admission to Tezpur University for BSc?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University (TU) intakes admission in its BSc programme through two mediums: CUET-UG and Tezpur University Entrance Examination (TUEE), which is TU's entrance exam. faqs.question: Is there a BSc B.Ed Integrated course available at Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University (TU) provides a four-year full-time BSc B.Ed Integrated course comprising eight semesters. BSc B.Ed is one of the most opted courses by students. Tezpur University inducts students in the BSc B.Ed Integrated course through CUET-UG rank. Candidates interested in taking admission in the BSc B.Ed course must take the CUET-UG entrance examination and prepare well for the exam described above. Students whose rank is within the specified range mentioned in the merit list released by Tezpur University can register for the counselling process, followed by document verification and fee payment.

faqs.question: Is there MA in Tezpur University?
faqs.answer: Tezpur University (TU) provides a two-year full-time MA course comprising four semesters. MA is one of the most opted courses by students. It is to be noted that the Tezpur University's rankings in 'Overall' category have demonstrated stability in trend as per the rankings of the previous years. In 2025, Tezpur University's rank is #151 , the same as last year's rank in the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF ranking. It has been seen that in the 'Management' category, the institute's ranks have shown a decreasing trend when evaluated against the ranking of the prior year. sections.heading: Introduction
text: Tezpur University is spread over an area of 262 acres with modern infrastructure conducive to learning and dedicated research. The facilities of Tezpur University include Facilities, Central library, Computer Centre, Hostels, Health Centre, Food Quality Control Laboratory (FQCL), Guest House, Kendriya Vidyalaya, Takshashila Vidyapeeth (A Pre-Primary School), Yoga Centre, Horticulture Section, etc.

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description:
Central Library is the focal point of all user community of Tezpur University. The Library caters to the educational and research needs of the academic community and its resources are consulted by scholars from all over the country. Central Library has been started functioning since 1994. At present, the library holds about 83200+ books, 10000+ journals (print + online),online databases, CDs and 7848 back volumes of journals.

Library is a member of e-ShodhSindhu Consortium, DeLCON consortium and DELNET. Library users can access book database, journal database, e-journals, institutional repository, electronic thesis & dissertations and other e-resources from any terminal within the University campus. Library provides reading facility for 365 days in the year.

The library is continuously striving at to adopt the best practices in all endeavours of its activities. The library has fully computerized with the help Libsys software which is an integrated multi-user library management system that supports all in-house operations of the Library.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description:
Tezpur University has 5 boys hostel and 7 girls hostel.All the hostels have basic amenities like water purifiers, common room, recreation room, mess, TV, laundry services, security and surveillance system etc.

The University provides separate accommodation for men and women students and research scholars, having  more  than 3700 capacity. The University also has a married research scholar’s hostel with capacity of accommodating more than 30 married research scholars.

college_info.college_name: NIE Mysore: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Scholarships, Placements, Rankings

highlights.summary:
The National Institute of Engineering (NIE), located in Mysore, was established in 1946. The institute is recognised by the AICTE and got autonomous status from Visvesvaraya Technological University, Belagavi in 2007. In addition to this, the institute is also accredited by the NAAC. NIE is the second engineering college in Karnataka and the first one in Mysore. NIE Mysore currently offers 20+ courses across two streams, Engineering and IT. Admissions at this institute are entrance-based. NIE Mysore accepts national or state-level Engineering entrance exams, such as COMEDK-UGET, KCET, Karnataka PGCET, etc. for UG and PG admission. Interestingly, the institute offers State Scholarships called epass and Vidyasiri. NR Narayan Murthy, the ex-chairman of Infosys, is one of the notable alumni of the college. Candidates can check the highlights related to The National Institute of Engineering in the table provided below
Check out more on The National Institute of Engineering Highlights in the below videos:

college_info_program.intro:
The flagship programmes offered at NIE Mysore include BE, BTech, MTech and MCA in affiliation with Visvesvaraya Technological University. MCA is offered at the North Campus whereas, MTech is offered in the South Campus. The institute has reserved some seats under the Management Quota (MQ).
Apart from this, NIE Mysore also has one seat reserved under the Sports Quota, which is offered to students who have represented the Junior/ Sub-Junior team of Karnataka/ any other State of India/ Union Territory of India at various state, national, and international sports events. Candidates can check some of the popular programmes offered at NIE Mysore in the following table:
