NIE Mysore Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Nice environment and college with diversity.

detailed_review.Placements: 40 percent of students get placed by companies. The highest package is 12 LPA, Schindler Electric, TCS, and Lams Engineers. The lowest package is 6 LPA. 30 percent of students get internship opportunities in various companies. Top roles are supervisors as a fresher in the company.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I do not live in a hostel, but my friends do. The hostel is situated in a nice place, we get good food, and the room is clean, but sometimes toilets get dirty and need to be cleaned on time. A security guard also plays an important role. I appreciate it, and my friend even said hostel food sometimes is not good, but hostel life is.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are ready to share notes and subject related stuff, but I feel like there is a little partiality among the teachers. The subjects are difficult, but teachers provide good notes, so it makes it easy to learn. Teachers are friendly to us, and students are also happy to learn.
detailed_review.Other: Fest on our campus is quite good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIE Mysore is the best place to study. It is really worth our time and effort.

detailed_review.Placements: There are 180 students in our batch, and out of that, 80% of students get placed which means 144 students got placed. The highest package offered is 12 LPA, and the lowest package is 3 LPA. The average package is 5 LPA. Benz, Bosch, and Siemens Technology are the top recruiting companies for our course. 70% of students got internships in various companies like Toyota, TVS, and Mypol. Top roles offered are HVAC engineer and plant manager.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The mechanical department has the best lab facilities not only in our college but in the entire state. Students who are willing to do research work in the mechanical field should opt for NIE Mysore without hesitation. The quality of the food served in the NIE boys' hostel is top-notch. If students are from North India or South India, they can easily adjust to our hostel food. The food is hygienically prepared and very delicious. The ground available to play sports is not that much big. It has one basketball court, one handball court, and some space for playing cricket.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our teachers are highly qualified. Most of them are from IIT. They have in-depth knowledge of their subject. We can approach them any time of the day. They are friendly and easily approachable. The course curriculum is up to date. What are the things practiced in the industry those things are only taught here.
detailed_review.Other: I am always interested in machines and how machines work, so I chose a mechanical engineering course. The best thing about our course is we will learn everything about machines, manufacturing processes, design and quality control.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It provides good placements every year. It is worth joining this college.

detailed_review.Placements: 85% of students get placed in the electrical stream, and the placement rate is high. The highest package received is 27 LPA. The lowest package is 4 LPA. The average ranges from 7-8 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Samsung, Texas Instruments, DTICI, TVS, etc. It offers roles based on their knowledge and skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are well-equipped. Free Wi-Fi is available and classrooms are well-furnished. It also has smart boards, and the library fulfills our needs. Food in the canteen is affordable and the taste is also good. Medical facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified, supportive, and responsive. The teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is good and ensures that everybody is eligible for placements. Semester exams are tough. Paper correction is strict. The pass percentage is 85%. The college is autonomous so it satisfies the demands of companies or industries. The teaching atmosphere is good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because 90% of students choose software. I wanted to be different from others as semiconductor industries upgrading job opportunities are more. It is the toughest branch as everybody knows. In odd semesters, branch fests will take place which include sports, ethnic day, DJ night, etc. In every semester, the college fest, i.e., TECHNIEKS is held for 4-5 days. The campus is good and refreshing. Social connections are more.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Reviewing NIE in just a glance.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90 out of 125 students are placed by the end of the final year. The highest package is 29 LPA, and the lowest is 3 LPA. Around 85% of students get internships by the start of the 4th year. The various companies that come for the internship drive are Infosys, Samsung, Nvidia, Texas Instruments, Bosch, and Havells. The role of a test engineer is a good for me to start earning.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Libraries are very huge, containing all books we need to understand our course thoroughly. Wi-Fi facility in classrooms is good enough, and I have no complaints about it. The canteen at our college is very lively and is a great place to hang out with friends or study for exams.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality at NIE is really good, as teachers are highly experienced, and the course is highly recommended and regularly revised to meet current industry requirements. Teachers are very helpful and go out of their way whenever needed. They provide informative notes that are good enough to score well in exams.
detailed_review.Other: I chose ECE because of the growing semiconductor demand in India. The course includes power electronics from the first year itself. The college hosts several fests and ensures maximum participation from students.

reviews.course: (Discontinued - 21-Aug-2025) Bachelor of Engineering (B.E. Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: Go for it. A must college for you people.

detailed_review.Placements: 95% of students have been placed. Packages range from 4.5 LPA to 24 LPA. Companies include Infosys, Cognizant, SAP, and many others. 85% got internships. Roles offered include Associate Engineer, Full Stack Developer, Web Developer, Software Engineer, Software Trainee, UI/UX Designer, and Software Engineer Trainee, among many other positions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is excellent. Hostel people are very polite; they will care for you a lot. Food is also good. There are canteens in GJB, NRN, as well as in the admin block. Many games are organized, like volleyball, basketball, throwball, weightlifting, and many others.
detailed_review.Faculty: Lecturers are very helpful. Courses are very helpful for the students to learn about industrial standards, and also teachers are very helpful; they will make you understand better at any time. Semester exams may be the toughest, but if you study hard, you will be ready to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I'm interested in coding.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Poor but memorable life.

detailed_review.Placements: 75 percent of students are placed in the college, with 21 LPA as the highest and 3.9 LPA as the smallest. Infosys, Deloitte, Google, and National Instruments.50% got internships in software development. Many students opted for short-term internships and left for higher LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very great, and they have a nice broadband connection and digital labs with digital tabs. I have not opted for any hostel amenities, so I am not sure about them, but my friends say that the amenities are neither too good nor bad; they are average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very good, qualified, and knowledgeable. The curriculum needs improvement in many ways. They use semester-based exams, which involve three internals that take much time, wasting time for mugging up. There is no practical use of such exams, but they are quite good.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for ECE and am unhappy with the college. I wish I had chosen the ISE course. ECE events are moderate.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: NIE is the best college for EEE.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good here. Around 80% of students are placed every year. The average salary package for EEE students in our college is around 8 LPA. Also, some top-notch companies visit for placements, like Texas Instruments, Samsung, DTICI, TVS, Tata, etc. This course is very good. There are many useful subjects about electrical and electronics engineering which help students for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facilities are available. The fees for both boys and girls are around Rs. 1,10,000 per year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-experienced, have good knowledge, and who can teach very easily. Curriculum is also good. There are many subjects to gain good knowledge about electrical electronics. Exam pattern is better compared to VTU College.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied because of faculty and people in Mysore are very good.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 81% were placed last year, and the highest salary package offered was 51 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Volvo, Infosys, Mercedes-Benz, and many others. There are good placement opportunities in our college, especially for core branches. Top roles offered are developing engineering and testing engineering.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Food is good, and all sports equipment are available. There is scope for sports in our college. Mess and canteens are fully cleaned and hygienic in our college. Food is also tasty in our college. Still, some medical facilities should be better.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are fully friendly with students and their teaching style is also good and understandable. Course curriculum is very good and it also helps in building students' skills practically and theoretically. Semester exams in our college are a bit difficult and pass percentage is 6.5 CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: I was interested in ECE branch. Still, use of technology should be better. There are fewer events in our college and campus crowd is average.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the college and placements are excellent.

detailed_review.Placements: In 2023, there were 120 students in the ECE department, out of which 116 students participated in placements. Around 56 students got salary package of over 10 LPA. Placement cell is good. Recruiting companies like Texas Instruments, Samsung, and L&T offer high salary packages.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available in labs and classrooms. Library is good. Sports event is conducted, which is good. I don't stay in a hostel, but from what I have heard from my friends, it's worth joining. There are some negative comments as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is excellent. The course curriculum is good. There is a CIE which is internal and SEE which is a semester-end exam. After the semester-end exam, there is two to three weeks' holiday for students, which is good. After every semester, there is one to two months' holidays.
detailed_review.Other: Fests and events are organized every month. College life is awesome.

reviews.course: (Discontinued - 21-Aug-2025) Bachelor of Engineering (B.E. Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure and faculty members .

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of students were placed last year. The highest package offered was 48 LPA, and the lowest was 8 LPA. The average package was 12 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Google, Microsoft, Infosys, JP Morgan, etc. 85 percent of students got internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: So there are basically two campuses. One is north and the other is south. Students who choose EEE, ECE, civil, and mechanical have to go to the south campus, while students who choose CSE, AIML, and ISE have to go to the north campus. Labs are there for each subject, and the library is vast with study material books, novels, and more reference books.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are quite knowledgeable and qualified. They teach in an interesting way. The course curriculum is good. It makes the students industry-ready. The teaching quality is also good. Semester exams are not that difficult. We can pass them easily. The pass percentage is probably around 95 percent.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college life was average with difficult curriculum and average placements

detailed_review.Placements: About 90 percent students are usually placed every academic year from our batch. Highest package was 34 LPA and lowest was 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Texas instruments, National Instruments, Samsung Nokia, Deloitte, Bosch, Cisco.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is mediocre with basic facilities available. Campus life is little boring as the fests and events conducted here are not that grand. It is an academic oriented college with more exposure towards course and curriculum. Sports facilities are also not that great.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is quite good most are PhD holders. They have good understanding over concepts and very dedicated and committed while they are teaching and encourage students to take part in many core club events so that they will get good exposure towards the subject knowledge.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Why you should do mechanical engineering in NIE Mysuru!

detailed_review.Placements: I am student of mechanical engineering from NIE Mysuru; our class strength was 180 with 3 sections out. 180 students and 150 students got placed in campus placements; the highest package was 15 LPA, the lowest was 4 LPA. The top companies for mechanical engineering was lam research, Mercedes-Benz, Daimler struck, Being, Schneider Electric, Dassault Systems, etc. Various roles offered were graduate engineer trainee, design engineer, young innovator, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Overall, the infrastructure of the college is very good, with good lab facilities but Wi-Fi is not available in classrooms. The library was good with fine infrastructure, and the hostel facilities were average. Sports and game facilities were there but the food was not up to par.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were very helpful and supportive during project work, and also faculty members are well qualified and some of them were from IT. Making students industry-ready is a quite challenging task but to some extent, our college has done a great job by teaching us various software used in the industry for example, SolidWorks and Ansys. These 2 programs are used in the mechanical design industry. Some colleges won't teach you these programs, but our college did. The semester exams are quite tough and the faculty are very strict about them.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am fascinated by mechanical engineering. The things I wish to improve in our course are that instead of sticking to a conventional way of teaching, they should use a practical approach because students will have good theoretical knowledge but not practical knowledge. The college conducts events regularly.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good faculty, okay infrastructure; placement is now a bit less but back in the day it was great.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60% of students from my course (seniors) are placed. The placement department head has a great number of contacts for the placements but due to student performance in the last few batches, the number of companies coming has decreased a bit. The placement coordinators are trying to bring in more companies. The highest package offered in our course is around 20 LPA, and the lowest is around 4 to 5 LPA. The top recruitment companies are Mercedes-Benz, Bosch, BMW, and Being. Almost 80% students got internships at companies like Being, BMW, Mercedes, Bosch and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are many labs for almost everything, they are well maintained and the trainers also have nice experience and teaching is good. The classrooms are good too, and have smart boards. The benches in the class are too comfortable; a class can have around 60 students. The library has a nice environment and has a variety of books to refer to for your studies. There is also a computer in a separate room in the library for your other research. The library is also well-equipped with books that can be borrowed but have to be returned by the due date or pay the fine.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. They have a lot of experience. Some are a bit strict but that's in other courses, while others are friendly and helpful. The quality of teaching is also good. Yes, the course is curriculum relevant and the college also provides students with different curriculum courses to make them industry-ready. The semester-end exams are a bit difficult. You might feel that they are giving you less time to prepare. In the beginning, I felt certain subjects were difficult in the first semester itself and a number of people scored less. The pass percentage is 40%.
detailed_review.Other: I got the course so I just went with it. Things to improve will include helping the students pass a bit. And there was a time when the portions were not completed but still, the staff just went on with it, didn't listen to students and made us write the exam. So these kinds of things should be avoided for the best of the students because we know what we go through if we don't get proper marks. Other things, like events, festivals, and crowds, are fantastic. You will make great memories and 1 tip is to enjoy as much as possible in the first few seems because the last seems to be hectic. Although do keep in mind that you have to keep your CGPA high from the start itself because you never know when and how it will drop if it does.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is good for engineering, it is recommended in Mysore.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college is outstanding in terms of placement and training activities. Our college being one of the reputed college in Mysore offers about more than 85 percent of placements every year, a good number recruiting companies visit our campus for recruiting students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a good infrastructure as it facilitates all the latest facilities in the campus. There are numerous grounds available for sports activities and laboratories are designed using the latest technology for a good practical knowledge attainment for a students. Hostels are very hygienic and well maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members here are very strict and will only help in academic related issues. Although they are well versed in the field of teaching. Our college is an autonomous Institute, conduct exams by itself. Exams here are very strict. The re-examination fee is comparatively high.

reviews.course: (Discontinued - 21-Aug-2025) Bachelor of Engineering (B.E. Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: Good for North Indian students who scored 90–96 percentile in JEE Main.

detailed_review.Placements: My course in NIE Mysore is CS with a focus on AI and ML. Nearly 87-92% of students got placed in CSE core; according to my placement cell, AIML placement will be similar to CSE core placement. The highest package this year was INR 54 LPA and the lowest was INR 4.5 LPA. The average pack for CSE was INR 11.4 LPA and that for ISE was 12 LPA. Top recruiting companies are TCS, WIPRO, VISA, and Mercedes-Benz. From the 5th semester itself, colleges provide internships to nearly 65–70 percent of students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
My college provides bad Wi-Fi. In terms of infrastructure, it is average, having decent labs and good classrooms. The library is also good but it is under construction. There are two campuses at my college: one is the south campus and the other is the north campus. All CS-related branches are on the north campus and the remaining branches (e.g., mechanical, EEE, CIVIL) are on the south campus. The hostel on the north campus is under construction so every student is told to stay at the hostel on the south campus. You will be amazed at how the distance between the North and South campuses is 13 km so we travel 13 km daily to attend our classes on the North campus. Facilities in hostel are:
*For North indian guys, food is okay, not too good. *you will find only one canteen in boys hostel, which is very small; they do not keep many items in canteen. *No medical facilities are available at the hostel. All sports facilities are available, like basketball, cricket, football, and table tennis. For that, you need to go to the girls hostel, which is 300 meters away from the means hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is nice. Teachers are kind and helpful. The course curriculum is very good and in my opinion, it will definitely help students a lot and make them industry-ready. Clearing the exam is easy; you have to go through the notes and pdfs shared by teachers. That's all you need to easily score good marks.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my rank in COMEDK. There were lots of Bangalore colleges waiting for me but as per my rank, it was difficult to get a CS-related branch. No such great event took place at my college. I joined this college for placement. It's placement is too good.

reviews.course: B.E. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: I recommend this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Although more than 60% of the students were placed, our batch had the least mass companies placements. In terms of the core companies, civil and industrial production have the fewest placements. However, many IT companies, including many startups, gave students from core companies a chance.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It is one of the oldest colleges in the country and also the finest. Our civil department had the finest hydraulics lab, concrete and material testing lab, highway laboratory, and CAD lab, among many others. The library offers a wide range of books and has a huge study area too. The digital library offers great resources too.
detailed_review.Faculty: The civil engineering department is the oldest department in the institution, with very experienced professors who support students in exploring their interests. The curriculum is very diverse, gives a good overview of all the subjects, and helps in developing a career.
detailed_review.Other: Technieks is the annual college fest which happens in the month of March. It is a three-day fest which is super fun. The department also has its own fest called Aakar, which happens once every two years. There are many societies that students can take part in. There are multiple organizations where students can volunteer.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The hidden secret of NIE.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are pretty good in our college compared to others. The average package goes up to INR 11 LPA for the teaching branches. The placement is the only thing that makes this college better than other colleges. The average package for the other branches is around INR 8.5–9 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the hostel is pretty good, but it is outside of the college, and the food is really bad. The hostel has common washrooms for the entire floor, and they have only triple sharing for boys, but girls have some pretty good options, and their hostel is inside the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty here is mixed, like some are pretty average while some are exceptional, but everyone has at least a master's degree. The curriculum here is decided as per the college's case; it is autonomous, and the timetable of the exam is also decided by the college itself.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is an excellent college in Karnataka for engineering courses.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90% of students got placed in this course. Few students opted for higher studies. Top recruiting companies are Mercedes, L&T, Google, Microsoft, Infosys, Philips, Wipro, etc. The highest salary package offered was 53 LPA. The average salary package offered ranges between 8 LPA - 9 LPA. The lowest salary package offered varies between 6 LPA - 7 LPA. Around 90% of students got internships in this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is excellent. Facilities are very good in our department. Every classroom has a digital board and screen. Our campus is Wi-Fi enabled. Laboratories are excellent. Hostel is very good. The food quality is perfect. Canteen is available. Medical facilities are available. Sports are conducted in this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified, helpful, and interactive. They are friendly with students. They always clarify our doubts. Doubt-clearing sessions are also held. Students from NIE are successfully placed and have good jobs. Semester exams are hard.
detailed_review.Other: Our college organises a popular fest called Technieks.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Our college is very good in terms of placements.

detailed_review.Placements: About 96% of students got placed on campus. The remaining students went for startups and further studies. The highest salary package offered is 35 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available on campus. There is an elevator facility in all buildings. The library has more than 1,00,000 books. Classrooms have boards and projectors. There are 2 canteens and 2 messes in our college. They provide good food at better prices. The hostel is behind our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many teachers are doctorates. They are Ph.D. holders. Most of them are strict in terms of attendance. Courses are selected by students. The majority of courses chosen by students are allotted for the semester. Exams are conducted very strictly. The passing marks are 40.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in signal and radio analysing. The infrastructure of our college should be improved. Our college conducts a fest named Technieks. It is held every year in our college. It is a good fest. Our college holds the national record for launching 1,000 websites at a time on March 1st, 2023. Infosys chairman and founder persuaded electrical engineering.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with this college.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 90% of students got placed in our college. The highest salary package offered is 50 LPA. The average salary package offered ranges between 10 LPA - 12 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 6 LPA. TCS, Infosys, Wipro, HP, Tata, Benz, etc. More than 300 companies visit our college every year. All students got internships in TVS, TEK Systems, Dell, etc. Students got IoT application roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of our college is very good. The campus is very good. All labs are working well. Each lab has excellent professors. All classrooms are clean and good. We have smart boards and smart classrooms for presentations. Our college provides free Wi-Fi. The library is very good. It has more than 12,000 books. It has a friendly librarian who encourages us to learn more and suggests some new books. The hostel is good. The hostel provides good food. Our college provides good medical facilities. There are no washing machines in the hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty members are very good. They encourage us to come forward. They help us to learn more rather than the syllabus. They help us to fix the bugs in building projects and prototypes. The teaching quality is very good. The course is very easy. Semester exams are conducted strictly. Our faculty members prepare us for exams. More than 85% of students pass exams every year.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in hardware works. Some courses should be upgraded. Our teachers should explain the uses of 3D projecting. Many events are held in our college. We have the best sports field.

college_info.college_name: NIE Mysore Admission 2025: Dates, Fee, Application Process, Eligibility

admission.title: NIE Mysore Overview 2025
admission.overview_text:
NIE Mysore admissions 2025 are primarily entrance-based. The institute accepts national or state-level Engineering entrance exams like COMEDK-UGET , KCET , Karnataka PGCET , etc. for UG and PG admission. NIE offers admission under regular, Management Quota and Sports Quota. NIE Mysore offers UG and PG courses in the Engineering stream, including BTech, MCA and MTech in affiliation with VTU . MCA is offered in North Campus whereas, MTech is offered in South Campus. Besides, the institute also offers PhD course at the doctoral level as per the VTU regulations.

To make an application to The National Institute of Engineering (NIE), Mysore :

Apply online to the Karnataka Common Entrance Test (KCET) through the KEA portal , or

Apply to COMEDK through the comedk.org portal to secure government and management quota seats , respectively.

For Management Quota seats , refer to nie.ac.in where a separate application is required.

For Postgraduate programs (MCA) , apply via the official NIE site after taking the Karnataka PGCET .

Undergraduate Engineering (BTech) Programs:

Apply to KCET/COMEDK: Students must apply and take either KCET or the COMEDK entrance exam.

Study at KCET/COMEDK: Appear for the respective entrance examinations.

Application of Management Quota: Visit nie.ac.in to apply for Management Quota seats .

Postgraduate (MCA) Programmes:

Karnataka PGCET: Seats are allotted based on performance in PGCET .

Apply on the Official Website: Visit the NIE site to apply to the specific course.

Check the Merit List: Track the merit list and follow instructions for admission fee payment after shortlisting.

faqs.question: Which entrance exams are accepted by NIE Mysore?
faqs.answer: Students seeking admissions into NIE Mysore must visit the official website and make sure to check the relevant details about the course selection they are looking for. Admissions are based on both merit-basis and entrance-basis. The prescribed entrance tests vary according to the particular course opted for by the candidate. Some of the prominent entrance exams accepted at NIE Mysore include KCET , COMEDK-UGET , Karnataka PGCET , among others.

faqs.question: What is the fee for BTech at National Institute of Engineering Mysore?
faqs.answer: NIE Mysore BE fee is INR 2.6 lakh. The fees might include components other than tuition fees. The BE tuition fee is calculated on the basis of first year. Hence, the actual amount may vary. Aspirants need to pay the course fee after completion of the selection rounds to confirm their seat in the institute. Besides, the programme fee, candidates also need to pay a registration fee in the start of the admission process.

faqs.question: Is COMEDK required for National Institute of Engineering Mysore?
faqs.answer: COMEDK is an entrance exam conducted by colleges of Karnataka to get admission for B.Tech courses. The eligibilty criteria for COMEDK is 50% aggregate in 12th boards. Yes, COMEDK is required for NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ENGINEERING MYSORE. Candidates can also get admission through their JEE MAINS SCORE, COMEDK SCORE or KCET  entrance exam into NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF ENGINEERING MYSORE.

faqs.question: How many students can do B.Tech at National Institute of Engineering, Mysore?
faqs.answer: The total number of seat intake for B.Tech at the National Institute of Engineering (NIE) Mysore is 1020. These seats are filled through exams like KEA, COMED-K, and Management Quota, with 234 students through COMED-K, 207 through the management quota, and the rest 579 students through KEA intake aided and unaided both.

faqs.question: What will the Karnatake PGCET exam be held for admission to M.Tech programme at  NIE Mysore?
faqs.answer: Karnataka PGCET is one of the exams that is accepted by many colleges including NIE Mysore. As per official sources, the Karnataka PGCET 2026 exam for the M.Tech course is scheduled to be held on May 23, 2026. Registration process is likely to begin in April 2026. Registered students must not forget to download and carry the Karnatka PGCET admit card on the day of the exam.

faqs.question: Can I join National Institute of Engineering Mysore without COMEDK?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates who have not qualify COMEDK UGET can still apply for NIE Mysore admission to BE course. Aspirants can join NIE Mysore through KCET or JEE Main scores. The institute also has reserved some seats under the Management Quota (MQ). It also has one seat reserved under the Sports Quota, which is offered to the candidates who have represented the Junior/ Sub-Junior team of Karnataka/ any other State of India/ Union Territory of India at various state, national, and international sports events.

faqs.question: What is the fee to apply for PGCET exam for admission to M.Tech course at NIE Mysore?
faqs.answer: NIE Mysore offers various M.Tech courses at its South Campus. For admission, students can submit valid Karnataka PGCET scores. Those who wish to take admission can appear for the PGCET exam. The fee to fill out the exam's application form ranges from INR 500 to INR 650. Note: The above-mentioned fee is as per the official sources. However, it is indicative and subject to change.

faqs.question: What is the application process for admission to M.Tech programme at NIE Mysore South Campus?
faqs.answer: In order to apply for the NIE Mysore M.Tech programme, students are required to visit the official website of the institute. After landing on the website, go to the admissions tab and click on the 'Apply Now' button. Next, fill out the form displayed on the screen to register and make a new student account. Further, log in to the account, fill the application form and submit the application fees.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for the BTech course offered at NIE Mysore?
faqs.answer: A minimum of Class 12 is required to get admission to BE programme of NIE Mysore. Below is the detailed eligibility for BE: Eligibility criteria as per KEA: Candidates who have completed 2nd PUC/ Class 12/ equivalent exam with English as one of the languages and obtained at least 45% aggregate in Physics, Mathematics along with Chemistry/ Biotechnology/ Biology/ Electronics/ Computer (40% aggregate for SC, ST, Cat-1,  2A,  2B,  3A and 3B category candidates) can apply for BE programme. For MQ Seats at NIE: Aspirants who have completed 2nd PUC/ Class 12/ equivalent exam with English as one of the languages and obtained at least 55% aggregate in Physics, Mathematics along with Chemistry/ Biotechnology/ Biology/ Electronics/ Computer can apply for BE programme.

For MQ Seats at NIE: Aspirants who have completed 2nd PUC/ Class 12/ equivalent exam with English as one of the languages and obtained at least 55% aggregate in Physics, Mathematics along with Chemistry/ Biotechnology/ Biology/ Electronics/ Computer can apply for BE programme. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Which has better placement at NIE Mysore, B.Tech in CSE or B.Tech in ECE?
faqs.answer: Given the institute's repute, both branches often have strong placement possibilities. Individual elements like skills, experience, and the unique demands of the job market might influence the placement scenario at NIE Mysore for B.Tech in CSE and B.Tech in ECE. According to the college's official website, the number of students placed in CSE in 2022 was 118, and 116 in ECE, which is relatively close. Because of the rising IT sector, the Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) discipline frequently has a somewhat greater demand in the industry. However, Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE) has seen significant placement success, especially in sectors such as telecommunications and electronics. Not satisfied with answer? faqs.question: Can I get a job in the government sector after pursuing M.Tech from NIE Mysore?
faqs.answer: Yes, there are many employment opportunities available in India's government sector for NIE Mysore M.Tech graduates. Thus, students who have completed their NIE Mysore M.Tech courses can seek out various job opportunities in the public sector of India Some of the reputed Indian PSUs to work for are NTPC, BHEL, GAIL, EIL, etc. Those who are willing to work in such PSUs have to appear for various government exams, such as UPSC (Union Public Service Commission) Exams, Staff Selection Commission (SSC), etc. Students recruited by the public sector of India can expect to start with a salary ranging from INR 5 LPA to INR 6 LPA . Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

Vallurupalli Nageswara Rao Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology, also known as VNR VJIET, is an autonomous institute and was established in 1995. VNR VJIET Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good academics, placements, and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Students are placed very quickly. Some students can get more than 2 offers if they have good knowledge in other subjects. While core people can get IT company, and core company has more advantages in it. They provide many different courses and offer a minor degree too.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the campus is very good compared to other colleges. Here, there is a good hostel facility so that everyone can stay without any worries.
detailed_review.Faculty: Here, the curriculum is very nice, and the value for our money. Exams are conducted perfectly as per the guidelines of the college. The pass percentage of the college is 40 out of 100. Teachers are helpful, very qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality is good. Faculty here is very good. They are perfect in teaching and understanding the students' mindset.
detailed_review.Other: Fests and events are quite interesting.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: It is good for placements and career.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement percentage is 70%. The highest package is 54 LPA, the lowest is 3.6 LPA, and average is 6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are D.E. Shaw and Oracle. Around 60% of students got internships in various companies like Chubb and Virtusa. Top roles offered are special programmer and graduate engineer trainee.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure of our college are awesome. They include Wi-Fi, lab instruments with high quality, neat classrooms, peaceful and insightful library. The quality of the facilities in our college is awesome. The quality of food that is available in mess is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is good. The curriculum is greatly relevant. It makes students industry-ready. The semester exam difficulty is above average in the first few years of college, then it gets easier.
detailed_review.Other: This college is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Faculty is helpful, and placements are good. The infrastructure is wonderful.

detailed_review.Placements: In recent years, about 80–95% of students get placed. The highest package was 21.7 LPA (2023), the average was 5.7 LPA, and the lowest was 3–4 LPA. Deloitte, TCS, Oracle, JPMC, and TSSPDCL recruit students. There are 188 internship offers, but only half are completed. The top roles are TSSPDCL engineer and graduate trainee engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are available. The Wi-Fi gets slow due to a large number of students actively using it. The library is good and well-maintained. Every book is available, and if a book is not available, we can request it. If it is useful for students, they provide it immediately.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of our teachers are Ph.D. graduates and provide good-quality teaching. The difficulty level of exams is medium, not too easy or too hard. They try to make the academic curriculum easy so students can easily grasp it and be prepared for industry work.
detailed_review.Other: I take a vocational course in intermediate, so I chose EEE, and as per my rank, it is the best option. They provide good infrastructure and certificate courses as well.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, the college offers a balanced experience for students.

detailed_review.Placements: About 70–80% of interested students in our course get placed. The average packages is 4–6 LPA and a few higher offers for top performers. Top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Accenture, Cognizant, and similar IT companies. Along with a few core and embedded firms for ECE students. Around half of students manage to get internships, both on and off campus, mostly in software, analyst, and trainee engineer roles. Overall, placements are good but not perfect, which is why the experience deserves 4 stars. Opportunities are decent, but core ECE roles and very high packages are limited.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Overall, the infrastructure is solid, with a green and clean campus. It also has a good academic and sports facilities, and reasonably comfortable hostels. Wi-Fi and mess consistency, along with a few maintenance issues, prevent it from feeling like a 5-star campus. It justifies a 4-star rating from students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college follows autonomous and JNTUH regulations, with core subjects that help students become industry-ready. Though a few topics are outdated, real industry skills still depend heavily on self-learning and projects. Semester exams are concept-based and generally of medium difficulty. If concepts are understood and notes are prepared, passing is manageable, but last-minute rote learning is risky. The pass percentage roughly ranges between 55% and 85%, depending on the batch and subject, so results are decent, but not everyone passes easily.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good academics, supportive faculty, strong placements, and a balanced campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 70–75% of students from our course get placed through campus recruitment. The average package offered is around 5–6 LPA, with the lowest packages starting at about 3–3.5 LPA. The highest packages go up to 20–25 LPA, mainly for software and product-based roles. Top recruiters include companies like TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Accenture, Cognizant, Deloitte, Capgemini, Amazon, Bosch, Qualcomm, and Siemens.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The department has well-maintained classrooms with projectors, Wi-Fi connectivity, and properly equipped laboratories. It support practical learning. The central library is spacious and well-stocked with textbooks, journals, and digital resources. It provides a good study environment. Hostel facilities are decent, with clean rooms. Along with a regular maintenance and good security. The mess food quality is average but hygienic, while the canteen offers affordable additional options. Basic medical facilities are available on campus. Students have access to sports facilities. It includes outdoor grounds and indoor games, encouraging overall development.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable. Semester exams are moderately difficult. They focus more on conceptual understanding than rote learning. With regular attendance and consistent preparation, clearing exams is manageable. The pass percentage is 75–85%.
detailed_review.Other: I belong to the B.Tech batch at VNR VJIET. The campus has an active student crowd, regular technical and cultural events, good sports and extracurricular activities. It is well-connected by transport. Scholarships are available for eligible students. Overall, it offers a balanced and disciplined campus life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Good placements, supportive faculty, strong placements, and industry-ready curriculum.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80 percent of our senior students have already been placed. JPMorgan Chase & Co. stands as the top recruiter, followed by leading organizations such as Deloitte and Darwinbox. The placement process begins in the second semester of the second year. With strong institutional support and a well-structured curriculum, nearly all students secure placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The campus offers excellent food facilities with multiple canteens, providing students with a variety of choices. The food is clean and exclusively available to students. Fresh ingredients are delivered weekly, and meals are prepared fresh every day. By focusing on popular and well-loved dishes, the canteens maintain consistent quality, especially the fries, which are exceptionally popular among students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are supportive and highly knowledgeable. Once students get used to each teacher's way of teaching, they realize it helps them learn better. The course focuses on making students industry-ready by including subjects like business communication.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the Computer Science Engineering course. They offer a variety of roles, such as software developer, tester, and web developer. Percentage of students are placed 80-90 percent. The top recruiters include JPMC, CHUBB, TCS, Infosys, and Deloitte.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is a lavish 12-floor apartment-style building surrounded by peaceful scenery between the concrete jungle. It has all benefits like quality food, gym area, yoga, study labs, indoor and outdoor games. Along with canteen, walking and cycling track, greenery, laundry, and also air-conditioned rooms.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly skilled, mostly being Ph.D. holders. They often show great compassion towards their job. The curriculum is designed carefully to make students ready for the real world. Exams are conducted fairly, with medium difficulty, testing the real conceptual understanding of students rather than following the traditional marking system.
detailed_review.Other: Hyderabad is the biggest cultural fest. Sintillashunz is organised, and it happens for three days and nights. It is an amazing time to experience the campus and the prestige of VNRVJIET.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: A decent college. Can go for it.

detailed_review.Placements: 85 to 90 percent of my batch gets placed with an average of 7 to 9 LPA, and the lowest being 3LPA, and the highest will range from 30 to 50LPA domestic and 90+LPA in Rubrik. Some of the major recruiters include JP Morgan, Deshaw, Deloitte, Amazon, and even some of my batchmates got internships from JP Morgan and Adobe, too.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Infrastructure is great. The classrooms are neat and big and have a smart board or a projector, and the labs are equipped with AC and have good computers. The hostel facilities are quite good for a college hostel, they are very good compared to other hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. There is even an ed cell for startups, and we have teachers helping students build startups. The course curriculum is based on the curriculum of JNTU, which cannot be changed but we need to learn new skills apart from the curriculum and for the same reason the college provides various upskilling programs like MERN Sack Web Development, DSA "Smart Interviews" and screening tests are conducted for the course that needs to be taught for the students like AWS and DevOps. And the semester exams are not that hard.
detailed_review.Other: I have applied to this college through B CAT JEE Main 96.7 percentile, although the maximum no of admissions are from A CAT, i.e., EAMCET. My score in the only course I got in the field of Computer Science is CSE Data Science. I will say curriculum, but thats not in the college hands as it is JNTU rules.  VNR is known for fests. There are many student chapters and clubs, both technical and cultural, which are the best places to connect and interact with people. The biggest cultural fest is "Sintillashunz," and the biggest Tech fest is "Convergence.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Review of VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Our seniors are 80 percent placed. JPMC is the top recruiter, followed by Deloitte and Google. Placements start in the second year, second semester, and almost all students get placed. As long as you follow the curriculum strictly, you receive placements. We also get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has hostel facilities and really good food. There is more than one canteen. We have a variety of food. It is clean and affordable, just for students. Food is prepared fresh every day. The infrastructure is huge, with many blocks and rooms to study and beautiful places to enjoy.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have supportive faculty with loads of knowledge. Over time, we get used to the working style of faculty. The courses make students industry-ready. Different types of courses are available, all of which are useful and help students excel in their fields.
detailed_review.Other: We have many events, and Scintillations is the biggest event in the college. There are lots of clubs and student chapters for extracurricular activities, technical activities, and career growth.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: VNR VJIET College review: What students should know.

detailed_review.Placements: We have seniors who are 80 percent placed. JPMC is the top recruiter, followed by Deloitte and Google. Placements start in the 2nd year, 2nd semester. Almost all the students are placed. As long as you follow their curriculum strictly, you are sure to receive placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Really good food and more than one canteen on the campus allow us to buy food that is clean and affordable, just for students. Food is regularly delivered every week and made fresh every day. The key lies in selecting the most popular dishes and relying on them. Fries are to die for.
detailed_review.Faculty: Supportive faculty and filled with loads of knowledge. As long as you get used to the working style of the respective teachers, you will feel that it is in your best interest. This course makes the students industry-ready, with courses like business communication.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college with well-defined faculty. And really good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: We have seniors who are 80 percent placed. JPMC is the top recruiter, followed by Deloitte and Google. Placements start in the 2nd year, 2nd semester. Almost all the students are placed. As long as you follow their curriculum strictly, you are sure to receive placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Really good food and more than one canteen on the campus allow us to buy food. Clean and affordable, just for students. Food is regularly delivered every week and made fresh every day. The key lies in selecting the most popular dishes and relying on them. Fries are to die for.
detailed_review.Faculty: Supportive faculty and filled with loads of knowledge. As long as you get used to the working style of the respective teachers, you will feel that it is in your best interest. This course makes the students industry-ready, with courses like business communication.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Great environment, great people and lots of memories are made here.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our course are, honestly, quite satisfying. Most of my friends got placed, probably around 85 to 90 percent and a few chose higher studies. The packages vary depending on performance, but top companies like Microsoft, ServiceNow, and Amazon gave great offers, while other companies offered solid starting roles too. The average package is around 6 to 7 LPA, which is decent for a fresher. We had regular training sessions for aptitude, coding, communication and mock interviews that really boosted confidence.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure at VNR gave a comfortable learning experience. Our department had good classrooms, clean space and systems in labs that worked fine for most of the projects. The library is honestly one of the best places because of how peaceful it is during exam time. Hostel rooms are decent, security is strict, and the environment is clean. Mess food is okay, some days tasty, some days average, but hygiene is maintained. Overall, nothing too fancy but definitely reliable and well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are supportive for the most part. There are a few excellent teachers who make classes interesting and guide students wherever needed. The curriculum covers topics where the industry experts, especially if you aim for software roles, but you need to keep learning extra skills on your own. Semester exams are not too hard, as long as you follow the lectures and prepare at the right time, you can pass comfortably. Overall, the academics here felt balanced.
detailed_review.Other: The campus atmosphere is friendly and positive with active clubs, fests and workshops that make life more than just classes. Events like technical exposure and cultural festivals really bring out student talent. So I feel happy with the experience overall.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Really good facilities, infrastructure and great faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: We have seniors who are 80 percent placed. JPMC is the top recruiter, followed by Deloitte and Google. Placements start in the 2nd year, 2nd semester. Almost all the students are placed. As long as you follow their curriculum strictly, you are sure to receive placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Really good food and more than one canteen on the campus allow us to buy food that is clean and affordable, just for students. Food is regularly delivered every week and made fresh every day. The key lies in selecting the most popular dishes and relying on them. Fries are to die for.
detailed_review.Faculty: Supportive faculty and filled with loads of knowledge. As long as you get used to the working style of the respective teachers, you will feel that it is in your best interest. This course makes the students industry-ready, with courses like Business and Communication.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Well-maintained campus with proper curriculum.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm from 2023-2027 CSE (artificial intelligence and machine learning). In our course, 85-90% of students are placed. Some top recruiting companies include Amazon, Deloitte, and several good startups. The average package lies between 7 and 10 Lacs per annum.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college, which is being built now, is quite good with advanced digital classrooms, labs with projectors, and we have a digital library and a department library. Classrooms are well-maintained with ample seating and ventilation. The campus is filled with greenery everywhere.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most faculty are experienced and approachable. They support students regarding projects and doubts. The curriculum at VNR is quite good, with proper industry orientation, lab-oriented courses, and project-based learning. Apart from that, we also have DSA training with mentors assigned.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: In the TG and Andhra Pradesh, this is the best college.

detailed_review.Placements: 70 percent of students got placed from our course. The highest, the lowest, and the average package offered in our course is 2 LPA-7.5 LPA. The top recruiting company for our course is TCS. 50 percent of students got internships from our course at TCS, NDMATRIX, and Reliance.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available for our course. There is good communication between students and teachers. The good quality of the facilities in our hostel. The quality of food available in the mess and canteen, medical, sports, and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful to us and qualified. The quality of teaching is good. The course curriculum is related, which makes the student industry-ready. The semester exams are easy to pass in our college, the pass percentage is 70 percent each semester, which may vary.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course based on our inter-faculty suggestion that this is the best for the upcoming years.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great campus facilities with decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Computer Science and Engineering 2026 batch. Around 50% of students were placed till 2025. The highest package was 30 LPA, the average was 6 LPA, and the lowest was 4 LPA. Some of the top companies are JPMorgan, Deshaw, Deloitte, and Oracle. Roles offered are software developer and consultant roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Digital classrooms, well-equipped labs with good Wi-Fi, and both digital and physical libraries are available. The canteen offers different varieties of food, and the taste and quality are good enough. There is a medical room in case of an emergency.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are supportive and well-qualified. The curriculum is updated every 2-3 years, and it is industry-relevant and focuses on real-world problem solving. Semester exams are of medium difficulty, and the college maintains a very good pass percentage.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Automobile Engineering
reviews.review_title: I'm a little satisfied with the college. Something more I need.

detailed_review.Placements: Especially in my course, 70% of the students got placed in the recently passed-out batch of 2025. The highest package was around 9 LPA, and the lowest was around 3.6 LPA. The average is 5-6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Mahindra, ACKO, TCS, ZEPTO, INFOSYS, Hyundai R&D, Pinnacle Generators, Amazon, etc. Roles include R&D, graduate engineer trainee, supervisors, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities of our course are average, like okay-ish. Wi-Fi is there, but not at high speed, and classrooms are okay, not greatly facilitated. The library is there in not bad quality. The facilities in our hostel are good, and the quality of food is also okay, not bad at all. Medical facilities need to improve more, and sports and games are prioritized the most, and we can happily participate in any type of sports or games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, and all the faculty members are highly qualified, like Ph.D. holders, and they have good knowledge. The teaching quality is good; actually, this course prepares us for the industry, but we need more practical knowledge so that we can understand better. Semester exams are a little tougher to pass for classmates, as the pass percentage is 60% in my class.
detailed_review.Other: Actually, my fate decided my course; I'm not much interested in my course. The best things in my course are AUTOMOTIVE CLUBS.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life at VNR VJIET as a student.

detailed_review.Placements: I think around 50 percent of students from my batch get placed. 95 percent are placed from the 2025 batch. The top recruiters are Infosys, TCS, and other companies like Chubb and Deloitte. They provide great opportunities for all students from various backgrounds. However, most companies come for CSE and allied branches.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel infrastructure is pretty good. The management provides all kinds of facilities such as stationery, computers, a gym, and sports grounds. The mess and canteen are very clean. Medical facilities are available on call. Students are given utmost attention. Wi-Fi and LAN are both provided. A balanced diet is provided every day, with a variety of meals. The menu changes according to the season.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is good. They are available at any time for students to contact and check in with them. They guide students at every step. The college conducts many events and guest lectures, inviting industry specialists to prepare students and keep up with emerging technology. The exams are easy if we study the syllabus provided. They test student's ability to understand, analyze, and comprehend the topic.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is crowded as it hosts a large student body of at least 7,000 students. So the campus could be bigger and more accommodating. Events are conducted every week. So students need not worry about their extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is good and suitable for students who want to get placed with a good package.

detailed_review.Placements: Coming to placements, all top companies approach our college. The highest package this year is 19 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The whole course costs around 1.5 LPA, but recently it increased to 2.4 LPA. Wi-Fi is available in the college and in classrooms. Hostel charges are around 1.3 LPA, including bus facilities. Sports like football and volleyball are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very friendly with students. They behave like friends with every student. All teachers are well-experienced. Coming to exams, the papers are moderate and sometimes very difficult. Teachers clarify doubts without any irritation.
detailed_review.Other: I am Puli Chintu, currently pursuing B.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering. Our branch has more strength compared to other branches.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is a very good college. Value for money. The placements are very good.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm a civil engineering student from VNR VJIET. The college has very good placements for all the branches with a decent package. For my civil branch, the placement is good. The highest package offered is 8 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA. L&T, MEIL, Shapoorji Palonji, Aparna Construction, etc. The college mainly focuses on startup culture, which is very important for the present generation.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure are very good. We have the best Civil engineering labs in our college. The whole campus has a free Wi-Fi connection. The classrooms are well-maintained, and the faculty is very friendly and supportive. The library facility is also very good, with a variety of books.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and very friendly. Always supportive and encouraging of students. The help is not only in studies but also in personal development. The course is designed in such a way that it makes us industry-ready. The best thing is that you can follow your passion in this college.
detailed_review.Other: I opted for this course because I'm interested in civil engineering. I got a rank of 15000, but I chose civil engineering because it is one of the best engineering colleges for civil engineering. Events are also held in this college to refresh our minds and control stress. We even have various clubs which help student choose their passion.

college_info.college_name: VNR VJIET Admission 2025: Category seats, Application , Eligibility, Admission

faqs.question: What are the courses that VNR VJIET offers?
faqs.answer: VNRVJIET is an autonomous institution under UGC and affiliated with JNTU-Hyderabad, offers a range of specialisations in BTech, MTech, and PhD courses. If you're interested in pursuing an M.Tech degree, you can find the application on the official VNRVJIET website and submit the completed form via email to or directly to D-519, D Block, VNRVJIET. Keep in mind that entrance-based admissions for VNRVJIET courses admissions are determined by TSCHE guidelines.

faqs.question: What are the essential qualifications for admission to BTech course at VNR VJIET?
faqs.answer: Candidates willing to apply for VNR VJIET BTech must have passed class 12 from a recognised board with Physics, Maths and Chemistry / Biotechnology / Biology as optional or related vocational courses in the fields of Engineering and Technology. The table below showcases the detailed eligibility of BTech at VNR VJIET: Passed Class 12 with Maths, Physics and Chemistry / Biotechnology / Biology as optional or related vocational courses in the fields of Engineering and Technology from a recognised examination board, with a minimum 45% marks for general category and 40% marks for the reserved category. Minimum Age: 16 years

faqs.question: What is the fee for B.Tech at VNR VJIET?
faqs.answer: The fee for B.Tech at VNR VJIET can range from INR 3.9 to INR 5.4 Lakh, based on the specific course you're applying for. The institute accepts CBSE 12th, ISC, TSBIE, and TSEdCET exams for admission to B.Tech. The average package offered to B.Tech students is around INR 6 Lakh.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for admission to M.Tech at VNR VJIET?
faqs.answer: VNR VJIET offers M.Tech courses with 13 specialisation options, such as Advanced Manufacturing Systems, Computer Science and Engineering, Electronics & Instrumentation, and more. Admission to VNR VJIET M.Tech is done on the basis of rank secured in GATE or TS PGECET. To get admission at VNR VJIET for M.Tech, one needs to have at least a 50% graduation score in a Bachelor’s degree and qualifying marks in entrance exams (GATE, TS PGECET).

faqs.question: What is the latest cutoff information for admission to M.Tech at VNR VJIET?
faqs.answer: Admission to Masters of Technology (MTech) at the VNR VJIET is not done based on the scores obtained in any entrance exam. To be eligible for the course, the candidate must have passed Graduation from a reputed university/institute with 50% marks in aggregate.

data.title: VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology Placement Report 2025
summary: In the 2025 placement drive at VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology, the highest package reached INR 54 LPA . The overall average package for graduates stood at INR 7.09 LPA . More than 90 companies participated in the placement process, resulting in over 1640 job offers. Notable recruiters included TCS, Oracle, IBM, Accenture, Google, Microsoft , and others.

Earlier, in the placement drive for 2024, the highest and the average package stood at INR 51 LPA and INR 7.09 LPA , respectively. A total of 125 recruiters participated in the recruitment drive. Additionally, 80% of students got placed from CSE and allied branches in 2024. Similarly, in VNR Vignana Jyothi Institute of Engineering and Technology placement in 2023, the highest package recorded was INR 48 LPA.

These courses are offered in Full Time mode. A total of 17 courses offered by the Institute are available across streams such as Engineering and Business & Management Studies. The institute has all the necessary facilities to the students.
