college_info.college_name: Vardhaman College of Engineering Fees 2026
Vardhaman College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the college and am having a great experience.

detailed_review.Placements: I am yet to complete my course and am in the final stage. Placements are quite good for seniors. Various companies visit the campus. The selection percentage is good. Most MNCs visit the college. The average salary is 6 LPA, and the highest package seen is 54 LPA, but most students get average packages.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Most of the infrastructure is good. All labs are well-equipped and accessible at all times. Core and computer labs are available, and every branch has all types of labs. The quality of food in the mess is good, clean, and reasonably priced. Sports and games are conducted at decent times during the year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and effective in teaching. They implement real-time teaching methods for every course. The curriculum is relevant and provides valuable information. Semester exams are moderately difficult. The pass percentage is around 82%.
detailed_review.Other: Overall, the college provides a decent experience. Students are satisfied with what they pay. The crowd and campus life are good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The placements are not so good, and campus life is okayish.

detailed_review.Placements: There are not many good placements. Mostly, mass hiring is going to happen from service-based companies, but rarely do product-based companies visit the campus. So placements are not too good. Companies with 3 LPA to 5 LPA visit the campus more often in the 4-1 semester.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good, and the college hostel is also good and well-maintained. The food in the hostels is okay and good sometimes. The rooms are either six-occupancy or two-occupancy. The infrastructure is good. We also have an incubation center in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is okay. Some are lab assistants, and some are doctoral holders. Lab assistants also teach core subjects, but they sometimes lack knowledge, which is not good. If we complain, the management is not going to change the faculty members.
detailed_review.Other: The events are good. The technical events are very good, and sometimes the non-technical events happen once a year, like concert night, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall a good college experience with great academics.

detailed_review.Placements: For the 2023–24 batch, placements in my course are good and around 82 percent of students got placed. The highest package is 52 LPA, the average is 6 LPA, and the lowest is 2 to 3 LPA. Many top companies visited our college, including Accenture, Deloitte, Capgemini, Cognizant, TCS, Infosys, Salesforce. There are a few who got internships on their own, and the college is promoting internships as well. Top roles include software engineer, data analyst, data engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our campus is spread over about 15 acres with 5 academic blocks, canteen, mini auditorium, library, and auditorium. The overall infrastructure is good and clean. There are dedicated labs for every important course. As an ECE student, in our block there are costly kits for the experiments in labs. Wi-Fi is poor, classrooms are good but not benches. There are SMART classrooms as well (3 or 4). The quality of the facilities in the college hostel is excellent, and the food is top notch. But it is costlier to stay in the hostel. Sports and games are excellent, and events like Tejas, etc., happen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is good. Yes, the teachers are qualified in Ph.D. too, and some teachers only explain with PPT. But yes, by considering majority teachers, the quality is good. The courses are relevant but it may not make the students industry ready. It makes 50 percent ready, I would say. The semester exams are probably easy when compared to OU paper, as our college is autonomous. Pass percentage is 70 to 75 percent.
detailed_review.Other: I chose ECE course to balance between both software and hardware. The improvements may be college benches, and teachers should make students industry ready. Events and all extracurricular activities are excellent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: It is strict and studies are good, and placements are also nice, but you need to work hard.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are around 70%-80% of students got placed. They also provide internships. Top recruiting companies are Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, and startup companies. Top roles are software developer, data analytics, system engineer, business analyst, test engineer, and marketing analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has Wi-Fi enabled in the classroom, good labs, hostel that provides decent rooms, a mess with hygiene and good food, and a canteen that offers more options at a higher price. There is no campus area to explore, there is no time for sports and games to participate, overall, I did not like it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Not bad, teaching is not good, everyone passed, but the semester duration is very short, teachers are not very helpful, poor qualification of faculty and poor knowledge, poor teaching quality, there is mostly industrial relevant information, and the pass percentage is 85%-95%.
detailed_review.Other: It is a specialization that can improve placement and training, events are not conducted.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: I can say that the faculty is more responsive to help students.

detailed_review.Placements: The course I'm pursuing includes a total of 120 students. The college placements are good with a package of a minimum of 3 LPA and a maximum of 6 LPA. The college encourages a lot of recruitment companies, but the college can place only few who are extremely skilled.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is great, along with the faculty. We have a huge library with lots of books and grounds too to make us stress-free. The canteen in the college is awesome with tasty food at a reasonable price. The classes are huge, but the only thing that is lacking is the MBA.
detailed_review.Faculty: The lecturers are highly talented, and they show the best route to achieving our dream. But the semesters are difficult to clear due to regular exams. We are having internal exams every 1.5 or 1 month, where we need to write 2 papers in a day, and these marks are added to the sem.
detailed_review.Other: I chose an MBA to become a professional financial employee. The college also offers huge events to relieve our stress.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good placements, supportive faculty members, and excellent campus facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: For Vardhaman College of Engineering, Hyderabad, our batch has a strong placement record, with nearly 80-85% of students placed. The highest package is 52 LPA. The average package is around 6 LPA, and the lowest is 2 LPA. Top recruiters include Amazon, Google, Deloitte, Infosys, Accenture, Capgemini, and TCS. Around 70-80% of students also secured internships in reputed firms, with roles like software engineer, data analyst, consultant, and developer being the most offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Vardhaman College offers modern infrastructure with Wi-Fi, smart classrooms, well-equipped labs, and a rich library. Hostels are clean with good security. The mess provides hygienic food. Campus has medical care along with indoor and outdoor sports facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at Vardhaman College are highly qualified, supportive, and knowledgeable, with many holding Ph.D. degrees. The curriculum is regularly updated and aligned with industry needs, helping students become job-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult, but with proper preparation, most students pass, and the overall pass percentage remains consistently high.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am interested in technology and future job opportunities. The best part is the supportive teachers and good placements. I wish there were more practical exposure. Campus has fun fests, events, scholarships, and a friendly crowd.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Good placement opportunities with strong industry connections.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80% of students from our course got placed. The highest package is 12 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA, and the average is 5 LPA-6 LPA. Top recruiters include Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Accenture, and Cognizant. Nearly 65% of students also receive internships in reputed companies like TCS and Cognizant, with roles such as software developer, data analyst, and system engineer being offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Vardhaman College offers smart classrooms, Wi-Fi, modern labs, and a large library. The hostel has clean rooms, 24/7 water, Wi-Fi, medical care, and good security. Mess provides decent food. Sports facilities include playgrounds and indoor games, and there is a gym.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified, supportive, and knowledgeable, ensuring concepts are explained clearly. The curriculum is well-structured and relevant to current industry trends, making students job-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult with a high pass percentage, provided you prepare well in advance.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for career growth in tech. The best part is the updated syllabus, great faculty, and good placements. The campus is green, has fests, clubs, and sports. Connectivity is good. Improvement is needed in advanced labs and more internship tie-ups.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Review of Vardhaman College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: In Vardhaman College, in our course, AID has a demand branch, so many people want to join this course. At least 85% of students got placed in our branch. The highest package in our course is 21 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. On our campus, there are top companies visited like Kia, Zomato, PhonePe, Google, TCS, and so on.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is good, with clean and neat facilities in every block, which includes Wi-Fi with high-speed and a large library full of books, which is helpful for students to improve their percentage. The classrooms are also neat and clean. In the hostel, the quality of food is good and the rooms are clean.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified and friendly with students to clarify their doubts. The campus trains the students to get their dream job by teaching coding subjects. The course curriculum is relevant, semester exams are moderate in writing, and the percentage to pass the exam is 40%. Vardhaman faculty members are well educated, full of knowledge and experience, and have good teaching skills.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: It is very useful and can help you with your studies and other activities.

detailed_review.Placements: Evernorth, Wipro, etc., they only keep boosting you in placements and tell you how you should boost yourself to improve your knowledge and take placements. They also give you chances to get into internships and other courses, and help you with all the forms and companies to get placed in them.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is too expensive, and their rooms are too small, while the mess food is not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching is good and the faculty are very helpful. They assist with exams and make sure you don't get involved in other activities or bad habits. They are very good. When we come to the curriculum, it is also very good. It feels like a small yet substantial amount of material to gain knowledge and work with.
detailed_review.Other: Making new information and running technology

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: My honest review on Vardhaman College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: My batch course is alright. It's going pretty well, and the placements are good for the going batch. The highest and lowest packages are according to the passing batch. Top roles are not offered by the college. Maximum 50% of students are getting placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure at Vardhaman College of Engineering are adequate and excellent. The hostel premises are neat and clean, including the mess and canteen areas. The quality of the facilities in our hostel is average. The quality of food is better.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at Vardhaman College are Ph.D. holders with great teaching background. The curriculum is designed such that the prerequisites of every domain are laid out. There is not much difficulty for the semester exams in the college, and the pass percentage is nearly 75%.
detailed_review.Other: Vardhaman annual fest called Ortus is a 2 days event which is held grandly. The first day is the traditional day, while the second day is Western.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Excellent infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 90% of students get placed. The top recruiting companies are IBM and Microsoft. The highest salary package offered is 15 LPA, and the lowest is 4 LPA. The top roles offered are Data Scientist and Machine Learning Engineer. Around 70% of students get internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is good. The college building is nice. The teaching and learning facilities include 50 classrooms and 4 computer labs. The Wi-Fi is enabled with high-speed internet. Many technical and financial books are available in the library. The campus provides good hostel facilities, like bedrooms with attached bathrooms. The canteen is also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable and well-educated. They are highly qualified and experienced. They are very helpful and supportive, and they are very friendly to students. The course curriculum is relevant and makes students industry-ready. The semester exams are difficult and prepare students for the industry. The pass percentage is 75%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good for encouraging activities in you.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements in recent times are good. Our batch was started during 2023 and going nice in front. Courses offered here are well and good. Recent time the college has received placement percentage of 63%. The average package is of 7.5 Lacs and the highest was 45 Lacs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facility is nice. The fee of the hostel is increased by Rs. 10,000 per year. Sometimes it is thought that it is not good to stay in a hostel as the fee increases. Many students prefer to stay 1st year at the hostel and later the next 3 years at an outside hostel or rooms given rent.
detailed_review.Faculty: The explanation of the courses by faculty is good. The curriculum is designed well for the students according to the society's recommendation. Of course, the explanation is the same as compared to the remaining colleges but if you want clarity on any topic you can meet the faculty personally.
detailed_review.Other: Events occurring at college are well good and should be given the care to study also at the same time.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the college events.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% percent of students were placed during the recruitment process. The highest salary offered was Rs. 5,200,000, while the lowest was Rs. 2,00,000, and the average was Rs. 6,14,402. Accenture was the top recruiting company. JPMorgan offered internships, with 25% of students securing positions. The top role was securing as a manager at Google. While coming to the placements maximum number of students will be placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure will be available but in the lab sometimes some systems will not properly. Sometimes we even face network issues during exams. The hostel accommodations are decent, but the rooms can be small. On the positive side, sports and games are highly encouraged and well-supported.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very well and knowledgeable. They guide the students very well. They are very friendly. The course curriculum was excellent. Standards are very high and ready for industries. Semester exams will not be very difficult 85% of the students will pass.
detailed_review.Other: I choose this course according to the present value in the market. By this, we can able to perfect in coding skills. The infrastructure is good. Events and fests are good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science
reviews.review_title: Let's come to Vardhaman College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, Vardhaman College of Engineering placements are very good they provide almost every student with a job or placement almost all the students get placed in Vardhaman College of Engineering. The highest package in my college is 39 LPA. Top companies like TCS and Infosys are recruiting in my college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college is good with infrastructure and there is full Wi-Fi available. Labs, library, and washrooms are good the classes are digitally available every 1 class among 3 classes. Hostel is good and canteen is also good. There will be good memories for us in this college (Vardhaman College of Engineering).
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in my college (Vardhaman College of Engineering) are very well educated and almost all of them are post-graduated faculty. They are well known for their knowledge and their teaching skills but some of the faculty are not that kind and exams are mostly moderate.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has all good facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has average placements that are okay. It does not provide proper placements but provides average placements for students. But, it has a lot of rules and regulations that are of no use. The overall is okay.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is amazing. The mess and hostels are kept very clean and neat. The food in the canteen and mess is very hygienic and properly maintained. The college has an incubation center where students can showcase their innovative ideas.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are good and amazing. They are very talented and Ph.D. holders. They teach each and every concept well. They are very formal even while communicating with students. They provide good placement assistance and also provide good guidance and encouragement at every point of your journey.
detailed_review.Other: College life is good. Events are okay, not too good, but many technical events in the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has very good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Top recruiting companies are Infosys, TCS, Accenture, etc. 80% of the students got placed every year. Many of the students got internships. 70% of students got the internship. The highest package is 38 lacs. The average package is 4 lacs. Many students get placed every year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college provides many facilities like Wi-Fi, labs, drinking water, etc. A hostel facility is also available. The food has very good quality and quantity it feels like home. The college provides sports, games, etc. Many students participate in the games and sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty teach very well and provide more knowledge to us. They are very skilled teachers they help us in every activity. They teach excellently it provide good knowledge. The pass percentage for every sem is 80% or 85% percentage. Sem exams are very difficult to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I choose this course to get a job in either software or hardware. Every year college conducts fests.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: For me, it's an engineering school.

detailed_review.Placements: 20% of students are placed in my course. We are the first batch in our college for my course. Top recruiting companies till now for my course are Evernorth for internships. Top roles offered in my course are related to data scientists, analysts, and other banking-related data analysts.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities regarding the hostel are okay to be considered, but the pricing is too high. The food and its quality are a class. But regarding the living rooms, ACs are switched on only for a certain period of time over the year. Medical facilities are available daily. Regarding games and fitness, we have a good gym, a separate one, and a separate ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are really helpful, but there are a few who keep a grudge against some particular students throughout the semester. The course curriculum is really well planned in a proper and good manner. Semester exams are actually tough, but we manage anyway. Mostly 70% of students pass the exams.
detailed_review.Other: Actually, I had chosen this course randomly. College offers a monthly one fest, either it's technical or normal.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My experience at Vardhaman College.

detailed_review.Placements: Students who are good at coding, communication skills and interactive skills have a high probability of getting placed. A decent number of companies visit our college every year with the maximum package offered ranging between 4 to 6 LPA. There is a lot of scope for placement but you need to work hard and gain strong knowledge of relevant skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are very good with well maintained library and Wi-Fi facility available in labs and classrooms. The hostel facilities are excellent offering homely food and AC rooms though the fees are slightly high. The mess is well maintained, and the campus also provides sports facilities with designated grounds.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at our college are very helpful and have great knowledge. The course curriculum is relevant, helping students prepare for competitive exams and placements. The question paper quality is good, with relevant questions asked. If you prepare well, you can attempt the exam confidently.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely good. It has good environment, faculty members, and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Maximum 70% of students are placed in my course. The highest package is 32 LPA, and the lowest is 3 LPA. The average package is 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Google, Infosys, TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, Capgemini, HCL, and Amazon. Many people got internships from my course in different fields.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure includes teaching faculty, learning facilities, and hostel. Classrooms, laboratory, e-resource, library, and rooms are good. The hostel food is good as compared to other colleges in Hyderabad. Hostel rooms are neat. The hostel has big ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They have good respect for us. They complete course curriculum on time. It is more helpful to us to prepare for exams. The semester exams are not tough.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is good to go.

detailed_review.Placements: As we know students must have competitive skills to get placed. A decent number of students got placed. The highest package offered is 54 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered is 5 LPA. Internship depends on our own developed skills, though you are somewhere else. College is good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs, classrooms, and library are good. Hostel fee is too much. Hostel facilities are not worth the money but the food is good. There are sports and games and medical facilities available in hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are qualified. The teaching quality is moderate but some teachers are awesome. The difficulty level is moderate we can pass if we study well and follow teachers guidance. Pass percentage is 70% to 80%. We need to acquire a good amount of skills.
detailed_review.Other: In our college extracurricular activities are conducted. We can participate in every event, if interested.

faqs.question: TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in how many rounds?
faqs.answer: The TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in three phases, namely Phase 1, Phase 2, and the Final Phase, for admission into BE/BTech/BPharma courses by the Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) and will be managed by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad (JNTUH). Further, TS EAMCET (now TS EAPCET) Spot Round will also be conducted for Private Unaided Engineering Colleges.

faqs.question: What is TS EAMCET 2025 Counselling schedule?
faqs.answer: TS EAMCET Counselling process is ongoing. TS EAMCET Seat Allotment results for Phase 1 Counselling are out. To download the allotment order, candidates must login at the official webiste of TS EAMCET at tseamcet.nic.in. To be conducted in three phases TS EAMCET 2025 Phase 2 Counselling process began in July , whereas the Final Phase counselling process will begin August . Based on the candidate's achieved ranks, TS EAMCET seats are allocated.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff for BTech at Vardhaman College of Engineering for other than general categories?
faqs.answer: Vardhaman College of Engineering TS EAMCET Round 1 cutoff 2023 for BTech in Computer Science and Engineering was 9116 for OBC,  22698 for SC,  24954 for ST,  4770 for EWS. While the admissions are based on the scores/rank obtained in TSEAMCET, the last cut offs also change a lot depending on All India quota or Home State. It also varies if the applicant is a female.

faqs.question: What is the TSEAMCET Round 1 cutoff for BTech in Civil Engineering at Vardhaman College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: As per the TSEAMCET Round 1 cutoff 2023, the closing rank for BTech in Civil Engineering was 36112 for General category candidates in All India quota at Vardhaman College of Engineering. BTech cut off varies depending on the category and domicile/quota of the applicant.

faqs.question: How can I get into Vardhaman College of Engineering for UG/PG courses? Am I eligible for admission?
faqs.answer:
Vardhaman College of Engineering has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility M.E./M.Tech Candidate must have completed B.E./B.Tech./AMIE in ECE / EEE / CSE / Electronics & Computers engineering / ETE/ IT/CSIT/ Electronics & Control Engg./Instrumentation Engg./ Instrumentation Technology / EIE /ICE/ Electronics Engg., /Bio- Medical Engg./ AMIETE and Electronics and Telematics Engg. / Electronics or equivalent from a UGC recognised University/ Institute.
Preference will be given to GATE qualified candidates over TS PGECET qualified candidates.
Candidate must have secured 50% marks in group subjects taken together in the qualifying examination (45% for reserved category). B.E. / B.Tech Candidates who have passed or appeared at the final year of the Diploma examination in Engineering conducted by the State Board of Technical Education and Training, Telangana / Andhra Pradesh or any other examination recognised as equivalent thereto by the State Board of Technical Education and Training, Telangana / Andhra Pradesh.
Candidates should have completed 16 years of age, as on 31st December of the year of admission. There is no upper age limit. MBA/PGDM Candidate must have passed Bachelor Degree (BA / B.Com/ B.Sc/ BBA / BBM / BCA / BE / B.Tech / B. Pharmacy / Any 3 or 4 year Degree except Oriental Languages). Examinations of minimum three years duration with at least 50% marks (45% marks in case of reserved categories) in the qualifying examinations.
Final year appearing students may also apply on provisional basis.
The minimum age of the candidates should be 19 years as on the date of notification (Candidates whose date of Birth up to 30th MARCH,  2003). No maximum age limit. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

highlights.summary:
Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology was established in 1956 and was known as the University College of Engineering (UCE). Now it is also known as VSSUT and is located in Orissa. The university is ranked in the range of 101-150 in the Engineering and University categories by NIRF 2023. Earlier University College of Engineering (UCE) was a constituent college of the Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, through 16 departments, offers UG, PG, and other courses to students. These courses are provided across the Computer Applications, Architecture, and various other streams.
VSSUT provides BTech and MSc as flagship programmes. VSSUT Burla some courses are approved by AICTE and Council of Architecture, New Delhi, and NBA-accredited. Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology offers placement assistance to students. Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology is visited by top companies such as Deloitte, GenC, Infosys, Wipro, and Vedanta, and others. The major highlights of Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology are tabulated below:
Establishment year | Ownership type

VSSUT has adopted a global, dynamic, creative and communicative approach in the field of education as well as research and development. There are various facilities available with the VSSUT. VSSUT Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Power System Engineering
reviews.review_title: I love our college and our faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: Our university is a government university, but our college provides good placements with good packages. 60-70 percent of students got placed in different companies like Tech Mahindra, Wipro, Tata Steel, etc. Students get placed with a good package that ranges from 10-16 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our university hostel facility is very good. It provides very good food quality. The hostel room is very good, and the hostel rent is Rs. 8,000 per year. Our college provides 24-hour high-speed Wi-Fi to us. Various types of labs are provided by the college for different departments.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our college, 2 semesters are performed in a year, and a practical exam is held before every semester. Teachers are very good and friendly. They are very helpful to us and help with examinations. Semester exams are not so different, but if we study for 2 to 3 hours, then we can achieve a good score.
detailed_review.Other: Our college provides scholarships to poor students. Our college surroundings are very good, and nobody is allowed in without permission.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Power Electronics Control and Drives
reviews.review_title: I like my college and our faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Our university was a very good university in Odisha. In our college, many students were hired by different companies like TCS and Tech Mahindra and other multinational companies in our country at a good package of 5 to 15 LPA by Tata Steel, and Mahindra automobile.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our university, various buildings were prepared by different departments, and college authority provided a good Wi-Fi 24 hours a day. Our college had a good hostel provided by government, and provided good food quality to us. The food quality was very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our professors were very good at studying and help us in examinations, but the non teaching staff was not so good, they ignore us in our course. Semester was held in one year, and the pass percentage was approximately 70 percent. The college prepared students to work in industry.
detailed_review.Other: In our course, we prepared for industry electricity work. Our college provided scholarships to needy students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: VSSUT-the first engineering college.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement for our branch of electrical engineering is quite good. In the year 2024-25, around 111 students got placed. Top recruits are TCS, Nalco, Deloitte, Infosys, etc. The highest package is around 18 LPA, the average package is around 6-7 LPA, and the lowest package is around 3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms have a smart board. The library has Wi-Fi connection and AC so that students can read without any problems. The quality of food in the hostel mess is decent. We get 4 times a meal a day, and in the college canteen, one can get breakfast and lunch. The infrastructure of our college is good, and it has enough hostels, around 12 hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and qualified from IITs and NITs. Our college has its own curriculum, and it is based on theoretical as well as practical knowledge. The semester exams' difficulty level is medium, and the pass percentage is around 95 percent, which is good.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of the high placement and fests like SAMAVESH and VASSAUNT, sports events like ILLUMINA take place. One can avail of scholarships from the first year from state/central scholarship portals.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Power System Engineering
reviews.review_title: Very good college for M.Teach.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good as it is a government institute. This year, Tata, JSW Group, Birla Group, etc., hired students. Mostly, students got jobs through placement interviews. The highest package offered is 5.8 LPA, and the lowest package offered is 3.2 LPA. The internship programme for students is provided by Tata Power.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is very good. Labs are spacious and equipped with all apparatus. Classrooms are spacious and digitally updated. The library is good, with all types of technology books available. The hostel is good, with two-seated rooms available. Mess food is average. There are several grounds for different sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are good and all have completed their postgraduate degrees. They understand what the students want and clear doubts through discussion. The course curriculum is good and prepares students for the industry. There are two semesters in a year, and each semester has two sessions.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I should join VSSUT or otherwise.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a student of VSSUT Bhubaneshwar, which is one of the most famous colleges all over Odisha, and I am a student of Mechanical Engineering. In the past year, 2024 out of 140 students, 121 students got placed in Mechanical Engineering, and that is why it is known as the golden branch of VSSUT. The lowest package goes up to 4LPA, and the highest in 2024 is 12LPA, but the average package offered is 6LPA, sounds good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a great infrastructure,  450 acres campus. Labs are also well maintained, smart classrooms. The problem is there in the hostel and also a bit in classrooms in summer season, no air conditioning in classrooms, and in the hostel. The food menu is good, but the quality is decent, not so good, but okay, and they have a great exposure to sports.
detailed_review.Faculty: Its faculty, curriculum, and exams are so important, and they take exams so seriously and strictly. My midterms are over, I will take the exams with proper seriousness. They also ask their own question, and getting 7 to 8 CGPA at VSSUT is like getting 9 CGPA at any other private college.
detailed_review.Other: The main highlight of VSSUT is that they provide all these facilities without charging much of a fee. They take 41k yearly, its very affordable.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the college.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a student of VSSUT. There are plenty of options available for placements at this college. Almost all students have the option of doing internships at this college. The companies in this college offer very top growth in their companies. I am very happy with this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of this college is pretty good and is improving day by day. A new building is also going to be opened in few months. Facilities in this college are top notch but some classrooms are small. Wi-Fi is available on the campus. The food in the hostel is very good and hygienic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at this college are very helpful, knowledgeable, and qualified to top notch. But something problem is that it is difficult to pass the semester exams. All the subjects that are taught are industry-ready. I am very satisfied with this college.
detailed_review.Other: There are many extra-curricular activities.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Applied Physics
reviews.review_title: I recommend this college.

detailed_review.Placements: We have an amazing placement in our university. There is a different placement cell that functions, and this makes sure that each student gets placed by the end of their career. Some great companies like TCS, Infosys, Cognizant, etc., visit every year, and the minimum package for students is 4 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are 7 boys' hostels & 6 girls' hostels. Each hostel has a library and 2 independent study rooms. A volleyball court is in each hostel, and a TT is also in each hostel. The infrastructure & the hostel maintenance are simply wow. They serve us food 4 times a day. Very healthy and hygienic food is served. Each floor has 10 toilets and 10 bathrooms, and they are sanitized daily.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are 4 professors, 3 associate professors, and 2 assistant professors in our department. They are extremely friendly and highly qualified. They are extremely helpful, give proper guidance to the project works & motivate us to attend some industrial internships. In my opinion, our course name should be renamed as mathematics & computing, so that we can also attend some campus interviews with IT companies. Discussing the exam, sometimes question papers are from some IITs, so the level of the exam is always high to moderate. The faculty members are too lenient, so we can achieve a good mark here.
detailed_review.Other: We have 20 students in our batch. Everyone is placed now. Some are guest faculty members of government colleges. We spent some great moments there. I enjoyed university life and am now content in professional life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: VSSUT Burla: A comprehensive review of infrastructure, faculty, course structure, and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: VSSUT, Burla, has a dedicated training and placement cell, ensuring good placement opportunities. For the 2025 batch, 76 recruiters made 639 job offers. The highest package offered is 24 LPA, and the lowest salary package offered is 2.7 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Digital Green, Amazon, JP Morgan, UBS, and Maruti Suzuki. The university focuses on equipping students with industry-relevant skills, leading to a strong placement record across various engineering and technology sectors.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: VSSUT, Burla, offers a well-developed infrastructure. It is spread over more than 500 acres of land. It boasts a central library, well-equipped departmental laboratories, a central workshop, and a central research facility with advanced instruments like SEM and XRD. The campus is Wi-Fi-enabled, and classrooms are often ICT-equipped. Residential facilities include numerous boys' and girls' hostels with modern amenities. The university also provides extensive sports facilities, a gymnasium, an auditorium, a cafeteria, and a guest house, ensuring a holistic and supportive environment for students and faculty members.
detailed_review.Faculty: VSSUT, Burla, had experienced professors, associate professors, and assistant professors across diverse engineering, technology, and science departments. Many teachers are PhD holders and are active in research. The university offers comprehensive courses like B.Tech, M.Tech, MCA, M.Sc., and PhD programs. Undergraduate courses emphasize core engineering with specialized electives. Postgraduate programs offer deeper specialisation. The course curriculum balances theoretical knowledge with practical skills, which is updated regularly to meet industry demands and prepare students for professional careers and further studies.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is somewhat good, with good placements, especially for core branch students.

detailed_review.Placements: About 80–90% of students get placed in the CS branch, and the average package ranges from 6 to 8 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Amazon, Infosys, and TCS. The highest package offered is 21.75 LPA, given by JP Morgan. Some of the top roles offered are Software Developer and Associate Developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The courses are somewhat good, but some CS labs lack new technology as they continue to teach on Ubuntu. The hostel facilities depend on which hostel you are allotted. Like in every engineering college, the hostel is just like an ordinary one. The quality of food is somewhat below average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-qualified, educated, and knowledgeable. However, like every other engineering college, they still follow traditional methods of education. The teaching is somewhat aligned with what companies demand. The semester exams can be challenging, as VSSUT focuses more on academics.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good college and the whole infrastructure is being renovated. Helpful faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements: The fourth year hasn't started yet but already 10 students from my branch got placed at around 5.5 LPA-6 LPA is the average. Last year's placement wasn't that great but this year looks promising. The placement cell and other teachers help students act as their guardians during placement seasons.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: They are renovating the whole hostel. The hostel facility is very good and they can improve the food a little otherwise other facilities are good at the low price of Rs. 18000 per semester. Free Wi-Fi is available. The generator works when the current is cut. The gym is available in the hostels and now they are improving hostel facilities more.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exams are quite difficult at a reputed government college but it is smooth and the benches and room are good too. Faculty members are very helpful and good they will help you whenever you visit their cabins. Teaching is good too. The things which they can improve is the interaction after the class.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: VSSUT, from where the engineering journey begins.

detailed_review.Placements: I am a 2nd year student of Electronics & Telecommunication. The placement of our branch was above 80 percent in the year 2024. The highest package was about 11 LPA, and the average package was 6 LPA. The lowest package was 2-3 LPA. The top recruiting companies were TCS, Infosys, Accenture, Wipro, Cognizant, and Concentrix. The majority of students were placed in the software domain, as semiconductor-focused companies are not available in our college. Students have to find off-campus internships, but some interned at IIIT Bhubaneswar, NIT Rourkela, DRDO Chandipur, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a central internet facility which provides free Wi-Fi to all hostels and also on campus. We have a huge air-conditioned library named UCE Library. All the classrooms are equipped with smart boards and green boards. The labs are good, but the equipment is very outdated. The hostel has a lift, washing machines, aqua guards, a small variety store, a badminton court, indoor chess, etc. The quality of food is decent but edible. Both veg and non-veg options are available. The hostels have basic first aid available with an emergency ambulance service.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are highly qualified. They are Ph.D. holders from IITs, NITs, etc. Their teaching methods are very good, but the curriculum here is outdated and not as per industry standards. The teachers give assignments, take surprise tests, viva, etc., to make the teaching better. The semester exams are quite easy. The questions come from the notes and PPTs of the faculty members. The pass percentage is above 85%.
detailed_review.Other: The first reason to chose this college was my AIR in JEE, as I could not go to other premier institutes. However it is the oldest technical institute in Odisha, so it has a huge alumni network and also a good reputation. Also, this college provides a B.Tech degree under 4 Lacs in 4 years, which is quite cheap. However, the teaching methodologies, infrastructure, hostel food, etc., should be improved. There are two annual fests, Samavesh and Vasant. But the connectivity here is very poor, especially the railway. Various extracurricular activities such as swimming, cricket, volleyball, chess, etc., are available here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Up to 65 percent of students get placed in my civil department. The highest package is, I think, 25 LPA, the average is 8 LPA, and the lowest is 4.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies like Ultratech Pvt., Adani, L&T Pvt. Ltd., and Aditya Birla.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided to us are lacking in some areas. During summer, our classrooms feel like a theater because the fans don't work properly. We have smart boards, but sometimes there are power cuts in the college. Hostel facilities have improved, but the food quality in the hostel. Some days, we get the very worst food to eat.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have skilled and knowledgeable teachers for studying, and they also guide us in some places. I would rate the teaching quality as average because some teachers only come for the money they get, but this is not the case in our civil department. This course curriculum is relevant, and it has made students industry-ready. I have also visited some industries for internship purposes, and the college has funded industrial visits. Semester exams are very difficult sometimes in the college. The pass percentage for one subject requires an overall score of 35 out of 100, and you can have no more than 5 backlogs.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college because of its reputation, placement overview, and near to my hometown. The best thing about my course is that I will be getting high-paying jobs after qualifying for GATE. I wish to improve our labs, marking scheme, and the details of the civil course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Decent infrastructure, moderate placements, but limited core opportunities.

detailed_review.Placements: In our civil engineering batch, typically around 30% of students (45 out of 150) secure placements. The highest package ranges from 8 LPA - 9 LPA. The lowest package varies between 3.5 LPA - 4 LPA. The average package ranges from 4.5 LPA - 5.5 LPA. Recruiting companies are Aditya Birla and L&T. Only a few students get internships, mostly in government organizations like PWD. Top role offered is site engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are decent, but the infrastructure is still developing with ongoing improvements. Some areas are well-maintained, while others need upgrades. The new hostels are good, offering a decent living experience, but the old ones are quite outdated and lack modern facilities. One major drawback is the absence of a proper gym, which limits fitness opportunities for students. The mess food is served only once per meal and is just average. Not the worst, but far from great. There is little variety, and many students prefer eating outside. While some canteens and food stalls are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are qualified and knowledgeable. But not all are equally helpful. Teaching quality varies, some explain well, while others focus more on theory. The curriculum is decent but lacks industry exposure. Exams are moderate. The pass percentage is high.
detailed_review.Other: Just for the fee, it may be a good option for you guys.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Power System Engineering
reviews.review_title: The best college in Sambalpur.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are average. This year, Tata Power, Havells, Bajaj, etc., visited our college. Tata Power is the top recrutior. The highest package offered is 3.5 LPA. The lowest package offered is 2.5 LPA. There are internship programs offered by Tata Power.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good. There are separate hostels for B.Tech and M.Tech. There is Wi-Fi all over the campus with CCTV security. Labs are spacious and have all the chemicals and apparatus used in industry. Classrooms are spacious and digitally updated. There is a cricket ground, volleyball court, badminton court, basketball ground, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are the best. They are top faculty members in Odisha. They all have done their postgraduate in reputed universities. They use simple language which is easy to understand. They clear our doubts through extra classes. There are two semesters in a year conducted by the university. Each semester has two sessionals. Questions are moderate level.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is all good. It is absolutely a lot good to read in this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good as per recent years' records.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite brilliant if we overlook it from all around. We can experience various moral values. Facilities are all good, and we have different options available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are quite experienced and well-trained from different institutions. We have different facilities here and can explore many opportunities to achieve brilliance. They are well-trained and can explain concepts in a short time. They are quite brilliant in teaching using different methodologies and can help explore many problems with us. We can access help at any time and initiate a helping hand from them, so it can be a lot good to read in this college. They are always up to date and cover the syllabus at a particular time.
detailed_review.Other: Everything is alright.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Very good for a third-tier and good value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: In the CSE branch, almost all students get placed. The highest package so far is from UBS, offering around 12 LPA. The top recruiting companies like Accenture, Cognizant, Infosys, KFINTech, UBS, Incture, etc., come to our college. Almost all are giving software engineer roles here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is above average and needs improvement. Classrooms are good, and some hostels have free Wi-Fi while others do not. VSSUT has one library, and each branch has its own library and seminar halls. Hostels provide good quality food, but sometimes the quality gets worse. There is one sports room for badminton, and the volleyball court have one swimming pool.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful except for some. They understand problems of students and help them out. The semester exams are average, which means that only 1 week before the exam for a subject is more than sufficient. There are two exams in one semester one is the mid-sem, and the other is the end-sem. For the mid-sem, there is no pass criteria, but in the end-sem, one has to score above 15 to pass.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Computer Science and Engineering because CSE is more advanced than others, and for a third-tier college like VSSUT, I feel CSE is the best. There is a fest every year one for the tech fest called SAMAVESH and the other is a cultural fest called VASAUNT.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall, VSSUT is one of the best engineering colleges in Odisha, and it is also the oldest college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are offered in reputed companies like Aditya Birla Group, JSW, Tata Power, Tata Steel, and many other reputed companies. These companies provide job opportunities through VSSUT. Currently, the highest package offered is around 18 LPA, the lowest is 3 LPA, and the average package is approximately 6 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food quality is good, and hygiene is well maintained. Events like Saraswati Puja, Holi, Diwali, and various others are celebrated in our hostel. All hostels are in good condition and are renovated every 4–5 years. Overall, the hostel infrastructure is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers have studied at top NITs and IITs like IIT Bombay, IIT Delhi, and NIT Rourkela. They help students in various activities like branch events and projects. Teachers are supportive, and overall, they give good marks to students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Metallurgical and Materials Engineering
reviews.review_title: 1st engineering college of Odisha. Going to be a national-level university by 2030.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 80%-90% of students secured placements in my course. The highest package ranges from 11 LPA - 12 LPA. The average package varies between 5 LPA - 6 LPA. The lowest package ranges from 3 LPA - 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies are JSW Steel, Aditya Birla Group, Vedanta, Shyam Metalics, Electrosteel, Visa Steel, Capgemini, and Mahaveer Ferro Alloys. Around 60%-70% of students secured internships by PPO. If anyone wants to apply for any other internships he/she can apply through referral and the rate of getting this type of internship is 100%. Top internship companies are JSW Steel, Tata Steel, Vedanta, Jindal Stainless, RSP (SAIL), research institutes and government labs, etc. Top role offered is graduate engineer trainee (GET).
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every lab facility and classrooms are equipped with smart boards. My hostel is Pulastya Hall of Residence and here the quality of food is good as compared to other boys/girls hostels (after Marichi and Kratu HOR). Canteen is available on the ground floor.
detailed_review.Faculty: The best department of our college is metallurgical and materials engineering. Teachers are super excellent and helpful. They also help students to prepare for the GATE exam. Semester exams at our branch are very easy where the passing percentage is 100%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in this field from earlier. The best thing about this course is that the demand for this course is very high but the supply (students) is very less. It is a good opportunity to opt for metallurgy. Fests, clubs, seminars, and everything are top-notch. You can join any club of your interest to increase your knowledge and create projects in the club and then you may put it on your resume.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 75% of students got placed from my course in civil engineering. The highest package in my course is up to 10 LPA and the average package is 5 LPA-6 LPA. Ultratech is a top recruiting company. Approximately 60% of students got internship opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is good. Library has an ample amount of books for studies. Hostel life is also quite good around with batchmates. The food quality and the menu are also great but repetitively new. Medical facilities and a gym are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are a total of 4000 students and approximately 250 faculty members are there in college. Faculty members are good and supportive. There are 2 exams per semester and the level of exams varies from moderate to hard. Course provides a vast field of experience so I chose this course to pursue my degree. Course curriculum prepares students for real-world applications or further academic pursuits exams conducted two times. Semester is moderate to hard level.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am not really satisfied with professors but the campus is far more beautiful.

detailed_review.Placements: The college is famous for its placements in core branch engineering. Last year (2023), 95% of students got placed in mechanical engineering. The highest package is 43 LPA. The average package is 8 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Wipro, Infosys, Deloitte, Tata Steel, etc. Mainly students from the software branch get internships in the college. Their top roles are data analysis, programming, software design, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure of the college are above average. Wi-Fi and central library are also present in the college where you can issue all the books for your course. The mess is far better than top private colleges. The food quality is best where you can get 4 times food in a year. Medical facilities are also available in case of emergency.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly educated. They have qualified post-graduation and doctorate of philosophy from top colleges such as IIT and NIT. But their way of teaching is not that creative. They only focus on cramming without the basic knowledge of subjects but some of them are also very supportive. The course curriculum is comprehensive and designed on the basis of industry requirements. Exams are very easy. The questions mainly come from PYQs.
detailed_review.Other: I have chosen mechanical engineering due to my interest in this course. This branch is also the best branch of this college. I don't think that there is any improvement required in this branch. Many fests take place in a year such as Vassaunt and events such as Illumina. The scholarships are also given to the students based on their performance in academic.

college_info.college_name: VSSUT Admission 2025: Courses, Eligibility & Application

faqs.question: What is the admission process of Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology?
faqs.answer: To get admission at Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology the students need to qualify various entrance exams for different courses. For B.Tech students- JEE MAINS or JEE ADVANCED rank M.Tech- GATE SCORE M.Sc- IIT JAM MCA- Odisha JEE Ph.D- GATE/UGC-NET/CSIR-NET/ICAR/ICMR SCORE with written exam and interview. You need to apply for the courses on the official site by filling a application form. After that if your rank is within the cutoff rank you will be given admission. Further you need to visit college to take admission.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam is accepted by VSSUT?
faqs.answer: Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology (VSSUT) accepts various entrance exam scores for different programs.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam scores does VSSUT accept for admission to M.Sc?
faqs.answer: Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology (VSSUT) accepts national and state-level entrance exam scores for admission to its M.Sc program. Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology (VSSUT) accepts the following entrance exam scores for admission to its M.Sc program: Every July, VSSUT, OJEE, or OJEE Main conducts the admission test for the five-year Integrated M.Sc. program.

faqs.question: Can I get admission in VSSUT for B.Sc with 60% in Class 12th?
faqs.answer: No it is not compulsory to get 75% in class 12th. The candidate should have Passed HSC Examination/Equivalent with Physics, chemistry and Mathematics. You should have passed the Class 12 th (10+2) Examination from a recognised Board, with at least 45% marks for general category and 40% marks in case of SC/ST category.

faqs.question: Is B.Tech Computer Science and Engineering course offered at Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes,  VSSUT offers various courses at undergraduate and research levels in Engineering, Science, Computer Application, Arts and Architecture streams including B.Tech. All courses are AICTE approved. it has aa category called Computer Science & Engineering . It's sanctioned intake is 60 students and total intake is 70 students. B.Tech is a total course of 4 years and can be a great career option for computer enthusiasts.

faqs.question: What BSc specialisations are offered by VSSUT?
faqs.answer: Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology offers the five-year integrated BSc programme in three different specialisations. These specialisations are as follows:

faqs.question: How can I get admission in VSSUT for BSc?
faqs.answer: VSSUT BSc admission 2025 will be entrance-based. To get admission to the five-year integradted BSc plus MSc programme offered at Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, candidates will be required to appear for either of the following entrance examination namely, OJEE/ OJEE (Main) which usually takes place in the month of July every year. VSSUT also conduct its own entrance exam for VSSUT BSc course admissions.

faqs.question: When is Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology application forms out?
faqs.answer: The forms for getting Admission in Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology are generally out after the Results of JEE MAINS examinations is declared. The particular time may differ as JEE MAINS is being conducted at different times since last 3 years but from now onwards generally the result for JEE MAINS would be declared by May. So you can expect that the form filling can start by Mid of May Month.

faqs.question: Which entrance exams scores are accepted by VSSUT for BSc?
faqs.answer: Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology BSc course admissions are based on performance of candidates and rank obtained  by them in the entrance examination conducted by VSSUT/ OJEE/ OJEE (Main).

faqs.question: How can students get admission to BSc course at  VSSUT?
faqs.answer: VSSUT BSc admissions 2024 is entrance-based. Candidates seeking admission to the BSc programme must apply online on the official website of the University. Given below is step wise VSSUT BSc admission process 2024 : STEP 1: Visit to the official website of the University and register for fresh admission by providing all the required information, upload all the necessary documents and pay VSSUT BSc application fees 2024 . STEP 2: Candidates must appear for an entrance exam conducted by VSSUT/ OJEE/ OJEE (Main). STEP 3: A merit list is then declared by the University and the shortlisted candidates must appear for the counselling process and VSSUT allots the seat to them according to rank obtained by them in the entrance exam.

faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at VSSUT for BSc?
faqs.answer: Candidates seeking admission to the VSSUT BSc course must appear for entrance exam conducted by VSSUT/ OJEE or OJEE (Main). The University does not offer direct admission to the BSc programme.

faqs.question: What is the minimum cutoff for B.Tech at Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology 2023?
faqs.answer: The cutoff various every year but as per the past year cutoff, a general category student with a rank under 1,50,000 in JEE MAINS EXAMINATIONS can easily get a seat at VSSUT. For getting higher branches you need to have rank under 60K. The cutoff rank for reserved categories is around 4-5 Lacs rank in JEE MAINS examinations which is very low. So, getting Admission in this college is not so difficult as NIT'S and GFTI. A student with basic knowledge of subjects can easily make up to get a seat here.

faqs.question: How are Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology 2023 cut off marks determined?
faqs.answer: The cut- off marks are determined by various factors like:- This all factors can affect the cutoff scores but as per General trends the cutoff score is somewhere higher than the previous years score as the level of competition is increasing day by day.

faqs.question: What are the fees for B.Tech programmes at Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology?
faqs.answer: In Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, the B.Tech programmee include courses such as Computer Science and engineering, Electrical engineering, Electrical and Electronics engineering, Mechanical engineering, Civil Engineering, Information technology, Metallurgical and Materials engineering, Electronics and Telecommunication engineering, Chemical engineering, production engineering. For these all courses, the fees is 91,280 rupees (first year fees) only. The lateral entry students will also have same fees i.e 91,280 rupees only.

faqs.question: What are some of the key dates for admission to BSc course at VSSUT?
faqs.answer: VSSUT BSc admission dates will be out on the University's official website. The University will accept the scores of OJEE and also conducts its own entrance test. OJEE exam is conducted in May for Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology BSc course admissions.

faqs.question: How can I get admission in VSSUT for BSc?
faqs.answer: VSSUT BSc admission 2025 will be entrance-based. To get admission to the five-year integradted BSc plus MSc programme offered at Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology, candidates will be required to appear for either of the following entrance examination namely, OJEE/ OJEE (Main) which usually takes place in the month of July every year. VSSUT also conduct its own entrance exam for VSSUT BSc course admissions.

faqs.question: When is Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology application forms out?
faqs.answer: The forms for getting Admission in Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology are generally out after the Results of JEE MAINS examinations is declared. The particular time may differ as JEE MAINS is being conducted at different times since last 3 years but from now onwards generally the result for JEE MAINS would be declared by May. So you can expect that the form filling can start by Mid of May Month. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: Which entrance exams scores are accepted by VSSUT for BSc?
faqs.answer: Veer Surendra Sai University of Technology BSc course admissions are based on performance of candidates and rank obtained  by them in the entrance examination conducted by VSSUT/ OJEE/ OJEE (Main). Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.question: How can students get admission to BSc course at  VSSUT?
faqs.answer: VSSUT BSc admissions 2024 is entrance-based. Candidates seeking admission to the BSc programme must apply online on the official website of the University. Given below is step wise VSSUT BSc admission process 2024 : STEP 1: Visit to the official website of the University and register for fresh admission by providing all the required information, upload all the necessary documents and pay VSSUT BSc application fees 2024 . STEP 2: Candidates must appear for an entrance exam conducted by VSSUT/ OJEE/ OJEE (Main). STEP 3: A merit list is then declared by the University and the shortlisted candidates must appear for the counselling process and VSSUT allots the seat to them according to rank obtained by them in the entrance exam. faqs.question: Can I get direct admission at VSSUT for BSc?
faqs.answer: Candidates seeking admission to the VSSUT BSc course must appear for entrance exam conducted by VSSUT/ OJEE or OJEE (Main). The University does not offer direct admission to the BSc programme. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

college_info.college_name: VR Siddhartha Engineering College: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Velagapudi Ramakrishna Siddhartha Engineering College is also known as VR Siddhartha Engineering College was founded in 1977. It is a private institute and is located in Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh. VR Siddhartha Engineering College courses are offered to students at the UG and PG levels. The institute is approved by AICTE and offers courses in Full Time mode. VR Siddhartha Engineering College offers a total of 25 courses in streams such as Engineering, IT & Software and Business & Management Studies. Some of the popular courses offered at the institute are B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM and MCA and the total seat intake for the available courses is 1932. These courses are offered to students across several specialisations such as Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering and Structural Engineering. Further, the fee for all these courses ranges between INR 1,20,000 and 3,06,000 and the average median salary is around INR 3,75,395. Apart from this, the VR Siddhartha Engineering College campus has a state-of-the-art infrastructure with all the advanced facilities.
