VR Siddhartha Engineering College Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements, supportive faculty members, and a peaceful environment.

detailed_review.Placements: 95 percent of students got placed. The highest package offered is 52.6 LPA, and the average package is 4.5 LPA. The least package is 3 LPA. Recruiting companies are Amazon, Cisco, Wipro, TCS, Deloitte, HSBC, PWC, and Flipkart. Almost all students who have good skills got internships. Roles offered are solution architect, quality analyst, developer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Department facilities are good. Classrooms and labs are provided with Wi-Fi and AC. Our college has a central library where we can get any books. Coming to college, the food is good. Medical facilities are available. Every Wednesday, the doctor comes. We can play outdoor games as the ground is available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very qualified. They support us and guide us in every aspect. The course curriculum is relevant. We can get ready for industrial placements. Exams are in range so that we can pass, but the matter here is that we have to study. The highest CGPA may be 9.8.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college with good faculty and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70 percent of students got placed from my course. I am not sure about the highest package, but students were satisfied with their placements. Top companies like Ultratech and JSW. After the completion of 3 years, our faculty members guided us on how to grab the industrial opportunities. This helped all our students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides computers, Wi-Fi, and books. They provide good food. In the library, they could have provided a good selection of books. Students in our college evolve through the book, but they are limited. In the neutral being of nature, the college offered all types of information.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good students are provided with teaching, labs, and other services in the area. They are reliable and among the best in our country. 50 percent is based on the subject in the area, and they served all types of neutral, qualified teachers, including Ph.D. holders, who led us well.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with IT department. It has good facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: The 2025 batch placement is very strong. About 85% of students getting placed through campus placements. The average package offered is 3.5 LPA. The lowest package is 2.5 LPA, and the highest package is 35 LPA. Top companies like Microsoft, Cognizant, Accenture, and TCS visit the campus and offer software roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for the course is decent. Wi-Fi is available. The library has all the required books. Hostel facilities are average, and the mess food quality is also average. The canteen prices are high. I do not see medical facilities during my college days. Sports facilities are available but are poorly maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are qualified and knowledgeable. The level of helpfulness varies from person to person in the IT department. The curriculum covers basic fundamentals, and additional learning is done through self-learning and certifications. The semester exams are of moderate difficulty and are mostly theory-based. The questions are repetitive.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the 2021–2025 B.Tech batch. I chose this course mainly because of my interest in technology and growth. The best part of the course is the strong foundation in core subjects. Many things still need improvement. The curriculum should be updated, and more focus must be given to practical learning. The campus crowd is mixed, and events and fests are conducted.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: VR Siddhartha College of Engineering and Technology provides many courses to students.

detailed_review.Placements: In Mechanical, we get companies like Tech Mahindra, TCS, Zomato, and Swiggy that offer jobs with a minimum package. Some students in our college participate in hackathons, which help them get internships at big MNC companies. They provide many opportunities to the students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are good. The quality of lab materials and classroom facilities are excellent. They provide certain competitions for students to improve their sportsmanship qualities. There are ground facilities for students to play cricket.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is qualified to teach students. The course curriculum is relevant to the industries. They are taught by industrial experts. The semester exams in the college are not very difficult, and they include mostly industrial questions. The pass percentage for the semester is 80%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I absolutely love this college.

detailed_review.Placements: 60 to 70% of students get placed in our course. The highest package is about 50 LPA. The lowest package is about 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies in our course include Medha Servo, Hyundai, TCS, etc. Many students get internships in top companies. Top roles offered in our course include graduate engineer, R&D, design engineer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure in our department are very good. Wi-Fi and classrooms are good. A well-stocked library is available. The quality of facilities in our hostel is good. Hostel food is also good. Canteen food is also good. Medical facilities, sports, and games are also available in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable in our college. The teaching quality is also good. The course curriculum is relevant. It makes students industry-ready. The semester exams are neither too tough nor easy.
detailed_review.Other: I want to join and work in a core field like mechanical engineering.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of Velagapudi Ramakrishna Siddhartha Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: 85% of students got the placements in our college through campus interviews. The highest package for the last year is 44 LPA. The highest is from the AIML branch, not the IT branch. Mostly every year, the highest package is from CSE students. And the average package is 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies include TCS, Infosys, and Amazon. We have also provided internships from the second year onwards. Our college provides good skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available in our college are very good. Our college is a university, so all exams and curriculum are designed by their own decisions. Our college is one of the best colleges in Vijayawada. The placements are also very good in our college. Classrooms are very good in our college. Good benches and digital boards are available in our college. Wi-Fi is available in our college at all times. Hostels are also very good in our college; the food is also very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable at our college. The teaching quality is very good in our college. Most of the faculty in our college have completed their B.Ed., and some of them have PhDs. They teach well, and we understand very well. Our college is a management college; no EMCET students in our college, so the fees are also very high in our college. The course curriculum is very good at our college. It makes the students industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I chose information technology at our college. I choose this course because I have an interest in this course, so that's why I choose this course. The best things about my course are good knowledge gain and skills. I want to improve my coding skills. In our college, so many fests and events are celebrated; we enjoy ourselves a lot at those events. And also we have a canteen available in our college; so many items are available in our canteen, and there is a good environment in our canteen and college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: A college where dreams come true.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of students were placed in my course. I am not sure about the highest package but students were satisfied with their placements. Top companies like Ultratech and JSW. After the completion of 3 years, our faculty members guided us on how to grab the industrial opportunities. This helped all our students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs and classrooms were excellent. Library was provided with wide number of books and research papers. When it comes to hostel, all the infrastructure and facilities were very good. We had a big ground, an indoor stadium, and a small gym with clean ambience.
detailed_review.Faculty: Each teacher comes with their own style of teaching and each one shared their experience in problem solving. The curriculum provided students with best practices and prepared them for the industry. Semester exams at this college were conducted with extreme care. There will be no chance for any miscellaneous activities.
detailed_review.Other: I am interested in civil engineering, and I have deep passion for civil engineering. For civil engineering, this was the perfect college for me to practice.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Join only if you have true passion for your career goals.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are very less. Let me be clear about the reality in the college placements: it doesn't depend on the branch. The faculty will send students to the placement drives, for example, if an IT company visits the college for placement, then the faculty will send students. The recruitment mainly gives preference to IT branches like ECE, CSE, AIDS, AIML. As for the core companies, those are not even at the level of engineering; they offer stipends of 16-18k per month.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: About Wi-Fi, it is available across the college and can be accessed using the student registration number; however, it does not work for faculty members. The labs have okay infrastructure, but in our branch, most of the equipment is old and mostly not working. Classrooms are good, equipped with projectors and proper ventilation. The library is the best in the college, with card access for every student and a wide range of books across many genres.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty in our branch are not very professional; only three members have Ph.D. qualifications, and they possess great knowledge and give their best. The remaining faculty mostly teach by memorizing topics. The syllabus and curriculum need changes as they are not updated enough to fit this generation, they have remained the same for about 30-50 years.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this field because I have a passion for the Mechanical Field. The best aspect of my course is that it's a Core Industry, which is stable and evergreen. Things like the curriculum and guidance from the faculty to choose a better career should improve; only then will it be worth the money. Events, fests, campus crowd, and connectivity are all average, not quite providing value for the money we pay.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college, I am satisfied. In 2025, really had good facilities in area. They should finalize area

detailed_review.Placements: 40% of students got placed. The highest package was 7 LPA, offered by Reliance, and the lowest was 1.5 LPA, not from MNCs. Reliance provided placements to 80% of students in core roles. They provided very good placement. Some kind of work they had revealed in nature, but they could not get enough area in the revolution of the country in the free course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provided computers, Wi-Fi, and books. They provided good food. In the library, they could have provided a good types of books. Students in our college were evolving through the book, but they were limited. In the neutral being of nature, the college offered all types of information.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good students were provided with teaching, labs, and other services in the area. They were reliable and among the best in our country. 50% was based on the subject in the area, and they served all types of neutral, qualified teachers, including Ph.D. holders, who led us well.
detailed_review.Other: It's a nice course, depending on the student's interest, but it is a good college. They have received a lot of funds at the moment. It reviewed the library, and a good type of question was asked, they will important.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A strong infrastructure, placements, and supportive faculty members - A worthwhile CCSE at VRSEC.

detailed_review.Placements: For the 2021 to 2025 batch at VRSEC Vijayawada, 81.12% of graduates secured job placements. The highest package reached 44 LPA, and average salary is around 5 LPA. Top recruiting includes Infosys, IBM, Deloitte, NTT Data, Virtusa, Capgemini, Amazon, Cisco, Microsoft, TCS, Accenture, Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Cognizant, and PayPal. For internships, about 40-50 % of students received offer letters. The primary roles are associate/advanced senior, data analyst, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels (725 = capacity both boys and girls) single/double groomed attached toilets, study lamps, laundry, 24X7 power backup, reading areas, wired Wi-Fi via 40 Cisco access points. The mess canteen serves both veg and non-veg. The 24-acre campus offers high-speed Wi-Fi across all zones.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are mostly qualified, supportive, and accessible with many holding Ph.Ds and industry backgrounds (including NIT and IIT training). The curriculum is industry-aligned. Semester exams are moderately tough, updated regularly with input from experts and include hands-on experience.
detailed_review.Other: NSS, NCC, yoga, dance, music, freshers, and fests are held for 3-4 months. It has a vibrant social environment.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of our college Siddhartha.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement scenario for my batch (2025) in the information technology department is quite promising. Around 80-85% of the students are successfully placed by the end of the final semester. The average package hovered around 6.8 LPA which is decent for a tier-2 college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for information technology is quite decent and improving each year. All classrooms are equipped with projectors, whiteboards, and proper ventilation. The department has access to Wi-Fi, although the speed could fluctuate at times. The computer labs are fairly modern with up-to-date systems and reliable internet connectivity.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in the information technology department are generally helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Most professors hold M.Tech or Ph.D. degrees, and a few have industry experience as well. They are approachable during college hours and even after classes, especially when it comes to doubt-clearing and project guidance.
detailed_review.Other: I chose information technology because of my interest in programming, data structures, and understanding how software systems work in real-world applications. The course provided a good balance between core computer science subjects and applied IT topics, such as web development, database systems, and cloud computing.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: About our Valagapudi Siddardha College.

detailed_review.Placements: Mostly in the college, the pass percentage is much greater than 70%. The highest package in the college is 50 LPA, and the lowest package will be the 3 LPA. Also students get internships from the 3 year onwards. Roles offered in the college are based on coding skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided in V R Siddartha College are Wi-Fi and labs. There are good classrooms and also the quality of the facilities in the hostel is good. The mess and the canteen food in the college is superb. Sports and games are held.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in our college are helpful and also the professors are friendly towards students. The course curriculum in the college needs improvement compared to the sem fees. As the fee charges are too high compared to other colleges.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for a better future, and also there are many best things in the course like machines. Chemicals need to be checked. Many people do not prefer computer science and engineering.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in CSE (Artificial Intelligence and Data Science)
reviews.review_title: It is overall an average college.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 85% of students from the CSE batch got placed. The highest package is 45 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. The average package ranges from 8-10 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Amazon, Microsoft, Infosys, TCS, and Deloitte. About 75% of students got internships in reputed companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs are fully air-conditioned with high-end systems and fast internet. Classrooms are equipped with smart boards. Wi-Fi is available throughout the campus. Hostels are clean and secure, but rooms do not have AC. Mess food is decent and hygienic. Sports and medical facilities are well-maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are well-qualified, and many are PhD holders.  The course curriculum is updated and industry-relevant with practical labs and elective choices. Exams are moderately difficult with high pass rates. Faculty members encourage projects, certifications, and research participation for overall development.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is good to study and enjoy college life very happily.

detailed_review.Placements: About 90 percent of students get placed. The highest package is 50 LPA and the lowest package is 4 LPA. It is good to study and it is helpful for students. It provides good placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It has a good hostel and study environment. In the hostel, the food is good compared to other hostels. There are good in charges in the hostel. It has a friendly environment. We have a ground, and we can play games in the evening.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college has good faculty members. The syllabus is good. Faculty members are friendly, and we can understand topics quickly. They can teach in a very good manner, and we can understand the matter. Faculty members can express the feelings of students in a good manner, which is very good.
detailed_review.Other: In this course, we can gain knowledge, and I can successfully complete it, so I chose it.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great placements and solid infrastructure, with scope for more industry exposure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 90 percent of students get placed in our course. The highest package offered is 52 LPA, the average package is around 7 LPA and the lowest package is around 3 LPA. The top recruiting companies include Microsoft, Amazon, TCS, Infosys, Deloitte, Cognizant and Capgemini. About 50 percent of students get internships through the college. Internships offers come from companies like TCS, Virtusa, Infosys, Hexaware and Deloitte. Overall, the placement training and support from the college are really good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has well-equipped computer labs with updated systems and good internet connectivity. Wi-Fi facility is available across the campus. Classrooms are spacious and have smart boards and the library is well-stocked with technical books, journals, and access to digital resources like NPTEL and IEEE. The campus is clean and green with good overall maintenance. The hostel facilities, hostels are decent, with basic furniture and a 24/7 water and electricity supply. Wi-Fi facility is available but the speed varies at times. The mess food is average and manageable but repetitive. The canteen food is better with a decent variety and quality.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are helpful, well-qualified and knowledgeable especially in core subjects. The curriculum is industry-relevant with regular updates and practical exposure through labs and projects. The semester exams are moderate, and the pass percentage is around 85-90 with proper preparation.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE for its career scope and my interest in coding. The course has good faculty, strong placements, and hands-on labs. More industry-focused projects and workshops would improve it. Campus fests, clubs, and a friendly crowd make college life vibrant.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placements across the years.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 75% of the students got placed. The average package is 4 LPA - 5 LPA. The highest package in our course is 23 LPA secured by one of the students. The recruiting company is NXP Semiconductors which is a multi-national company. There are other recruiting companies like Avantel. Avantel also offers internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is pretty good in our college. The maintenance of labs and classrooms is excellent. There is a department library available in the department where students can go through many course-related books. There is Wi-Fi facility available in the department.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members here are very helpful and everyone are Ph.D. holder. The teaching quality is good. Teachers explain in a very interesting way which grabs the student's attention towards the subject. Semester exam's difficulty is decent and tests the student's ability. The pass percentage is 90%. The curriculum is purely course based which makes the students gain more knowledge in the industry and core related topics.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course based on my interest in electronics and chip design. The course is excellent and it is totally based on our skills and ability to gain success. There are various fields such as communication, semiconductor, VLSI, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's an average college compared to other universities, but it's a good college in Andhra.

detailed_review.Placements: 60% of the students were placed, 52 LPA is the highest, and 2.4 LPA is the lowest. Reliance is one of the top companies that recruit in my course. 80% of students got internships in Reliance and Indian oil, etc. Many mediocre company spends internship offers.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities could be better and the labs are well-equipped. Classrooms need air conditioning and the library is a downgrade for the college. The hostel facility is poor in the college. Mediocre colleges, sports facilities, and overall infrastructure need development in the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: 60% of faculty members completed their Ph.D. The teaching quality is good. The course is curriculum-relevant but not industry-ready courses. 60% is the average pass percentage of students it depends on your semester if you are in sem college pass percentage is low and high at the end of the sem.
detailed_review.Other: This course has great placement in the college, Real-time learning should be implemented. Events are average when compared to other universities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has good placements and supportive faculty members. Core opportunities need improvement in EIE.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the EIE branch at VR Siddhartha Engineering College. Around 70-80% of EIE students got placed through campus placements. The highest package is 10 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.5 LPA. The average package offered in our branch ranges from 4-5 LPA. Top recruiters companies for our course are TCS, Infosys, Accenture, Capgemini, and Tech Mahindra. Around 50-60% of students got internships, mostly in IT companies and startups.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: EIE department has well-equipped labs, decent Wi-Fi, and smart classrooms. The central library has a good collection of books and digital resources. Hostel rooms are okay with basic facilities. Cleanliness is maintained. Mess food is average, but the canteen offers better options. Sports facilities are good and a basic medical center is available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members in EIE are helpful and qualified. They explain concepts well. The course curriculum is decent but slightly outdated. Extra effort is needed for industry readiness. Semester exams are moderate in difficulty level with a high pass percentage around 85-90%.
detailed_review.Other: Campus fests are lively. The crowd is friendly, but I wish there were more core opportunities and an updated course curriculum.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Friendly nature and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements:
80%-90% of students got placed. The lowest package is 2 LPA-3 LPA
and the highest package is 52 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Microsoft, Google, Amazon, TCS, Accenture, etc. Mostly 80% of students got internships in companies like Piple and JP Morgan.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel is good and maintenance is also good, food is also of good quality. Food is available anytime. Medical facilities are also good. Wi-Fi is available 24/7 in classrooms and hostel. Labs are very good every system works and if there is a problem in any system the lab technician is available anytime if we call them and they come fix it. Library is good, all books are available in library and some system are also available in library.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very friendly. The pass percentage of internal is 15 marks, external is 22 marks, and overall is 45 marks. Teachers are very friendly even HOD mam is also friendly. Teachers help if we have any difficult situation. Teachers are motivated in every situation. In this course, we have some rules and regulations that are very useful to students and students maintain time management.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: It is quite good but infrastructure is poor.

detailed_review.Placements: As of now, 60%-70% approximately got placed. The highest package is 40 LPA and the lowest is 3 LPA. The average is 4.5 LPA-5 LPA. Amazon and JP Morgan are some of the top recruiters when it comes to internships, about 30%-40% got internships. Top roles are initially team lead and developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every classroom has separate Wi-Fi modules. Labs was extraordinary but classrooms are old and benches are not as comfortable and coming to library has plenty of books. In hostel, we have lot of computers and Wi-Fi access while coming to mess we can adjust to that every year. Our college sports department conducts internal tournaments.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers have good knowledge and grip on the subject. Every teacher completed their Ph.D. Teaching quality is perfect in our college. Every year we meet with industry people and get suggestions from them then the curriculum will be changed accordingly.
detailed_review.Other: I chose it because VR Siddhartha is known for its department's best things. They are always according to current trends, while coming to fests and events it is not as expected. There is only 1 fest per year which is also not as much as expected.

faqs.question: What are the documents required for admission to Velagapudi Ramakrishna Siddhartha Engineering College?
faqs.answer: Category A and B admissions: Applicants may need to provide a declaration by the applicant, parent, or guardian, an affidavit by the applicant and NRI sponsors, and an undertaking to pay fees. Lateral entry admissions: Applicants may need to provide proof of passing a diploma in Engineering or Technology from a recognized university. B.Tech. program admissions: Applicants may need to provide their rank in the Andhra Pradesh Engineering Common Entrance Test (AP EAMCET). MTech. program admissions: Applicants may need to register for the GATE exam. MBA/PGDM and MCA program admissions: Applicants may need to participate in the AP ICET counselling

faqs.question: What entrance exam scores are accepted by Velagapudi Ramakrishna Siddhartha Engineering College for admission B.Tech.?
faqs.answer: B.Tech. admissions to Velagapudi Ramakrishna Siddhartha Engineering College (VRSEC) can be through several entrance examination scores : 1. AP EAMCET: This is most popular entrance exam for admission in the Andhra Pradesh and carries weightage on the basis of obtained score of the exam. 2. JEE Main: The result of JEE Main examination is also considered and serves as an option for those students who have written this test across the country. 3. Management Quota: With regard to management quota students may directly apply and there are some prerequisites too. All candidates should preferably follow the updates on the current standard and that of the admission requirements on these exams.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility to get admission in Velagapudi Ramakrishna Siddhartha Engineering College for UG/PG courses?
faqs.answer:
Velagapudi Ramakrishna Siddhartha Engineering College has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility B.E. / B.Tech Candidate must have passed Diploma in Engineering/Technology in relevant stream from a recognised University. M.E./M.Tech Candidate must have passsed B.E./B.Tech. in relevant stream and obtained at least 50% marks (45% in case of reserved category candidates) from an AICTE/UGC
approved institution recognised by the Government of Andhra Pradesh as equivalent thereto.
Final year appearing students may also apply on provisional basis. MBA/PGDM Candidate must have completed Bachelor degree of 3/4 years duration with above mentioned marks from any recognised University/Institute.
45% marks for BC categories.
Candidate who are appearing for the final year degree examination are also be eligible.
Degree obtained by Distance Mode Program should have recognition by Joint Committee of UGC, AICTE and DEC/DEB.
Candidate who passed all the subjects of the three years of any Degree course in one sitting is not eligible for admission. MCA Candidate must have passed Bachelor degree of 3/4 years duration with Mathematics as one of the subject at Intermediate or Degree level with above mentioned marks from any recognised University/Institute.
45% marks for BC categories.
Candidate who are appearing for the final year degree examination are also be eligible.
Degree obtained by Distance Mode Program should have recognition by Joint Committee of UGC, AICTE and DEC/DEB.
Candidate who passed all the subjects of the three years of any Degree course in one sitting is not eligible for admission. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

college_info.college_name: VELS University Chennai: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Cutoff

highlights.summary:
VELSU was established in 1992 and is located in Pallavaram, Chennai. It is UGC recognised and holds A+ NBA & NAAC accredition. VELS Chennai is also approved by the Ministry of HRD, AICTE, NCTE, IRCLASS, and DSIR.
Further, the university has been ranked 64 by NIRF 2024 in the Pharmacy category. VELSC courses are offered to students at the UG, PG, PhD, and Diploma levels. VISTAS is mainly concerned with streams such as Medicine & Health Sciences, Business & Management Studies, Law, etc. The university also offers BPharm, BTech, and MBA as flagship courses.
Additionally, the university offers placement assistance to students and is visited by top companies such as Accenture, TCS, Microsoft, Cisco, etc. VELS Chennai admission 2025 is strictly merit-based, with the college accepting Class 12 scores. The university has top notch facilities and highly qualified faculty members. The major highlights of VELS University are tabulated below:
VELS University Highlights 2025

AICTE, BCI, PCI, NCTE, IRCLASS, DSIR, Ministry of Human Resource Development

college_info_program.intro:
VELS University Chennai popular programmes are BPharm, BTech, LLB, and MBA. BTech is provided in specialisations such as Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Data Science, Electronics and Computer Engineering, and more. VELS University is visited by top companies such as Amazon, Accenture, Apollo Hospital, and others. More than 200 international students have completed their education at this university. Among them, many were from the Engineering and Management fields.
VISTAS MBA students are placed in top companies in top sectors. Below mentioned are some of the popular programmes offered by VELS Institute of Science, Technology & Advanced Studies, and their respective eligibility and VISTAS fee structure:

VELS University Chennai Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Microbiology
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the faculty, infrastructure could be improved, and good placements last year.

detailed_review.Placements: I just joined my batch a few months ago. I don’t know the placement percentage, but there are 63 students enrolled in my course. I also don’t know the package system yet. The recruiting companies for my course are SYASANS and ZOHO, and the top roles are Senior Microbiologist and Lab Technician.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The whole college is divided into particular blocks for certain courses. Some newly built blocks are very comfortable, but the block I am in, the first building made, is honestly not the ideal block to have classrooms in. I come from Lucknow, and it is sort of difficult for me at the start, but now I have adjusted to hostel life. It has been a hard journey, but overall, the hostel is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The best thing about my course and college is my teachers. They are very helpful and listen to all sorts of complaints, especially my mentor, she is the best. Teaching-wise, they explain topics clearly so they enter our minds. Right now, I am having my semester exams for the first time, and they have been moderately easy.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to move abroad and become a Senior Microbiologist, as I am fond of Biology. The only thing I would wish to improve about the college is the infrastructure of my block.

reviews.course: B.A. LL.B. (Hons.)
reviews.review_title: Good faculty and better studies.

detailed_review.Placements: Legal side roles are offered in limited companies only. The highest package for my course is more than 1 lakh per semester. 100% of students are placed in my course. We have three sections in each batch. Top recruiters are Zoho Corporation, HDFC Bank, and other companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have labs, a moot court hall, classroom projectors, and a library for our course. The quality of food is okay but not very hygienic. They provide both veg and non-veg from the same canteen, and a medical room is available. Sports and games are conducted every semester in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very helpful overall. They have limited knowledge of their subjects only, but they clarify doubts. The curriculum is relevant. Semester exams are a little difficult, but the passing percentage is very high in our college. They also conduct regular exams.

reviews.course: B.Sc. Computer Science in Cyber Security
reviews.review_title: Absolutely very good college you can go for it if you get a scholarship .

detailed_review.Placements: Totally 92 percentage of students are placed in my college but we can't predict what kind of job they will get some may I get placed in a very good company or some way even get placed in normal company and they are very few top companies will come for the campus interview like accenture company etc. But only three company will come which are like top they will provide you intention in the summer holidays but you have to pay separately for the term internship top role in my core is like data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food will be good but the feels will be or nearly one Lacs per annum labs and classroom will be very good the bench will also be very clean and they will be SMART board projector etc. In every classes there is no Wi-Fi connection the library will be common for all the department also you will be very good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very knowledgeable but they can't cover the portions example totally 5 unit will be there and they will complete only three, the passing percentage will be 40 and it is not that much difficult to pass in the exam. But you should get at least 18 mark in the internal out of 40 so that you can pass or else you will fails in the semester.
detailed_review.Other: I choose vels University because they provide scholarship for most of the people and it is very value for the money you can save a lot of money but you have to work a lot to maintain that's scholarship.

reviews.course: B.Tech Electronics and computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: A short review of VELS School of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Don't need to worry about placements. VELS is providing good placements, 90% of the students particularly. They have been doing good in this part for the recent few years. VELS is a trusted university. They are offering placements from good companies, salary is not so high but I can say that VELS is one of the top 10 colleges in Chennai that is offering good placements with a decent salary package.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure and facilities are good. Hostel is not a good option not satisfied with my college hostel but it's not that bad also. Well, there are also not much canteens present in my college. Mess food is good. So, if you ask me an overall review of my college's infrastructure and facilities it is average but manageable.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very friendly, liberal, and lovable. Teaching at VELS is so trusted and good. That's the main part I like about my college. They will complete the syllabus within the limited time so no need to worry about studies. But exams are a little pressuring here maybe there you will lack.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: It is a good college with memory space.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students get placed in our college. The top companies for our course are IBM, HCL, Tech Mahindra, TCS, Accenture, and Wipro. The lowest package offered is 4 LPA and the highest package is 12 LPA. Nearly 80% of students got internships there. Roles offered are software developer and data analyst.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have good labs with a Wi-Fi connection. All computers are high in standards. We have a huge library which is helpful for students to learn. We can yearly sports activities to support physical skills.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are knowledgeable and highly qualified with PhD degrees. Many teachers published research papers. The syllabus is well-equipped and correlated with current trends. The pass percentage is above 70% in our college. The course is aligned with subject trends. Courses are taught well.
detailed_review.Other: I want to become a data analyst so I chose BCA in the college. We have many tech-related festivals which encourage students technical skills.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the college and good placements.

detailed_review.Placements: There are 50 students in the class. The minimum salary offered is Rs. 10,000 per month and the maximum is 1 LPA. Companies for recruiting are not that many only some top companies, others are startups, and not that many salaried companies. Maximum students do not get that many internships. Top role offered is BPO.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Computer labs have AC. It is a good and cool lab system. Wi-Fi is awesome and it has good speed but only in lab, you can access the phones only by without knowing and sneaky. The library is fine. The hostel is average. Canteen provides snack items, which are good and meals are average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Few teachers are good for me and others are average. Teaching quality is good. They don't make students industry-ready, we have to be self-ready. MCA has 4 semesters, 3 semesters, and the final semester has only one project.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course MCA because I have already done BCA I have computer knowledge, so I took the MCA. The best thing about the course is we can learn programming and computer knowledge. Events are made very grand. Culturals are made for 3 days which is very fun.

reviews.course: B.Com. in Computer Applications
reviews.review_title: My college is very bad at parking. They should improve it.

detailed_review.Placements: They offer good packages to the passed batch, but some of them are not satisfied with the package. Also, some students can’t get jobs because they don’t learn the necessary skills during the semester. Most of them don’t look out for opportunities, and the college leaves them free at the end of the semester without proper guidance. They see everything.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department staff is good, but the only problem is the building. It is an old building and has many problems due to a lack of maintenance. At least they can improve the seating benches and replace all the electrical equipment with new ones. That may help.
detailed_review.Faculty: They are enough qualified and also good at conveying knowledge to students, but sometimes they lack English skills. They are not good at speaking English. The semester exams are strict and difficult, but it is easy to pass if you fill the paper with a minimum of 35 pages.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I took computer applications in my 11th and 12th grades, so I selected this course.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Overall, it's very good for students' sake.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, students who have above 65% can apply for their respective courses. The highest package is for law courses, which offer 1 LPA, while the lowest package is Rs. 55,000. The average package is about Rs. 75,000. Tata is one of recruiters. About 98% of students are selected in our course. The top roles offered in our course are in bioinformatics, microbiology, and food biotechnology.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The atmosphere around the campus, especially for the hostel students studying at our university, is good. The infrastructure is good, and Wi-Fi facility is available for students. They can visit the library after class hours at any time, as it remains open until 8:00 PM. The university provides all necessary facilities and shows extra involvement in sports activities for the benefit of students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very friendly towards us, and they are well-qualified faculty members. They structure the student curriculum properly and prepare us well. It's pretty good actually, but if we concentrate more on every subject, it becomes easier for students. The pass percentage is 40%.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Biotechnology
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of faculty, really good for learn more things and parts about life.

detailed_review.Placements: A minimum of 20% of students are placed in more companies, like Metropolis Lab, and all students complete their internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My department has free Wi-Fi, labs, and smart classroom facilities. The hostel food is not bad, but it is good to eat. Some foods, like poori, are not as good, but no one can complain about it because the food is not bad in flavor and taste. It is lower in cost compared to homemade food, but it's okay. The entire campus is very clean.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our department, the teaching is perfect. Some teachers are not very good, but they complete our syllabus on time and provide important questions for the semester examinations. Some faculty members teach in a friendly manner, while others are not bad. But, there are some incidents that could be avoided, but those are not our problem. Students are not allowed to leave during class hours. They are closely monitored by guards for student safety.

reviews.course: B.Com. in Corporate Secretaryship
reviews.review_title: Review of VISTAS by the student of VISTAS.

detailed_review.Placements: 20 students were placed in our course. The highest salary was 3 LPA. The lowest salary was 2 LPA. The average package offered in our course was 2.5 LPA. Accenture and MRC were the top recruiting companies in our course. 100% of students got internships in an accounting firm for auditor. Roles offered were data analyst and process associate.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms, library both online and offline, workshops, and mentors from different organisations were there. All the facilities were good. Their food and accommodation were good and clean. They also encouraged us to participate in the college sports and cultural events.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were helpful and the quality was so good. They helped me to grow my knowledge and even cleared my placements with their support. It was relevant and helped us to get ready. The semester exams were pretty difficult but we cracked it. The pass percentage was 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I was planning to do corporate secretaryship at that time. I learned the in-depth concepts of CS and it helped me to clear my exams in CS.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Computer Science with Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Overall, my college campus life, faculty, and facilities are all good.

detailed_review.Placements: Moreover, 75-80% of students are getting placed in my college. My college is giving placement training from the 2nd year onwards and internship opportunities for every student. Over 250-300 companies hire from my college for placements, but the only problem with placements is that only some companies are good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I am a day scholar, so I don't know about the hostel, but my friends told me that the hostel rooms are good, but the taste of the food is bad, and the hostel fees are higher. My classroom has a smart TV, and in my department, there are vendor machines in which we can take the food by paying online
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers in my college are good. They are well-educated, and the teaching is also good. However, my college keeps more exams before the semester exams like CIA 1, CIA 2, Model Examinations, and practical exams. They do not give proper internal marks.

reviews.course: B.Sc. Computer Science in Cyber Security
reviews.review_title: About college environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement cell are sending so many jobs on Vels student login and all are coming for BPO or non-technical. However, for technical 4 to 5 companies visit, selecting around 10 to 15 students. If you get selected for a non-technical role, you can join immediately company, which is only one benefit.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good with Wi-Fi connection and charging plug points near our tables. AC rooms and computer labs are available with high-speed systems. There are two canteens and you can go outside for lunch or you can buy snacks and eat in class also. You can play sports at cultural events.
detailed_review.Faculty: Staff is very strict about doing assignment. Course curriculum is good with nice subjects and exams are very easy because they conduct CAT1, CAT2, and model exams before the semester exam. If we study these papers we will get pass and you will get 40 as internal marks so you can pass easily in the semester exams.
detailed_review.Other: In the college, VSAT scholarships are available and so many movie events and cultural events are conducted.

reviews.course: MBA in Shipping and Logistics Management
reviews.review_title: Good placements in 2010 and really good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year 70% of students got placed in the top to average companies. Top recruiting companies were HCL Technologies, Hexaware, Zifo Solutions, and Shipping companies that were related to our courses. Top roles offered were executive officer, data analyst, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure was good. The department of management studies had Wi-Fi, laboratories, classrooms, and library. The quality of hostel was good. The hostel food was hygienic. The food quality and quantity were worth the money that was provided by the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality was good. The course curriculum was relevant to the exams. The students could understand and study easily. Semester exams were little bit tough but everyone could clear the exams on the first attempt.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: I’m very satisfied with the faculty, placements, events, and sports. It’s a great college.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost out of 100.95% of students were placed in my course. The highest package is Rs. 150,000, the lowest package is Rs. 60,000, and the average package is Rs. 100,000. Top recruiting companies Deloitte, IBM, Accenture, Amazon, HCL, Indigo, and Cognizant 90% of students got internships on Cognizant IBM, Amazon, etc. My college experience was a memorable mix of academics, friendships, and personal growth.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our classes have highly advanced infrastructure, with classrooms equipped with labs, a library, a good Wi-Fi connection, and online lectures to clear all our doubts after college hours. Our hostel has all the necessary facilities, including air coolers, mattresses, etc. The food in the canteen is affordable, and medical facilities are available. The college also has an on-campus hospital, and all kinds of sports are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly educated, and their teaching quality is excellent and easy to understand. They convey information in a way that meets our needs. It is challenging because it's a university, but the pass percentage is 90%. The course curriculum is relevant and prepares students to be industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: Events and cultural activities are the best in our college. Vels Nakshatra is a 3-day event that includes a lot of competitions, games, programs, stalls, car shows, and many more or etc.

reviews.course: B.E. in Marine Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is the top college for marine studies.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students who get placed is 40-60%. The highest package is 6 LPA and the lowest package is 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies like K Line, etc., visit the college for placements. Top roles offered are deck officers, captain, chief mater, second mater, third mater, marine engineers, chief engineer, second engineer, third engineer, and supporting staff positions like purser. 30-40% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All the facilities are available like the library, labs, classrooms, etc. But one problem is the net connection is poor. The quality of the food is good. The hostel facility is average and a swimming pool is also available on our campus. Medical facilities, sports, and games are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. Their teaching skills are good. It is mandatory to know English or else Tamil language. Students do not become ready for industry because of certain reasons like less internship for students. The total pass percentage is 60% and above.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Peaceful and stress free college for students.

detailed_review.Placements: In Vels University, 80% of the students are placed in companies. Top recruiting companies are Accenture, Zoho, CapitaLand, TCS, Hexaware, and Shell. The highest package is about 15 LPA, and the lowest for the UG program is 3 LPA. For the PG program, it is 5 LPA. The top roles offered in our course are senior analyst, database manager, and software developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In VELS University, all classrooms have smart class facilities with TVs and projectors. For each department, we have vending machines for snacks. For all departments, we have Wi-Fi connections, and there will be one common library, but a large one. All the quality was good except for the rooms of the hostels.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculty of Vels University are well-qualified, and all the faculty have doctorates for the particular degree. The course curriculum will be more helpful for the students in the aspect of future development. The semester exams are for 100 marks. For UG, the pass mark is 35%, and for PG, 50% is the pass mark.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to gain knowledge in the computer section. There is an annual event in VELS called Nakshatra.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: Good college for better future.

detailed_review.Placements: Eighty percent of students in my course were placed with companies such as Amazon and Wipro. The average package offered was 65,000 rupees. Ninety percent of students got internships, with the top roles being in sales and marketing management.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Vels University has a unique style of infrastructure that attracts new students. The campus is well-maintained, and the buildings for different departments are separate, which makes it easy to navigate. However, the quality of some of the departments is a bit low.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers are helping-minded, and some are too lazy and rude. They are not even thinking of the students futures. They will not be attentive, and they don't even know how to control students.

reviews.course: B.Sc. in Aeronautical Science
reviews.review_title: Best university life is in VELS University.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students who were placed in the course is 42 students out of 93 attendees. 3.7 LPA. Indigo Airlines and Airport Authority of India have given internships to most of the students who have applied: Officer in AOCS, Executive in Ramp, Officer in Security, and Officer in Catering.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, labs, gyms, cafeteria, library, auditorium: we have all the facilities with good amenities. The medical facilities are spot on and very immediate in action. The sports clubs are one of the best. It has both indoor and outdoor activities. The quality of food is very easily adaptable.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality was top-notch. All our instructors were very qualified and experienced. Our curriculum was totally in-depth to the practical level of the work field. The semester exams were very difficult, and moreover, the monthly assessments were equally difficult as the semester exams. The pass percentage of the semesters is 45%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it is totally about aviation. We had one college fest every year. The crowd was full all the time.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Placement training is good, and the infrastructure and facilities are very good.

detailed_review.Placements: 75% percent of students are placed in my course. The highest package is 7 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.2 LPA in my course. Cognizant, Wipro, IBM, Hexaware, Fusion, TCS, etc. companies are recruiting in my course. 70% percent of students got internships from my course, and the companies are Sanmina, etc. Software development, web development.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It is the most comfortable place and peaceful to roam. The hostel is very safe and secure, and they provide medical inside the hostel. Food is very good and healthy, and Wi-Fi is also available. Labs are also available, and classrooms are very neat. The library is also available to learn new skills there, and games are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very helpful, and teaching is very good, and the way of teaching is also very good. The course has the most important subjects available in our course, and the semester exams are very easy and a little bit tough to attend to the questions. The pass percentage is 50%.
detailed_review.Other: Because I am interested in learning new skills and things, that's why I chose this course.

reviews.course: MBA in Logistics and Supply Chain Management
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with this college, very good college.

detailed_review.Placements: College has good placement facilities, with more than 80% of students being placed. The highest packages are 13 to 20 lacs per annum. The lowest packages are 3 to 7 lacs per annum. Many recruiting companies such as Infosys, Google, Amazon, Microsoft, and Delight offer higher packages, and some students got internships with stipends.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure are very good in our college. The course is relevant to logistics, and facilities like Wi-Fi with a high range of 7 to 10 kb per second .The college hostel also has a good quantity of food. Sports are conducted in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful in teaching. Teachers are qualified with higher education. They are well-qualified, and the teaching quality is good. The course curriculum is relevant. Students at our college are made ready. Semester exams are hard to pass. The pass percentage in our course is 68%.

college_info.college_name: VELS University Chennai Course Admissions 2026: Fees, Eligibility, Dates & Selection Process

admission.title: VELS University Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text: VELS University admission is both entrance and merit-based . The university conducts its own VELS Scholarship Admission Test ( V-SAT ) to provide scholarship admission to 60+ UG courses. Additionally, the university also accepts national-level entrance exams like CAT, MAT, XAT, GATE, etc., for admission to MBA and MTech courses, respectively. VELS University offers courses at UG, PG and PhD levels through different schools. The courses are offered in multiple streams like Engineering, Management, Science, Commerce, etc. VELS University admission begins with online registration. Read on the following article to know more details about VELS University course admission.

faqs.question: Are VELS University admissions open?
faqs.answer: Yes, VELS University admissions are now open for 2026-27 AY. The university is accepting applications for all of its courses. VELS University applications will be open till August 2026. Students can apply through the university's official portal.

faqs.question: Can I do B.Com LL.B in VELS University without an entrance examination?
faqs.answer: No, VELS University BCom LLB admissions are purely entry-based. For BCom LLB admissions, the university conducts its entrance examination, namely the VELS Entrance Examination (VEE) . Thus, students seeking admission to this programme must register and appear for the aforementioned exam. Based on these scores, students are ranked and allocated a seat.

faqs.question: Does VELS University offer fee waivers for candidates belonging to the economically weaker section of society?
faqs.answer: Yes, candidates belonging to the EWS category can avial fee waivers. The university provides scholarships to support the candidates belonging to the economically weaker sections of society. To extend financial support, the university provides a 20 to 100% scholarship in the tuition fees. To be eligible, interested students must have passed the qualifying examination (HSC or degree as applicable) in regular mode in the first attempt in the current year of admission, and have an income of less than INR 5 lakh.

faqs.question: What is the seat reservation policy at VELS University for candidates seeking admission to B.Com LL.B course?
faqs.answer: VELS University follows the reservation guidelines set by the state government. As per the norms, the university provides a reservation of 22% of the seats for candidates belonging to the SC/ST community . For students belonging to the other categories, such as the EWS and PWDs, the university does not have any seat reservation policy. However, it extends its support via scholarships and fee waivers. The university also admits students with excellent sports performance under the ‘Sports’ quota . Students who have already participated in interstate and interuniversity sports and games competitions are offered free education, including boarding and lodging.

faqs.answer: Vels University offers BSc course for a duration of three years. The total fee for one semester of the programme is INR 26,000. Find below the semester-wise course fee for VISTAS BSc programme:

faqs.question: What is the selection criteria for BSc course at VELS University?
faqs.answer: Admission to BSc course is based on merit in the last qualifying exam. The selected candidates based on the merit are called for counselling and document verification round. Candidates need to pay a course fee to confirm their seat in the university. The total tuition fee for BSc ranges between INR 21,000 and INR 26.40 Lacs as per an unofficial source. The fee varies as per the BSc specialisation selected by the candidates. Only after paying the fee, the admission to the university will be confirmed. To know about the complete BSc admission process, click here .

faqs.question: Which are the BSc specialisations at VELS University?
faqs.answer: BSc is a three-year course divided into six semesters. VISTAS offer BSc course through School of Maritime Studies, School of Life Sciences, School of Computer Sciences, School of Hotel & Catering Management, School of Basic Sciences and Department of Aviation. BSc is available in 19 specialisations, namely Nautical Science, Maritime Operations,  Applied Medical Biotechnology & Clinical Research, Biochemistry, Biotechnology, etc. Candidates who have completed Class 12 or equivalent exam can apply for the BSc specialisation of their choice.

faqs.question: Which are the MBA specialisations at VELS University?
faqs.answer: MBA is a two-year course divided into four semesters. The university offers MBA through School of Management & Commerce in four specialisations, namely Business Analytics in association with IBM, Logistics & Supply Chain Management, Logistics & Shipping Management and Finance, HR, Marketing, Systems & Production. Candidates need to pass a three-year bachelor's degree with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for reserved category). The eligibility remains same for all the MBA specialisations. Candidates need to submit the documents verififying their eligibility during the counselling round for final selection in the university.

sections.heading: Introduction
text: VELS Institute of Science, Technology & Advanced Studies has a big campus with 342 classrooms, 173 labs, five auditoriums, hostel facilities, LCDs, printers, and other facilities are provided to students. The university offers internet and various other facilities to students.

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description:
VELS Institute of Science, Technology and Advanced Studies has a fully automated central library with a seating capacity of 500 persons and follows Open Access System. The library has a collection of 114305 books, 137717 e-books, and 10032 back volumes. It has the subscription of more than 359 Periodicals (National & International), more than 12381 e-journals, 4106 dissertations, 4849 audio-visual resources.
It also facilitates access to e-journals from IEEE/IEL, ASME, ASCE, EBSCO, ProQuest, BENTHAM Science Pharmacy, Micromedex’s Drugdex System, Inventi Online, Nature Online, Law finder, NPTEL etc.
The library is also an associate member of Madras Library Network (MALIBNET) and Institutional member British Council Library.

facilities.name: Cafeteria
facilities.description: The cafeteria is a very significant meeting and discussion place for any institute. Students get refreshments and use the space and time to make informal discussions and knowledge sharing. VISTAS Cafetaria provides delicious and healthy food service. We have three good cafeterias within the campus.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description:
VISTAS offers residential accommodation for more than 1,000 students within the campus premises. The University houses Ten hostels (AC and NON AC Hostels) 5 Boys Hostel, 3 Girls Hostel a NRI Hostel and an International Students’ Hostel — providing a safe, inclusive, and multicultural living environment.
Rooms are available on a shared basis (2 to 4occupants) with all essential amenities, including air-conditioned options. The hostels have spacious dining halls serving multi-cuisine meals (both vegetarian and non-vegetarian) prepared in hygienic conditions.

facilities.name: Shuttle Service
facilities.description: The university transport offers more than 150 buses which connect to various parts of the city. The students are also permitted to come by their two-wheelers and four-wheelers. The premises have a huge parking space for the students as well as the faculties and other visitors.

data.description: VELS Institute of Science, Technology & Advanced Studies has experienced and skilled faculty members. VELS University faculty are degree, PhD, and diploma holders. VELS University faculty have years of experience in relevant fields. VELS University faculty invites guest faculty for lectures. VELS University also conducts faculty and student exchange programmes.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 198 published reviews , 147 reviews are verified.

highlights.summary: Vignanâ€™s Foundation for Science, Technology and Research, Hyderabad, also known as Vignan Institute of Technology and Science, was established in 1999 in Hyderabad, Telangana. It is approved by AICTE. The institute offers Degree programme in Full Time mode. It offers a total of 35 courses in 15 specializations including Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Electronics & Communication Engineering, Information Technology, Mechanical Engineering and Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning. Some of the courses offered at Vignan Institute of Technology and Science include B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM, B.Sc. and M.Sc. The fee for these courses ranges between INR 1,14,000 and 14,40,000. The total seat intake for the available courses is 1368. Vignan Institute of Technology and Science offers courses across multiple streams such as Engineering, Science, IT & Software, Business & Management Studies, Accounting & Commerce and Humanities & Social Sciences. The average median salary offered at Vignanâ€™s Foundation for Science, Technology and Research, Hyderabad is around INR 5,16,571. The institute offers all the necessary facilities to the students.

college_info_program.intro: The flagship programmes offered at Vignan’s Foundation for Science, Technology & Research are BTech and MTech. The college offers these programmes to students at UG and PG levels. Further, the college offers these programmes for a duration of 4 and 2 years, respectively, with a comprehensive curriculum. VFSTR Hyderabad courses strive to enhance the learning experience of students in order to prepare them for the industry.
